author: {'steamid': '76561198978728954', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1092, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1711870105}
review:
A solid beat-em-up, combined with Metroidvania-style unlocks in a 2D platformer. The reason this is such a good combination, is that finding a new power-up has a lot of implications. Not only can you access more areas of the map, but another layer of complexity is added to both the combat and the platforming (for example, the uppercut acts as a quasi-double jump, breaks red enemy shields, and launches enemies into the air). The Mexican aesthetic and goofy tone tie it all up in a nice little ribbon.

If you like best em ups, 2D platformers, or Metroidvanias even a little bit, I'm sure you'll find some enjoyment here.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198308265246', 'num_games_owned': 2431, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 816, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1712085407}
review:
Al fin pude quitarme este pendiente de encima y me sorprendiÃ³ lo bueno que puede ser para lo cortito que es. 
Guacamelee es un correcto metroidvania que trae mecÃ¡nicas beat em up muy bien implementadas haciendo asÃ­ que no sea necesario un gestor de inventario y buscar el arma para tu tipo de juego, todo es puÃ±o, patada, llaves de lucha libre muy divertidas de ejecutar, los comandos de movimientos son relativamente sencillos y es sorprendente lo variado que puede ser el move set, estÃ¡ tan bien pensado que muchas veces vas a hacer combos larguÃ­simos de forma natural sin realmente pretender eso y por ese lado es totalmente adictivo, dirÃ­a que es lo mejor del juego.

Me encantÃ³ la estÃ©tica con folclore mexicano, los colores creo que fueron muy bien elegidos representadose en una comedia bastante acertada un juego que no se toma muuuuuuuy en serio que digamos, la historia es simple, no se van muy por las ramas, los poderes especiales que sirven como ''llaves'' tambiÃ©n son simples y que bien se pueden usar para encadenar combos.

Va sonar repetitivo, pero realmente lo mejor de Guacamelee es su sistema de combo y lo que mÃ¡s se va disfrutar. 
Â¿Vale la pena probarlo?, no hay duda, no va ser ni de cerca el mejor metroidvania de steam, pero fÃ¡cilmente entrarÃ­a en una gran selecciÃ³n y su sistema de combate le dan una capa de originalidad en un gÃ©nero algo saturado de cosas medievales, slash de espadas y magia.

Su duraciÃ³n pienso es perfecta, ademÃ¡s es bastante intuitivo, es muy difÃ­cil perderte, ideal para la gente sin paciencia, eso sÃ­, tiene alguna que otra zona complicada de plataformeo que hay que sortear con ingenio, pero como el luchador se maneja muy bien, tarde o temprano (mÃ¡s temprano) lo vas a terminar superando. 

Una muy buena opciÃ³n para amantes de metroidvanias y jugadores retros de beat' em ups, lo recomiendo bastante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075049053', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 362, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1711933824}
review:
a totally fun platforming game with a focus on kinetic, 1v100 combat scenarios. really fun chaining hits together, launching stuff around, and bouncing through the levels. really boring walking through boring towns, fighting enemies that sit still and tick down a timer and then hurt you, and playing simon says with the lame final boss.

great artstyle and pretty cool music. apparently this edition of the game adds some filler levels, which, despite the games relatively short runtime, was definitely felt. there were some levels where i was running around doing stuff, ended up back at the beginning through some neat looping level design, and then realised i was supposed to just leave at that point. it felt like i had got through all the warm up parts, and then right when the meat of the level was going to begin, it was over. i.e. these levels were all starter and no steak.

otherwise that's fine. maybe i will play guacamelee gold one day and update this review.

played on deck, experienced no issues whatsoever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136046683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 283, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1711279491}
review:
Guacamelee is a charming metroidvania style brawler that focuses on combos, throws and aerial combat.

I say metroidvania-style, since while you do gain new abilities that let you access new places in old areas, the main path is signposted for you and exploration is not really incentivized unless you want to gather all the power-ups and secrets.

The combat system is great - responsive and impactful. The moves are also incorporated into the platforming challenges. Only problem is that Guacamelee is rather easy on normal difficulty.

On the whole I recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198275469876', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1710117702}
review:
Espectacular plataformas 2D con un combate brutal.
Tiene cooperativo hasta para 4 personas.
La ambientaciÃ³n mexicana estÃ¡ muy bien lograda, mezclando lo mejor de la cultura. Desde el dÃ­a de los muertos hasta la mÃºsica, todo estÃ¡ hecho con cariÃ±o.
La historia no es la gran cosa pero el humor en ciertas zonas le da el toque.
Combina diferentes mecÃ¡nicas para que no se sienta repetitivo en ningÃºn momento, teniendo que jugar con todas y cada una de ellas. El diseÃ±o de niveles estÃ¡ muy bien pensado.
La pasÃ© muy bien jugÃ¡ndolo. Lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032541079', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1991, 'last_played': 1709860134}
review:
Guacamelee! combina magistralmente los estilos de plataformas, metroidvania y beat 'em up. Todo bajo una cuidada y hermosa ambientaciÃ³n, basada en la cultura mexicana, que como buen ciudadano hispano he apreciado enormemente. A todo esto le suma humor del bueno y varias referencias a otros juegos clÃ¡sicos, que los mÃ¡s veteranos detectaremos enseguida.

El juego en sÃ­ tiene una duraciÃ³n media y es bastante lineal sumado a una historia trivial que solo es una excusa. Su dificultad va de menor a mayor y presenta algunos retos complicados que en varias ocasiones nos obligarÃ¡ a repetirlos una y otra vez. Por suerte no llegan a ser frustrantes, ya que gracias a la delicia de sus controles, con un poco de prÃ¡ctica, tarde o temprano los superaremos.

Solamente le achaco que como fan de los metroidvania le faltÃ³ mucha mÃ¡s profundidad, pero definitivamente lo recomiendo para todo aquel que disfrute de los tres gÃ©neros mencionados al comienzo. Una grata sorpresa que bien vale la pena ser vivida.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993946302', 'num_games_owned': 2989, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1708760415}
review:
Inizio subito con il dire che Guacamelee! Ã¨ un signor metroidvania. A me Ã¨ piaciuto praticamente in ogni suo aspetto. Bella grafica essenziale, belle musiche messicane, bel gameplay con combattimenti divertenti, belle le abilitÃ  che si prenderanno progredendo nel gioco, bello il modo intelligente in cui bisogna sfruttare queste abilitÃ  per progredire o ancora di piÃ¹ per trovare i segreti, bei personaggi, bei boss. Ho apprezzato anche la presenza delle sfide nell'inferno che costringono il giocatore ad usare o non usare specifiche abilitÃ  nei combattimenti o sfruttare le abilitÃ  al meglio per finire un percorso in un certo tempo prestabilito. Ãˆ un gioco fatto con cura e lo consiglio senza riserve a chiunque sia appassionato di metroidvania o semlicemente platform 2D.
Il gioco ha solo un neo: l'esistenza di Guacamelee! gold edition. La gold edition Ã¨ semplicemente lo stesso gioco con piccole differenze, un boss in meno e un paio di mappe in meno. Trovo perfettamente legittimo che dopo aver fatto uscire la gold edition, gli sviluppatori abbiano deciso di arricchire il gioco facendo uscire una versione piÃ¹ completa che Ã¨ questa, la super turbo championship edition (STCE), ma che senso ha venderle entrambe? Ignari giocatori potrebbero comprarle entrambe credendo che siano giochi diversi, invece sono ESATTAMENTE lo stesso gioco (a parte quelle differenze citate poco sopra). Una cosa piÃ¹ onesta sarebbe stata vendere la STCE e includere anche la gold edition, in modo da permettere a chi vuole, di provare la versione originale, cosÃ¬ come hanno fatto gli sviluppatori di Ori and the Blind Forest. Invece al momento sono in vendita entrambe e allo stesso prezzo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199517935282', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1709404798}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is a great Mexican inspired Metroidvania with great beat 'em up style combat, well made level design and platforming, amazing art, and a really good soundtrack to boot. You play as Juan who must don the legendary luchador mask to save El Presidente's Daughter from the evil Calaca. The story has plenty tongue in-cheek humour and there is plenty of Easter eggs to other games found throughout the adventure. Took me about 10 hours to get through and just found it to be a great time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104177230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1709397017}
review:
An sich ist das eigentlich ein cooles Spiel mit einer eigenen Art von Humor und einer gewissen Prise Magical Boy Vibe.
Mit voranschreitenden Spiel schaltet man weitere KrÃ¤fte/KampffÃ¤higkeiten frei und muss verschiedene Bosse der Totenwelt bekÃ¤mpfen. Die Tatsache, dass man zwischendurch als HÃ¼hnchen durch die Kampfgeschichte spazieren muss, bringt ihren eigenen Charme.

Mein Daumen runter liegt jedoch darin begrÃ¼ndet, dass es sehr viele Stellen im Spiel gibt, die einfach unnÃ¶tig schwer/unfair gemacht wurden. So muss man sich an vielen Stellen/Plattformen wortwÃ¶rtlich milimeterweit durchwuseln, andernfalls schmiert der Charakter direkt ab. Im Kampf kann es vorkommen, dass plÃ¶tzlich einem sÃ¤mtliche Gegner auf dem SchoÃŸ sitzen, sodass man weder die eigene Spielfigur sieht noch sich irgendwie freikÃ¤mpfen kann. Oder man trÃ¤gt Schaden von einer gut entfernten Explosion, die einen trotzdem so trifft als stÃ¤nde man direkt daneben.

Die BosskÃ¤mpfe sind machbar, aber an einigen Stellen genau so frustrierend. Insbesondere dann, wenn die Spielfigur plÃ¶tzlich beschlieÃŸt sich nicht mehr an der Wand festzuhalten und somit mit voller Wucht eine Strahlenattacke abbekommt.
Zwischendurch dauert es aber auch etwas zu lange, bis die Spielfigur wieder aufstehen kann (ohne direkt danach wieder eine geballert zu bekommen, sodass sie wieder komplett flach liegt).

Es gibt in einem Gebiet Bonusherausforderungen, in denen man verschiedene Aufgaben BewÃ¤ltigen muss. Diese bestehen entweder aus KÃ¤mpfen (Besiehe so viele Gegner wie mÃ¶glich in kÃ¼rzester Zeit / ohne Spezialattacken / ohne zu Werfen / ohne die Kombo zu unterbrechen usw.) oder schnell von A nach B kommen. Ich habe mich an 6 von bisher 8 "freigeschalteten" (der Zugang zu weiteren war durch einen mir noch fehlende Spezialattacken-Block blockiert). 2 finde ich (fÃ¼r mich) nicht machbar, da sie Milimeterarbeit beinhalten und ich irgendwann darauf keinen Bock mehr hatte.

HÃ¤tte man das Spiel im Verlauf herausfordernder machen wollen, so hÃ¤tte man entweder Schwierigkeitsstufen einbauen oder erst nach und nach steigern sollen - aber nicht immer wieder zwischendurch Stellen einbauen, die Frustration gepaart mit Aggressionen hervorrufen. Das nimmt mir dann doch ein wenig die Spiellust, weswegen ich es zum Zeitpunkt dieser Rezension nicht abgeschlossen habe.

Ich werde das Spiel vielleicht zu einem anderen Zeitpunkt beenden und die Rezension eventuell (minimal) anpassen.
WÃ¤re eigentlich ein Daumen nach oben gewesen, wenn meine Frustrationsgrenze nicht weit Ã¼berschritten wÃ¤re 

[h3] Anmerkung [/h3]
Je nach Controller kÃ¶nnte die Tastenbelegung ein wenig anders sein.
Ich hatte einen von der Marke VOYEE, welcher mit der Switch kompatibel ist, da waren X = Y; Y = X; A = B und B = A. Die anderen Tasten waren die wie im Spiel vorgesehen.
Allerdings erkannte das Spiel den Controller auch nur, wenn er per USB-Kabel angeschlossen war. Per Bluetooth war der unsichtbar (obwohl mein Laptop mit ihm gekoppelt war).

author: {'steamid': '76561198094479567', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1645, 'last_played': 1708004507}
review:
Guacamelee is a delightful (albeit slightly dated) Metroidvania game that offers a user-friendly learning curve and an effortless integration of combat and parkour mechanics. I first played it on my PS4 in 2015, but was recently encouraged to revisit it after completing the Ori series, which also serves as an excellent introduction to the genre.

While the narrative in Guacamelee is minimal, it successfully intertwines with the gameplay and environments. The main characters are vibrant and fulfill their roles effectively, without overstaying their welcome. However, I cannot say the same for the villains (bar Calaca), as they provide little substance beyond comic relief, particularly in their disappointingly easy boss battles.

The true standout feature of the game is the aforementioned combat and navigation mechanics. The map is filled with various colored blocks, each corresponding to a specific move. As you progress through the game, you acquire these moves in classic Metroidvania fashion. By utilizing these moves, combat can range from straightforward to intricate. Although the variety of enemies is somewhat lacking, the game strategically places them throughout, constantly keeping the player engaged.

The parkour elements in Guacamelee deserve special mention, particularly during moments such as the Tule Tree, where movement and puzzle-solving are seamlessly combined. However, there are also instances where the movement can be frustrating, such as in the orb challenges. These segments push the game's mechanics to their limits, and the player may face consequences for any missteps.

Overall, Guacamelee provides a highly enjoyable, compact gaming experience that can be acquired for a super cheap discounted price. Prior to playing, I would recommend adjusting your sense of humor to align with the style of the 2010s, as the game frequently utilizes classic phrases like "derp" and "trollololol".

author: {'steamid': '76561197991825366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1708673483}
review: This game screams Mexican culture and vibrancy ranging from the music and colours to the aesthetic. Awesome combat mechanics with intricate fun combos combined with metroidvania exploration and progression. The platforming and jumping is like no other game I have played, imagine traversing realms mid jump in order to get to your destination, a spike wall that can now be stood on or a platform appearing beneath your feet. Really well made and a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177586287', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1706878185}
review:
I have played Guacalmelee before on my PS Vita (base game + DLCs which effectively amount to the Guacamelee! Gold Edition). The handheld provided a great experience with a good control scheme and good colors on the OLED. 
And now I have picked up both Guacamelee! Gold Edition and Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition on Steam.

Since the 2 games are related I will provide the same review for both.
[b]TLDR:[/b] If you are new to the Guacamelee franchise, it is a very fun and thoughtfully designed game and I highly recommend it. I would recommend the STCE over the Gold Edition for new players because it has more levels.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Good music
- Thoughtful level design and teaching is done incrementally on the job, resulting in a good difficulty curve.
- Colorful theme.
- I am proud to say I 101% this game without referring any online guides (especially for hidden collectibles).
- Hard mode provides a good challenge and makes the bosses much more challenging.
- Practical quick travel system that does not take away from exploration.

[b]Comments on STCE[/b]
Having effectively 100% completed the Gold Edition twice (once on the PS Vita and once again on Steam), I took good note of the changes in STCE. Of course the main addition in STCE is the expanded map and levels but there are mechanic changes, etc. as well.
- STCE tutorial could have explained that Y (on a controller) also allows clinging to the wall
- Color saturation was changed, I didn't appreciate it on some levels.
- Using the bright purple color scheme provides a way to tell players that the attack is not dodgable but takes some of the immersion in some cases, eg: (spoiler) [spoiler] Lava attacks in the final fight should be orange. [/spoiler]
- [spoiler] Requires confirmation but I think you can unlock the happy ending with one less orb, or at least the cut-scenes will be unlocked in the menu? [/spoiler]
- Mixed feelings about combat balance since we have more health and stamina upgrades compared to the GE. This especially applies to getting gold medals in the Inferno levels, especially since we now have Intensio.

I blasted through this and had a pretty good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994773294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1706137020}
review:
As of January 2024,

Great game overall but with lots of bad parts that I'll list below 

Last stage seems so rushed, it just so unispired, like the devs rushed it to finish it quickly. It's just hard fights and use of last power which makes you fly.
The last boss is ridiculously hard, I one tried every boss but I gave up on the last one... Too bad...
This game is NOT for people with color blindness, there is a shield mecanic with color so if you don't see the colors, don't even try to play this game.
Lots of time, your controller will make the wrong power (you input something something else happens), it's infuriating and it happens a lot.
The travels stones are really badly located, might as well not put them at all as they're utterly useless due to bad location.
Some part of the game are extremely difficult randomly whereas it's overall great everywhere else. Make no sense at all.

The goods : Music is really awesome. I think that's one of the best things of the game. Anyway, all the good things about this game have already been said and are true. The game is really fun and well written.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104197959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1705521207}
review:
Guacamelee! es un juego de plataformas con estructura de Metroidvania en el que tendremos que rescatar a nuestra amada viajando entre el mundo de los vivos y de los muertos durante la famosa fiesta del folklore Mexicano.

Durante la partida obtendremos dinero que invertiremos en comprar mejoras de nuestro personaje; buscaremos cofres muy escondidos para aumentar nuestras estadÃ­sticas de vida y energÃ­a, y encontraremos un simpÃ¡tico chivo que nos otorgarÃ¡ nuevas habilidades para seguir avanzando.

Una maravilla de juego plataformero con combates interesantes con dificultad en aumento, mucha exploraciÃ³n y una serie de retos adicionales para ser el autentico LUCHADOR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971874140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1704310958}
review:
Solid sidescroller with some fun mechanics. Be warned that there are some incredibly frustrating parts even on normal difficulty.

Great art style and soundtrack. Snappy satisfying combat and clever jumping puzzles. The team did a wonderful job on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328685336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1650736455}
review:
Amazing, flawless game! Also, it laid the groundwork for the 2nd one, which is my favourite 2D metroidvania PC game (Ive played Hollow Knight, both Alwa games,all Shantae games,both Ori games,both Guacamelee games and others)
HARD RECOMMEND

author: {'steamid': '76561198160741210', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1703699224}
review:
[h1] Â¡Orale! [/h1]

Guacamelee makes it clear that it just simply loves video games. "Solid" is one of the very best compliments I can give to a game and I can't really find any better words to describe as such. It's an excellent tribute to Metroid-vanias as well as all of its other influences present throughout the entire experience.

+ Addicting combo-focused combat that also serves toward environmental traversal and exploration
+ Snappy/responsive controls and overall lighting fast pacing
+ Overwhelmingly passionate presentation across numerous aspects of the game from its art style/music/story/world/characters

author: {'steamid': '76561198021176531', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1703768892}
review:
I played through the normal campaign with my girlfriend and it started average, got quite good after 1 hour, and then truly disappointed us in the last 2. 
The game mixes your usual Metroidvania with beat-em-up and precision platformer mechanics. At first this paved the way for engaging gameplay, but eventually it just seemed like they jambled the poorest aspects of these mechanics together to form an unpleasant mess of a game.

By the time you reach the annoying and artificially difficult part of the story it is way past the 2 hour mark, and Guacamelee! becomes an experience unlike what it was up to that point.

Also, even though we played with two female characters, the game kept pretending it was one player who had selected the male character. If you're gonna allow this option in your game, it beats me why you wouldn't try and make it work properly.

60/100; will not play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108144738', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1703417886}
review:
PRO: Contesto, piacevole, soundtrack, secondarie
CONTRO: Parecchie ingenuitÃ , mondo bonus
VOTO: 7+/10

---------------------------------------------------------

Nel mio percorso di recupero dei metroidvania, che ho ignorato troppo a lungo, ho deciso questa volta di provare Guacamelee, nella sua versione rimasterizzata. Non ero super ispirato da questo gioco e i miei timori si sono abbastanza concretizzati, ritenendolo discreto ma mai brillante.

La direzione artistica Ã¨ molto carina e originale, con uno stile molto azzeccato e una colonna sonora bellissima. Ho apprezzato il contesto messicano stereotipato, che crea situazioni simpatiche, resto bene anche dalla traduzione italiana. La costante ironia, con anche numerose citazioni, rende piacevole l'intera esperienza, riducendo perÃ² il coinvolgimento nelle scene piÃ¹ intense.

La storia infatti Ã¨ piuttosto semplice e prevedibile ma efficace, con ottimi personaggi che sfruttano il folklore messicano. Buono anche l'uso delle missioni secondarie, poche e banalotte ma che aggiungono un po' di varietÃ .

Purtroppo, sulla lunga distanza, mi ha deluso anche il gameplay, che dovrebbe essere il cuore della produzione. Innanzitutto il level design Ã¨ piuttosto basilare, rendendo il platforming limitato e poco interessante. Questo Ã¨ inoltre ulteriormente semplificato dall'impossibilitÃ¡ di morire cadendo, si viene solo teletrasportati a poco prima dell'errore. 

Meglio il combattimento, che ha anche alcune buone idee, ma che comunque finisce per stancare sulla lunga durata. Ãˆ ben responsivo ma le animazioni non sono cosÃ¬ fluide e, soprattutto nei combattimenti molto caotici, si finisce per non essere troppo padroni della situazione. 

L'elemento metroidvania Ã¨ affidato soprattutto a quattro abilitÃ , talvolta utilizzabili anche per aumentare la mobilitÃ  del protagonista oltre che in combattimento, che permettono di rompere blocchi colorati che impediscono il passaggio. Ãˆ una soluzione un po' troppo grezza, avrei preferito una maggiore integrazione proprio nel level design, come del resto Ã¨ possibile fare in certi passaggi. 

Carina la meccanica del cambio di realtÃ  (mondo dei vivi e dei morti), che rende visibili o no elementi o nemici. Questa viene tuttavia inizialmente introdotta in un certo modo, poi scompare per diverto tempo e infine viene reinserita differentemente, causando qualche perplessitÃ .

Quasi ogni elemento porta con sÃ¨ alcune sbavature ed ingenuitÃ , come il mercato (che funge anche da checkpoint) un po' confusionario e che dÃ  poco la sensazione di progressione, i teletrasporti troppo rari, poche tipologie di nemici e una telecamera che non fa distinzioni tra zone non accessibili e aree segrete.

Buoni invece i boss, ben pensati anche se mai troppo difficili e ulteriormente facilitati dalla presenza di checkpoint intermedi in caso di morte (che ripristinano la vita del giocatore ma non quella del boss). L'intera avventura Ã¨ quindi piuttosto facile e quasi solo in presenza di ostacoli o nemici che uccidono in un solo colpo.

Ãˆ presente infine un mondo opzionale (El Infierno) che mette davanti a numerose sfide che sbloccano ricompense in base ai voti presi (bronzo, argento e oro). Ho completato un po' di questi livelli ma poi ho desistito per mancanza di voglia, terminando l'intera partita in 10 ore abbondanti.

In conclusione, Guacamelee Ã¨ un classico del panorama indie ma secondo me ormai superato sotto quasi ogni aspetto. Se lo stile e il world building hanno ancora il loro fascino, il gameplay risulta troppo grezzo, finendo per stancare un po' sulla lunga distanza. Quasi ogni elemento ha una piccola sbavatura, mai grave e facilmente correggibile (in futuro proverÃ² il secondo capitolo), ma rimane un buon titolo per i fan del genere. Per chi ci vuole approcciare per la prima volta invece consiglio di provare un prodotto piÃ¹ recente e rifinito.

VOTO: 7+/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198871692645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1701952299}
review: Yeah it's cool and all, funny, enertaining... but then you play on hard and try to do the challenges... difficulty goes from 5 to 50 pretty quick.  And it's mostly a RNG based gank. If you get good RNG you can do good crowd control. If not... dead. Most of the time it feels like the red skelly bones are timed, and the yellow skellys go full ninja and never stop dodging if not to punish. Plus the stunlocks... and the one shots... it kinda becomes an exercise of patience until you get good RNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888370', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1694350683}
review:
Nachooooooo!

â€¦oops, wrong Mexican!

One of the best games I've ever played. Music is incredible, fighting is terrific, and story is outstanding. I strongly (and very subjectively) disliked the art style, but the game is so good that I got past my dislike for the visuals.

Guacamelee was the first game my wifeâ€™s boyfriend ever played to completion since he was a child and he absolutely loved it. The theme, the art style, the dialogues...everything.

I really loved that Guacamelee fuses platforming and combat in a way that other Metroivanias don't quite manage. In a lot of the classic metroid and castlevania games, different weapons and abilities open different doors or allow you to get to a new area, but this time each of your attacks is ALSO used for traversal, which is brilliant. 

There were things that just seemed impossible to me at first, that would invariably turn into cake in the most satisfying of ways. I remember when I got to the final boss, I was like ".....how?!?", only to be using my entire aresnal to take it down with ease a bit later. Right amount of challenge for me as well. It's tough, but not balls hard, and even though it's a metroidvania, I only got lost once.

I got it on sale long ago and I just liked how easy going it was in terms of the writing and art style. I loved how the combat is punchy and satisfying and seeing what different kinds of combos or strings I could pull off and since the game wasnâ€™t very long I didnâ€™t find it overstayed itâ€™s welcome either.

Not to mention that itâ€™s freaking hilarious. Seriously, if you like Metroidvanias and difficult platformers I couldn't recommend this games enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144178842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1705411253}
review:
This game is amazing and an almost perfect plaformer.
The story is great, the interface is simple and functional, the controls are tight and almost always on point.
The visual style and the music is enjoyable.
The characters are wacky, believable and likeable.
The challenge for a normal gamer to beat the game is acceptable and the challenge for 100% runer is also doable.

I highly recommend this game, my rating 9,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116090570', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1699277271}
review:
Guacamelee is a solid metroidvania-style action platformer with a great sense of progression and an inspired art style. The controls feel fluid, the combat is satisfying and all of the moves/mechanics introduced become an integral part of the player's moveset. 

Narrative-wise, it's pretty bare-bones and basic yet the characters are memorable and it doesn't take itself too seriously. The game got a little frustrating near the climax due to some questionable enemy design, but overall very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199020382046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1659197649}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963094949', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1699069155}
review:
Maybe it was great when it came out, but it's just... soooo easy and not in a good way.
It doesn't pose a challenge, it just throws color coded crap at you you need to use your color coded special moves on... it's just annoying not challenging. The same goes for the platforming. It's super basic and just throws annoying and frequent mid-jump "world transition" color codes at you.

The exploration is also spelled out for you. Color coded block? Don't have the color coded ability yet? Come back later, it's automatically marked on your map. Not like you can find anything exciting, it's just gold or more health or stamina, which you don't really need either of, because it's so easy.

Can't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142943855', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1700034964}
review:
Beat Guacamelee! Gold on Switch a few years ago, felt nostalgic and decided to pick up this version on PC. This version has a few significant changes from Gold, but is ultimately the same game. Buying this gives you Gold as well, so recommend buying this and playing it, then going back through Gold if you want to see more.

This game is very underrated. Super tight combat based around spot-dodging/dodge rolls and using abilities and throws/slams to move enemies around into favourable positions for combos. Metroidvania-style exploration, great for completionists. Great music and simple but really detailed backgrounds and art. A story that doesn't get in the way of the gameplay, but gives just enough flavour to make things interesting. A must-play for fans of action platformers, Metroidvanias, or anyone that likes wrestling!

review: Loved this one. The gameplay is addictive, characters, dialogues and humor work and its colorful style is really captivating. Sure, it's very derivative of other games, but Guacamelee doesn't try to hide it at all and at times it just feels like you're playing a Mexican-themed parody of them. 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561199089770633', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1699556589}
review:
Guacamelee es un juego de acciÃ³n y plataformas que se destacÃ³ por su originalidad y diversiÃ³n. En cuanto a su dificultad, ofrece un equilibrio interesante. Si bien presenta desafÃ­os en forma de combates y acertijos, no llega a ser excesivamente difÃ­cil, lo que permite a una amplia gama de jugadores disfrutarlo.

La historia de Guacamelee es cautivadora. Se centra en Juan Aguacate, un aguacateador convertido en luchador de lucha libre para rescatar a su amada, Lupita. La narrativa se desarrolla en un mundo de mezcla entre el folklore mexicano y el inframundo, lo que le da un toque Ãºnico. La trama es humorÃ­stica y llena de referencias a la cultura pop y los videojuegos.

La ambientaciÃ³n es uno de los puntos fuertes del juego. Los grÃ¡ficos son vibrantes y coloridos, con un estilo artÃ­stico inspirado en el arte mexicano tradicional. Esto crea un ambiente Ãºnico y atractivo que se siente fresco y original.

La mÃºsica de Guacamelee es simplemente genial. Combina ritmos mexicanos tradicionales con toques modernos y vibrantes. La banda sonora aÃ±ade mucho carÃ¡cter al juego y se adapta perfectamente a la atmÃ³sfera general.

En cuanto a las referencias, el juego estÃ¡ lleno de ellas. Desde homenajes a otros juegos populares hasta guiÃ±os a pelÃ­culas y cultura pop, Guacamelee es un festÃ­n para los amantes de las referencias y los Easter eggs.

Para mÃ­, Guacamelee es una experiencia de juego Ãºnica que combina una historia interesante, una ambientaciÃ³n atractiva, mÃºsica increÃ­ble y un buen equilibrio de dificultad. Si bien disfrute mÃ¡s el 2 (Al cual le tengo pensado hacer una reseÃ±a mÃ¡s adelante), Sus numerosas referencias, su historia y su estilo visual distintivo hacen que sea una experiencia memorable para cualquiera.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128438346', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1695081127}
review:
Guacamelee is simple but wonderfully charming game that I had a lot of fun with. I somewhat took my time with it and got all achievements (besides one that required me to play through the game a second time) in about 15 hours and I enjoyed all of it, not at any point was I frustrated or lost on what to do. The art style and vibe alone make this game worth it, definitely recommend.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198246069650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1691856940}
review:
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition Review

Review is after completing the main story missions and a few of the initial side quests.
[hr][/hr]


[b]Story[/b]
The story is about Juan (a simple Mexican agave farmer) and his quest to rescue his crush El Presidenteâ€™s daughter from an evil undead Charro. The story is simple but the main attraction of the game is its humor and its colorful art style. The game has no voice acting; only having dialogue prompts, but that dialogue is also laced with good humor. Along the way in his rescue his crush Juan meets a bunch of helpful characters who teach him the moves and powers required to become a luchador. It turns out that Juan must become a fully fledged luchador to save his beloved. He also meets a cast of enemies who are also similarly hilarious. Overall it was an enjoyable story that was wonderfully inspired by Mexican culture. 
The only complaint I have is regarding the ending of the game. The game requires you to find about 6 hidden items in order to get the good ending. This only becomes apparent after playing the game and receiving the bad ending. The game doesnâ€™t tell you that you need to find all these hidden areas (in addition to the hidden chests), at least I don't remember any prompts or hints about these hidden areas. Thankfully a good auto save point just before the final boss battle allows players to backtrack through the maps, collect the hidden items and thus get the good ending. I did not fulfill this task as I did not have time to backtrack.


[b]Gameplay[/b]
This is my first Metroidvania style game and so I played on Normal difficulty. The gameplay was very entertaining because it had a healthy mix of platforming and combat. Platforming and exploration required creative use of the various luchador powers as well as excellent timing. Because of this getting to some hidden chests required a lot of retries and button mashing. I was not able to get to all the hidden chests but I managed to get at about 75% of them. The combat was very satisfying, supported by a great enemy variety. The enemies are also colorful and have a variety of attacks. The luchador costumes were also very amusing in their functionality and they are unlockable after earning special coins through gameplay: as it should be! As I remember when it comes to backtracking, all the enemies did not respawn; which is so refreshing, because I was dreading the grind. But fortunately only some of the enemies respawned or was it the enemies I skipped? I don't honestly remember. But either way backtracking wasnâ€™t a slog. Out of all the powers I think Pollo power is unmatched. I wonâ€™t spoil what that is but it matches the gameâ€™s humor and themes very well. 
As mentioned I did not backtrack to find all the hidden items required to get the good ending of the game. I tried out one of those hidden areas and got the hidden items but backtracking felt tedious. I understand that one of the draws of Metroidvania games is backtracking to previous areas to collect the hitherto inaccessible areas or show those tough bosses whoâ€™s the hero of the story. But this is not my choice so I did not backtrack much; I found it tedious after a while. The only annoying part of platforming were the portals. There were some parts at the end where quick reflexes were needed to move forward through the portals. I found this tedious and unenjoyable compared to all the other excellent platforming sections.


[b]Graphics[/b]
The art style was colorful and lovely and subsequently the graphics were also vibrant and refreshing to look at. This is one of those game that will look good regardless of whether you have a low range or mid range graphics card. Backgrounds, enemies, bosses and allies have the same lively color theme. An absolute treat to look at.


[b]Controls[/b]
Played using the Xbox controller attached to the PC. A controller is mandatory for this game. Some button mashing was required at times and at times attacks did not register correctly. So there were some frustrations but they did not prevent me from finishing the game. 


[b]Side Missions[/b]
There are a few side missions in this game. I was only able to complete a handful of these. For most of them I couldnâ€™t find where to go to complete them so they were simply forgotten as I progressed.


[b]Music/Soundtrack/Voice[/b]
The game has no voice acting which I did not find to be a negative. The soundtrack was thematic and adequate and all the funny sounds accompanying power ups encounters and combat filled out the gameplay experience nicely!


[b]Performance[/b]
Experienced no crashes and the game ran smoothly on my PC (which is a mid-range PC). It did not cause undue heating of the CPU and GPU.


Overall Score 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054690449', 'num_games_owned': 1377, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1693765166}
review: I originally played Gold Edition because I could only play Steam games on a Mac at the time and I enjoyed it.  This version has more challenges, extra areas, and a couple new abilities, including an overdrive mode.  I wish that they'd just upgraded the gold version or at least gave a discount, but if you haven't played either, go for this one.  It's a fun metroidvania with a huge emphasis on combat.  Just be ready for some of the optional challenges to be of the butt-kicking variety, especially if you want all the rewards for finding those bonus orbs (which you will...).

El estilo basado en la cultura mexicana y un poco cartoon esta muy bien logrado y es muy bonito visualmente.

el sistema de combos es bastante completo hasta el punto de llegar a ser un poco complejo si queres sacarle el maximo potencial.

review:
8/10
Esta bastante bueno. El diseÃ±o grÃ¡fico es agradable, capaz llega algunos momentos de que tantos efectos de vÃ­deo me hacen perder al personaje de vista. El hitbox es medio raro, porque hay algunos Ã¡ngulos en los que les intentas pegar a los bichos y fallas, pero seguido a eso ellos te pegan y aciertan. 
Los bosses estan realmente bien logrados. Los ultimos dos si son dignos de llamarse "final bosses".
Hay un par de referencias que vi que me cayeron bastante graciosas.
En fin, recomendado si no sabes a que jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216283357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1679849349}
review:
Amazing platformer and good hack-and-slash. A solo experience, but definitely better with 1-3 friends.

The platforming is challenging, but doable. It will frustrate you, but it feels fair. The puzzles can be very clever and are imaginative.

The fighting aspect is fun and offer a break between platforming. It can be a challenge if you play solo. Being with a friend makes it the much easier.

The humour and tone are nice, the aesthetics are breathtaking, and the music adds to the good ambience.

Definitely worth buying and playing once, twice or more. As a plus, it is not one of those games that is impossible to finish at 100%. Stop reading. Go play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340654979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1692780134}
review: Perfect Game #26, Guacamelee! STCE.  A great blend of some of my favorite genres.  It sounds a little crazy to say that a platform-fighter metroidvania adventure game would work, but Guacamelee pulls it off fantastically.  The combat is fluid and there is a lot of depth to the system.  The world is filled with secrets and is really fun to explore as well.  The areas are detailed and filled with easter eggs of other games.  The characters are very funny, but can be a little over the top at times.  Overall it's definitely worth checking out, even for the combat alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302925456', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1692042290}
review:
Man I wish they made a third game rather than branching out. These games just get better the more I play them. Nobody would be able to tell that this is over a decade old.

I love the new content from this version, however I wouldn't recommend it for first time players. It adds a mechanic that doesn't quite fit in that well with the main bulk of the game, and the mandatory additional areas really slow down the pacing. It's sort of like Ori definitive edition in that sense, except at least in that game the new content was optional.

I also noticed that the music was super repetitive this time around. A couple more tracks couldn't hurt. Glad the sequel addressed that problem.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064045120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1691163952}
review:
I wasn't planning on playing this until it was chosen as the Game of the Month for August 2023. I like metroidvanias and I figured why not give it a try.

What I liked:
* The colours and the music. It's surprisingly beautiful.
* The platforming sections get more frustrating towards the end but the game is short enough to suffer through some moments. I liked that falling off the stage wasn't instant death.
* Fighting with the different coloured shields takes some getting used to, but it's a fun mechanic.
* Some other mechanics are introduced that make battles interesting to say the least.
* One of your forms is hilarious to me.
* There are some easter eggs of different games (especially the song in the final dungeon ha!) that makes progressing fun to find the next thing.
* Boss fights are fun enough and easy to figure out.

What I didn't like:
* The story was not too interesting and the ending was abrupt to say the least.
* Falling off the stage is fine, when you fall into lava your transported back to the save point...
* Combat gets messy when there are a lot of enemies in the area. Your fall animation is painful because it takes a long time. There's one particular punchy enemy that drove me crazy because of the loop of falling and him beating me I would get stuck in.

It was a fun experience and I can recommend this game for people who liked the mechanics in the Messenger but who would like a little bit less challenge.

review:
Highly recommended for metroidvania fans.

What a treat. This game oozes with character. The design, characters, story, world, movement, combat... All are done so well. It's hard to find a fault in this game. If you like exploring, character progression, finding hidden secrets and challenging combat, than look no further.

SÃ³lo me tira para atrÃ¡s el plataformeo, a veces excesivo y con un punto de exigencia mayor de lo que suele ser habitual en estos juegos. Con la miriada de metroidvanias que hay, muy orientados sobretodo al estilo de Dark Souls a causa de Hollow Knight, Ã©ste es full old school classic con el punto de dinamismo y flexibilidad que necesitan estos juegos en estos tiempos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366671300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1689193820}
review:
Drinkbox games is one of the best at these kinds of 2d metroidvania platformers.  In fact, I think the platforming in their games is better than anything in Hollow Knight, and about on par with the Ori games. I particularly love the difficulty tuning.  The game keeps throwing new enemies, new mechanics, new traversal methods and areas at you but it never feels overwhelming because the difficulty curve rises at just the right pace.  The difficulty always feels just right, keeping some pressure on your but without abrupt spikes, just right to maximize fun.

I can't praise most of the game too highly enough with the sole exception, sadly, of the last phase of the last boss Calaca.  He's very big, too big for all of him to fit on the screen at one time, which make the tells for his attacks kind of hard to read sometimes.  Jaguar and Flame Face are both more fun to fight imho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874036113', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1690161593}
review:
En abril de 2013 se lanzaba este juego para la PlayStation 3 y la PS Vita,  recuerdo que me gustÃ³ mucho el arte conceptual y el diseÃ±o del mapa y ya que en aquel entonces no tenÃ­a una consola lo jugaba en el almacÃ©n de un centro comercial cada que podÃ­a. AÃ±os despuÃ©s este juego se convirtiÃ³ en el primero que pirateÃ© en la primera computadora que llevaron a casa, nunca me lo pasÃ© ya que me daba pereza ejecutar los combos con teclado XD.

Sim embargo, ya con la oportunidad de comprarlo y jugarlo puedo decir que este indie es sumamente bueno. Tiene un muy buen diseÃ±o de niveles, la verticalidad de sus mapas es adictivo y la simplicidad del combate es una de sus mejores cartas de presentaciÃ³n. La variedad de enemigos y jefes es muy decente, cuando crees que ya no verÃ¡s mÃ¡s arquetipos de enemigos te sueltan uno nuevo acorde a la temÃ¡tica del mapa que te harÃ¡ variar la forma en que has estado combatiendo, haciendo mucho mÃ¡s dinÃ¡mico el gameplay y aportando a tus skills. Los obstÃ¡culos dentro de cada mapa son igual de retadores, no son nada del otro mundo pero sÃ­ que te harÃ¡n pensar un poco y te retarÃ¡n a mejorar/coordinar el timing de pulsaciones de tu teclado y mando. El "Ãºnico defecto" que puedo ponerle a este juego es la simpleza de un par de combates con jefes, fuera de eso todo en cuanto al gameplay estÃ¡ correcto. Y, ademÃ¡s, contiene una buena parte de secretos aÃºn por descubrir y pequeÃ±as misiones secundarias en los poblados de algunos mapas e incluso desafÃ­os de habilidad.

De la historia, mÃºsica y diseÃ±o artÃ­stico tengo que mencionar que son exquisitos. En tema de trama no esperes algo presentado a la altura de los metroidvanias mÃ¡s de culto pero sÃ­ que es una historia entraÃ±able con un final que sÃ­ te hace sentir un vacÃ­o, mÃ¡s aÃºn con la Ãºltima imagen despuÃ©s de los crÃ©ditos.

Este juego es muy recomendable, me hace querer sacarle todos los logros y darle otra pasada en la dificultad difÃ­cil. DespuÃ©s de 10 aÃ±os de su salida estoy contento por haber concluido su historia. Recomendado.

review: Seems to be rather easy in the beginning, but after a while gets substantially more difficult, especially if you aim at 100%ing the game (which I miserably failed due to the Infierno challenges. The alternate ending is rewarding enough though). Not a fan of the art style and the whole lucha libre theme, but the gameplay itself is solid, as well as the number of unlockable skills allowing for pretty vast exploration. Definitely worth checking out.

review: "Guacamelee!" is a delightful game with charming art and a cool Mexican-inspired world rarely explored in metroidvanias. It's packed with pop culture references, like the chozo statues from the Metroid games. The gameplay is simple yet enjoyable, offering a brawler-style experience that can be both fun and challenging. Recommend to fans of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561199403686284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1687457628}
review: I bought this game due to being a big fan of metroidvanias. And this game didn't disappoint! It perfectly nails mashing together metroidvania and beat-em-up gameplay, with the combat itself being great overall, never getting boring. Though it's relatively linear compared to most metroidvanias, its platforming segments are very well designed, integrate well into the world map, and backtracking is completely optional! It also has bosses that are hard-but-fair overall, and stand out! It also has a ton of cute little references to other games, memes, and pop-culture in general. The characters are also very memorable, and are written very well too. Overall,  if you like both metroidvanias, and Devil-May-Cry-style combat, I highly recommend the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198147938706', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1688236811}
review:
From my perspective it's a must play for metroidvania fans. But be ready for some challenge if you want to make it 100% , because it can be tough. It has LOCAL coop for 4 players and great vibe. It's more linear than other metroidvania's but it compensates with more engaging combat. Last but not least controller is recommended, it is possible to play on keyboard all though it's not as comfortable as it would be. 

Play it, complete it, don't regret it

author: {'steamid': '76561198063035714', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1687340005}
review:
[b]TLDR: INDIE METROIDVANIA WITH A REALLY COOL THEME AND ARTSTYLE AND CO-OP (!!!), PLAY IT[/b]

[b]Guacamelee[/b] is a 2013 indie game (2014 for this rerelease with extra stuff, technically), one of DrinkBox's first games (their third, to be precise).
[i]Though even if I didn't explicitly say it, you could've probably told what timeframe this was released in considering the game's humor and constant gamer references throughout the entire world.
Including that one side villain that, in no uncertain terms, says [b]"Trololololol!"[/b] to your face.[/i]


It's a mix of a platforming metroidvania and a brawler, with simple and easy-to-grasp controls (basic attacks, a grab button with aimable throws, and directional special moves like Smash Bros.) but a LOT to do with those controls.
Progression is pretty standard, as you might expect; you explore areas to the extent your initial abilities allow, and gradually unlock more skills as you play to open up the way to more and more interconnected areas (abilities you get from breaking... [b]Choozo statues[/b], yes this game wears its inspirations on its nonexistent luchador sleeve).

All of your BASIC fighting moves (standard attacks and grab/throw attacks) are available from the start, but you CAN buy some little side upgrades for those from the shops on every savepoint.

Yeah, you get money (Pesos, fittingly) from beating up enemies, as well as silver coins as unique collectibles that can be used to unlock [b]costumes[/b] that (mostly) give special effects and act as sidegrades (one good effect, one bad effect).


Speaking of pesos... Yeah, it's a mexican-folklore-themed game. A [i]VERY[/i] mexican-folklore-themed game. You can probably tell from the artstyle and screenshots already, but both the visuals and the music [i]heavily[/i] help carry that vibe along.
It's a weird mix of that type of theming with 2013-era humor. Obviously not everone is going to [i]like[/i] that type of humor but it's honestly inoffensive enough to not really detract from the overall story and writing (and hell, it's a bit [i]nostalgic[/i] in its own way).


Obviously like any good Metroidvania there's a TON to explore. All the areas are interconnected, and you can unlock teleport spots in (almost) every area to quickly warp from one to another. The map also handily marks walls that require specific abilities to break (the ones you unlock as you go, which are all color-coded for convenience) and keeps track of your item discovery percentage in every area, so you can comfortably head back and check for any small paths you might've missed on your first run through.


This isn't a TERRIBLY long game, you can beat it in about 3-4 hours. I know [i]my[/i] Hardmode run just now to finish 100%ing the game was a little over 4 hours, including all my deaths from... it being hardmode.
Without doing any sidequests (yes, those exist) or going for all collectibles, anyway.

But that's for the [i]BAD[/i] ending.
Yes, without spoiling anything, this game has MULTIPLE endings. You'll be expected to get the bad one on your first go, as [I]right[/i] before it ends it introduces an entire SEPARATE set of Macguffins to collect, all of which will be on entirely new parts you hadn't even THOUGHT were there before. Adds a GOOD chunk of extra playtime. My 100%ed savefile with all the extra content done ended up being about 11 hours long or so.
...Some of those collectibles are also kind of CBT to collect, or even to FIND [b](looking at [i]you[/i], Forest del Chivo)[/b] but hey, that's the point of it being extra challenges to earn the better ending.
You [i]might[/i] need to look up a guide for that specific one though.



Anyway yeah I've rambled on enough, it's a good game and it's cheap. Get it. It's fun, [b]ESPECIALLY[/b] if played co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011371788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1536250353}
review:
This is the best non-Metroid Metroid that exists. Yes, including the Castlevanias. Everything that makes the genre great without the fluff of experience points, endless inventories and weapons that do +1.5% damage. Guacamelee looks great, the animation is on point, the challenge is well calibrated.

Two criticisms I'd have is that the "good" ending is hidden behind some very difficult parts of the game which I did manage but I think it is a shame that most people won't see. And the music is not bad, but is only kind of there and not exciting enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998836780', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1687069028}
review:
Very unique brawler/metroidvania. Great combat, music, platforming, interesting bosses, and extra challenges make it a great game. The cartoon graphics and brawl combat make it stand out from others of the genre. Difficult but rewarding challenges.
Main game took 9 hours. With extra challenges and achievement hunting, it took 21 hours.
Got it free, but it is definitely worth $5 to $10. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197993566775', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1455332341}
review:
A very worthwhile metroidvania with an OUTSTANDING OST. The soundtrack alters between a major and minor scale [spoiler] when you alternate between the world of the living and the afterlife [/spoiler] which is a very nice touch, besides being an essential mechanic.

Some cool Easter eggs and humor along the way.

Steam workshop and community has made a variety of neat skins for your characters to keep things fun.

Turbo championship adds additional challenge rooms to perfect your art of the lucha and lay the smack down on los demonios.

For the record, I've completed this game on a different platform, hence the low playtime on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165472708', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1685286085}
review:
Nice game, a little bit short. Map seems huge, but a lot of these spaces are traversed rather quickly. Mechanics are fun, combat, while not being exceptionally deep, is addicting, and only extra challenges make you master it. Can sometimes be a little frustrating, but not to great degree.

P.S. If you're stuck (especially on true ending requirements) and you looked up the guide, make sure you're looking for a guide for this particular version, don't repeat my mistakes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029641873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1683644938}
review:
+ fun combat system
+ cool abilities for both combat and navigation
+ a decent amount of secrets
+ lots of optional and challenging platforming and combat challenges
+ nice music

- combat can feel a bit imprecise sometimes
- backtracking can become a bit cumbersome due to limited fast travel and disjointed maps
- a few later challenges can become pretty frustrating
- a rather cliche plot

overall: 8/10

review:
Its a good Metroidvania style game! It doesn't overstay its welcome, you gain your abilities, you throw down some classic Luchador moves and you meddle in the world of the living and the dead!

If you enjoy Metroidvanias, then I would highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051147160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1706725451}
review:
A great mix of a metroidvainia and a beat-em up with heavy focus on platforming. The game play is fast paced and there is a ton of humor hidden around the game. 

Pros:
-Great Visuals and sound
-Good map system
-Fun Combat,flows very well
-lots of good platforming challenges
-Good use restart points when dying instead of going too far back


Con:
-A bit short only about 8-10 hrs
-can get repetitive 


Overall a great game to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1682106608}
review:
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - High Quality â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1] 
Guacamelee! (GM) Super Turbo Championship Edition was a local coop game that I played over at a friend's house. It's a title I already owned, but when you're trying to find any Steam game with local coop, there's only so many options available. Based on how it went playing with friends, I was slightly concerned about trying it on my own, because even when we juggled health and lives, we kept failing to clear certain fights. Surely I'd be screwed by myself. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
Taking the role of a luchador, you might assume that GM would be a beat-'em-up or brawler of sorts. With respect to the combat, it more or less plays that way, as you combo and grapple your foes. However, it also has Metroidvania aspects, as you'll return to previous areas with new abilities, unlocking paths that were blocked off before. Most of the moves revolve around combat to some degree, such as uppercuts and headbutts, but they also have relevance to platforming. For instance, when you can switch dimensions, this is needed to create and pass through floors and walls, but also puts you into the same plane as the enemy. Otherwise, they're apparitions you can't hurt, while they can still attack you. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2961799363
[h1]Controls[/h1] 
There aren't many situations in GM where you'll be dealing with platforming and combat at the same time, but with abilities covering both matters, your move set is pretty consistent in either situation. After acquiring so many moves, it can be easy to mix them up, though the mistake I made most often was whether I changed into a chicken or switched planes. It's also theoretically possible to pull off some complicated combos, but I tend to use simpler ones myself. Overall though, I think the controls worked quite well. 


[h1]Story[/h1] 
Having been cheated out of his glory, after making a deal with the devil, Calaca overthrows him and plans on becoming the ruler over life and death. After invading the mortal realm, he kidnaps the main character's love interest, kills him, and creates his own adversary. For it was written that a recently murdered agave farmer would become the luchador of justice. In some ways, I think the villain is overshadowed by his more eccentric followers, as he's a pretty generic foe. Although I enjoyed the story overall, I was bummed that there wasn't an overview of what happened to all of the characters after beating Calaca. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2964826628
[h1]Visuals[/h1] 
Honestly, I love the presentation of GM. It's flashy, colorful, and really invigorates me while I'm playing. You always know when you find a secret or clear an arena battle, because the game does a small celebration. Plus, who can really hate smashing a pinata? Also, with the alternate dimension, every screen has two variations, though its not always much of a difference. Sometimes it's just water being swapped out for lava or a color swap, while other times a destroyed village is inhabited by several skeletons. 


[h1]Sound Design[/h1] 
Inspired by its Mexican theme, the instruments used for the music consists of items like trumpets, guitars, drums, and I believe the harp for some of the underworld tunes. Since you'll swap back and forth throughout the game, there's a version of the music for both dimensions, with some of the underworld interpretations being pretty creepy. Otherwise, a lot of the music is fairly bright and lively, favoring the idea of a celebration more than the skeleton army's invasion. Ah well, they died once, surely they'll do so again. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2964826018
[h1]Pros[/h1] 
ğŸŒŸ White knights might complain about supposed racism, but they're just projecting. GM is awesome because it celebrates Mexican culture, not lampoons it.
ğŸŒŸ I enjoyed the game's sense of humor, although I didn't need an old goat hitting on my mother. 
ğŸŒŸ There's a fast-travel and mini-map system that helps players navigate around the game. 


[h1]Cons[/h1] 
âŒ Due to some insta-kill obstacles, a few checkpoints can be a bit annoying. The fast-travel system also would be improved if you could move from checkpoint to checkpoint. 
âŒ Sometimes, I wasn't always clear what color the shields were around enemies. I'd mix up the blue and green or yellow and white. 
âŒ A faster run would have been a nice way to get around quickly, as your move-set doesn't always help with that. 


[h1]Tips[/h1]
ğŸ” I preferred saving my money for the more expensive upgrades, or ones I knew would be immediately helpful. For example, increasing my stamina regeneration. 
ğŸ” You have invincibility while grappling, but there will be times when you need to dodge attacks. When I forgot that was available, I always paid for it. 
ğŸ” Due to how many abilities there are to unlock, I wouldn't bother exploring too much in the early game. 


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1] 
Give me a Metroidvania game set in the dark ages or a sci-fi landscape, and I'll likely enjoy it. However, with so many cultures and options available from our own world, it's refreshing to see something different. Wrestling isn't what would normally come to mind for a platformer, but such moves were incorporated suitably for a game like this. There's some rough spots where a quality of life change here and there would be nice, but aside from a few nuisances, I enjoyed my playthrough of GM, earning most of the achievements from getting all of the optional content. For those who have difficulty with platforming, I could see a few portions being roadblocks, so you might want to have a ringer who could join you in coop in case they're not your forte. Otherwise though, I'd recommend getting GM.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960880229', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1697235314}
review: Such an unexpected gem.  I was expecting a straightforward beat-em-up.  What I encountered is a metroidvania with an entertaining story and a deep move set.  Great roster of interesting enemies on whom to try the ever-expanding list of combos.  Try this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1679758613}
review: Guacamelee! is simply an amazing metroidvania with a Mexican setting. The art-style has a cartoonish angular look, which may look a bit weird at first, but it fits well and establishes the game identity, since itâ€™s immediately recognizable. It has a lot of charm and humor as well. The story is basic, with the game shining in the gameplay. To be honest, itâ€™s nothing you havenâ€™t seen before, but itâ€™s well implemented. The game is fun, and the controls feel right, both in combat and platforming sections. Combat is melee focused, where you combo normal attacks, throws and specials moves. A clever design choice is that these special moves are also used in movement and are needed to access some optional areas, and in true metroidvania style, some areas arenâ€™t accessible during your first visit. The map does a great job marking those spots, so you can easily return later when you have the necessary abilities. The soundtrack is also great. Given the setting, I was afraid it was going to be very Mexican, but to my surprise, itâ€™s way more modern and videogamey, while still being Mexican inspired. I was humming along a lot of times. Itâ€™s also a great game to hunt 100% completion. Some optional challenges can be a bit harder, but thereâ€™s nothing hardcore in here. More importantly, it doesnâ€™t feel like a chore. The Super Turbo Championship Edition is also the definitive version of the game, with more content added. Not only that, but that content is seamlessly integrated. I only played this version, and I couldnâ€™t tell what was the original and the new content. It was all great. And thereâ€™re also more good stuff, like 4 player co-op and a Steam Workshop for custom costumes. I had a great time with this game, and itâ€™s an easy recommendation. Definitely worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026180488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1679692948}
review: So much to love about this game. Great combat, great platforming, cutesy story, all wrapped up in a thematic package that 100% commits to the bit. Uppercutting and suplexing and luchadoring will never get old. The platforming challenges were just difficult enough to be satisfying. The game is also super forgiving, dying doesn't yeet you back to the start and force you to replay repetitive bits. Hard mode provides a solid challenge. Right when I thought I had the combat pegged and could wipe bosses without getting hit, hard mode told me to sit down and gitgud. It wasn't agonizingly difficult, just enough to freshen up the challenge again. Guacamelee is a goat punch of charm right to the chest.

Si excluyo Hollow Knight, este Guacamelee! es el juego con el que mejor lo he pasado en los Ãºltimos tiempos. Es realmente divertido. De 11 en este sentido. Y tambiÃ©n es el juego que he desinstalado con mÃ¡s rabia nada mÃ¡s terminarlo. AÃºn asÃ­ es un juego sobresaliente (a pesar de la estÃºpida decisiÃ³n de diseÃ±o tras su final), que seguro reinstalarÃ© (o cuya segunda parte comprarÃ©) y que recomiendo por 10, 15 Ã³ 20 euros, lo que estimes conveniente. Porque los vale.

---------------------------------------------

Lo mejor:

* Inteeeeennnsoooo!!!
* El chivo.
* La locura y la alegrÃ­a general que contagia su gameplay.

EntÃ£o vocÃª pode conseguir metade no primeiro slot de save, a outra metade no segundo save e os dois save terÃ£o todas as fantasias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256129666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1678330982}
review:
Quando comecei a jogar, nÃ£o imaginava que teria mais um jogo de plataforma que um jogo de pancadaria. A sorte Ã© que os comandos sÃ£o muito responsivos, o que evitou culpar o jogo apÃ³s falhar em alguns trechos mais do que gostaria de admitir.

A campanha comeÃ§a em um ritmo normal, mas aos poucos, conforme ganhamos novos poderes e habilidades, torna-se necessÃ¡rio realizar diversas manobras pelos cenÃ¡rios para avanÃ§ar. Elas requerem pular de uma parede para outra, trocar de dimensÃµes e usar portais, entre outras coisas, quase sempre em uma velocidade e coordenaÃ§Ã£o que chegam a bugar o cÃ©rebro.

Ao final de uma jogatina de duas horas, meus dedos estavam genuinamente doendo.

Sobre o combate, ele Ã© divertido, porÃ©m pouco desafiante. Uma nova dificuldade Ã© desbloqueada apÃ³s zerar, mas nÃ£o cheguei a testar para ver como se difere da dificuldade normal.

Podemos executar combos e desencadear golpes em sequÃªncia com certa facilidade, desde que esquivando na hora certa. Ã‰ bastante intuitivo, pois os poderes sÃ£o desbloqueados aos poucos para que consigamos nos acostumar. E ao contrÃ¡rio da movimentaÃ§Ã£o pelos cenÃ¡rios, nÃ£o precisa tanta agilidade.

Em termos tÃ©cnicos, apesar de antigo, Guacamelee apresenta grÃ¡ficos muito bonitos. Esta Ã© uma caracterÃ­stica normal nesse estilo grÃ¡fico, afinal Ã© desenhado Ã  mÃ£o. Provavelmente, se jogarmos daqui a 10 ou 15 anos games como este ou Ori, continuaremos achando que sÃ£o obras artÃ­sticas incrÃ­veis.

Por fim, o Ã¡udio tem vÃ¡rias mÃºsicas divertidas e animadas, inspiradas em ritmos mexicanos, mas tambÃ©m nÃ£o faz feio quando o assunto sÃ£o os efeitos sonoros ambientais, de monstros e pancadaria.

Por outro lado, nÃ£o hÃ¡ dublagem. Isso deixa a sensaÃ§Ã£o de vazio no mundo, sendo, portanto, um fator negativo, ainda mais considerando que com personagens tÃ£o excÃªntricos seria divertido ouvir suas vozes para conhecer as nuances de suas personalidades.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062925091', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1678255572}
review:
Time for a real review for this game.  Is it fun?  Yes.  Is it Well made?  Absolutely.  Is it hard?  Let's put it this way.  Checking the achievements - which you get some of for standard actions such as completing boss fights or areas - only 40% of all people playing this game have made it past the first boss area.  Only about 20% have made it as far as the last area, and less than that have finished the game.  These stats roughly apply to both this version and the gold version.  So, all these reviews saying the game is easy to average difficulty - no it isn't.  Not even remotely.  This is pro level stuff.

Expect to die.  A lot.  And I mean a LOT.  Expect to find many areas where your average player will just give up and quit playing from sheer frustration or genuine lack of knowing how to proceed.  Which is a shame, because it really is fun and well made.  And it is generous with power ups.  But it's hard.  Very.  Only masochists, people with endless patience, or pro level platform gamers need apply.

Do I recommend it?  Yes.  Just know the truth of what you are getting yourself into.   The one thing I will say helps is that it is sometimes forgiving where you continue from when you die, and it's not a game over kind of death, just a teleport back to the last save altar if you die from damage (with whatever fight scenario you were in respawned), or last ledge you happened to be standing on if you die from falling.  Don't mistake me saying that for oh so it is easy.  It's not.  Again, only 40% of all people playing this game even made it past the first boss area.

TOP FUN THINGS TO DO:

THE UNIQUES:
ğŸ’Becoming a Luchador

PLAYER GAMING REQUIREMENTS:
ğŸ’¼ Platformer.
ğŸ’¼ 2D.
ğŸ’¼ Metroidvania.

PROS:
+ Most of the jumping puzzles are decent.
+ Colourful artwork.
+ Co-op mode.
+ Can be replayed!

CONS:
- Tedious combat.
- Map can be a little confusing.

VERDICT:
Guacmelee! Is a mediocre Metroidvanina, there's plenty of other games that do this better, which may put some players on the fence about this game, such as myself. It hasn't got many downsides but the gameplay tends to play it safe with the combat, which to me, is a very important part to this type of game.

They did a fantastic job with the jumping puzzles, this is where I think the main enjoyment is at and it's very rewarding when you complete the puzzle. The next thing that should be mentioned would be the artwork, it's so colourful and vibrant that it kept me interested for a while.

Overall Guacamelee! Does deserve to be played but know that other games do this a lot better, getting it on a sale would be the wisest move.
Total Score = 58/100.

GAMEPLAY:
Guacamelee! is a hybrid 2D Metroidvania style action platform and brawler. Players control the luchador Juan and explore an open, non-linear world to complete the central story objectives while collecting necessary character upgrades and battling enemies. Coins collected from defeated enemies are used to buy new skills at shops, which also double as checkpoints. The game features drop-in co-op play, with the second player assuming the role of Tostada, Guardian of the Mask.

SIMILAR GAME LIKE THIS? / REVIEWER PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE:
Hollow Knight, Rain World, Dead Cells.

review: Enjoyable metroidvania with a twist. Lots of humor and some great platforming. The fighting combosystem is quite extensive and hard to execute on, so lots of training is recommended. On normal, most enemies are manageable using a small combo set.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124022009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1676994505}
