author: {'steamid': '76561198060769335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1676803837}
review: Guacamelee is a fun game. Its metroidvania aspect is really streamlined so there isn't much exploration to really be had so if you're looking for that this might not be quite what you're looking for. However, once you get past its slow startup and you unlock most of your moves the beat em up part of the game becomes really fun and satisfying. It also has a lot of charm, humor, and is chock full of references to classic indie games. Overall it was a good experience and I'd say if you're considering it, it's worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009443460', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1676852431}
review:
Great game. The fighting, the controls, the progression, everything feels polished.
It has a couple of parts, near the end, that may prove a little hard, specially for the newcomers to the genre.
In all other aspects this is a very good title for newcomers. But because of the late game difficulty I wouldn`t recommend it to new players of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005521377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1677005629}
review:
This Metroidvania is goofy in the best possible way. I personally love the style of the game, but I think if you're sensitive to cultural appropriation you might dislike this game.

The platforming is pretty great, but its the interesting combat system that really sets it apart. It's based around making combos by throwing enemies into one another, uppercutting them into the air,  and keep hitting them in the air to keep the combos rolling.

My main gripe with the game is its inconsistent difficulty curve. It's boringly difficult during the first half or so, allowing you to pretty much turn your brain off and faceroll the fights. It doesnâ€™t really motivate the player to explore the move sets. Enemies die so quickly there isn't even that much opportunity to practice, even if you're looking to. During the later stages of the game suddenly the difficulty jumps up hardcore. I actually think this makes for a better game, but it's quite a jarring transition.

You might start this game off by thinking it's a fun little platformer fighter to unwind with, but suddenly you're forced to become serious and have to completely change the attitude with which you play. 

The game would be far better if the difficulty gradually ramped up between 5% and 75% of the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198151375933', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1676081183}
review:
Disclaimer: I don't usually play metroidvanias or platformers, but I can sometimes enjoy them
... so you can assume I didn't like Guacamelee as much as I wish I did.

I expected something funny. The game name is pun! There's posters that reference other games and overly festive music every time you learn a new ability. And yet, plot cutscenes don't even contain an ounce of humor.

I expected something fun to play. Fighting enemies at the start was fun; trying to aim for a higher combo by throwing the enemies around and all. But by the end of the game, I felt like combat arenas were just mindless enemy spam, and although I got new abilities, I was worse at fighting them off.

There's also a difficulty spike where the game suddenly expects you to complete really long screens that include platforming and combat without dying in lava. Because falling into lava or running into blades kills you and respawns you at the last checkpoint, but falling into poison or falling into the void teleports you back to the last platform. You go from being able to retry the last jump you missed, to having to do harder platforming without failing once.

Similarly, there's that one screen where you need to do dodge, double jump, air dash, switch dimensions and up-B in a very short amount of time. It's the only instances where the game asks you to do that; and no it wasn't in a sequence of levels with increasing difficulty, it just happened to be there. Also, there's two autoscrolling tower levels. That's one too many.

Other annoying points were that the controls were too tight for me (the up button *must* be pressed before B or the ability doesn't activate) and that the final boss is different from all the other fights: [spoiler] it's more of a puzzle where you need to figure out what you're supposed to do, while all the other boss fights were hitting the boss until it died[/spoiler].

For a game that I expected to make me smile, I ended up feeling frustratingly weak. It feels like a very well-polished student game that's just not that interesting in the end.

TL;DR I know I'm not good at this kind of game, but the difficulty spike is awful

author: {'steamid': '76561198309690787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1676052831}
review:
I can't possibly say no harder to a game than this one. It takes every lesson from prior titles, and iterates on all of the worst aspects, while removing anything good. This process is done, as they constantly reference other, better media, reminding you of precisely how bad this game actually is. 

I think the worst aspect of this, is that you don't truly understand how bad it is until you can no longer return it, as it unfurls into some twisted lovechild of the worst metroid puzzles, and pieces of actual, factual, Kaizo trash.

The game's incredibly slow controls and sluggish response time feels more at home in a souls title, but enemies there move at compensatory speeds; unlike this title.

The boss that finally killed this for me was (I believe) the second boss, the angry lady along with the design of everything between her and (the genius tbh) small hole upgrade.

Any room and space I entered I could hear myself asking "Would it be possible to make this room more infuriating than it is right now?" the answer was always no.

her design was so annoying and opaque with endless frustration exponentially compounding with every phase that I genuinely wanted to break my controller. The final phase, which I assume was built to make you use the previously introduced shield mechanics, requires RNG to ensure both are in a vulnerability phase at the same time, near enough to hit, reachable, and with you not in some 2 second long knock back, or in the middle of doing literally anything.

I should have tapped out at the Bowser boss in temple 1. I should have realized the Kaizo DNA present. Especially with the variety of slowing mechanics that were layered atop a boss where you would be given almost no time to escape from.

I spent most of my play time unable to control my character, or waiting for my character to get back up after some random thing happened. 

Further; floaty platforming controls, without a reliable double jump, on platforms barely wide enough to have hit detection, right at a timed switch... Right outta mario maker's worst.

I'd love a refund; especially since it would have taken a substantial amount of effort to make a product this fantastically bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119634375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1675638234}
review:
I will start off by stating that I don't typically enjoy metroidvanias but this game was one of the exceptions. 

Gameplay:
Truly wonderful! Very addicting! Action-packed! This game gives you a range of abilities and combos that seems overwhelming as every single button on the Xbox controller does a different attack/move but you adjust to it and I would say it is easy to catch on. 

Atmosphere:
This is really where the designers nailed it. The design is absolutely stunning and really gives off what Mexico would look like in a video game. Many cultural references were nailed beautifully in this game. The catchy music, bright visuals, and character designs are well done, to say the least. The designers were clearly passionate about this game and it is easy to see.  

Storyline:
This is actually where the game is weakest. The story is pretty bland, very much of a Super Mario game in which you have to go save the princess type of thing. In fact, there was a couple of Mario references in the game which I thought was hilarious (also a reference to Metroid so these designers love Nintendo). There is an ending and an alternative ending...but the amount of work you have to do for the alternative ending for what you receive...not really worth it. You could beat the game and then watch the other ending online without the hassle. You gain only one extra ability if you wish to continue playing and collecting orbs which you will pretty much only use to break purple barriers. I expected a new suit or at least something other than just a new slideshow for going to the extra mile. 

Price:
It's worth it! However, it's an older game so you may as well wait for it to be on sale if you waited to this point.

Conclusion:
There is a reason this is a well-known indie title. The design and gameplay push this game to be one of the best metroidvanias I have played in a long time. This game can beat around 8 hours which is the perfect time frame in my opinion (10 hours if you want the alternative ending). If you want to give a friend a game, this is a great present for Cinco De Mayo. 

Score:
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198401297077', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1674581944}
review:
Este juego es un metroidvania basado en la cultura mexicana que tiene bastante carÃ¡cter, por un lado, tiene, en su mayorÃ­a, un diseÃ±o de escenarios espectacular. Las ciudades son preciosas y estÃ¡n cuidadas hasta el mÃ¡s mÃ­nimo detalle. En un goce visual. Por otra parte, tiene un combate bastante entretenido y conforme avanzas en la historia puedes hacer mÃ¡s convos, a la vez que aparecen nuevos enemigos con distintas debilidades. En este sentido el combate es muy entretenido. El apartado musical tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ muy bien conseguido, tiene canciones populares que conjuntan perfectamente con las ciudades. Conforme avanzas, no todo es pelear, hay partes de la historia donde tienes que hacer parkour y utilizar tus habilidades para continuar. Tiene unas cuantas misiones secundarias que son bastante entretenidas pero son cortas. TambiÃ©n, hay lugares donde puedes probar tus habilidades haciendo desafÃ­os. La historia estÃ¡ bien y los personajes tienen bastante carisma. El problema que yo encuentro es que, en el nivel final, empieza a empeorar visualmente y es muy tedioso. TambiÃ©n que los bosses son bastante faciles, tiene un modo dificil pero no lo he probado. Aunque si quieres que sea un reto puedes ponerte el traje de piÃ±ata y sufrir. (Se pueden comprar mejoras y trajes con el dinero del juego). 

El juego en sÃ­, dura unas 9 horas yendo con tranquilidad y completando algunos lugares al 100%. Para completar el 100% supongo que son unas 20 horas aproximadamente. Con todo esto, recomiendo el juego porque es bastante bueno y no dudes en probarlo si lo tienes gratis. Si tienes pensado comprarlo te dirÃ­a que lo puedes comprar perfectamente al precio al que estÃ¡, aunque si no tienes prisa, puedes esperar a las rebajas. TambiÃ©n tiene multijugador local de hasta 4 jugadores. Por Ãºltimo, hay otra versiÃ³n del juego pero esta es mÃ¡s completa. 
Overall: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198099458236', 'num_games_owned': 1666, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1653524818}
review: A classic of modern platformers. Played it on the Vita but was never able to finish it, and I'm really glad I revisited it. Fantastic art design and very fun combat with none of the boring design choices a lot of modern metroidvanias love to include. It's also a cute homage to videogame and mexican culture (with a really good mexican spanish localization). Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978029151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1678411646}
review:
I just discovered this game.  It was sitting unredeemed in a Humble Bundle from 2016.  I went in with no expectations and was blown away.  So damn fun.  Clever writing - Monkey Island level humor.  Great platforming, great fighting.  Buy it immediately.  Play it.  Enjoy it.  Then go buy the sequel.

Side note 1) I really hope they are working on a Guacamelee #3
Side note 2) If not, I would totally buy a chicken-only Mexiverse adventure.

review:
Ahora que me lo he pasado al 100% puedo decir que este juego no pasa con pena ni gloria, Â¿Por quÃ©?, porque ya a mitad de juego este se pone repetitivo y no logra innovar en nada, haciendo q tengas ganas de dejarlo ahÃ­. Como 11 enemigos sin contar las variaciones de algunos enemigos que estÃ¡n ahÃ­ porque sÃ­, un juego literalmente lineal porque no te dan una pista de por donde tienes que ir, te lo dicen, algo que en un metroidvania el cual trata mayormente de explorar pues igual y estÃ¡ algo pendejo. 
Puzzles jodidamente iguales unos a otros: salta, usa una habilidad, agarra lo que hay ahÃ­ o pasa de zona, ni siquiera un desafÃ­o con mini-jefe o un acertijo q te haga pensar. Y los trajes ni hablar, te pasarÃ¡s olvidando de que existen si es que no te acuerdas de darle a la E en los puntos de guardado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198727195683', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1566070115}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053060154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1672379539}
review:
Guacamelee is a solid title, and is a game definitely worth playing through. With good gameplay, good atmosphere, and good music; this cross between a metroidvania platformer and a beat'em up combo fighter is both satisfying and fun.

Grapple an enemy and kick them into a group for a big knockdown. Grab hold of a flying chupacabra and piledrive it into the earth. Dash punch into an uppercut and headbutt enemies into smithereens. The combat is pure fun, and isn't all that hard (bosses can be tough), even on hard mode.

The platforming is where the challenge lies, especially in the optional sections like Tule Treetops and Cueva de la Locura. These two lategame sections are unbelievably tough but are actually really satisfying to beat. Although you [i]do[/i] have to beat them for the alternate, and in my opinion, more satisfying, ending.

This is a game you've probably heard of, but maybe never actually seen gameplay of. It's done crossovers with everything from Brawlout to Dead Cells. Its reputation preceeds it, and for good reason.

I turned myself into a chicken. Funniest shit I've ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048226459', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1672362827}
review:
[h1]Guacamelee! STCE 100%[/h1]

[b]Single Playthrough: [/b] maybe 10 hours 
[b]Time to 100%: [/b] roughly 15 â€“ 20 hours
-Iâ€™d recommend searching the steam guides for the code to skip straight to hard mode without having to playthrough it once. Saves a lot of time and energy

[b]Difficulty: [/b] Difficult at times
-You can make the playthrough itself fairly simple by getting all the health, stamina, and special upgrades to make bosses and challenge arenas simpler.
-There are challenge rooms that require you to test gold in all aspects of the game, but you can hold them off until the end once youâ€™ve grasped the games mechanics

[b]Overall: [/b] Worth getting 100%
- The game is a mixture of tight combat, traditional metroidvania discovery, great art style, and references to other games / media that just add to the humor of the experience. Really solid experience, definitely worth your time!
... Not to mention thereâ€™s 4 player co-op for additional replay value and good times!

en conclusiÃ³n bla bla (no se organizar ideas) xd

author: {'steamid': '76561198202713148', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1706455335}
review:
Between the gameplay, the visual presentation, the always-upbeat soundtrack and the characters, it's clear Guacamelee's main objective is for you to have as much silly fun as possible

There's no greater philosophical themes, or finger-breaking difficulty for difficulty's sake; Just a charming, vibrant adventure oozing with love for Mexican culture and the Metroidvania sub-genre

Beating up hoards of skeletons, while jamming out with the ever-cheerful OST, puts you in a zen mode I can't quite explain, it's a sort of "relaxed excitement"

----------------------------------------------------------------

As for some notable flaws:

- Despite being a Metroidvania, the game is oddly linear, your next destination is always clearly defined and there is always only one area you're really meant to be exploring at any given time; the world doesn't quite feel like a real place the hero is traversing, with choices and branching paths, but just a video game map, which is fine for Guacamelee's size and fun-centric design, but noticeable enough

- Hard mode; It's pretty much just normal mode, except all the enemies have more health, and deal more damage,  which results in a second playthrough that just seems... slower and duller, as every foe gets an artificial boost - you'll be executing the same combos over and over and over while the baddies' healthbars barely budge, it simply gets boring compared to the fast paced normal mode

- This is a pretty personal nitpick, but I believe text boxes are a very overlooked part of a game's aesthetic; A good text box can add so much personality and flair to the characters and the game as a whole - take Celeste's text box for example! A sleek, textured backdrop displaying a beautiful, hand-drawn, 2D animation of the currently speaking character, while adorable gibberish mimicking human speech plays over every rapidly appearing letter, it's so fun! Guacamelee, despite having so much personality otherwise, really drops the ball in the text box department, giving us little more than a solid-color shape with no animation, and a single, mediocre sound effect, maybe I'm weird, but it is honestly the worst part of the game for me

----------------------------------------------------------------

At any rate, don't let the fact that the cons section is the longest part of this review fool you!
Guacamelee is overall a delight to play through and complete

If you're a fan of goofy, energetic escapades, that don't take themselves too seriously and are just laughs all the way through, definitely give Guacamelee a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999077438', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1689438492}
review:
This game is fun and beautiful to looks at.

The only thing I have problem in this game are the difficulty spikes... Most of the jumps and puzzles are very simple almost boring and repetitive and then you get to the one section in whole level that seems almost impossible.

This game also can't decide if it wants to be a jumping puzzle action game or arena beat the up game because it wants to do both but not's not great at either.

If you like platformer or metroidvania games give this game a try but be aware it can be frustrating at times

author: {'steamid': '76561198104914880', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1666688027}
review:
This game is called Guaca melee, but the combat just sucks.
You're learning cool combos, but there is hardly anyone to use them on.

There are only a few boss fights, and the rest is just getting swarmed by a bunch of mobs that all have certain conditions.
Like, go to death realm, break his shield with green attack, go back to death, oh there is a fucker up that you can't get to because you're melee.
It's so frustrating, and it breaks the flow of the game.

Is it an alright game? For sure? Would I recommend it? No.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128244632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1670291714}
review: This game is an amazing Metroidvania. It also has a great story and really awesome chracters. A must-have if you are into the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055255783', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1666644051}
review:
Guacamelee is a pretty fun metroidvania. The idea of your standard upgrades being combat moves was wonderful as is the combat. The art style and mexican themes are quite charming. Most of the game is running through corridors and fighting enemies in an arena but it's broken up by really fun platforming sections. The one thing I didn't like about this game but gave me a sense of nostalgia are the very dated video game references that remind me of the old days of the internet/youtube.

My play time is around 11 hours but I play this on my steam deck without setting up cloud saves first so the 4 hours is NOT my actual play time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207417937', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1666122242}
review: Guacamelee is that trip to Mexico you've been planning if Mexico was a Metroidvania series of connected dungeons. The level design and abilities are all by the numbers, but the beat-em-up combat is really fun and the visual style and music are excellent. This one is on the easier side but it's also short enough that it never gets boring dunking on all those skeletons and Mexican mythology creatures. You can turn into a chicken so it's of course the best game ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270804', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1666589049}
review: Great Metroidvania style game. Has some difficult platforming parts with some really cool mechanics, as well as some REALLY hard platforming parts that are extra if you're brave. Got the Platinum for this on the Playstation Vita and was excited to give it another go just for fun; still a great game that holds up after all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803090661', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1689286739}
review: This game has been one of my favorite nostalgic games growing up. I've done full playthroughs of this game every 4 years since 2014. I don't know how that coincidence happened but it just did. In 2014 I did a full playthrough of the game on easy mode, in 2018 I did another full playthrough, got the secret achievement and I did a little more by trying it out on hard mode and in 2022 I got all of the achievements to the game. Every time I return to this game I've enjoyed playing through it like it was my first time. I don't regret playing this game and that's why I leave my review as positive.

review:
If you're into getting games that are occasionally free or ultra cheap this is worth it.

If you wanna get into indie metroidvania shit but want something more straightforward to warm you up this is a great spot to start.

Overall one of the better vibrant and colorful games I played recently.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995671518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1664602957}
review: Finally got around to playing this game and it was a ton of fun! A great entry in the metroidvania genre. I love that there were lots of pure platforming bits as platformers are another favorite genre of mine. I also enjoyed the arena fight mechanic where you're locked into a challenge that you must overcome. There's heavy use of platforming and these arena battles throughout the game. Check it out if you're a fan of metroidvanias!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036806268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1547452924}
review:
This game is a hell of a lot of fun.  Amazingly great Metroidvania, with a lot of fun jokes thrown in.  Sorry, if this offends you, no one give a crap.  I love the Mexican/Dia de los Muertos aesthetic, if you get offended by it occasionally poking fun at itself, well, that's your problem.

Absolutely worth a buy.  This game kicks almost as much butt as the protagonist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074776927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1663188085}
review:
This game is very very short. You unlock abilities very often, and none of them feel nearly explored enough. For a metroid-vania game, i'm left with a strong unresolved feeling after finishing the main story. To my disappointment, you cant play as the woman luchador in a 1-player game.

The final boss is designed poorly. Throwing out random attacks without showing super short (specific-to-each-attack) warning animations, if at all (this is also present in a few other normal enemies), and doesn't give the player enough time to discern which movement/dodge options you have to handle each attack. And the laser attacks have annoying hitboxes that extend wider than they look.

If the game is on sale, then maybe give it a try. I don't think this is something i'd ever want to play a second time. Oh also the game has a lot of references to other games if you're into that

author: {'steamid': '76561198105614513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1662976151}
review:
Recommended with caution

At first mechanics are fun, but through out the game it seem forced, and you have to do the jumping uppercut mechanic over and over and over again, after almost half of the game you'll get double jump instead of being early due to uppercut mechanic but other than that the games good and a must play. 

hopefully they fix the mechanics (phasing) and add more on guacamelee 2

review: Que decir de este tremendo juegazo, tiene una ambientacion increible, un mundo increible y lo mejor es el sistema de combate y exploracion, una sorpresa porque no es muy conocido pero me gusto mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177558007', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1592847205}
review:
This is a solid indie metroidvania, the artstyle combined with the mexican thematic makes this so unique and cool to look at, I mean, just look at the enemies in the store images, they express everything you need to know.
The platforming is fun, it is not impossibly difficult but it does expect you to use your newly aquired powers in their totallity, forming combos with each other. 
I think the metroidvania aspect is a little bit "weaker"? Like it feels really streamlined and handholdy. 
I also liked the humor.
I finished this in about 6 hours, if for some reason you are the kind of person worried about price/hour, 2 bucks when in discount or the 10 dollars it asks by default is completely worth it.

I did enjoy the boss fights a lot, especially the last one. I just wish the game had some difficult post game content as there is none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171050929', 'num_games_owned': 2009, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1564469162}
review:
[b]Guacamelee! [i]Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i][/b] es de los mejores metroidvania que podes encontrar. Super divertido y con un buen toque de humor.
Somos Juan, un luchador que se enfrenta a la muerte para rescatar a su amada. Exploraremos los rincones del mundo de los muertos y los vivos en bÃºsqueda de Lupita.
Tiene un lindo sistema de combos haciendo que el combate sea muy divertido, la exploraciÃ³n una vez consigamos ciertas habilidades, serÃ¡ bastante mas sencilla.

9/10 Finkitos

author: {'steamid': '76561198061481125', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1660701101}
review:
Mola como han hecho lo de viajar entre el mundo de los vivos y el de los muertos.

Reconozco que solo por la temÃ¡tica mexicana ya me tenÃ­an casi convencido (la banda sonora es genial) Luego al jugarlo he visto que ademÃ¡s de ser bonito artÃ­sticamente tambiÃ©n es pura calidad en el resto de apartados.

Los grÃ¡ficos y diseÃ±o me flipan porque recuerdan a la serie de animaciÃ³n Samurai Jack (2001) Luego estÃ¡ la jugabilidad con diferentes tÃ©cnicas para hacer combos a los monstruos, si aprendes a hacerlo bien no les dejarÃ¡s ni respirar.

Aunque se podrÃ­a considerar un "metroidvania" por su exploraciÃ³n del mapa, conseguir mejoras, etc. va muchÃ­simo mÃ¡s directo al grano que otros juegos de este gÃ©nero que suelen tener un sistema muchÃ­simo mÃ¡s complejo.
Por ejemplo no tienes armas ni equipo, vas a tortazo limpio aunque puedes comprar diferentes trajes de lucha libre con habilidades pasivas. AdemÃ¡s de la historia principal hay misiones secundarias, secretos escondidos y hasta distintos finales.

Tiene mÃ¡s dosis de plataformeo de lo habitual en este tipo de juegos, cosa que a mÃ­ me ha gustado mucho, pero lo comento igualmente como dato relevante.
Muy buen videojuego, lo recomiendo.

Esta ha sido mi reseÃ±a y al que no le guste que le den. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199124272072', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1647893088}
review:
A somewhat challenging, somewhat relaxing, mostly feelgood, Metroidvania game with a fun Mexican setting. Colourful and cheerful visuals and music. Awesome humour and lots of pop culture references.

Gameplay-wise it's a pretty basic Metroidvania. During the game the player unlocks extra combo's and special moves. The special moves also unlock new parts of the levels.

Fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155946727', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1660470340}
review:
I think.... It's Ok?

UPD: After 44 days I can figure out my opinion about the game. It has many abilities, pretty graphics, nice costumes and problems. Guacamelee has poor music, no voices, easy bosses (but stylish). The game tells you what you need to do with help of colored bricks (I think it is not the best practice). The number of abilities is really large so sometimes you should miss press the buttons. Oh, and the game is way too long. I think, one location could be easily cut out.

But, for 2014 it is a nice game. There were no platformer bangers like we have now. It is only the 2nd game from DrinkBox and the 1st in that genre. So, despite all problems, the game is nice, but outdated.

review:
Recomendable no, Â¡Â¡HIPERRECOMENDABLE!! Como cosas positivas a destacar: la ambientaciÃ³n rollo mexicano, su traducciÃ³n a espaÃ±ol (que no sÃ© si es traducciÃ³n o V. O., pero es MAGNÃFICA), sus miles de referencias a otros juegos como Metroid sobre todo, el modo de animaciÃ³n e ilustraciÃ³n del juego que es espectacular visualmente y los cientos de huevos de pascua y referencias a otros juegos con traducciones literales en espaÃ±ol que se pueden ver a lo largo de los mapas del juego.

El Ãºnico contra que le podrÃ­a sacar es que no sea mÃ¡s largo el juego y que por desgracia no tiene un Â«posgameÂ» digno, pero es algo comÃºn en los juegos de esta categorÃ­a, la batalla contra el jefe final es el desenlace y no hay nada mÃ¡s allÃ¡ despuÃ©s de ella. Pero estÃ¡ compensado por sus dos finales que aumentan la durabilidad del juego un buen cacho.

Es un 10/10, un juego de los que hace tiempo que no disfrutaba, enganchÃ¡ndome como cuando tenÃ­a 12 aÃ±os.

P.D.: Recomiendo pasar por la Workshop y echar un vistazo a los trajes personalizados, hay uno de Samus Aran que es fabuloso, y tambiÃ©n otros tantos de personajes famosos de otros videojuegos que te brindarÃ¡n una experiencia de juego espectacular.

author: {'steamid': '76561199229887596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1660389945}
review:
A simple but well-done Metroidvania. With charming graphics and and a nice soundtrack, the Mexican Luchador theme exudes all of it charisma through the screen, short npc text lines and straightforward story. The combat is responsive, fluid and quite entertaining. The combo possibilities are quite varied considering you have only two buttons. The special moves are colorful and remain useful and powerful through the whole game. The enemies variety and mechanics keep you entertained with the combat and challenges all the way through, with that said, this game is on the easier side, very few battles, be it with bosses or regular enemies, will prove much of a challenge to most.

One bad thing this game have is the lack of a sidequest tracker. While said sidequest aren't long or complicated to the point of escaping from your memory, it can get bothersome to remember where you stopped at with certain quests between longer breaks.

All in all, a good game, grab it if you have the spare cash. Plus there is coop up to 4 people. 
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198106511544', 'num_games_owned': 1624, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1659808331}
review:
[b]Sights & Sounds[/b]
- It's hard to find a good place to start when every aspect of the presentation is so good
- The style of the both characters and environments is fantastic. I particularly like the villains
- The music is so good. Almost every song is a banger

[b]Story & Vibes[/b]
- The story is your basic "save the princess" archetype, but it's effective here because of all the level design. Going through the diverse towns and environments with NPCs directing you and cheering you on gives you a sense of progression
- With all the humor and bright colors, the game is very inviting. Those aspects make you want to keep playing it, if that makes sense
- The humor deserves special attention. There's some clever writing in here (i.e., Fray Ayayay)
- All of these factors contribute to what feels like a cohesive, well-crafted world to play around in

[b]Playability & Replayability[/b]
- The attention paid to the other aspects of the game should clue you in to how good the gameplay is. It's outstanding
- This is much better on a controller. I found myself naturally fighting with the d-pad and platforming with the analog stick
- The fighting mechanics are quite good. By the time you pick up all the skills and abilities, fighting feels like you're playing Smash Brothers with additional platforming options
- Being a 2D platformer in the Metroid vein, a lot of those skills you pick will also help you solve platforming challenges and reach previously inaccessible areas
- Some of those puzzles are really quite challenging, and fit in well with the excellent level design
- I absolutely want to pick this one back up for a 100% run someday. It's all good enough to reexperience

[b]Overall Impressions & Performance[/b]
- This game is just pure fun. I had such a great time playing it
- Everything ran beautifully and bug-free

[b]Final Verdict[/b]
- [b]10/10[/b]. In the 2D platforming genre (including so-called "metroidvanias"), this stands at the top with games like Super Mario Bros. It's a masterpiece. I'd recommend it without reservation

author: {'steamid': '76561198080756721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1659356729}
review: I would love to talk about the gameplay, level design, enemy design, music, writing, etc. I would love to, but unfortunately the devs for this game decided to make an asinine control scheme and then refuse to let me rebind it. This is more than just petty, stupid, and lazy, it also shows a supreme lack of consideration for accessibility. Yes technically you can remap controls through steam, but that's like serving someone a meal covered in shit and reassuring them that if the shit bothers them, you can use the table cloth to wipe it off. Yes I could, but I could also shove a negative review down the developers throat and remind them that not everyone who plays their game is going to think that dodge belongs on the right stick, you dumb, arrogant fucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440874884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1658979436}
review:
Hardly a game, but a TORTUE.
First, the protagonist Luchador has a terrible face.
I have to say the game features great Mexican El dia del muerto art, but a good game or a game means more than its artistic characteristics.
I came to give a thumb-down review because the game lost its gaming core, more like a visual fiction cliche.
Maybe the studio staff comes to the living world just to have reunions with sus familias?
That 's it. A terrible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107064234', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1658914556}
review:
It's not really a bad game totally. I really liked the setting and the design.

Writing was poor though, I feel like, especially when it came to pacing and the REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY TERRIBLE HUMOR. gameplay got repetitive really quickly. The combat got so bad that it basically devolved into the game throwing as many enemies as it can on screen at a futile attempt at difficulty.  And, for a relatively short game, it felt like it was too long which is always a bad sign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979187773', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1671745058}
review:
I think guacamelee! STCE is great game even tho it's super old game, but still it hold itself well.
If you are thinking what is the best edition, gold or STCE. it's STCE. I know gold have more achievements but this one is more packed with new boss, enemy and level. yes, i don't have gold but i showed my cousin screenshots of my gmae and he didn't know who are the boss or an enemy so i know what the best. trust me get this it's way better then gold.

as for the game. the game is old and have basic platforming but it use the environment to make a puzzle so it can make unique gameplay making passing a platforming level super fun and feel super smart when passing it.
the story is basic but yet making you have sympathise to the protagonist and understanding he's childhood and the villain isn't just "there" he have back story and not making him evil for nothing.
the art style is amazing making you forget that is a 2014 game.
the combat is good and have good ideas but the some enemies are hard to beat but good thing there are not a lot of them.

guacamelee! is old but good game basic platforming but interesting gameplay and i think if you don't like metroidvania like me. i think you like it as i did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047594791', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1658303306}
review:
Bei diesem Spiel wÃ¼nschte ich mir echt ein richtig Bewertungssystem... Meine GÃ¼te frustriert dieses Spiel zum Teil enorm! Ab ungefÃ¤hr 1/2 - 2/3 des Spiels wirst du fast nur noch in Instadeath-Arenen geschmissen die jeden noch so kleinen Fehltritt direkt mit dem Tod bestrafen. Wozu hat man dann Ã¼berhaupt ein Lebensbalken, wenn jeder Hit quasi dein Tod bedeutet? Entweder, weil du danebengesprungen bist/ geschlagen hast oder weil dich ein Gegner trifft und du deshalb in die Instadeath-Trap fÃ¤llst. Ich finde die KÃ¤mpfe so wie sie sind schon mehr als knackig genug: StÃ¤ndig zwischen den Ebenen wechseln, den Ãœberblick Ã¼ber die Schilde nicht verlieren und gleichzeitig den Gegnerischen Angriffen ausweichen (teilweise auch 10 oder 12 StÃ¼ck auf einmal. Aber wie gesagt, das reicht noch nicht, es muss NOCHMAL schwerer werden und mit jeder Arena die du machst denkst du, viel krasser als das wird es kaum werden und du bist getÃ¤uscht. Aber anders als bei guten Soulslike Spielen ist finde ich hier der Frustfaktor immens viel hÃ¶her!
Anyway.. wenn dich das alles oben nicht abgeschreckt hat, dann solltest du das Spiel definitiv spielen, da es abgesehen davon echt ein gutes Spiel mit groÃŸartigem Humor ist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198310363049', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1658152291}
review:
I'd say I enjoyed this game 70% of the time. What starts off as a fun game though has a few noticeable flaws as the gameplay progresses. Being colourblind of certain defects, it was a tad frustrating to notice the difference between the yellow and green against the backgrounds which can make certain attacks against bosses frustrating. That and if you want the 'good ending' and want all the Chac Mools, the orb in the Sierra is quite possibly one of the hardest things to do and killed my love of the game. You either need to be very good or very lucky to get past one of the screens. That being said I'm 37 with a full time job and can only game when I can so someone younger with faster reflexes and time could probably garner more enjoyment.
It's a well made game but keep these frustrations in mind and maybe pick it up on sale...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970633599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1655496956}
review:
Are you're looking for a Metroidvania, but you're tired of aliens, anime, and dark, depressing games that take themselves too seriously? If so, then it's time to play Guacamelee. 

I'd give it a solid B. It's neat that combat abilities also serve as mobility enhancements. So the uppercut is also a super-jump, etc. The world is very colorful and detailed, but probably too slick. I think it would be more charming if it had less polish. There's also WAY too much going on in the background. You can see this in the screenshots. It kind of blurs all the areas together in my memory. 

My biggest complaint is that when you get hit, it takes too long for you to get back up. You have i-frames, but the animation slows everything down and makes the combat feel water-logged.

Overall, a genuinely funny and unique Metroidvania for when you need something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111017069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1629674647}
review:
Guacamelee is pretty much the perfect game to introduce people to not only the metroidvania genre itself, but just gaming in general. This game overall is fun, simple and not hard, although some sections spike the difficulty like the last rival fight. But besides that, it perfectly mashes the genre with the mexican culture of Lucha Libre in such a way that Mucha Lucha would be damn proud. 

This is the best version to play as it also has Co-Op on top of some little extra things the Original and Gold don't have. If you have your doubts, buy it on sale. It won't disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002067150', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1656531779}
review:
This is a best-case scenario for indie Metroidvanias.  Great art design and aesthetic, fun characters, and most importantly a solid core gameplay loop.  Every new upgrade flows together perfectly both in combat and in exploration, until by the end you're fighting and traversing by chaining multiple moves together in a way that feels extremely satisfying and rewarding.

Overall just a fantastic game, no qualms about recommending this one. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198036930900', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1654346201}
review: Despite the obnoxiously long name, this is a short and very fun action-packed metroidvania. The combat feels like a beat em up, the soundtrack/visuals are vibrant, there are some pretty funny jokes/references to other metroidvania games, and the platforming is fun/challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342024745', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1654308683}
review: This is a really fun metroidvania with a lot of charm. The visuals and audio are incredible, but the real star here is the gameplay. There is plenty to do, and it is very well paced so you wont get bored. Most metroidvanias I have played dont have great combat, but here it feels very fluid, and many of the combat abilities can also be used for movement, leading to a very cohesive experience. 10/10 fantastic game

author: {'steamid': '76561199033894989', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1653867036}
review:
Un juego entretenido, con buenas mecÃ¡nicas y un buen desarrollo de habilidades. Sin embargo, se queda en ello, un plataformero exigente que te pone a prueba, pero que no quedarÃ¡ grabado en tu memoria como un juego memorable y digno por conseguir. Â¿Quieres un reto y pasarlo bien mientras juegas? CÃ³mpralo sin duda. Â¿Quieres un juego que trascienda y rompa los esquemas de los plataformeros? QuizÃ¡ hay mejores opciones en el mercado. 

_____________________________________________________________________________________

A pesar del trabajo que conllevÃ³ la construcciÃ³n del juego y los diferentes escenarios, en ocasiones esta misma construcciÃ³n hace que no se sienta inmersivo. Es decir, las misiones y mecÃ¡nicas dan una sensaciÃ³n de â€œâ€˜ve al punto Aâ€™, â€˜oh, ya fuiste y aprendiste una nueva tÃ©cnica, es momento de que vayas al punto Bâ€™â€, y asÃ­ sucesivamente durante gran parte de la trama del juego (por no decir toda, ya que para el 100% sÃ­ hace necesaria la exploraciÃ³n autÃ³noma). Esto le quita atractivo, ya que, por sus dinÃ¡micas, y hasta cierto punto su dificultad, tenÃ­a todo por delante para convertirse en un juego que te llama, engancha y te exige jugarlo. 

Personalmente siento que esto es producto de una historia mÃ¡s bien floja, utilizando el tÃ­pico recurso de la damisela en peligro y el pobre enamorado que debe convertirse en alguien lo suficientemente fuerte como para afrontar el peligro y rescatar a la doncella de las garras del mal. Esto conlleva a que el juego pase sin pena ni gloria en cuanto a trama se refiere. Un ejemplo de este apartado podrÃ­a ser el personaje femenino, al que uno accede por medio de la mÃ¡scara. A pesar de que uno la utilice en todo momento, y juegue con el â€˜personaje femeninoâ€™ (que lo Ãºnico que varÃ­a es la skin, mÃ¡s no la jugabilidad, ya que es idÃ©ntica) durante el desarrollo de la historia se hace evidente que uno continÃºa jugando con Juan, nuestro hÃ©roe primario. Esto le quita seriedad y razÃ³n de ser a las skins entre masculino y femenino, ya que siempre el protagonista es el masculino. Si quisieron implementar el personaje femenino debieron darle el protagonismo que merecÃ­a, de resto me parece simplemente una pÃ©rdida de esfuerzo por parte de los creadores del juego. 

QuizÃ¡ una respuesta a este fallo en la trama podrÃ­a atribuÃ­rsele a que es un juego independiente, y que por tanto no posee los mismos recursos que un triple A del cual se espera que sea lo mejor y lo mÃ¡s esperado. Si bien esta podrÃ­a ser una razÃ³n, siento que serÃ­a brindar excusas a esta falencia que posee. El hecho de que sea independiente no implica que tenga que ser lo mÃ­nimo. Al contrario, como la creaciÃ³n del juego requiere de un esfuerzo gigantesco para poderlo publicar y comercializar, se hace necesario que se pula hasta los mÃ­nimos detalles con el fin poder continuar con secuelas. Aunque, puesto que existe Guacamelee 2, parece que sÃ­ cumplieron los mÃ­nimos y eso representÃ³ esos frutos. Espero puedan continuar mejorando. 

Un aspecto en el que sÃ­ resalta y que lo hace un juego llamativo e interesante es la dificultad. El juego es accesible para cualquier persona acostumbrada a jugar juegos de plataforma (tipo Super Mario Bros), y gradualmente comienza a hacerse exigente en algunos apartados. Ahora, si eres una persona completista, que busca encontrar cada opciÃ³n que te permite el juego, buscar todos los secretos y llegar a cada lugar disponible, en otras palabras, completar los logros y llegar al tan anhelado 100%, tienes un excelente desafÃ­o por delante. Los apartados de los retos del Infierno ponen a prueba de ensayo y error, concentraciÃ³n y precisiÃ³n a cualquiera que lo intente. Fenomenal, excelente punto para el juego.

Los enemigos son variaciones de uno mismo: los esqueletos. Estos son los que conforman el ejÃ©rcito de Calaca (enemigo a derrotar). Una idea base y acorde con la trama del juego son los esqueletos, los cuales se relacionan fÃ¡cilmente con la muerte. AdemÃ¡s, las diferentes formas en que se presentan, asÃ­ como la manera en que hay que derrotarlos, hacen que sea una idea sencilla pero bien desarrollada. AsÃ­ es como debe ser. QuizÃ¡ uno esperarÃ­a gran variaciÃ³n de enemigos, pero la forma en que presentan a los diferentes esqueletos responde a lo que uno demanda en cuestiÃ³n de adversarios. Este aspecto de los enemigos, tambiÃ©n se relaciona con la mecÃ¡nica del cambio de las dimensiones, la cual se utiliza en su justa medida, incrementando la dificultad y forzando la prÃ¡ctica con el fin de pulir y ser preciso a ala hora de utilizar alguna habilidad y/o golpe. Excelente. 

En lo personal el mejor plataformero que he probado es Hollow Knigth. Pero siento que este Ãºltimo no hubiese sido posible sin la existencia de Guacamelee. Los de Hollow identificaron, explotaron y desarrollaron ese talÃ³n de Aquiles que tuvo Gucamalee y crearon uno de los mejores juegos que he podido conocer.  

Pdta: ReseÃ±a realizada despuÃ©s de jugar un total de 29 horas segÃºn Steam, y luego de haber completado la totalidad de los logros. Que buen desafÃ­o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139480922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1654080264}
review:
[h1]My Thoughts[/h1]
One day I opened up Steam and I saw a new game that I hadn't bought. That game was Guacamelee. I was kinda surprised and saw that others also got it for free. Now I didn't have any interest in this type of game so I didn't play it for years. But now I have finally come around to it.

Overall the game isn't half bad but not great either. It doesn't have that many outright flaws, it's just that it doesn't do anything special to make it stick out from other Metroidvania's.

[h2]Story[/h2]
Story-wise the game isn't good at all, it rushes the player towards a plot point. None of the characters are interesting.

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
The combat quickly wears off its charm, for me at least, it's a bit too simple and easy, there's no real challenge in combat arenas until they start throwing some instadeath mechanics in the mix, which are more frustrating than anything else. Also, the combos, there's pretty much one combo, there's going to be a new ability here and there but not change much in terms of combos. 

Boss fights are pretty good, I loved the one against 'The Terrible Trio', it felt very unique and fun to play. It's just there are barely any of them here, there are 5 in total and 2 of those are so bland and forgettable.

The controls are kinda clunky. Especially the later areas are sort of frustrating because of this, all the special moves are bound to 1 button, the only difference is the input of the analog stick. Now, this is way too easy to miss input since a thumbstick isn't the most accurate thing there is. Platforming suffers heavily under this, again at least for me. In the later areas, you have to quickly switch between worlds, use specials, et cetera. So this was rather frustrating than rewarding.

[h2]Sound[/h2]
The audio is decent, hits feel rewarding, and so on. The music is alright, it repeats the same handful of tracks over and over which eventually gets tiring, but at the start, it's quite charming, except for one track that sounds like it's made by some mentally defective child.

[h2]Visuals[/h2]
Visually the game looks good, as you can see by the screenshots. It has its charm but, again, it wears off after a while. Enemies do look unique throughout the game.

There's one major complaint I have with the visuals and that is the top bar. When playing solo there's no reason to constantly see "Press > to join" times 3. It just looks ugly and obnoxious.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
All in all, it isn't a bad game, not even close. But the thing that stops me from recommending it is that it's very bland and quickly wears off the charm it has going for it. Combat gets stale fast, the story isn't interesting in the least, and the soundtrack or visuals aren't strong enough to carry it. 
I don't want to say you can't enjoy this game, it's just that I didn't enjoy it enough to give it a recommendation.
[h3]Rating[/h3]
4,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198100211395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1653708270}
review: I don't know if I and so many others had lower standards when Guacamelee originally launched or something changed in some updates, but I have never been more frustrated with the controls and overall design in a game in my life. A lot of the "skill" involved in this game involves platform puzzles that requires split second switching between dodging, double jumping and special moves. the problem is that all the specials are assigned to one button and a directional which is way too easy to  mis-input, their not quite responsive enough, and to top it all off I can't even remap the controls. So what happens is that you end up doing the same room for hours (or at times feels like it) knowing full well what needs to be done but not being able to because you're wrestling with the controls. That's just bad design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018417063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1654638809}
review:
It's a game i wanted to like but it has too many issues that end up pilling on top of each other ultimately making the game a slog to play.

It's supposed to be a "metroidvania" style game but its overall designed in a way much more akin to a linear action game. Which is frustrating for me, someone who doesn't like metroidvanias, because i would much prefer that the developers made a linear action game instead. I ended up just rushing to the end without doing any optional content or side quests. It took me about 4 hours to finish the game.

There are too many platforming elements. They are tedious and it gets bogged down with gimmick after gimmick. The combat is more enjoyable and it would've been preferable if that was the focus of the game.

The combat starts out OK, but it also gets bogged down with gimmicks very quickly. By the end of the game, the player is forced to use about half a dozen different skills and abilities to even damage enemies. It doesn't make the combat challenging or varied, it just turns the whole thing into an unfun, overly complicated slog.

There's little story in the game and infrequent cutscenes (unskippable). However, the small amount of story and cutscenes that are in the game are quite terrible. Would've preferred that there was zero dialogue and the story was told through animations. The developers, in particular, have a terrible sense of humor.

The difficulty is all over the place. The game for the most part is quite easy, but every once in a while the player comes across certain rooms of platforming or combat that are just backbreaking hard.

The final boss is awful. Impressively terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996645789', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1650521929}
review:
It's....okay. I think this game is like, the perfect candidate for a "Maybe" recommendation tag on Steam. I've bought both this and the older Gold Edition and probably have 20 hours as a whole across them both and I've bounced off them each time. 

The core gameplay is fun: grappling and throwing enemies around, including into other enemies is a neat twist on the usual combat for these kinds of games. The graphics are colorful and vibrant. The music is catchy. It's not terribly long or the sort of game that pads out its runtime. Some of the dialogue can be funny. 

It's also the sort of game that trades story for gaming references and jokes that are kind of run into the ground like an episode of Family Guy. I would've appreciated a little more story or worldbuilding for as colorful as the world is, it's mostly a vehicle to give "hey I recognize that thing"-style references to other video games. This doesn't always have to be a dealbreaker, but in a Metroidvania you should want to explore the world because that's a big part of the genre's concept and Guacamelee's world isn't...interesting enough on its own to want to explore. 

It's also kind of exhausting to play: by the end, the final dungeon, once all the mechanics are unlocked, enemies have a laundry list of things you have to do to be able to kill them (gotta be in the right dimension, gotta attack them with the right color attack, gotta dodge X and Y attack, but you can't dodge Z, etc) and the fights themselves turn into chaotic clusterfucks once 3+ enemies are on the screen where the action can be difficulty to follow and I just wasn't having much fun with the core combat anymore. The mechanics seem to build on in a way that's there to make it harder to kill enemies rather than to create any kind of fun variations on the core combat loop, such as giving them the ability to teleport away from you mid-combo to break up your all-important combo stack or the ability to be immune to all damage except certain attacks. 

And then little problems like some really questionable hit detection or a boss bugging out and changing attacks mid-animation, etc.

It's also a really platforming-heavy game with some puzzles that require precise timing and a section midway through the game (the volcano) where they throw in a lot of instant-death mechanics that just...grate.

So...it's a "maybe" game. Maybe it can be a game you really dig, if the above doesn't really bother you. I'd wait for it to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134208288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2026, 'last_played': 1650080851}
review:
[h1]Â¡Ay, gÃ¼ey! Que buen juego [/h1]

Metroidvania Clasico, que no es innovador pero que cumple con todo lo que un metroidvania debe hacer.
En resumen simple y satisfactorio, . 
en oferta esta a menos de 2 dolares y vale totalmente la pena.

como puntos a destacar:

[h1] Curva de Dificuldad:   8/10[/h1] El juego es bastante facil lo suficiente como para iniciar una partida en dificil desde la primer Run, tiene sus picos de dificultad en el ultimo tramo del juego y en los desafios que son opcionales.

[h1] Rejugabilidad : SI [/h1] para sacar el 100% me tomo 2 partidas y menos de 25 hrs .[spoiler] lo cual pudo ser reducido si hubiera sabido que usando el codigo konami puedes iniciar desde el inicio en dificil sin tener que pasar el juego 1 vez  [/spoiler]

[h1]Ambientacion: SI  [/h1] El juego es simpatico y agradable a la vista, si bien no sale de los tipicos cliche de la cultura mexicana sigue aÃ±adiendo algunas cositas que te hacen ver que almenos hicieron su tarea investigando para dar un contexto a todo el juego

[h1] Historia: Clasica [/h1] Si bien no innova en su historia sigue estando dentro del estandar de un videojuego por lo que  es buena.

[h1] Banda Sonora 10/10 [/h1] creo que cumple su funcion es pegadiza y facilmente reconocible le da una identidad al juego, combinado con su ambientacion es un 10/10

[h1] Jugabilidad 8/10[/h1] No considero que tenga una mala jugabilidad pero hablamos de un juego con unos cuantos aÃ±os encima y aveces se le nota un poco que el movimiento es un tanto torpe ,pero nada grave

[spoiler]Pd: Pinche desarrollador que se le ocurrio hacer que debamos transportar un pollo a lo largo de un nivel con pinchos y con limite de tiempo, ojala que le vallas a poner limon a tus tacos y este seco. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199013085125', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1650070759}
review:
Le jeu est vraiment fun dans l'ensemble,

J'ai eu l'occasion d'y jouer une premiÃ¨re fois Ã  la sortie sur Wii U et de le finir Ã  nouveau aujourd'hui en coop ! Et force est de constater que c'Ã©tait aussi plaisant qu'Ã  l'Ã©poque, ce jeu a quelque chose d'intemporel qui en fait un classique de l'indÃ© Ã  mon humble avis. 

Les contrÃ´les sont nerveux, les phases de plateformes ne se rÃ©pÃ¨tent jamais et savent poser de la difficultÃ© quand c'est nÃ©cessaire, le panel d'ennemis est cool et permet de faire des compos qui forcent Ã  "rÃ©flÃ©chir" pendant les combats, les animations sont franchement propres Ã©galement !

Sans parler des graphismes qui pour moi donnent vraiment un sacrÃ© charme au jeu. Je suis Ã©galement assez fan des charadesigns ! Mais Ã©galement l'ambiance sonore et les ost qui sont trÃ¨s bonnes, bref, y'a beaucoup Ã  dire.

L'histoire est clairement en fond, mais sa simplicitÃ© fait qu'on est totalement plongÃ© dans tout ce qu'elle enrobe: humour et folklore parsÃ¨ment la narration et c'est une trÃ¨s bonne dÃ©couverte pour moi. Que ce soit les dialogues, les techniques, certaines quÃªtes secondaires.. Je n'ai jamais trouvÃ© qu'un Ã©lÃ©ment Ã©tait en "trop". 

En bref, c'est un excellent mÃ©troidvania, la seule critique que je pourrais faire c'est que le mode coop est en "local", ce qui ne permet pas au joueur 2 de bÃ©nÃ©ficier de sa propre camÃ©ra. Elle est toujours centrÃ©e sur le joueur 1 tout en essayant de "garder" tout le monde dans l'Ã©cran, ce qui rend certaines phases de plateforme laborieuses. 
Mais encore une fois cette difficultÃ© ne survient qu'en coop.

Le jeu vaut totalement le dÃ©tour !

author: {'steamid': '76561198346433358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1650750351}
review: I usually wait longer before I write my reviews for games on Steam, but I guess this time is different. I opened the game for the first time and played for 1.5 hours straight and now I'm writing this review. The game is SUPER fun. The fighting mechanics are surprisingly smooth and enjoyable, especially the multitude of combos that you can perform. I also like the visual style and the soundtrack a lot. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968325520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1650057795}
review:
A love letter to Metroid/Castlevania and 2D platformers of the past while being incredibly unique at the same time. Rather than shooting or whipping, Guacamelee feels like a beat 'em in a Metroidvania world. The attacks and combos feel incredibly natural and intuitive and when thing get chaotic, it's great fun suplexing and piledriving enemies into each other.

In addition to the combat, there is some challenging platforming but I never thought it was unfair. The controls are tight, response and if you made a mistake, it's your fault.

I absolutely love the story and the humor of the game. While other games like this feel a little forced in humor, and dialogue, you'll find yourself chuckling to the smallest things and the entire thing just feels so charming.

I can't recommend the game enough if you into Metroidvania games and want something a little different from the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191911057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1650000961}
review:
Love the aesthetic, love the music, it runs well on a potato. The characters are colorful, and the look of the game screams fun.

But It was way more platforming that I expected or wanted. Did not like the combat having to switch into different dimensions to fight. The upgrades were meh, the power ups weren't anything special, and the combat was fine. I just did not like finishing a platforming section, only to reach the next screen which is also a platforming section. Felt like it was a platformer more than a lucha metroidvania. 

I wanted to like it, but its just not my jam.

You can't touch the floor since it's instant kill and you run out of the up attack and side attack and only 9 second to kill the kamikazes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041899839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1649873102}
review: Game looks and runs great, and this newer version has some welcome additions, but there's not nearly enough new unlocks and upgrades to level out your character to address some of the harder challenges. The big detractor from my endorsement though? The mechanics for some of the platform based challenge are borderline awful, and their increasing frequency near the final portion of the game, made this game insanely frustrating. The kind with one-hit kill traps, annoying enemies with unblockable attacks and unfun mechanics tossed in for no apparent choice other than making the challenge just straight up hard. I think this is the main problem with a lot of metroidvania style games in this vein, but the unique issue with Guacamelee is that all of the abilities require precise input. If you've ever played a fighting game for the 5th or 10th time and you're trying to nail the exact input to get a special move done, you know the pain, but the makers instead went, man what if it was that fight, plus we add a bunch of exploding guys on a countdown over a pit of instant death?

author: {'steamid': '76561198059955896', 'num_games_owned': 1223, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1649591574}
review:
This game gets too much praise. Although it's not a straight up bad game, it's not as good as people try to tell you. It gets very repetitive really fast and the game elements are not that much fun to hold your attention 'til the end of the game. The fact that the game isn't very long but still too long to be fun for it's whole playtime was very exhausting for me. From the half point on i hadn't much fun with the game and was already anticipating the end so that i can be done with it. Combat is really simple but get's only more annoying. Especially in the later areas, where you're thrown with encounter after encounter, consisting of enemies which are mostly the same but in greater numbers. Don't get me started with enemies which instant kill you if you don't kill them fast enough. Endgame enemies have the mechanic to randomly teleport away, which kinda breaks the flow of combat and doesn't do anything except wasting your time & combo.
Also there are some irritating checkpoints where you have to go through another area again just to reach the point where you died, which just wastes your time. This is in particular annoying in areas where you die instantly from environmental hazards. The game doesn't do very interesting stuff with it's metroidvania elements, you just get additional attacks for color code blocks which are destroyed by those attacks - apart from wallrun or the goat fly near the end of the game there isn't anything shaking up the gameplay, and backtracking for items which are not very rewarding isn't much fun either, also because the world isn't that interesting. There is a Teleport system, although the spots are often not in smart areas which led to me not using it for the most part.

All in all i can't say that this should at all be a metroidvania, and those element feel rather forced. Could be replaced with doors & keys, this game does nothing interesting with the formula - especially as the world doesn't change as you progress the games.
If you're looking for a metroidvania, play sth else. Because most games use the metroidvania elements in a better way.

review:
Jogo divertido, cheio de humor mas tambÃ©m com as suas falhas. A sua jogabilidade Ã© bastante satisfatÃ³ria variando consoante os poderes ganhos e iremos descobrir bastantes segredos dependendo das estÃ¡tuas descobertas, muito fluÃ­do e com variados combos. Os efeitos sonoros estÃ£o espectaculares e a sua banda sonora melhor ainda. A histÃ³ria Ã© muito simples mas os desenvolvedores deixaram claro que nÃ£o precisam de mais para fazer um jogo super divertido. Graficamente estÃ¡ perfeito tendo em conta a origem da histÃ³ria e estilo.
Acho um metroidvania obrigatÃ³rio para quem gosta do estilo e nÃ£o se irÃ£o arrepender de jogar esta obra Ãºnica.
Para mim um sÃ³lido 8/10.

review:
[h1] Meh. [/h1]
Pude pasarme el Guacamelee. Lo conozco desde que saliÃ³ allÃ¡ a principios de la dÃ©cada pasada.
La curva de dificultad empieza siendo MUY plana. Muy sencillo 3/4 del juego y al Ãºltimo se pone complicado. No me gusto que los 3 Ãºltimos jefes estÃ©n muy pegados.
El combate es divertido, pero muy imprecisos los controles. No se por quÃ© recomiendan controles (mandos) modernos si el input no es analÃ³gico. Los saltos y los dash son muy contra-intuitivos y cuestan acostumbrase.
Me gusta el detalle (que es comÃºn en los metroidvanias, todo hay que decir)de que es muy rejugable y que tiene desafÃ­os extra por si querÃ©s platinarte el juego.
Decididamente, quiero jugar Guacamelee 2 y ver si han mejorado estos defectos pequeÃ±os que acÃ¡ menciono.
La ambientaciÃ³n de la saga me encanta y aunque no salga del modelo Speedy Gonzales que tienen los yankees sobres los mexicanos, me gusta.

review: Guacamele ! Super Turbo Championship Edition est un jeu hybride conbat / Metroidvania basÃ© sur la culture mexicaine, avec un accent particulier sur le combat basÃ© sur les combos, l'approche intelligente et la plate-forme. L'histoire tourne autour d'un fermier nommÃ© Juan, qui est tuÃ© par le principal antagoniste alors qu'il tentait de sauver son ami, pour revenir en possession du pouvoir d'un masque magique, ce qui le transforme en un puissant Luchador dÃ©terminÃ© Ã  frapper, suplexer et bodyslammer son chemin vers la victoire.

author: {'steamid': '76561199200642397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1646586272}
review:
Non mi ritengo un esperto ma voglio spendere qualche parola su questo gioco.

In Guacamelee vestiremo i panni del coraggioso Juan, un luchador intento a fermare il perfido Calaca e la sua armata di scheletri cosÃ¬ da salvare la ragazza di cui Ã¨ da sempre innamorato e impedire la fine del mondo per mano di quest'ultimo. 
Il gioco Ã¨ un classico metroidvania con delle buone fasi di platform, che vi faranno mollare qualche parola poco consona, ma che regaleranno grandi soddisfazioni una volta superate. Quindi si avanzerÃ  attraverso delle aree interconnesse tra di loro, piene di segreti da trovare, perciÃ² occhi aperti.
Durante il gioco avremo a che fare con nemici via via piÃ¹ ostici, tra il mondo dei vivi e dei morti attraverso il cui si svolgerÃ  la nostra avventura, ma grazie al sistema di combattimento, semplice ma efficace, riusciremo a superare qualsiasi difficoltÃ . Forse avrei gradito un pelo di profonditÃ  in piÃ¹ nelle combo e nel potenziamento del nostro protagonista, con qualche costume in piÃ¹ magari o con potenziamenti piÃ¹ consistenti, ma resta ugualmente molto divertente e appagante nella sua semplicitÃ , soprattutto nelle schermate piene zeppe di nemici da sbaragliare. Interessanti le boss fight, senza infamia e senza lode.
Veramente interessante Ã¨ la colonna sonora "messicanegiante" molto in tema, che varierÃ  anche con il passaggio tra il mondo dei vivi e dei morti.
Infine mi sento di consigliare questo gioco agli appassionati del genere perchÃ© riuscirÃ  a tenervi impegnati per diverse ore, soprattutto se volete completarlo al 100% anche se dovete prepararvi a imprecare un pÃ² ma assolutamente nulla di proibitivo.

review: After all the FPS games I've been playing lately, it was nice to play something new for a change.  I finally got around to playing this game, and it was fun for sure.  I would give it probably a 6.5/10 though just because doing the same 3-hit combo got kind of annoying.  Would've loved to see your combo increase at least.  Also, while the platforming was fun and challenging (even the tough parts) I just really REALLY hated the damn exploding enemies.  Those were the worst parts of the game.  That aside, this game was decent.  I wouldn't play through it again though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030332092', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1646339716}
review:
Easy to pass, hard to complete. 100% completion is pain in the ass, but once u get it u will feel satisfaction. Doing very long one-shot combos totally rewards the pain of mastering game mechanics.
[b]Never played platform game with better movement and fighting mechanics.[/b]
Humour of the game and alternative ending is cherry on the top. Unfortunately hard mode is not so tough. Give it a shot.

review:
It is definitely better than Guacamelee! Gold Edition, and a LOT better than Guacamelee!, wish there was a Guacamelee! Super, Guacamelee! Turbo and some other editions, so I could stretch this joke to not being funny even more.
Guacamelee! is a great game, and you can't deny it.
It is not good metroidvania, but excellent beat 'em up.
Combos fun, jumping fun, skills fun.
Guacamelee 2! Better

author: {'steamid': '76561198282148408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1647696550}
review:
ATTENZIONE!
OGNI OPINIONE ESPRESSA E' DEL TUTTO PERSONALE!

I metroidvania: uno dei miei generi preferiti.
Adoro lo stile ed il design di questo genere e ogni volta rimango incantato: dal bellissimo castello di Symphony of the Night, al regno distrutto di Hollow Knight fino a quel capolavoro biblico di Blasphemous, uno dei miei giochi preferiti in assoluto, giÃ  consigliato qui su Steam.
E poi arriva lui Guacamelee! Arriva come un fulmine a ciel sereno e mai mi sarei aspettato di trovarmi di fronte ad un gioco cosÃ¬ dannatamente splendido.

Il gioco gira attorno Juan Aguacate, un umile raccoglitore di agave in un piccolo villaggio in messico, innamorato della sua amica di infanzia Lupita (figlia di El presidente).
Un giorno il villaggio viene attaccato da Carlos Calaca uno stregone scheletro che uccide Juan e rapisce la donzella.
Arrivato nel mondo dei morti, Juan, fa la conoscenza di una luchadora, tale Tostada, che gli dona una maschera misteriosa trasformandolo in un fortissimo Luchador, facendolo tornare in vita.
La storia quindi segue le gesta di Juan nel tentativo di salvare la sua amata dalle grinfie di Calaca e salvare il mondo (sia dei morti che dei vivi) dal suo dominio.
La trama, seppur semplice, Ã¨ caratterizzata da personaggi simpaticissimi e interessanti e perciÃ² funziona alla grande, In piÃ¹ e strapiena di eventi divertenti e surreali che la rendono sempre godibile e mai noiosa. 
Ho apprezzato molto la trama di Guacamelee che, ribadisco, seppur con la sua semplicitÃ  riesce comunque ad interessare dall'inizio alla fine.

Come detto in precedenza, Guacamelee Ã¨ un metroidvania, quindi vi saranno tutte le caratteristiche del genere: una mappa che si sblocca pian piano esplorandola e potenziamenti che permetteranno di andare avanti nella storia. 
Ma ciÃ² che ho apprezzato ancor di piÃ¹ Ã¨ la componente picchiaduro: non avremo armi o cose simili, ma solo ed esclusivamente i nostri pugni e varie mosse che potremmo imparare nel corso del gioco, che ci danno la possibilitÃ  di effettuare combo devastanti, specie nelle parti piÃ¹ avanzate di gioco. In piÃ¹ saranno presenti tante missioni secondarie da poter completare e tanti segreti disseminati per il mondo.
Guacamelee Ã¨ divertentissimo, sia per gli eventi della trama, che per il gameplay in se. La durata Ã¨ perfetta circa una decina d'ore di esuberanza e mazzate a destra e manca.

Non c'Ã¨ tantissimo da dire, solo elogi: il mondo creato Ã¨ davvero ipnotico e l'alternanza tra mondo dei vivi e dei morti Ã¨ esaltante, con alcune scelte di design veramente ottime basate appunto su questa caratteristica.
Le musiche sono fantastiche, specie se si adora lo stile messicano.

Lati negativi? Non ne ho idea, sul serio. E' un gioco straordinario, sotto tutti i punti di vista.
Non so effettivamente cosa non vada in questo gioco: l'unico consiglio che posso darvi Ã¨ di giocarlo, apprezzarlo e divertirvi. Lo trovate ovunque, al prezzo di neanche due caffÃ¨ e la rigiocabilitÃ  Ã¨ altissima.
PRENDETELO SUBITO.

PRO:
- Trama divertente e interessante
- Gameplay divertente e mai noioso
- Ambientazione e musiche messicane straordinarie
- Esuberante, simpaticissimo e longevo il giusto

CONTRO:
- finisce
- se non vi piacciono i metroidvania questo non vi farÃ  cambiare idea

Voto: 9
