review:
Guacamelee STCE is like Gold Edition but
-more polished
-prettier
-including 1 new boss, 1 new side quest, a few new enemies, 2 new abilities, 2 new costumes, 2 new areas with new themes and quite a bit more secrets
-30 less achievements (took me 16,5 hours to 100% but it's mostly cause I played Gold for 26 hours before this)
Would surely recommend to fans of metroidvanias or beat em ups!

review: I can't recommend this game enough. The main story is an absolute blast to play through, the art direction is amazing, and the entire game is bursting with character. I didn't have the best time playing the levels in Hell, but hey, that's to be expected from the land of suffering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198864620265', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2437, 'last_played': 1643265557}
review:
[h1]Guacamelee STCE-entre vivos y no tan vivos:[/h1]

[h1]Contexto:[/h1]

Es un videojuego que mezcla muy bien la exploraciÃ³n, acciÃ³n y aventura en unos escenarios fantÃ¡sticos, cada combo de golpes que haces te llena de determinaciÃ³n.

[h1]Historia:[/h1]

Tomamos el papel de Juan una persona ordinaria que pronto dejarÃ­a de serlo para entrar a un mundo de golpes, huesos rotos y muchas tortillas, de inicio a fin podemos ver la evoluciÃ³n de nuestro enmascarado, asÃ­ mismo el macabro cambio que esta haciendo al mundo el villano Carlos Calaca con el Ãºnico propÃ³sito de cumplir su ritual para unir ambos mundos.

[h1]Destacado:[/h1]

De este juego me encanto mucho los escenarios, la banda sonora que los acompaÃ±a, el cÃ³mo varÃ­a dependiendo la dimensiÃ³n en a que estes, la satisfacciÃ³n enorme que genera completar el juego al 100%, los distintos trajes que puedes usar, entre otros temas alucinantes que valen  la pena.  
   
[h1]Puntos negativos:[/h1]

El Ãºnico punto negativo es que tiene una ligera torpeza al momento de usar las habilidades especiales y que no se puede jugar multijugador en lÃ­nea, solo se puede local.

[h1]Para Resumir:[/h1]

Es un juego que vale la pena tener en la biblioteca, puedes adaptarte a su modo de juego fÃ¡cilmente, ir de prisa o disfrutar de los escenarios, personajes y enemigo, aparte de todas las diferencias ocultas que el juego tiene para ofrecernos, mientras escuchamos soundtracks como en el gran templo.

[b]Mi PuntuaciÃ³n Es De: 7.9/10:[/b]

GrÃ¡ficos: 9/10
Historia: 10/10
Jugabilidad: 7/10
Escenarios: 10/10
Banda sonora: 10/10

[h1]!!Gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer, un abrazo!![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198057414653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1516920372}
review: This game rules. It's a great Metroidvania style with fun characters and a good story that doesn't take itself too seriously, in an endearing way. The difficulty was spot on too, not too easy to be a bore and not too hard to be a slog. Definitely worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997575230', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1649261866}
review:
Linux:
Performance is fine with standard proton. Hex hack is required for ultrawide.
I *like* but am generally very bad at platform games. Bough this cos it looked pretty, and 3 hours in I have yet to give up in frustration. That's a major win. I discovered a couple of hours in the lady is available as a costume, and intent to use her for the rest of the game. Which is nice
Will probably buy G2 as well

author: {'steamid': '76561198115956636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1636235416}
review:
Guacamelee es un Metroidvania en toda regla. Se inspira en la cultura de la lucha libre mexicana en cierto sentido como parodia, con su humor propio un poco tonto pero divertido. Tienes muchas habilidades y zonas quÃ© ir desbloqueando conforme progresas en la historia y te invita a explorar cada zona minuciosamente. Las peleas son divertidas y hay una gran variedad de enemigos en cada zona, que mejoran progresivamente su dificultad. La historia es todo un pretexto para repartir golpes y llaves pero en general estÃ¡ bien. Y se vuelve muchÃ­simo mÃ¡s entretenido cuando lo juegas con amigos. Finalmente, la estÃ©tica de los grÃ¡ficos es muy hermosa, a muchas de las escenas dan ganas de sacarles captura y usarlas como fondo de pantalla o para enmarcar. De las mejores cosas que ofrece. 

RESUMEN
- GrÃ¡ficos hermosos. 
- Peleas entretenidas y variadas.
- Muchos poderes y zonas quÃ© desbloquear.
- Infinitamente mejor al jugarlo con un amigo o mÃ¡s. 

P.D. Aunque sÃ³lo tengo 0.9 horas jugadas al momento de la reseÃ±a, lo he terminado en Xbox y de ahÃ­ mi opiniÃ³n. Gracias por leer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134704427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1643168903}
review: A perfectly solid action metroidvania. Combat is good, platforming is decent, music and world design are nice. However, I wouldn't exactly call this game outstanding. As someone who does appreciate a bit of atmosphere and immersion I thought the very game-y feel and constant references to be a little annoying. Though I can't really fault the devs for making a creative choice that I personally dislike, and if you are more tolerant of those elements then I would certainly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317717303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1642443269}
review:
It looks fun, it plays fun, it is FUN!
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition brings out everything I love about Metroidvanias in 2D.
The only issue I had with the game itself was the silence that followed whenever you switch between the worlds of the living and the dead. Though it seems to play with its atmosphere in music, muffling the fun soundtrack whenever you do the jump between the worlds, it definitely seems to have some kind of music sync bug?
But in any case, the game is fantastic.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000606063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1642797179}
review: Exploration is pretty weak and combat is very one note with no real joy or logic. The art style has some charm, but overall the gameplay doesn't stand up and some of the mexican culture callouts are painfully cliche. It feels like people who like the common TV version of mexican culture, and not actually interested in the culture itself. Jokes get very stale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340847703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1641971955}
review:
Quick Description:
-I just played both Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition and Guacamelee 2 back to back.  Interestingly enough, I absolutely loved the sequel but was left very divided on how I felt about the original.  The sequel expands upon everything that is introduced in the first game, and cleans up every problem area that I ran into.  It's a true labor of love, and a clear example of how an Indie team can turn a promising yet deeply flawed game into a true work of art.  Unfortunately, the first Guacamelee can't compete w/ average beat 'em ups and offers very minimal metroidvania elements, while also being very rough around the edges.  This is a shame b/c there is so much charm, humor, and love put into this game, but it just doesn't quite all come together in the end.

What's Good:
-There is a ton of creativity and charm in this title.  I can't think of another beat 'em up metroidvania that offers bright colors, Mexican folklore, and breaks the third wall w/ humor constantly.  There are a ton of bright, likeable npcs throughout the game that really add life to the world.
-One of the smartest choices that the devs made was to make most of the major mechanics act as duel functions.  The uppercut is essential in combat, but also plays a role in breaking red bricks that block pathways, and is essential in platforming and secret hunting.  The dash punch also will be used in combat, platforming, and gatekeeping.  
-The impact when punching, dodging, and slamming enemies is perfect imo.  This is another area that this game really shines.  One of the biggest disappointments of Ender Lillies was how lifeless some of the attacks and dodges felt.  When you perfectly dodge an attack, the game slightly slows down to emphasize that movement.  When you hit an enemy, you really feel the impact, which adds weight to every combo.
-The dimension swapping ability, although underutilized, has so much potential.  This is another use of duel functionality.  The dimension swapping ability allows for every biome to have two different biomes w/ unique secrets and enemies.  It also adds another layer to every platforming section and becomes a focal point of late game content.
-Secret hunters will be delighted, as there are tons!  Most of the secrets are in fairly obvious locations, but there are quite a few secrets that are very difficult to find.

Could Use Some Changes:
-The biggest complaint that I have, is that this feels like a game w/ a lot of great ideas, but they just aren't executed to their full potential.  Combat feels great, but the enemies and even bosses are so easy, that they never feel like a real threat.  You can see that this could be a really unique metroidvania, but it's just not an organic, interconnected world that gives a sense of wonder during exploration.  The chicken power is basically only used for a few secrets and some mandatory tunnels.  This game kind of reminds me of Ori and the Blind Forrest.  I saw incredible potential, but it kind of felt like an extended tech demo instead of a fully coherent game. 
-This isn't really a metroidvania.  It's a beat 'em up w/ some very light metroidvania elements sprinkled in there.  It's exceptionally linear, and the game always tells you exactly where to go.  Even if you try to go out of your way to go to a different location, you will likely run into a literal brick wall.  The world doesn't feel interconnected, it feels much closer to a stage based action platformer.
-The pacing of this game feels off.  The first 3-4 hrs are extremely slow and dull.  If you are remotely experienced in this genre, then by hr 5, you will be so overpowered b/c finding health and stamina upgrades are really easy early on.  The game starts to hit it's stride near the 7-8 hr mark, but just as that happens, the game abruptly ends.  
-This is an extremely easy game.  All of the secrets are either health or stamina which is really helpful, but very boring.  Not every game needs to be challenging, but outside of the final boss and some optional secret hunting and side quests, there are close to no real threats in this game.  You can brute force your way through pretty much everything, especially all combat situations.  The platforming is the only area that is even remotely a challenge, but even that is fairly simple the first 2/3 of the game.

Thoughts:
-So I got this game for free during a giveaway about 2 years ago.  I then went and bought the sequel for a couple of bucks, but both have sat in my backlog ever since.  I want to make it clear, that I will be giving an absolutely glowing review of Guacamelee 2 and that I highly recommend it.  However, I can't recommend this one.  There are so many average beat 'em ups that are simply better than this, and this doesn't even compete w/ middle of the road metroidvanias.  I can't think of a single thing that this game offers that the sequel doesn't expand upon in a better and more creative way.  The sequel fixes every issue that I mentioned above and feels like a truly finished project.  So, the only ppl I would feel comfortable recommending this to, are ppl that loved the sequel, but just want more Guacamelee.  I personally, would rather just play the sequel over again.

Consensus:
-Bottom Shelf Gaming (Tier 5 and makes up 10% of my reviews).  It pains me to do this, b/c clearly this is an Indie studio that deeply loves this gaming franchise and put so much love in both of these games.  This is one of the rare cases where the sequel is so much better than the original, that the original becomes a game that is hard to market to players.  I review games based on a curve and compare them to everything that I have played b/c I think it's important to evaluate whether there is another title that offers better value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027357658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1641244225}
review:
I honestly dont want to thumbs down this game, but I also cant reccomend it. Despite the gorgeous visuals, sound fx and overall theme, gameplay falls flat of being an actual metroidvania and feels more like an ellaborate beat'em up. It is TOO linear to be a metroidvania and most of the upgrades dont give you the rush you would get from similar power ups in game such as Super Metroid and Castlevania SOTN. 
Combat gets tedious early on, not mention sudden and unfair difficulty spikes (enemies with shields that require different skills to be broken at the same time).
Exploring the map feels like a drag, since the collectibles and pickups are generic and uninteresting (mostly just health and stamina upgrades). Also, the story is very shallow and theres no character development (although the designs are great).
It might be appealing to younger audiences, but fans of classic metroidvanias will most likely be dissapointed.

review:
Guacamelee, es un juego de hack n' slash muy divertido, te ofrece mÃºltiples formas de rematar enemigos y hay acciÃ³n a raudales. 
Posee una historia decente para este gÃ©nero y los gags, ademÃ¡s de las referencias con otros juegos, son la cereza en la torta. Especialmente cuando la historia se centra en luchadores de lucha libre. 
Es una gran experiencia especialmente cuando lo juegas con amigos ya que, desde mi punto de vista, ese es el verdadero potencial del juego. Terminarlo con los amigos y esta versiÃ³n del juego te permite jugar entre 4 (si no me equivoco) haciÃ©ndolo una gran experiencia que cualquier fanÃ¡tico del juego deberÃ­a probar.
Lo Ãºnico malo fue que no le hicieron un homenaje justo a la cultura mexicana, solo enfatizaron la lucha libre cuando tenÃ­an mucho mÃ¡s por donde explotar, la mÃºsica es adecuada, enemigos difÃ­ciles si no estÃ¡s acostumbrado a los mandos (ya que literalmente en mucha peleas usas todos los comandos que te enseÃ±a el juego) 

Lo bueno:
- Mucha acciÃ³n
- Buena mÃºsica
- La mezcla de poderes que puedes realizar en los combates
- La lucha libre.

Lo malo:
- Historia un tanto genÃ©rica
- Misiones secundarias muy escasas como para que sean relevantes
- El juego muy corto

CalificaciÃ³n: 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198083924705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1640843338}
review: After a 100% run of this game, I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a great Metroidvania game and/or a humor filled experience. The game has unlockable powers and secrets as you go, like most games in the genre but they found a way to bring their humor into some of their abilities as well. Combat feels amazing with plenty of combos for you to enjoy the whole time. There are plenty of times where bosses and environments will push your mechanical skill, plus a few extreme jump puzzles to find later in the game as well. It took me about 8 hrs to beat the story with extras and a total of 14-15 hours to 100% (not including hard mode). A great value for the price, I look forward to playing the 2nd game!!

review:

E nem de longe foi uma surpresa ruim, apesar de as vezes frustrante, o combate do jogo Ã© muito divertido e a combinaÃ§Ã£o das habilidades sÃ£o muitos gostosas de serem usadas. A maioria dos chefes sÃ£o fÃ¡ceis, mas no final o jogo aumenta bastante de dificuldade, dando um bom desafio.

review:
Crazy good game, simple but deep mechanics at the same time makes an enjoyable gameplay.

The soundtrack and artstyle is unique and out of this world for this genre of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053290695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1639463558}
review: I found it to be a decent metroidvania, but nothing amazing. Combat often felt kinda messy and stunlocky, I wasn't big on the writing/atmosphere and certain visual effects were horrible to look at. I was invested enough to complete it, but it was starting to drag so I'm glad it wasn't any longer and I had no motivation to backtrack or really do anything other than directly follow the linear progression path. I'd probably give it a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025240136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1661000667}
review:
This game is the perfect combination of beat'em up, metroidvania and precision platformer, and I say that as someone who sucks at precision platformers and gets easily frustrated.

The base game mechanics is platforming and fighting enemies with different moves that you unlock throughout the game.

The progression of the main story is more or less linear, but you always have to go back to previously visited areas to open new passages once you acquire new abilities that allow you to pass through them.

You might think that the beat'em up part of the game means it's going to be quite repetitive, but in reality the game offers a decent sense progression and variety by giving you new, more powerful abilities, making you face newer, stronger enemies, and presenting you with some challenges of what you would call precision platforming, that are neither too easy, not too hard, so most people will find them enjoyable.

Now, if you're not quite a fan of precision platforming, don't worry. I kinda like games like Celeste, but they seem quite difficult and frustrating to me, too. Guacamelee, however, gives you the right amount of precision platforming for those who like to casually play precision platforming, but don't like when it becomes too hard. In other words, the precision platforming elements of this game are kept to a minimum, and are well-balanced in terms of difficulty: neither so easy that would make you bored, nor so hard that would make you quit (although you might be at the brink of quitting a couple of times).

Having said that, sometimes you might get frustrated and quit it after a few attempts, but it's often the case that when you come back to the game the next time, you'll manage to do it. This has happened to me a couple of times. So my advice to you: Don't give up!

Overall, the game is real fun if you like platforming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054915862', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1638932007}
review:
God no... don't get this.
Annoying screen clutter, awful colour distinction in some areas with enemies, Enemies that spam moves, awful timing(you can get perma stunned and die, no time to recover), dodging is awful, bosses are ok, final boss is awful, has terrible timing with your moves, you get knocked down instantly. 
Nah... this game was not fun, not even the story.

Also too many references, remember metroid? remember *videogame reference* every 5s very annoying.
I liked the graphics very good looking.

review: Hell yeah! This game is one of the most fun games I've played in quite some time! If you like a good platforming metroidvania game, Guacamelee is the game for you. Great graphics, fun fighting, the game gets more and more difficult as you play, but every challenge in it give you a lot of satisfaction. Took me 15 hours to achieve 100% on normal mode and, damn, I there were moments I really wanted to throw my pad out the window. Still, this game is something I'm gonna return to some time in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446337017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1638320354}
review: If you go into it with the expectation of playing a metroidvania, you're going to be disappointed. It's super linear, and even though it has an open world, there's no sense of exploration. You're just guided from one location to the next. The combat is unique but feels somewhat bland, which is unfortunate considering that it's supposed to be a focal point. Enemy variety is also sorely lacking; 95% of the mobs are the same. The platforming is probably the highlight of the game. However, the level design feels very samey once you look past the stylized art. With that said, the game has a lot of character and the dialogue is quite funny. Itâ€™s more of a friends and family type game than something you can sit down and play for hours without getting bored. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273585591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1637982916}
review:
This game is an amazing ride from start to finish. The story is kinda basic yes but even that aside, it has so much great on its corner that I can't help but recommend it

For starters, the look and feel is so obviously influenced by Mexican culture. It's just so beautiful to look at. Everything is just infused with this colorful and lively style which I really like. Fair warning tho but sometimes it may get too colorful to the point that the creators had to put an epilepsy/seizure warning for the game. 

The difficulty is just the right kind of piss me off hard that I'm looking for. I wouldn't say it's the most difficult MetroidVania I've played (Hollow Knight still holds that honor cos I can't finish it to this day huhu) but that does NOT mean it's easy. There are a lot of parts that need split-second decisions and then it does the wrong move and then you blame the controller for not reading it right! It's that kinda difficult. But still I was able to finish it. It took a few good hours of work and determination to get what I needed especially for the True/Good Ending.

The gameplay itself feels just right at home with most modern MetroidVanias in the sense that it doesn't have a levelling up system akin to CastleVania or BloodStained. Instead, it's all about getting new moves or augments to your arsenal to make you stronger. One more thing, in this edition, it has something called Intenso mode which was not available in the Gold Edition. It's a neat addition but I rarely found the use for it. It's cool and you're stronger but I feel that it drains way too quickly anyway and it's just as much a bitch to refill it. Very rarely did I use it like when enemies were too difficult for one part so it made the task easier or go faster but for the most part, it was unnecessary for me. I used it about 5 times max throughout the game. It's also probably cos the control for it is pressing down both the analog sticks. Why not use the L+R trigger instead? Maybe it's meant to deter players from using it so that they don't need to depend on it so much? But whatever, gameplay is still rock solid

Highly recommended if you just love the look of Mexican culture and a right amount of difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001614017', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1473433213}
review: This is a prime example of what a metroidvania can be. Challenging gameplay, fun mechanics, and a wonderfully crafted setting. The art direction in particular is just top notch. It's a great premise for a game executed masterfully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062378688', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1656, 'last_played': 1526956063}
review: This game is fantastic. Excellent art, music, writing, level design and gameplay. There is a constant sense of momentum and a fine-tuned challenge to the mechanics that makes discovering secrets and defeating challenges a genuine pleasure instead of a slog.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796542556', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1637213681}
review:
Es realmente divertido, a pesar de que puedes morir bastante si no estas acostumbrado a este tipo de juego la experiencia nunca se vuelve frustrante, al contrario, solo te dan mas ganas de seguir jugando.
Totalmente recomendado para aquellos a los que les guste el metroidvania y para aquellos a los que les interese adentrarse en el genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979943656', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1634801145}
review: A fun metroidvania with an arcade beat em up feel that supports 1-4 players. There are a couple areas that drag on a bit and annoying multiplayer mechanics tied to all players being on the same screen, but the game manages to keep things interesting with a mix of beat em up combat, metroidvania progression, and 2d platforming puzzles.

review: How to show off culture in a non-cringe way. The game is actually fun because the pacing is so fast and it keeps you interested constantly. There are lots of secrets and side missions but the plot can be advanced without any of them as well. Conversations with NPCs are fun and sometimes actually hilarious. Freshest metroidvania in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999232155', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1650559622}
review:
Where to start, this game is quite simply the best platformer, metroidvania, and beat em' up mashed into one very solid title. At first I was genuinely turned off by the amount of genres mashed together considering how many other similar genre titles fall short.

The game starts off a bit slow, giving you a simple grab and 3 hit punch attack to use. Then slowly and steadily over the course of the game adds new simple moves into your movelist that slowly and steadily increase your overall power and allows you to push a combo further on a single enemy or multiple groups of enemies which are varied and allow you to continue to utilize your 3 hit combo when you'd normally be stopped.

The platforming puzzles and the map are perfectly tuned for what you need, sure at times you may be wondering where to go but know that any area without a chest is the way forward to your next objective. You could also get secrets and do side quests on your way to the end of the game but they aren't required to actually do well.

Overall this game has done phenomenally well to keep me engaged and at the edge of my seat to figure out what happens to Juan to the end and I will highly recommend this to anyone looking for a real gem of a game that hits all the right beats and utilizes it's genre mixture to the fullest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161134147', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1634334908}
review: Guacamelee is a fun lighthearted metroidvania that I really enjoyed, however it does have some small issues spread throughout. Encounter balancing could be better, the platforming isn't always as precise as I would want, I'm not a fan of the intenso mechanic and some enemies have really annoying design like undodgeable attacks. All of these are small issues that don't make it a bad game but it prevents it from being an amazing game, it's just good solid fun. And while the colorful artstyle is nice and pleasing, it fails to enthrall me like other games in the metroidvania genre like Hollow Knight and Ori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077584895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1633396196}
review:
Amazing game; Guacamelee manages to achieve a near-perfect balance of challenge and accommodation.  Fall into a pit?  You instantly respawn back on your last solid ground.  Die in combat?  Savepoints are everywhere, and they heal you to full.  You almost never find yourself repeating challenges you've already beaten just so you can get another chance at what you failed at last time; instead platforming is broken up into small, tight, chunks that can be focused on, beaten, and moved on from.  Even the bosses have built-in savepoints in between phases.

As an adult with a busy life, I don't have the time, willpower, or teenage reflexes needed to do everything consistently perfect.  Being able to retry challenges until I can beat them without the frustration of long stretches of slog in between checkpoints is an absolutely wonderful design that every game like this should implement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346837582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1639756482}
review:
Un juego muy divertido. Inicialmente, el control del jugador es sencillo. SegÃºn avanzas los retos y enemigos son mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles, pero sin llegar a ser muy complejos (hasta el momento). Todo sigue una trama que estÃ¡ bien llevada. AdemÃ¡s, de la trama principal los habitantes del pueblo te van pidiendo ayuda, y podrÃ¡s ayudarles segÃºn avanza la trama principal. 
Lo que mÃ¡s me ha gustado es la ambientaciÃ³n en la cultura mexicana. La historia tiene toques de humor, y no se hace pesada. El arte muy correcto tambiÃ©n, usando mucho los colores vivos mexicanos. Ha sido una buena compra.

review:
Better game than I was expecting. Maybe even better with friends since it is more action heavy than typical metroidvanias. The platforming gets pretty difficult late game. Love all the references to other games. I like all the work that went into making 2 different worlds with modified graphics and music.
Indifferent: The music can be hit or miss. a lot of it sounds same-y to me. Forest del Chivo and Temple of Rain are pretty good.
Con: There's so much fighting that it makes the decent variety of enemies stale very fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970463641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1631905545}
review:
[h1]Hola combastandes!
Guacamelee, well this is a heavy shit in good terms ğŸ˜Š[/h1]


[i]What have I learned from that game?[/i]

[b]I can beat every enemy with a INTENSO uppercut!!! And also transform to an unbeatable animal the chicken!!!![/b]

My first step with Guacamelee was the psplus gift for vita, ps3 and ps4, ive played it first on vita but at the first time arriving at the tule tree level Iâ€™ve hopped on ps3 (the controls are ok but with controller it is much easier!), ive played it over 3 years (no I didnâ€™t need 3 years just 8 hrs. but over the time another games where played). And I finished it last week on PS3, but Iâ€™ve saw that I have it also on Steam the super turbo version and I want it clear there also with all the dlcÂ´s and the other stuff. For my thoughts this game has so many good things but there is also the frustrating jump stages that get my controller hurt. Yeah maybe the 15 meters that I throw against a wall to break it, didnâ€™t get the controller better^^) But now the review:
[b]
1)	Gameplay 08/10:[/b]
Metroidvania with many uppercuts and wrestle feelings. Its in a good balance between Enemy hurting, climbing walls, fly goating, turning dimensions and puzzle thinking with the head of a Pollo. There is also Backtracking included but not in a Metroid way(in that frequency). But I hate the Jump Stages, I hate the Devil torture Chambers, not because the difficulty, its because you must learn the right strategy, the right timing, every stone where it stands & I donâ€™t have the time for this shit, this is the reason why I donâ€™t get the true ending. (ive watched it on youtube, donâ€™t throw a stone on me^^). You need approx. 8 hrs to finish it, the length is totally ok for this price.
[b]
2)	Story 08/10:[/b]
Well its funny, it has a nice story, the characters are well written. But its self explaining, you are the hero, the one an only luchador, the men of the hour, the chicken in the pot. It is a classical hero story and it is good so! The good thing is also it is a Parodie to many games out there, but Mario you get the most attention!
[b]
3)	Atmosphere (graphic) 7,5/10:[/b]
The levels looks great, the environment have shadows, some stages have a 2,5d effect, the developer makes here and there some ideas like zoom out zoom in, but nothing breathtaking, this is cause it gets just 7,5/10, donâ€™t misunderstand it it is a beautiful graphic but nothing outstanding.[b]
4)	Audio 08/10:[/b]
Ahh el trio de la muerte, Mexican meats metroidvania would be my suggestion. There are some mucho mucho mucho tracks, the background music is also very well done. But comprehended to other metroidvanias (like Axiom Verge; inexorable takes my heart) there is less there. Overall a good music/sound. 
[b]
5)	Content 06/10:[/b]
The World is filled with a few maps that arenâ€™t huge, you have some movements, with the turbo version you have elite skelet enemies, that are difficulter to master, but all in one there is not much content, I gave 6/10 cause you must master your gameplay to get items, chests and the satisfaction to be a true luchador.

[b]Great Game overall 7,5/10:[/b]
I love it, it was  a pleasure to play through after beating the normal version on ps3, but the intensive training to get through all torture Chambers, or the tule tree highest platform or the yoku blocks (I hate you mega man, I hate you!!) takes me in my personal INTENSO Rage mode, and I must say the ps5 Controller did well, the wall has some scratches, the controller works fine^^..

[b]Muchas gracies drinkbox, you are a huge Pollo!!
Hasta luego combastandes!!
Yeah I would recommendet the game for 13 bucks you get much fun![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198384718882', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1629857737}
review: It's a fun game. The combat isn't super technical but it is possible to chain some combos together. The platforming challenges are good but they don't really get truly challenging until the late game after you've gotten all the abilities. For a metroidvania I found it to be a bit too linear for my taste and exploration isn't that inciting since the rewards are always predictable and really just amount to stat upgrades. The soundtrack and artstyle are great. The humour is hit or miss, a lot of it is references to games and memes from the time of its release and in 2021 it feels very dated but it's never in your face and obnoxious like the Borderlands games. The length of the game is perfect, if the playtime were any longer I would've gotten bored and dropped it. If you like metroidvanias and timing-based platforming challenges it's worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967530504', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1629813942}
review:
- Clunky, overly complex controls on controller which cannot be remapped.
- Whimsical difficulty spikes.
- Combat difficulty relies on overly crowded rooms filled with capricious enemies.
- Exploration feels boring due to lackluster leveldesign.

+ At times combining moves makes for satisfying combat.
+ Platforming can be fun when allowed by the controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061032152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1680636169}
review:
Look past the name, the goofy graphics and character design, and the cliche story filled with B movie humor.

This game is a great platforming Metroidvania, filled with secrets, that have some of the most incredibly satisfying jump puzzles, cannot stress how much fun it is getting the actual "platforming" down. Now, the difficult ones are all optional, so you don't "have" to do them, if they're too difficult. There is also a extra zone that has a series of challenges that can really push the platforming skills, so there is plenty of challenge there.

If you don't enjoy that, this game won't be for you. The combat is good, but nowhere near the draw of the platforming mechanics in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024883753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1628711557}
review:
Good Metroidvania-style game with interesting combat. Some nice homages to Metroid with a fun art style & plot that doesn't take itself too seriously. One thing I really liked was that in trying to get through platforming or secret puzzles, they usually aren't punishing to your health - just try again and again until you get it. 

The music and combat stand out to me as the strongest points. Most of the secrets are pretty easily found if you're the exploring type. I recommend diving into El Infierno as soon as you get the chance; it's a nice challenge and you can get an exploration upgrade if you do well enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198851181662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1660254329}
review:
El juego es muy buen juego y muy buen metroidvania, si quieres iniciarte en el genero te recomiendo empezar con este y con su secuela, su precio me parece bien para lo que ofrece, yo me lo pase en siete horas basicamente me sentÃ© solamente dos veces hasta completar la historia , la duraciÃ³n total del modo historia me parece un poco corta, aunque cumple y te deja satisfecho, aunque siendo sinceros la historia no es el gran fuerte de este juego, ya que es la tÃ­pica historia de salva a la princesa,aun asÃ­ el humor esta lleno de jergas mexicanas que como mexicano puedo decir que no caen en los estereotipados Â¨weyÂ¨ y Â¨no mamesÂ¨,  su jugabilidad es bastante simple si vienes de juegos como dust o hollow kinght, aunque eso no la hace mala, es bastante divertido utilizar las habilidades de juan para moverte por los escenarios.

ConclusiÃ³n: es un buen juego que si te inicias en el genero metroidvania te viene como anillo al dedo, el precio es econÃ³mico, y su humor te harÃ¡ cuanto menos sonreÃ­r una que otra vez, su gameplay se ajusta bien tanto a los jugadores novatos en los metroidvanias como a los que ya tienen algunos tÃ­tulos a sus espaldas , la historia es mas bien simplona aunque con un buen humor que compensa su simpleza

PD: aveces esta por por 30 pesos mexicanos o lo que vendrÃ­an siendo 1.5 dolares

author: {'steamid': '76561198066983814', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1628372012}
review:
Good metriodvania. Short and sweet. Basically no filler. Love the Mexican art style and nods to the culture. Music is pleasant, but to me all the tracks kinda blend together in a haze. The humor is hit or miss, a lot of meme culture that will really show it's age quickly.
Overall good game! Amazing art and fast and punchy gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155654639', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1627339684}
review:
+ Cool Graphics
+ Good Humor
+ Fluid movement
+ Good/Useful Metroidvania Progress Upgrades

- Overly Repetitive Enemies
- Unnecessary Combos
- Some Areas of Precision Platforming, some of those areas you had to pass to move on

So, if I had never played either Ori game (Blind Forest or Will of the Wisps), I would have probably liked this game a lot more. The other problem is now Ori and the Blind Forest is $5 all the time.  Comparatively, Ori is the better game and the better value.  With that said if you are looking for a pretty good Metroidvania this fits that description.  Not great but not terrible either.

Solo hubo una cosa que no me gustÃ³, si juegas con Tostada, que es la personaje alternativa, los diÃ¡logos y algunas imÃ¡genes antes de un boss siguen teniendo a Juan, se que Juan es el personaje principal sin embargo considero que hubiera estado bien, al menos cambiar la imagen que se ve antes de luchar con un boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055181574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1609843581}
review:
Incredibly fun Metroidvania. There are still a lot of rough edges here which get cleaned up in the sequel. Its a bit shaky In terms of level design, enemy design, map design, and especially progression. It sometimes feels like the developers didn't properly know how to deal with a certain part or how to make certain sections more engaging. Thats why this game constantly jumps between really fun and fantastic to sort of ok. Especially the early sections can feel really slow and simplistic for a game like this. 

But at its core its still a fantastic game with a really unique setting (Middle and South American culture are incredibly underrated in the gaming industry) and a lot of personality to stand on its own. If anything its great to play this and then play the sequel just to see how many improvements were made. I would still heavily recommend this game even without the sequel, it does not need a sale at all to sell itself. I would even say that this game is worth more then the starting asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561199036993900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1626744996}
review:
TL:DR; frustrating, not fun, platforming sessions are so badly designed it is only a matter of time you will drop this out of frustration. Avoid at all costs. 

Full review: this was one of the most frustrating experience at playing a game ever. Art is good, combat is reasonably good, could have been a fun game, but game-design is among the worst imaginable when it comes to the platforming sessions, and there's no way to avoid them. Part of the problem is that every ten minutes, a new control key or key combination is added, and soon they exceed the number of fingers or appendages of any human. Key combinations are particulary bad as the order in which you press the keys matter, and is not responsive, so at best you get them once every three attempts.

But the biggest problem are the unreasonable, unavoidable platforming sessions. Navigating across platform can be a bliss in other games, in this one is just a pain. For some reasohs, they decided that it would be fun to force the player do a predefined robotic sequence of too many actions. Thet stops being any fun quite soon, and becomes just a challenge of patience. You'll have to alternate between 50 different moves in a quick unforgiving succession. There is no joy in failing 1000 times, or in succeeding alike. 

It boils down to a matter of pressing the right action in tight sequences, so it basically feels like a Hasbro Simon electronic toy game for brain dead people, only instead of being 4 buttons there is like 20 and sequences are way, way too long. How on earth they could image this could be considered even remotely fun to play. You want to see the rest of the game you paid good money for, so you try with patience to surpass a section or two, or ten, or twenty, hoping they will stop the nonsense and let you play the game, but no, it gets worse and worse until it stops being worth it. There is one point, for example, where to progress you need to jump swap-plane jump, jump, double jump, swap "plane" twice, dodge, upper cut, side smash, append to wall, double jump.... the list goes on it basically never ends, one key out of sequence and you are out, one millisecond away and you have to redo it all. Of course, there is not way to avoid that sequence. I dunno what to say, it is the opposite of fun. 

I see positive reviews but I'm guessing they wrote them before ever getting this late in the game. At the beginning, nothing makes you suspect levels will be so poorly designed later. 

I finished the metroidvanias that are considered the hardest ones on the market, but I never encountered this level of frustration. 

Vote 2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049679262', 'num_games_owned': 967, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1626543323}
review:
Guacamelee is a quirky & fun, light-hearted metrodvania set in colorful Mexican cartoon theme.

I would say this is a pretty *EASY* game (even on the unlockable "Hard" mode), since there's literally no penalty whatsoever on death, and the monsters weren't really challenging to beat at all once you got the hang of the combat (There are some aspects of platformer that's rather frustrating though, if you intend to complete every side contents for the achievements [spoiler]and to unlock the alternate, good ending[/spoiler]).

Speaking of the combat, it was fast-paced and fluid, not deep but still pretty fun to play, smashing those skellies with funny wrestling moves and combo are somewhat hilarious and satisfying.

Overall I would say in no way this is a bad game, so it's easy to recommend ğŸ‘.
Oh and on a side note, there are A TON of funny easter eggs that took references from many other games & memes to be found, Metroid, Super Mario, FEZ, Journey, to name a few... Was pleasant to discover if you recognize them~

author: {'steamid': '76561198086919345', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1620616351}
review: I didn't get the appeal of this game. The animation is great, don't get me wrong, and some of the puns and gags kinda made me chuckle (the first time I saw them, anyway), but the combat feels soooooo freaaaaaking sloooooow. I get it, it's going for that whole luchador-fighting-style-thingy with grabs and locks and whatnot, but damn it if it doesn't feel super clunky compared to the fast-paced gameplay in  similar titles, such as Dead Cells or even Hollow Knight.  Maybe it's just me, but I certainly prefer more active and involved gameplay in my metroidvanias and rogulites, and this title sadly doesn't match up to what's out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930289254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1653697089}
review:
Had been watching some top ten metroidvania videos in an effort to find some more games in the genre worth adding to my wishlist, and this game came up a few times... Having just spent 10 hours running through the game, I can see now why it's rated so highly. While I'm definitely not a fan of the 'brawler' genre, the way they've fused that with the metroidvania formula so seamlessly makes for a stand-out, excellent title. 

Visuals: I dismissed this game a while ago over what at first seemed like bizarre looking visuals. Looking closer, it's actually a really nice visual style, character models look good and are expressive, backgrounds look vibrant and inviting. A great looking game, and one that runs on low-end hardware no less!

Platforming: Besides following the metroidvania formula of side-scrolling exploration very well, the platforming itself is some of the most engaging I've encountered in any platformer, period. Every new combat/traversal move learned throughout the game is used to the fullest, and even gets downright diabolical, in some of the more secret areas.

Combat: The combat could be a challenge for me at times (brawlers aren't really my thing), but I couldn't deny that it was fun, even if I did get frustrated at times (a couple of times having to consult a walkthrough to teach me a winning strategy). Almost every traversal move has a combat application as well, so the combat gets ever deeper the further into the game you get. The bosses are all very well designed... although each one just boils down to pummeling them into submission, I found them all nonetheless to be unique and engaging each in their own way.

Story: While not an overly deep story, it's delivered quite well, at times in a very humorous way, at other times slightly more serious. There are, if I counted right, four towns you come across during the course of game, helping the world that's been designed here not to feel empty... every town has at least one side quest for you to do as well, though none of the quests are that deep or engaging.

Got it on sale for $4.37 CAD, was definitely well worth the purchase! If your budget permits you to get it at full price, I'd say it's still well worth the purchase, even if the experience is relatively short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029904609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1625111947}
review:
This is such a strange game.

Formula-wise, it's pretty standard stuff. It's a metroidvania with character action game elements. You find powerups and expand your kit to include new traversal and combat options, and enemies become more complex and encounters more puzzle-oriented as your progress. It's mostly good and fluid, but sometimes special move inputs are unresponsive, and hitboxes are occasionally vague.

However, the writing is full of weird and conflicting energies.

I don't know how else to describe it. This is a game that is earnest and deep and shallow and banal.

The art is gorgeous. Consistently, stylistically, sound as hell. The character designs pop, and everything feels like it fits perfectly together.

The writing is inconsistent. The overall tone is sort-of-comedy, and sometimes the characters are extremely likeable and compelling. There's a lot of Spanish peppered into the dialog, but it feels more like how people write bilingual dialogue rather than how bilingual dialog actually is. Some beats hit super hard, some whiff, and there's a lot of 2010s era nerd culture references scattered throughout (Castle Crashers, Rooster Teeth, Strong Bad, etc)---all with unexpectedly high effort in-game posters.

The setting's mythology feels interesting, and the art makes it feel grounded and mystical and lush.

At no point was I able to figure out whether the game was making a caricature out of Mexico or an earnest homage.

Taken as a whole, I think I have to say that I liked Guacamelee. There are better metroidvanias, but the art here is so good that it's impossible not to recommend it on visuals alone.

If you're on the fence, it's worth a try.

Edit: The platforming gets a little bit Path Of Pain towards the end, to the point where there was a progress-essential room in the last 1% of the game that I couldn't figure out. I'd done all the optional stuff and had the chicken flight final upgrade, but the room was built specifically to block it from working. So, idk. I'll never see what the last bit of gameplay was like. I youtubed the ending.

review: Recommends using a controller, then doesn't account for input delay in more advanced challenges / reflex puzzles, requiring user to both have lightning reflexes for "picture perfect" actions (dodging through vines) and fully account for trigger delays, providing zero coyote time for input while demanding exact frame actions. I played this game a while back and had actually enjoyed it quite a lot at the time so tried to come back for that fun, tight and RESPONSIVE challenge I remember. Was greatly disappointed, seems my memory was wrong, as evidently worse input control than Skul & Dead Cells.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126071324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1781, 'last_played': 1680384514}
review:
Gold Edition is a fantastic single player art piece and genuinely challenging game.
Turbo Edition is a "party game" (2+ players). It's the tex-mex BBQ and Monster-truck Rally version.

Gold edition is substantially better. Unfortunately stce pile-drives Guacamelee's otherwise flawless pacing and story. The Canals are fine, but the side-story with the "Terrible Trio" is actually terrible. It's not especially long or hard, but it interrupts the Sierra Morena sequence and includes one of those BS insta-kill chase rooms, along with trapped arenas. Intenso is just an annoying rage-mode they threw in. It honestly adds nothing to the game, accept a crutch for lower skill players.

Even so, I'd still rate stce at 7/10
It's just that I'd give Gold Edition a solid 9/10

I recommend getting the bundle that includes both. That way you can make up your own mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561199113500749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1231, 'last_played': 1623118046}
review: The beat-'em-up combat was an interesting change of pace compared to most metroidvania games. It was also cool that the special combat moves also doubles as platforming moves. The exploration in the game is pretty good, and quite fair - anything that you might miss is generally made clear on the map if you look at it in close detail, so it's not too painstaking to retrace your steps and pick up everything (if you are a completionist). Overall, a fun game and a unique experience that certainly convinced me to play the sequel.

review: Esta con madre. De los mejores juegos de su estilo que he terminado. Merece una oportunidad. Al principio pense que no le habia ido tan bien para que lo regalaran, pero al ver que tiene una segunda parte tal vez no le fue tan mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201646755', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1623198666}
review: I found Guacamelee to be an enjoyable experience. While the story isn't here to blow minds, the characters and humor are likable enough to carry the plot. The beat-em-up combat and metroidvania exploration blend well together, as most techniques learned are both used in combat and exploration, making a very smooth experience. My only gripe is there's definitely a sizeable difficulty jump during the very late game and post game, but that's natural for the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190591243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1692721296}
review:
Pros: Fun combat, funny characters, unique enemies, escape sections, and puzzles, creative use of dimension swapping, you can throw an enemy at other enemies.

Cons: A bit of annoying cultural appropriation, bad Spanish, keyboard control of throwing is a pain (but otherwise plays fine on keyboard), really linear for a metroidvania, and seizure-inducing splash screens. 

Really good game, just look away when you collect stamina/health upgrade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080474308', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1622684853}
review: This game is pretty funny and has a lot of charm, but I got fed up with the puzzle-like, color-based battle system that ending up just being a guessing game when the enemies were in the other dimension: enemies get a colored aura (red, blue, yellow, or green) that has to be broken with a particular attack before you can start dealing damage. The aura comes back if you don't hit them consistently enough and it isn't always the same color again. This was an okay idea when you could see what the color was, but this mechanic persisted even when enemies were totally silhouetted and you just had to guess which color they were. Not a fun battle system imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155695042', 'num_games_owned': 2078, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1621341239}
review:
English review:
Guacamolee is a indie metrovania platform game. The graphic is very pleasant and colorful and it takes inspiration from mexican floklore. I found the gameplay very smooth and it isn't a punitive game as many similar games where you have to make 100% accurate jumps or you have to repeat the same point 1000 times until it leads you to frustration.
In the game there are several save point and custumes so you can change your main character aspect whenever you want. During the game you can unlock new special moves and combo to beat enemies.
Music is very nice if you like the mexican traditional Mariachi style even if sometimes it could be just a bit repetitive. There is even the co-op mode to play with your buddy on same computer or with remote play, but I never tried this mode.

If you like eating burritos with guacamolee and mexican wrestling luchadores this is the game for you!

Italian review:
Guacamalee Ã¨  un gioco indie di tipo platform metrodvania. La grafica Ã¨ molto piacevole e colorata e prende ispirazione dal folklore messicano cosÃ¬ come la musica. Ho trovato il gioco molto scorrevole e non punitivo a differenza di molti platform attuali dove devi calcolare il salto al millimetro altrimenti ti ritrovi a  ripetere lo stesso punto un migliaio di volte fino alla frustrazione. Nel gioco ci sono diversi save points e costumi aggiuntivi che ti permettono di cambiare l'aspetto del protagonista. Nel corso della storia si sbloccheranno nuove mosse aggiuntive e combo per poter far fuori gli scagnozzi. Le musiche sono piacevoli se vi piace lo stile Mariachi della tradizione messicana anche se alle lunga puÃ² risultare un pochino ripetetiva. C'Ã¨ anche la modalitÃ  co-op sullo stesso computer o in remote play che perÃ² non ho mai avuto il modo di provare.  
Se vi piacciono i burrito con guacamolee e i luchadores del wrestling messicano questo Ã¨ il gioco che fa per voi!

author: {'steamid': '76561198315179091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1559976282}
review:
OK platformer.
First mixing Luchadores, el dia de la muerta and probably some more Mexican cultural heritages.
That's the only original thing in that game.
For the rest, it uses mechanics seen in other games of the genre. It reinvents nothing and stretch theses mechanics out of their borders. 
I am not a fan of the pale colors scheme. Something is lacking in the art. I think it is peyote.
So, nothing exceptional here but a working platformer in a cool universe. I keep it up for this one but I did not buy the second opus for the same reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971263288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4516, 'last_played': 1636066666}
review:
Super fun Metroidvania with an emphasis on combat. I would highly recommend it to anybody, especially people with good memories for XBLA mainstays like Castle Crashers (which the game references in the background lol). 

However -- I'd slightly recommend the Gold edition over this one. This game has some minor gameplay tweaks (e.g., the colors of projectile and undodgeable attacks) that make it more fun to play casually, but the Gold edition can be speedrun much faster... if you're into that sort of thing. 

I *am* , so I'd slightly recommend the Gold edition over STCE. That said, this is still a really fun game, so go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964735295', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1619912040}
review: The controls on this amazing platformer are slick and responsive. The difficulty for the main game never feels unfair, and there are a variety of extra challenges tucked away in corners of the Metroidvania-esque game world that will test your dexterity if you like. The story is simplistic but bombastic, as are the outrageous graphics and the maraca-shaking soundtrack. As an added bonus, there are numerous references to classic game franchises of yore hidden here and there. This is video gaming amped up to the maxx (with two Xes); get it and play it and strike that luchador pose when you win it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027038417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1619555950}
review:
This is an above average 2D platformer with beat-em up-style combat. I definitely recommend it for fans of the genre. However, there are a number of negatives I have with the game, and other games I would recommend over it. I got Guacamelee on sale for ~$4 and found it well worth it at that price, but much more than that and I may have been hard to recommend.

Note: I played this game single player, and thus my review is for a single player experience, but if you are looking for a multiplayer game in this genre, this this game is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED because there isn't as much quality competition.

I would recommend these games on Steam before Guacamelee:
- Monster Boy and the Cursed Kingdom [single player 2D platformer]
- Wonder Boy The Dragon's Trap [single player 2D patformer]
- The Shantae games (Half-Genie Hero, Pirate's Curse, Seven Sirens, Risky's Revenge) [single player 2d platformers]
- Streets Of Rage 4 [multiplayer beat-em up]

Here are some of my negative opinions of the game...

The sound in this game sucks. The music all feels like stock music and doesn't really elevate the game in any way. The sound effects (or lack thereof are even worse than the music). Sound effects are really important in beat-em ups so that your attacks feel impactful especially considering how much you will be mashing the attack button. But the sound effects of the basic attacks sound like whooshing noises rather than the typical beat-em up sounds. There is also no voice acting. There is more dialog than you might expect from a game in this genre, and that makes the lack of voice acting hurt a bit.

The game is fairly short. I was able to beat the game on my first blind play though in ~4 hours. I did NOT 100% the game, so if you want to 100% the game that will add a lot of time, but I don't really have an urge to do that myself. Guacamelee DOES NOT HAVE A GOOD COLLECTIBLE MAP. It shows you collectibles per area, but it does not show you the locations/which you already collected. Compare this to "Monster Boy and the Cursed Kingdom" that has a map that shows every collectible location on it.

The game is too  easy. Not once did I struggle with the game. That goes for both the platforming and the combat. That doesn't mean it isn't fun, but more challenge would have gone a long way. I didn't even realize you could buy upgrades from save spots until nearly the end of the game. I just never needed any buffs because there was no challenge.

The character is a bit sluggish. There are a lot of actions that require a lot of frames for the character to recover. After every special move that is a a fraction of a second before you can attack or dodge again. When you get hit, your character must fall all the way to the ground before you regain control. You can change your trajectory mid jump, but not very much without using a special. The character clings to walls ALL THE TIME. Sometimes I want him to get off the wall but he just won't let go of the walls. You can also only use each type of special once (except for the vertical wall run) before stepping on horizontal ground again. Specials also kill your momentum. I understand why they made some of these decisions, but it would have been nicer if the character felt a little faster/smoother.

The graphics could be better. The animations usually look fairly cheap (but this isn't a AAA game to be fair). A few spots in the game the enemies were similar colors to the backgrounds and I didn't actually notice them at first. Also when there are a lot of enemies on screen, they will overlap, and your attacks have an effect, so it just becomes a jumbled mess sometimes that you can't follow because everything is overlapping.

The hit boxes. This is pretty minor, but I found that a lot of hit boxes don't really match their visual representation. An annoyance, but once you trial-and-error the hitbox it isn't bad.

The comedy. This game has a lot of comedy, and it just didn't do it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798792203', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1619389256}
review:
Really nice metroidvania. Art style and sound are really good with a strong Mexican flavor. Controls are tight, combat is fair and you can juggle opponents midair with combos. Characters are fun and well designed.

Only 2 cons for me: many platform sessions are a bit on the easy side, and the fact that when you fall down a pit you pop up where you last were immediately makes them even easier. Secondly, due to the nature of the combat (its a brawler) and the many colors of enemies, environments, projectiles etc sometimes it is hard to see where you are exactly, and getting hit is unavoidable.

Overall the game is in one word FUN

author: {'steamid': '76561198028149409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1619346250}
review:
The game's art style is fun, the writing and characters are enjoyable and I really digged the skill progression parts (the goat's animation had me every time). Most boss fights are rewarding even if you need a few tries.

Where there's light, there is also shadow.

Some environment puzzles appeared to be put into place just to annoy people. Having to remember a maze-like structure beforehand because for no reason at all your screen gets limited to just a small section around the character for the first and only time in the game felt unnecessary. And especially the "Tree Tops" area was highly frustrating. After about half an hour of slow progression upwards without any save points or teleport options I got stuck in the last section. With sweat dripping from my gamepad and nowhere else to go the game now forced me to drop all the way down again, seeing my hard earned progress fleeting by.

Also if after a few hours of playing I still confuse two of the buttons it would've been great to just remap them. However the gamepad button configuration is fixed.

If you like easy to learn and hard to master platformers, Guacamelee is probably for you. I liked it for the most part, but can't excuse the frustration it also caused.

After finishing the final boss, the game tells me, "Hard Mode" is now available. No thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142274084', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1618503366}
review:
I'm inclined to give this a thumb down but then the pros still quite outweight the cons so I will keep it as thumb up, but be aware:

The whole game was good. Can say it's pretty great. Story is pretty straightforward. I know quite a number complain about the [spoiler]combo chicken[/spoiler]. It's kinda hard, but still manageable. A bit pointless though since you're not going to use most of those [spoiler]combo[/spoiler] anyways, but if you treat it as "doing this to get items", then still ok.

The challenges are hard, but that's why they are called challenge right?

However, there are 2 kinda frustrating parts:
1) The first one is the [spoiler]disappearing platform on the mountain[/spoiler]. It's hard, but the worst is, it's not even matching the style of the whole game. You can feel pretty clearly that this part was merely added to make the section really really difficult.

2) The difficulty spike at the final final battle. [spoiler]The second form of Calaca[/spoiler]. To me, the whole game was almost a walk in the park. Maybe I will die randomly when I'm being too relax. Most of the bosses was beaten on the first try (which mean I walk into it without knowing but still managed to just win) or at most second try (after learning the pattern), but when it come to the last one, suddenly it took me like 10~20 tries. 
I'm not complaining that the boss fight is hard or if you should tone it down. I'm complaining about the difficulty surge. Unlike some other game that ask you to "git gud" from the start and that the boss difficulty increase as you go, this one feel like everything was way too easy then suddenly the last one is a massive road block. Maybe balance it a bit will be better so at least we got to train along the way.

Anyways, good game still. I've got the second one and hopefully have time to play it soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079852070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1617150032}
review: Really neat game. It blends a few different genres together, primarily those of platformer, beat em ups, and puzzle. The characters have a lot of charm and have some great designs. There are plenty of extra like various costumes that are not only aesthetically pleasing but also provide various bonuses (some good, some bad). Gets pretty challenging towards the end and hard mode provides an extra challenge if normal wasn't enough. For me normal was plenty challenging. Worth checking out if you're in the mood for an old school metroidvania style game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050247990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1488190145}
review:
Actually really good if you can get past all of the reddit memes from 2010. 

The writing isn't anything special but the characters are all well designed and have a certain amount of presence and impact, the gameplay is solid and the game loves asking you to mix and match systems in new and interesting ways. 

It's a really good metroidvania, you can tell the devs cared a lot about the mechanics, but it would have been great if they cared anywhere near that much about the writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994085641', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1311, 'last_played': 1621793532}
review:
A colorful, charming, funny metroidvania with its own distinct style built around Mexican culture. It doesnâ€™t exactly try to push the genreâ€™s boundaries, but it does carve itself a nice, comfy and memorable corner within them.

Despite being rather straightforward and linear, it has a nice progression of upgrades that feels like you gradually get access to every nook and cranny (starting from a single jump and going up to wall-running and even a sort of flying). Thereâ€™s a decent amount of combat where you throw the enemies all around the place (as is suitable for a luchador hero) and perform some nice aerial combos. The controls might feel a bit unresponsive at first, with a slight delay before most actions, but I got used to it very quickly.

Better yet, I think the game truly captures the genreâ€™s signature feeling of discovery thanks to the collectibles you need for the good ending. Placed in particularly well-hidden areas, each locked behind a unique challenge, they do a great job at communicating â€œHey, youâ€™ve found something really special!â€ without using a single line of dialogue. Furthermore, the good ending itself is indeed quite happier than the standard ending and manages to provide heartfelt closure even to such a simple comedic story, so the reward truly carries weight.

Getting all achievements is fairly easy here and took me around 20 hours, though it does require you to replay the main storyline on Hard. Alternatively, you can start with the Hard mode [url= https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=822241534]right away[/url], but that might prove a bit frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079755006', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2707, 'last_played': 1686811805}
review:
Overall Fun game to play! 

You play as Juan Aguacate, a guy who gets to become a Luchador in order to save his friend/love interest who is El Presidente's Daughter as well as the whole "Mexiverse"!

Its a solid Action Metroidvania with good humor, very bright and vibrant colors as well as a good story! 
The platforming is tight and there are challenges aplenty; some can be VERY frustrating, but once completed, the satisfaction is worth it. 

I enjoy the Drop in/out 4-Player local co-operative play, featuring independent dimension swapping! So everyone can join in the fun! It can be a bit difficult, but the chaos would make it fun! lol 

OVERALL RATING 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198143008698', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1550, 'last_played': 1615074310}
review:
[h1] RESEÃ‘A REALIZADA CON EL JUEGO COMPLETO AL 100% CON TODOS SUS LOGROS. [/h1]

[b] Guacamlee! Super Turbo Championship Edition [/b] es un juego de plataformas de acciÃ³n-aventura en 2D.

[b] La historia [/b] transcurre en un pequeÃ±o pueblo de MÃ©xico. El protagonista, llamado Juan, estÃ¡ enamorado de la hija de El Presidente. Un dÃ­a, un esqueleto malvado llamado Calaca ataca el pueblo y secuestra a la hija de El Presidente. Luego asesina a Juan cuando intenta detenerlo, enviÃ¡ndolo al mundo de los muertos. En este lugar, Juan consigue La MÃ¡scara del Luchador la cual le otorga poderes y lo regresa al mundo de los vivos bajo el nombre de El Luchador para impedir que Calaca sacrifique a la hija de El Presidente para poder tomar el control de ambos mundos.

[b] El juego [/b] es un mundo abierto con varias zonas a explorar donde vamos derrotando enemigos, obteniendo habilidades y mejoras, haciendo misiones secundarias y, por supuesto, avanzando en la historia.

En total hay aproximadamente 15 niveles (o mundos) y cada uno estarÃ¡ lleno de enemigos y grandes zonas para explorar y desbloquear habilidades o mejoras. Muchas veces habrÃ¡ que regresar a una zona ya con nuevas habilidades para seguir explorando y conseguir mÃ¡s mejoras.
Esto puede resultar repetitivo pero el lado positivo es que podemos transportarnos a la zona que queramos y no tener que caminar todo el recorrido de vuelta.

Los puzzles que se nos presentan para desbloquear las mejoras y/o habilidades son interesantes, ya que nos hacen usar muchas de las habilidades aprendidas.

Los jefes son Ãºnicos. Cada uno tiene un diseÃ±o diferente a pesar de estar hechos de esqueletos. Cada jefe tiene un sistema de combate diferente, no podremos usar la misma estrategia para todos los jefes.

[b] Los controles [/b] son muy bÃ¡sicos: saltar, golpear, agacharse y esquivar. Con las habilidades que ganamos se suman mÃ¡s controles y mecÃ¡nicas interesantes para explorar y luchar, pero no se complica tanto

[b] Los grÃ¡ficos [/b] son muy buenos. Cada mundo se ve distinto al anterior y ademÃ¡s, podemos ver cada mundo en sus dos dimensiones, la de los vivos y la de los muertos. Esto hace que en cada mundo no se vea solo una, sino dos ambientaciones.

[b] La mÃºsica [/b] suena muy mexicana. Es la tÃ­pica mÃºsica mariachi que nos imaginamos cuando pensamos en mÃºsica mexicana.

[b] [u] Veredicto final:[/u] [/b] Un juego divertido y complicado por partes, lÃ¡stima que es corto. Para sacar todos los logros hay que jugarlo dos veces, en Normal y en DifÃ­cil. Esto alarga la duraciÃ³n, pero en realidad estÃ¡s repitiendo lo mismo que ya hiciste. Fuera de eso es muy divertido explorar todo el mundo, hablar con los NPCs, hacer los puzzles para obtener las mejoras y los combates contra los jefes.

[b] [u] Mi puntuaciÃ³n:[/u] [/b] 10 nachos de 10

review:
Okay enough story, really goofy all along.
Beautiful art and music.
Well designed progress with character's abilities.
Cool combat, simple to learn, can do awesome combo if put in a little effort, or just smashing buttons is fine.
Puzzles are not difficult, but does not get dull either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311798346', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1703, 'last_played': 1614146563}
review: Another diamond in the Humble rough, Guacamelee was a game I had no expectations about. I'm not a fan of platformers, so I wasn't expecting to enjoy this nearly as much as I did. The vibrant Mexican-inspired art style pulled me into the game, the score was upbeat and dramatic at all the right places, and the game was a genuinely enjoyable challenge all the way through. There's just the right amount of platforming that you don't have to frustrate yourself endlessly to progress the story (though 100%ing is, understandably, a different story). Guacamelee was surprisingly fun, and it was an experience that will stick with me for a long time.

review:
Es un Metroidvania muy sÃ³lido, mÃ¡s concentrado en la acciÃ³n que en la investigaciÃ³n. Por eso, su jugabilidad es simple, pero muy accesible y mantiene un nivel de dificultad no muy elevado.

La mÃºsica va de acuerdo a la ambientaciÃ³n, asÃ­ como los efectos de sonido, sin que sea algo memorable, pero si disfrutable.

QuizÃ¡ lo que no guste a algunos, es la falta de profundidad en historia, personajes y diÃ¡logos, pero es en general, es una muy buena opciÃ³n para los que quieren iniciarse en este gÃ©nero, ya que mantiene las cosas frescas, dinÃ¡micas y no tan complicadas, aunque ofrece reto para casi todos los jugadores.

En conclusiÃ³n: muy recomendable para los que inician y tambiÃ©n puede ser una opciÃ³n para los que quieren algo relajado del gÃ©nero.
