author: {'steamid': '76561198120218592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1612746218}
review:
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition ... oh boy, que bien se siente decirlo.

UN DIVERTIDÃSIMO CO-OP QUE DEBES TENER

Guacamelee STCE es un juego que intenta divertirte de inicio a fin con una historia peculiar y graciosa. Si bien puede parecer un juego de niÃ±os a simple vista por lo colorido que llega a ser. No deja de ser una buena opciÃ³n casual para pasar un fin de semana entre amigos, familia o con la pareja. Este juego te permite jugar hasta con 4 jugadores simultÃ¡neos en un mismo monitor o Tv. AdemÃ¡s que si cuentas con un mando de Xbox 360 o One, el juego se adapta de maravilla como si estuviÃ©ses en la misma consola de videojuegos. 

Lo juguÃ© en PS4 cuando lo dieron por el PsPlus y lo he vuelto a jugar por Steam cuando lo regalaron unos aÃ±os despuÃ©s. Empero no dudo jugarlo de nuevo en el futuro. Es de esos juegos que se sienten bien al progresar, o desbloquear poderes o alcanzar combos. AdemÃ¡s que jugarlo con amigos en DifÃ­cil es una pasada! 

Si buscas un juego casual y entretenido. Este es mÃ¡s que una buena opciÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107465817', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1611552442}
review: Solid Metroidvania with fun combat and platforming challenges. I thought the combat was a bit too easy at first, but as you progress, it does become more demanding, and I appreciated that. It didn't blow my mind and I wasn't that interested in exploring a lot aside from the main path, but I quite enjoyed it, and would be willing to replay in hard in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088671224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1610505641}
review:
AMAZING GAME
Pros
1. The scenery is amazing .
2. Short but well written story. The story is funny and sad. 
3. A LOT of references to other games!
4. Easy combat but hard combos if you decide to get the chicken training achievement.
Cons
1. No replay value (collecting everything is worthless)
2. The stages take forever to traverse if you are trying to get every box. Even with the teleporting statues.
3. I use an xbox 360 controller and towards the end (last stage) the game would slow down to a complete freeze. I disconnected the controller and connected back and it would go back to normal. (My PC is 1,200 worth so its not a PC problem)
NOTE: This last one is just me complaining (mad cause bad).
4. The  stage "infierno" contains challenges that are beyond hard. I legit couldn't even get bronze on 2 challenges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091281119', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1610478234}
review: The combat system is entertaining but has a few things that I think make it a bit annoying such as the long stun/fall delay, 'shielded' enemies and those goddamn bomb creatures that are on a timer. I wasn't really a fan of the side quests either and didn't do many of them. The power-ups you get drastically improve the combat but they seem to be mostly unlocked near the end of the game. They also sorta remind me of the power-ups from Hollow Knight somehow. The story and art are nothing crazy but it is pleasant to look at and doesn't really NEED a complex story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271196994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1705022140}
review: Uno de los mejores metroidvanias de los Ãºltimos aÃ±os. La jugabilidad es, sin duda, su punto fuerte con un sencillo pero adictivo sistema de combos y combinaciÃ³n de poderes que permiten acceder a nuevas zonas. Estos mismos tambiÃ©n son aplicados al plataformeo del juego, el cuÃ¡l es exigente sin llegar a ser injusto o cansino. La ambientaciÃ³n, el soundtrack y el estilo de arte son otro punto a destacar y dan un aire bastante Ãºnico que hace de la obra algo mÃ¡s que disfrutable (en especial si se es latino). Finalmente, pese a que su duraciÃ³n es corta y la historia no es nada del otro mundo, hay desafÃ­os y coleccionables que contribuyen a alargar y mejorar la experiencia. Un juego extremadamente recomendable que suele encontrarse con descuentos bastante atractivos y que vale totalmente la pena. Un sÃ³lido 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872986959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1610641349}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1610034781}
review:
This is a console ported 2D platformer/brawler with a simplistic animation artstyle and a rich Mexican luchadore theme.

Often the use of this kind of art style is done because the developers are lazy or lack talent to arrange anything better, but in this case a lot of work went into it and it looks okay.  The game features excellent writing and a fun story, which really helps things along.  On the downsides, well, at heart this is still a console game and the gameplay is just a repetitive platformer/brawler with less than perfect controls, and not really well suited to KB+M.   It's worth noting the developers superseded the "Gold" edition of the game with this Super Turbo edition, but leave that on the store out of sheer greed.  That's unacceptable.

It's a shame to see good artwork and a fun story being wasted on an old, dead game format, but there's a reason these things should stay on consoles where the peasants like that kind of thing.   Also, $21.50 for a 2D platformer?  No way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198896831485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1658, 'last_played': 1608019636}
review: For some odd reason, when interfacing the PC with a TV through HDMI, the sound does not transmit through the HDMI. The audio only plays on the PC, while the video plays on the TV. I have troubleshooted this issue to death.... after extensive and exhaustive searches online, I have come to realize that there is no fix to this issue. So if this is a deal breaker for you then do not purchase this game. But personally I think it is worth the issue as the game itself is perfect. I wish there was more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198843472405', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1640978438}
review:
This is the fourth time going through completing Guacamelee on different platforms - and i love it!

The game is a quality mix of combat and exploration to build a unique and colourful metroidvania style game. Throw in co op for upto four players and awkward humor, and you have a game not to be missed.

and don't forget the ENCHILADAS!!

review: Guacamelee es un juego con muchÃ­sima personalidad, mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de una historia que tal vez la gente de MÃ©xico absorba mejor, ya que engloba en tÃ©rminos generales parte de su cultura religiosa, mÃºsica, y demÃ¡sâ€¦ Lo que hace mejor al juego es su jugabilidad frenÃ©tica en combate, el conjunto de poderes que podemos desbloquear hace que los combos sean el punto clave para enfrentarse al enemigo. Aunque a veces injusto para los mancos como yo, es notorio el grado de dificultad a medida que se avanza, es necesario comprender el comportamiento del enemigo y memorizar su patrÃ³n y tiempo de combate. Sinceramente no tenÃ­a mucha expectativa con este juego, pero la verdad que pegÃ³ el portazo e hizo que cambie de opiniÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128003305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1603619424}

Man is this game fun!

fun to play on joystick!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990036156', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 506, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1609004142}
review: I've known about this metroidvania for a very long time but up until now I was too intimidated by the prospect of it being too similar to street fighter 2 or some other beat em up. It turns out this game is nothing like that and my fears were completely unfounded. The combat is instead more similar to that of games like Dust: An elysian tale and the abilities are very smoothly introduced to the player with level designs that basically act to show the player how to make use of the abilities. This is overall a really great metroidvania that is recommended to any fan of platformers, metroidvanias, and yes, even beat em ups.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198065686699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 3111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2453, 'last_played': 1622807860}
review:
A mÃ­ personalmente no me gustado mucho, quizÃ¡ por la temÃ¡tica o porque me parece muy simple en su gÃ©nero o puede que sea porque no estÃ¡ del todo pulido pero lo mÃ¡s seguro es que el motivo se componga de la suma de las tres cosas mÃ¡s alguna otra y aÃºn con todo esto lo recomiendo porque es asequible, un buen comienzo para iniciarse en los metroidvania (aunque no es puramente de este tipo de juegos), es colorido y con un estilo muy marcado, tiene buena ambientaciÃ³n y es divertido pero es que a mÃ­ se me ha quedado muy pequeÃ±o.
Soy muy aficionado a este gÃ©nero y otros similares y tal vez el haber jugado ya a muchos hace que el siguiente tÃ­tulo que juegue lo tenga mÃ¡s difÃ­cil para engatusarme. Guacamelee es muy sencillo y, aunque no es fÃ¡cil, es poco desafiante, otra cuestiÃ³n es que quieras sacarte el 100% y ahÃ­ es donde el juego aprieta pero de una forma un tanto injusta. Sacar el final bueno recolectando las esferas esas raras y pasarse con oro todos los desafÃ­os del Infierno te aprieta las tuercas y estoy seguro de que la gran mayorÃ­a pasarÃ¡ de todo esto porque ahÃ­ sÃ­ que se hace tedioso. Las pruebas esas del Infierno son difÃ­cles y algunas estÃ¡n muy ajustadas en tu contra de modo que superar la marca que te indican cuesta y mucho. Pero lo demÃ¡s es un paseo incluso en DifÃ­cil.

Lo bueno:
-Su estÃ©tica, aspecto visual y ambientaciÃ³n musical te transportan a este enorme estereotipo mexicano con forma de juego que es GuacameleÃ©. Supongo que a alguien de ese paÃ­s le puede parecer hasta ofensiva esta colecciÃ³n de clichÃ©s o tal vez le haga gracia, no sÃ©, pero no se puede decir que el juego no representa a ese paÃ­s y habrÃ¡ que destacar eso.
-Es entretenido, a mÃ­ no me ha convencido del todo y no es un juego que me haya divertido en especial pero entiendo que, objetivamente hablando, te gustarÃ¡ lo suficiente como para seguir jugando por su sencillez y rÃ¡pido avance por el juego, estÃ¡s cada poco consiguiendo cosas, peleando,... es ameno.
-Las peleas estÃ¡n llenas de posibilidades, hay muchos combos, poderes y habilidades tanto ofensivas como de desplazamiento rÃ¡pido por los escenarios. Al final siempre acabas usando las mismas cuatro tÃ©cnicas y se acabÃ³ porque recordar todos esos combos, algunos bastante largos y poco intuitivos, es algo casi imposible y que no merece la pena.
-Tiene dos finales, desafÃ­os, plataformeo, secretos, muchas peleas, skins,... no estÃ¡ escaso en contenido pero tampoco es un derroche.
-Hay quests secundarias, pueblitos, gente con la que hablar, tiene cierta vida el mundo aquÃ­ representado.

Lo malo:
-Su historia es una tonterÃ­a pero no sÃ© si realmente contar esto como algo negativo porque por un lado dudo que sea asÃ­ porque sus creadores no tengan capacidad para inventar algo mejor sino que es algo premeditado y por otra parte a nadie que juegue le va importar lo mÃ¡s mÃ­nimo la trama.
-Muy simple en mecÃ¡nicas y jugabilidad. No inventa nada ni lo mejora y se queda por debajo de muchos otros juegos del gÃ©nero porque parece mÃ¡s un plataformas mezclado con un juego de peleas tipo God of War (salvando y mucho las distancias) y todo ello muy simplificado y es por esto que a mÃ­ no me ha gustado mucho, no me ha aportado nada.
-Es un clichÃ© andante.
-El control, siendo decente, es fallÃ³n. No siempre responde a lo que ordenas y muchas veces los saltos son bastante falsos mÃ¡s alguna que otra cosa de esas que hacen que no confÃ­es en el juego, sabes que vas a fallar bastantes veces por culpa de no estar pulido este aspecto.
-Algunas pruebas del Infierno son bastante injustas e insufribles. MenciÃ³n especial a una en la que debes llevar un pollo por un circuito pegÃ¡ndole y lanzÃ¡ndolo por ahÃ­, horrible. No sÃ© cÃ³mo fui capaz de sacar todos los oros.
-Personalmente creo que tiene muy baja rejugabilidad, solo si eres muy completista repetirÃ¡s y probablemente resignado.
-La mÃºsica estÃ¡ bien pero es muy protagonista en el juego, quiero decir que casi todos los temas son mÃ¡s bien fuertes y tambiÃ©n de melodÃ­as cortas que se repiten una y otra vez hasta que sales de la zona, a mÃ­ me cansÃ³ bastante y le bajÃ© el volumen, algo que no suelo hacer en otros juegos.
-Hay habilidades y sobre todo combos que parecen estar ahÃ­ mÃ¡s por parecer que hay mucho contenido que por ser Ãºtiles.
-La dificultad es muy irregular.

Alguna cosa mÃ¡s hay pero bueno, eso es lo que quise destacar. Recomendado pero con muchos matices, si buscas algo elaborado, un reto justo o alguna innovaciÃ³n ni te acerques; si buscas algo simple sin mÃ¡s intenciÃ³n que entretener, es una buena opciÃ³n, no tardarÃ¡s mucho en acabarlo y te harÃ¡ pasar el rato, puede que hasta te encante pero no dejarÃ¡ de ser un juego mÃ¡s, al menos en mi opiniÃ³n.

Nota: 6

author: {'steamid': '76561198182711975', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1307, 'last_played': 1605669198}
review:
Metroidvania; casi un beat em up pero en realidad mucho mucho mÃ¡s orientado a plataformeo.
El progreso en la historia, y el 'leveo' y los upgrades dependen de explorar y plataformear, obligandote a encontrar la soluciÃ³n en sus puzzles a base de encadenar saltos y combos. Con desafÃ­os de esta naturaleza en cada escenario de cada mapa.
Aunque en realidad siempre es todo opcional (excepto por la parte en que necesitas atravesarlos para avanzar en la historia jaja)

Relativamente fÃ¡cil y liviano (incluso en su "modo dificil") AsÃ­ que perfecta opciÃ³n para jugar en cooperativo local si buscas algo sencillo y que no te dÃ© dolores de cabeza.

AdemÃ¡s estÃ¡ llena de una curiosa y divertida temÃ¡tica mexicana, basÃ¡ndose totalmente en esa maravillosa cultura para ambientar con mÃºsica, colores, decoraciones con festividades del dÃ­a de los muertos (de hecho los enemigos son esqueletos). Humor liviano y un juego muy divertido al final. Cabe recalcar que PUEDES SER UN PINCHE POLLO DIOS AZTECA !!

review: It is a very well made game I can see that but the humor is not for me, the tight platforming for the side stuff can be annoying and I personally don't want to bother doing them for the simple rewards. The enemies that just teleport out of your combos is frustrating and also annoying. The game is short so you can get through it if you don't bother with any of the side stuff. This game is not for me but I am sure others can and will have fun with this.

Give it a try!

review: Fun for the first couple of hours, but excruciatingly repetative by the end of the game. author: {'steamid': '76561198449431578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1587, 'last_played': 1604759821}
review:
while the gameplay seemed like fun at the start it slowly turned into tideous and repetitive I won't complain about it being hard but certain things are nearly impossible to do with the delayed keyboard controls (sucks if you don't own a controller), the infierno challenges especially getting 10 golds was a workout some rooms leave you no room for mistakes one jump too late and you have to redo the whole thing, the chicken combo is just flat out bad not only it's a tutorial thing that they made into a quest but you fucking have to complete it to platinum this game, and people might be saying oh yeah just do combos better, sometimes the character just doesn't do the correct combo or the correct input and other times the enemy just clips out of a combo in the air it's really tideous and repetitive

The music and the animations were nice and I like the whole aesthetic of the game but for me it's one of those "haha hard and repetitive" = fun type of games and I usually drop them and forget about them within a day or two

author: {'steamid': '76561198379493421', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1605991385}
review:
inizio col dire che questo Ã¨ uno dei miei primi metroidvania... quindi prendete queste considerazioni come quelle di una persona non esperta
pro:
- artisticamente Ã¨ super gradevole, colorato e ben disegnato
- il sistema di combattimento l'ho trovato molto soddisfacente
- personaggi carismatici e divertenti
- la brevitÃ  Ã¨ un pregio! (7 ore di media per finirlo, qualcuna di piÃ¹ se vi bloccate nelle ultime parti) ma per averlo pagato 30 centesimi Ã¨ anche tanto
contro:
- storia banalotta
- a tratti frustrante 
- tutto molto poco approfondito

come mio primo metroidvania devo dire che mi ha convinto, tanto che ora sono pronta a giocarne altri (come hollow knight o cave story) e per 30 centesimi Ã¨ praticamente obbligatorio!

voto: 8

author: {'steamid': '76561198013611375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1628715362}
review: There is no doubt the idea and look of this game are fun ... but the Endgame is just not.  It begins as a clever Metroidvania platformer, then turns into a variety of trick shots and difficult fights.  Instead of creative puzzles that don't require pinpoint accuracy (found in a game like Ori), this one turns into using your powers to make perfect maneuvers across the landscape.  This gets kinda frustrating and boring.  It is a great game up to this point, just wish it hadn't turned into that.

review:
This game tells the story of Juan, a Salamander Space Marine specialized in melee combat fighting hordes of Necrons through the Warp and our material universe to rescue the Emperor of mankind's daughter Lupita from the evil Necron lord Calaca. 

This game is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008332774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1603132662}
review:
It's a well made game with fluent action, great setting, but with (small) bugs (soft-locking on rotating spikes for example) and some reaaally frustrating enemies.

But I just can't stand Metroidvania style games where you have play for hours just to get some mandatory movement "skills" with which you can destroy walls or jump higher to get to chests/unlock different paths etc. So lots of backtracking and replaying the same content. I despise this in platformers. Bleh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009317041', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1603053958}
review:
this is the dictionary definition of a 7/10 game.
a fun game for a weekend as as the true ending only got me 11 hours(blind) to get and outside one specific part, is not hard by any means.

is a game with nothing specially wrong. but there is nothing outstanding about it either.

my major gripe is that people classify this as a metroidvania. but this is not.
backtracking when you got every single power-up is not exploration.

if you go in expecting metroidvania, you gonna be disapointed. this is just a plataformer that happens to have the levels all connected together

author: {'steamid': '76561198117398959', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1602785815}
review:
Guacamelee is an action-platformer game that combines Mexican cultural elements, vibrant visual aesthetics, and captivating gameplay. Developed by DrinkBox Studios, the game has garnered a dedicated fan base with its fun-filled atmosphere, charismatic characters, and exciting challenges. In this analysis, we will explore the positive aspects of both Guacamelee and its sequel, Guacamelee 2, including their gameplay, story, and visual appeal.
Guacamelee stands out for its fast-paced and engaging gameplay. Controlling the protagonist, Juan Aguacate, you dive into a journey filled with frenetic combat, challenging platforming, and creative puzzles. The fluidity of Juan's movements, including acrobatic jumps, powerful strikes, and special abilities, makes the gameplay exhilarating and rewarding.
The progression in the adventure allows Juan to unlock additional abilities, further expanding his tactical options and providing a sense of growth and evolution throughout the game. The combat is fluid and action-packed, encouraging the mastery of combos and advanced techniques. The variety of enemies and challenging bosses keeps the game captivating and provides a satisfying experience when you overcome each obstacle.
In addition to its thrilling gameplay, Guacamelee features a fun and humorous story. With elements of Mexican folklore and references to popular culture, the plot follows Juan Aguacate on his journey to rescue the president's daughter from the clutches of the villainous Carlos Calaca. The story is skillfully presented, combining comedic moments with emotional ones, resulting in a balanced narrative experience.
The characters in Guacamelee are colorful, memorable, and full of personality. From the enigmatic Tostada to the extravagant and eccentric enemies, each character adds a unique element to the plot and the game's world. The witty dialogue and unexpected events ensure a fun and unpredictable experience throughout Juan's journey.
The art direction in Guacamelee is simply stunning. The game utilizes a vibrant and rich color palette, blending traditional Mexican elements with a cartoonish art style. The detailed environments are brimming with life and showcase a charming mix of rural and urban elements. The visual effects add layers of depth to the scenery, creating an immersive and captivating atmosphere. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199082723047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1602296790}
review:
Este juego es muy divertido y no estoy hablando solamente de la jugabilidad, sino en todo aspecto; sus escenarios, la mÃºsica, los personajes, los diÃ¡logos (creo que es mejor poner el juego en inglÃ©s, debido al uso de Spanglish) Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition es la versiÃ³n definitiva de Guacamelee!, creo que esto deberÃ­a estar claro ya que, esencialmente, es el mismo juego y si aÃºn no has jugado a Ã©ste tÃ­tulo, recomiendo probar Guacamelee! STCE ya que estÃ¡ mucho mÃ¡s pulida la jugabilidad, en especial las plataformas, ademÃ¡s del contenido adicional. 

El dÃ­a de los muertos ha ganado cierta relevancia en la pasada dÃ©cada, ejemplo de ello son las pelÃ­culas como Coco (2017) o El libro de la vida (2014), y precisamente de esto trata Guacamelee!, acentuÃ¡ndose en el tono cÃ³mico, nos cuenta la historia de Juan, un luchador mexicano que va en busca de salvar a la hija del Presidente, de manos del malvado Mariachi muerto Carlos Calaca. Como metroidvania no es mucho lo que tiene para ofrecer, dado que hay tÃ­tulos que ofrecen mucho mÃ¡s y mejor, pero en cuanto a la acciÃ³n y diversiÃ³n que entrega, y el precio, es un tÃ­tulo recomendable. 
------------------------------------------------0---------------------------------------------------------------

This game is pretty entertaining, and I'm not just talking about its playability, but every aspect; the background, the soundtrack, the characters, the dialogues (I think choosing English is the best option since it uses Spanglish in most dialogues)  Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is the definitive edition of Guacamelee! I think that this must be clear, since in essence, STCE and Gold Edition are pretty much the same game, though STCE has a much more polished playability, especially in platforms and it also has additional content.

El DÃ­a de los Muertos has gained relevance during the last decade, which is seen in movies such as Coco (2017) and The Book of Life (2014) and that's what Guacamelee it's about: whie focusing in the funny tone, it tells the story of Juan, a mexican luchador who goes in the quest of saving the Presidente's daughter from the hands of the evil dead mariachi Carlos Calaca. As a metroidvania it doesn't have much to offer, for the are other titles which deliver much more and better, but repect to the action and fun it gives, and the price, its a recommended title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049504356', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1562214834}
review:
Drain's playlist for Guacamelee: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLGYTSvZvuRkHcUOLaUI_DhIyIhUgImvSk

The Guacamelee games are excellent platformers with well written humor. They also do a good job of including the theme of Mexican wrestling moves into the combat and platforming. They make for truly unique and fun games even if the theme doesn't interest you that much. I'm not a fan of Mexican culture or wrestling what so ever but this didn't stop me from enjoying what was served to me. There's no denying that these are well designed games with few flaws to be found. I guess I could point out that there's no online co-op, not for either game. If you want to co-op these; it has to be done locally on the same screen. That's a real waste of potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131816676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1600553047}
review:
Review: Guacamelee

Guacamelee is a Mexican, frenzied, colored, Metroidvania. It is full of other videogame quotes, and almost a parody of a videogame itself.

From my point of view, it had really many potentials but wasted itself with a too chaotic combat system.

The platforming and puzzle components are pretty good, and also you can perform many different actions: Switch between the world of the deads and the world of the livings, jump between walls, fly between walls, climb vertical walls, and many others. And the puzzles are well structured and intriguing.

The combat system is instead based on basic combos, some special moves, and the ability to throw the enemies. many fights end up in a simple clash of the basic fight button. It is not wrong, but it is strangely basic for a game with other gameplay aspects that are very well elaborated. And it is frustrating to see such good platforming and puzzle sections alternate to basic fights or boss fights.

it is a good game, but it was not able to jump further and become one of the new masterpieces of the genre.

7/10 



This and more contents can be found at:
https://instagram.com/error404game?igshi

author: {'steamid': '76561198053660549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1600145790}
review:
[h1] If you want to buy this, get the One-Two Punch for consoles. [/h1]

I really wanted to be able to write a positive review of the PC port. I was willing to look past a lot of things, like STCE being late, and enjoy the game. That's the kind of gamer I am. As long as I get all the gameplay elements in the end, I'm happy. Unfortunately, this is not the case here, minor as some folks will probably call it. 

The reason I cannot recommend this port is because it never properly got a DLC pack the console versions did called "Frenemies". Instead, Drinkbox put the cosmetic half on the Steam workshop and called it good. Problem is, those skins had unique modifiers that changed how the game played on consoles that for some reason, never reached PC. This is especially confusing considering the sequel did the same thing but [i] did [/i] include it for PC. Given half the material needed was already there, there's no excuse the first game can't have the full package either. I could see putting the skins on workshop as a freebie for people who just wanted that part and had to wait so long, but that doesn't excuse Drinkbox from being lazy. And this was pretty dang lazy.

I do recommend this game. The atmosphere is great, the soundtrack is full of catchy Mexican beats, the story and characters are funny and well-written and the gameplay is a fun combo of metroidvania and light fighter. I just recommend doing so on console so you get the whole gameplay package. Plus, the One-Two Punch pack has a neat manual like in the old days, all the DLC and Bandcamp links to the OSTs along with the added benefit of portability if you get the Switch version. 

Just don't give your money to the port that pulled an unbelievably lazy move.

review:
Sencillo pero divertido metroidvania donde hay que destacar su apartado artÃ­stico, con mucha personalidad y divertido. Esta ediciÃ³n incluye los aÃ±adidos y DLC posteriores. Al precio de salida, inferior a 20â‚¬ merece la pena. DuraciÃ³n de entre 6-8 horas para completar la campaÃ±a y 2 horas mÃ¡s para los extras y completar retos.

PRO
- Combate divertido y variado. A menudo, es un reto dominarlo a la perfecciÃ³n.
- Apartado artÃ­stico animado y muy diferencial.
- Es un juego corto, pero intenso. A penas con 6-8 horas te darÃ¡s por satisfecho al finalizarlo.

CONTRAS
- Mapa poco inspirado donde faltan puzzles.
- A menudo el juego se vuelve muy plataformero, y si no es tu fuerte, puedes llegar a sudar para seguir avanzando.
- Faltan habilidades desbloqueables caracterÃ­sticas de todo Metroidvania que te invitan a volver sobre tus pasos.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198077707172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1599619420}
review:
Amazing game!
Art is breath taking and the machanics of the game are very fun.
Would recommend to any platforming, metroidvania or beat 'n' up fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800349497', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2120, 'last_played': 1617157323}
review:
This game is life saver.

I am 22.

When I finished the High School, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my left hand... My gamer hand...

After learning about mexican culture, I became the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage and I will be like my hero Rey Mysterio.

Moral of the story, NEVER punched some concrete with your gamer hand, and if I need to do it punch your pillow. This silly little game helped me to became a virtual luchador.

"La cucaracha, la cucaracha
Ya no puede caminar
Porque no tiene, porque le falta
Una pata para andar"

Thank you DrinkBox Studios

author: {'steamid': '76561198046100455', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1598433598}
review:
Let's start with what I disliked about the game, there isn't much though.
I found some boss battles underwhelming, some rooms with standard enemies were more challenging. And some parkour parts were just annoying (and I don't mean the puzzle ones).
Those, however, were just minor inconveniences when you look at the game for its pros. I loved the [i]wacky[/i] sense of humor, cool abilities, the overall aesthetic (loved the "posters" before every boss fight) and music of the game. Furthermore the puzzles were challenging but rewarding.
Overall great game, and even though the story didn't really matter to me for the most part, after the finale I have to know what happens in the second one...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996926388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1598273847}
review:
As I write this I can see the final boss (I think) in sight, but I am struggling to reach him.  Be warned before beginning: this is not the fun casual Mexican-themed brawler game I thought it was going to be.  The further in you go the more it evolves into a very challenging precision-platformer with a complicated and numerous array of control mechanisms, all of which you must master.  

Not sure I have the will (or skill) to complete it.  But I have enjoyed the time I spent playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845632586', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1598262022}
review:
Controller Type: Xbox Controller

Completion Status: Finish main story (probably not going to 100 percent it)

Hours Played: 8.2 hrs


Guacamelee! is an indie game developed by DrinkBox games, and it follows the main protagonist Juan, and takes place in Mexico with Day of the Dead as the recurring motif and theme of the game. This game gets slept on pretty often, as I haven't really heard anyone recommending this game before, and so here I am recommending the game to you.

The story of the game is simple. If you're familiar with Day of the Dead (or you watched Coco), then basically the story will be pretty easy to follow. People that are dead come back to life and try to take over the world of the living, it's pretty simple. The dead people's leader is called Calaca, and he has abducted Juan's childhood friend and probably his current girlfriend. The game is incredibly light in tone, and has the right amount of humour so it won't be forced. I absolutely love the references to different games, in particular Mario. There were several Mario references in the game, such as a poster, and the classic quote, "Sorry your princess is in another castle!" The music in this game is also absolutely phenomenal, it fits within the game and it sounds light and awesome.

Guacamelee is a game focused on combos. The nature of the game is to avoid losing your combo streak and try to sustain it as long as possible. The gameplay is incredibly satisying. Seeing skeletons smash to bits with that loud crunchy sound effect is awesome. It's hard to explain how awesome it is until you play it. The game is also very color coded, so colorblind people will need to beware. There are 5 types of "energy punches" in the game. Some enemies will have a coloured shield around them, and you need to use an energy punch of the same color to break that shield in order to deal damage. This mechanic works nicely in the game, so that each combat encounter won't be a mindless sequence of mashing buttons, but you would actually need to think and strategise each move.

The gimmick of Guacamelee comes here. Around 2-3 hours into the game, you will get the ability to swap between worlds - the world of living and the world of the dead. Well so what's the difference? It's a little hard to explain, but I will try to explain as best as I can. Basically in a level there will be some hidden tiles, if you switched to the other world then those tiles will appear. This system is often used in platforming, but it is often used in combat as well. Some enemies will be in the world of the living, some in the world of the dead. If you're in the world of the living and your enemy is in the dead and vice versa, you will not be able to damage the enemy. Again, this is color coded as well because enemies that cannot be damaged yet will be entirely black. Personally, I like this mechanic a lot too. As I said before, this turns a mindless sequence of mashing buttons into something more fun and interesting.

Unlike other metroidvanias like Hollow Knight, Guacamelee is very small in nature. There will be backtracking, but they will not be tedious at all. Checkpoints are incredibly close to each other, so if you die don't worry about traveling for like a long time to get to your previous spot. As a metroidvania, Guacamelee will also involve collecting skills at one point, then backtrack to a previous location to use that skill to unlock a new area. There are a lot of skills in the game, and since the game's world is not very big and the game is quite short, you will find yourself unlocking skills quite often. As I said, don't worry about the backtracking because you won't need to take a very long time.

In conclusion, Guacamelee is a fantastic game, and I highly recommend you to get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128384032', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1597764392}
review:
[h1]HISTOIRE[/h1]
L'histoire est la mÃªme que le Guacamelee! de base, en tout cas, dans les grandes lignes. En effet, vous aurez accÃ¨s Ã  de nouvelles zones inÃ©dites dans cet opus quelque peu spÃ©cial. Pour rappel, vous incarnez [b]Juan[/b], un fermier devenu [b]Luchador[/b] par la force des choses, afin d'arrÃªter [b]Calaca[/b], dÃ©sireux de devenir le Dieu du Monde des Morts et des Vivants et qui a en plus kidnappÃ© la fille du PrÃ©sident.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
C'est aujourd'hui assez rare, contrairement Ã  l'Ã©poque, mais nous voilÃ  face Ã  un jeu de plateformes, un peu Ã  l'ancienne mais modernisÃ© tout de mÃªme. Bref, vous aurez donc des passages compliquÃ©s Ã  passer, que ce soit seulement avec des plateformes ou avec des ennemis. Comme d'habitude, vous aurez diffÃ©rents types d'ennemis, les basiques qui attaquent au corps Ã  corps, ceux qui attaquent Ã  distance, les squelettes rapides, qui savent esquiver et attaquer en sautant. En plus des squelettes normaux, il y a les gÃ©ants qui font de lourdes attaquent au sol, des chupacabras qui lancent des projectiles depuis le ciel et qui sont assez Ã©nervants ainsi que les fleurs, uniquement prÃ©sentes dans le sol et qu'il faut donc rÃ©ussir Ã  faire sortir. Bref, de toute faÃ§on je n'ai pas la place d'Ã©numÃ©rer tous les types d'ennemis, en plus cette Ã©dition en apporte de nouveaux mais on les croise assez rarement. Bien sÃ»r, tous ces combats sont entrecoupÃ©s de combats de boss, toujours Ã  l'ancienne, oÃ¹ il faudra mÃ©moriser le pattern de leurs attaques pour pouvoir s'en sortir. En plus de tout Ã§a, au fur et Ã  mesure que vous avancerez, vous dÃ©bloquerez des pouvoirs vous permettant d'accÃ©der Ã  diffÃ©rentes zones fermÃ©es auparavant (oui, c'est aussi un [b]MetroidVania[/b]). Ah, et aussi, vous pourrez vous transformez en poulet pour accÃ©der Ã  de petites zones.

[h1]GRAPHISMES & SONS[/h1]
Les graphismes peuvent paraÃ®tre quelque peu spÃ©ciaux, mais ils sont trÃ¨s beaux. Ils ont choisi une direction artistique particuliÃ¨re mais elle fonctionne trÃ¨s, trÃ¨s bien, tant au niveau du monde du jeu que de son esprit.
Au niveau du son, c'est tout aussi excellent, les musiques sont vraiment trÃ¨s bonnes.

[h1]DURÃ‰E DE VIE & DIFFICULTÃ‰[/h1]
Un peu plus court que la version de base, celle-ci se termine en Ã  peu prÃ¨s 15h (tous succÃ¨s inclus). Votre premiÃ¨re partie Ã  100% (histoire, quÃªtes, collectibles) se fait environ en 10h et la seconde partie en difficile se fait assez rapidement aussi, vu que vous connaissez le jeu et que c'est potentiellement votre quatriÃ¨me partie, si vous avez dÃ©jÃ  terminÃ© la premiÃ¨re version normale, mÃªme si je le rÃ©pÃ¨te, cette Ã©dition a des rajouts qui sont vraiment sympas (nouveaux ennemis, nouvelles zones, nouveaux pouvoirs).
Au niveau de la difficultÃ©, c'est bien dosÃ©, le mode Normal est un bon dÃ©fi pour la premiÃ¨re partie et vous ne terminerez pas le jeu sans mourir au moins une fois. Le mode Difficile est lui aussi un trÃ¨s bon dÃ©fi, les ennemis sont plus nombreux, plus violents et ont plus de vie. Bien sÃ»r, vous, vous en avez moins.

[h1]AVIS[/h1]
TrÃ¨s bonne rÃ©-Ã©dition. J'ai pris beaucoup de plaisir Ã  y jouer (manette obligatoire), non seulement pour la nostalgie du premier jeu, mais aussi pour la dÃ©couverte des ajouts.

[b]Les plus[/b]
[list]
[*] Graphismes & Sons
[*] Les nombreux pouvoirs, de base et nouveaux. INTENSOOOO !
[*] L'humour du jeu
[/list]

[/list]

review:
Very intense - at least if you try to get 100% of the loot. So intense in fact that I broke the left stick of my xbox 360 controller playing it. But loads of fun and a great sense of accomplishment. 

Anyone looking for a challenging platformer/metroidvania: Here you go! (Monkey Island like humor included)

review: Un metroidvania con mucho carisma, con trasfondo de la cultura mexicana de luchadores y san la muerte. Es desafiante a medida que avanzamos en el juego, tiene una duracion corta pero por ser un juego indie esta perfecto. Nota 80/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198299688948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1597864276}
review:
Voy a ser sincero, tengo poca experiencia en el gÃ©nero Metroidvania o videojuegos de Metroid en general. Con eso dicho, Guacamelee es un juego bastante divertido.
Lo peor:
- El juego te presenta enemigos que requieren de determinados ataques para derrotar, pero en algunas ocasiones se vuelve un poco caÃ³tico cuando hay muchos con distintas habilidades a la vez.
- Los segmentos en las ciudades se me hicieron algo densos. En narrativa y presentaciÃ³n pueden ser algo efectivo, pero son mecÃ¡nicamente estÃ¡ticos.
Lo mejor:
- Gran diseÃ±o de niveles que recompensa debidamente a los curiosos. Este es un tÃ­tulo en el que NO querÃ©s seguir solo el camino principal.
- Combate que, mientras demasiado simple al principio, se vuelve mÃ¡s complejo y satisfactorio eventualmente.
- Excelente optimizaciÃ³n y controles muy funcionales (aunque recomiendo mucho usar joystick).
- Una presentaciÃ³n visual y sonora que le da mucha personalidad y con algunos momentos muy graciosos.
- Una banda sonora que exitÃ³samente combina un tributo a la cultura mexicana con sonidos pertenecientes a videojuegos retro.
Guacamelee no es un videojuego perfecto, ni siquiera es de mis favoritos, pero eso no niega su alta calidad y respeto que le tengo. Es un gran punto de partida para los que no probaron un Metroidvania. 
Muy recomendado ya en precio normal, con oferta comprenlo instantÃ¡neamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561199071820876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1597682911}
review:
Totalmente recomendable, es un metroidvania que paso a paso vamos desbloqueando nuevas habilidades y combos para ir expandiendo la exploracion y el combate. 
positivo: Duracion, Combates, Desafios totalmente superables por prueba y error, Habilidades
Negativo: no es compatible con mando de ps4 y jugarlo con teclado se dificulta bastante ya que necesitamos 6 botones para hacer uso de todas las habilidades y principalmente en la fase de desafios para completar el 100% se complica bastante.
La musica es siempre la misma, al principio esta bien pero luego de un par de horas cansa bastante.
El recorrido final para el 100% se torna un poco molesto principalmente por que hay algun que otro cofre que se debe ver en una guia donde esta para no dar vueltas como loco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016578669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1597270031}
review:
-Catastrophic on keyboard. (They do recommend a controller at the beginning of the game) Catastrophic. Keyboard ruined my gameplay.
-Double jump reaches the same level as the platform but does not connect, Juan connects to walls where he shouldn't if it is a very short wall. Input lag is horrible.
-Teleportation is absolutely useless and poorly designed. It is not implemented in any strategic location.   
-The artistic design is gorgeous (sound and visuals).
-Story: lame.
-I can imagine a better gameplay experience with a controller so I am recommending it (ONLY for controllers NOT keyboard).

Metroid-vania dont le gameplay ressemble fortement Ã  Outland.

Guacamelee se dÃ©marque par son humour, son univers de la fÃªte des morts et son style graphique trÃ¨s particulier.
Le jeu sait se rÃ©inventer en distillant au compte goutte de nouveaux pouvoir et en proposant diffÃ©rents challenges au fur et Ã  mesure, faisant rÃ©fÃ©rence Ã  tous les classiques du jeu de plateforme.

review: Most of my favorite metroidvanias have a sense of quiet atmosphere. Guacamelee does not. Instead, it invokes the colorful revelry of DÃ­a de los Muertos and the carnival of Mexican Luchadors. It isn't big on the exploration aspect, but it has a really fun combat system that utilizes (and often requires) your earned powers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027320803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1596402823}
review:
Juego que roza la perfecciÃ³n, un must de los metroidvania. Al principio da la impresiÃ³n que su apuesta por el Â«combateÂ» no es tan satisfactoria en comparaciÃ³n con otros del gÃ©nero, pero todo lo contrario. Es sumamente divertido y dinÃ¡mico la forma en la que han diseÃ±ado la lucha siempre cuerpo a cuerpo. 
No se hace nada tedioso hacer el 100 % gracias a su diseÃ±o de mapa, los teletransportes y la posibilidad de volar en cierto punto del juego.
Una historia completa y original. Destacar el humor que impregna todos los componentes del juego y que hace de este algo Ãºnico

author: {'steamid': '76561198261899323', 'num_games_owned': 2421, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1685346866}
review:
DespuÃ©s de unas cuantas horas de juego, creo que no voy a continuarlo. Me gustan los metroidvania pero no me motiva nada. No penaliza las muertes, el plataformeo es bastante soso y la mecÃ¡nica es ir de un lado a otro del mapa completando las tareas.

Tiene cosas buenas, los grÃ¡ficos con estÃ©tica mexicana y la ambientaciÃ³n, y los movimientos de los persnajes y enemigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431981748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1973, 'last_played': 1562943492}
review: Very good and enjoyable game. The story was pretty good and there were some funny and humorous moments here and there that made the game even more enjoyable. There also is a co-op mode that you can play the story mode in but I haven't tried that one out with anyone. The gameplay is also very enjoyable and satisfying, there are some unique abilities that you unlock along the way which make the game more exciting. Some of the achievements can be a little hard to achieve but with a little determination you can get them. While I did receive the game for free I believe that the game is worth the price that it has on the store and I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293703917', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1596203561}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is really the most challenging, most exciting, most adrenaline rushed, most difficult but very skilled to play this game. This Metroidvania Wrestling Game is that I have never seen before in my life. graphics were beautiful, the music is satisfying even when you change dimensions in the game and also this very difficult to get the happy ending, I stopped playing before because of no interest but 1 year later made me motivated to get the happy ending, And I finally learned my lesson. Don't rush to complete the game. Because if I rush the game there would be a consequence to get the bad ending

review: Wonderfully made Metroidvania. Tough platforming challenges if you want to 100%, so those who like that will have tons to learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054736740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1596071617}
review:
Pros:
The music goes well with the game's theme. Combat is simple and is like a typical beat em up. It is a game you can casually pick up as needed. Lots of humor based on mexican stereotypes. Did I mention goats, chicken, roosters, and co-op? Definitely recommend this tile to anyone who is a fan of the metroidvania genre. Lots of items to collect all game long. Controls are precise. Battle goes from boring to frustrating. The story is kinda like super mario. Won't post spoilers.

Cons:
The game is quite short at around 10 hours. This is also including backtracking for things you could not have gotten earlier. Some end game extras are frustrating to complete in case you are a completionist. Not a good title for those who are impatient.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202217949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1595987393}
review:
[h1]Plataformero basado en la cultura Mexicana  (el cual si esta en espaÃ±ol) con colores  muy llamativos, usando como soundtrack   mÃºsica tipo tradicional mexicana.[/h1]

Con una historia la cual parece haber sido sacada de una leyenda mexicana, el combate que tiene el juego es fluido y  una vez avanzando el juego puedes hacer muchos combos, el diseÃ±o de los mapas es bueno y variado teniendo algunos donde se centra mÃ¡s en  la exploraciÃ³n o el combate, aunque la dificultad del juego en si para alguien que no estÃ¡ acostumbrado a jugar este tipo de juego no va a representar un desafÃ­o, el juego tiene algunos niveles de plataformas lo cuales son  realmente difÃ­ciles y  la mayorÃ­a de estos estÃ¡n en el mapa de â€œEl Infernoâ€. 

Lo Ãºnico que no me gusto de este juego es que necesitas obtener todos los orbes de la MÃ¡scara (son 6) para sacar el Final Bueno y si solo te falta 1 automÃ¡ticamente  sacas el final Malo. Y los cubos morados necesitas 5 de las 6 orbes para romperlos. 

Totalmente recomendado 9 de 10

Horas y horas de diversiÃ³n asegurada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799671585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1595393748}
review:
Got this when it was free as a fluke. Fun game, but gets tiresome fast, and definitely not worth the money unless you REALLY need a spare metroidvania in your life.

Pros: 
-Interesting combat system
-Lovely folklore backdrop and definitely unique visuals
-Humor that is straight out of the mid 2000's
-Abilities constantly being added to the mix keeps the combat fresh
-The combat generally feels good and combos when YOU are the one freestyling them feel great.

Cons:
-Some arenas are plainly meant to troll the player, filled with platforming and only projectile enemies that aggro from off-screen
-Finicky jumping Puzzles
-So many side quests and challenges that add very little and are just plain frustrating
-More Jumping puzzles
-The game itself feels kinda finicky with timing and button presses for things like jumps, combos and the fixed moves you have to do perfectly for many of the secrets and exploration.
-Yet more jumping puzzles.
-Enough filler content going after secret endings etc that it feels like the game doesn't really respect your time

 I get it's a platformer and metroidvania, but this definitely feels like a game where the devs had more fun making it than most players will actually have experiencing it. It holds up, but just barely, given how many options have come out since its release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059208850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1594949240}
review:
TL;DR Review
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Final Score - (7.5) Good

In-Depth Review (Spoiler Free)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Visuals - 8/10 - (Very Good)
The game is quite beautiful and unique, hardly leaving anything for desires. Even though it is a small world, the areas are quite different from each other giving you a feeling of freshness. The game becomes even more beautiful and fresh when you unlock the ability to change between dimensions and you can experience everything from a new perspective.
Since the game doesn't support 21:9 the black bars can become quite distracting and pull you out of the game's immersion.

Gameplay - 8/10 - (Very Good)
Guacamelee! has some mechanics which are not new to the genre but are executed quite well by mixing your combat abilities with the platformer sections and puzzle-solving.
When it comes to combat the game is quite responsive and smooth, feeling really good to control and hardly ever getting in your way when attempting a combo or string of attacks.
The platforming is well responsive and challenging and is one of the game's strongest assets, completing the platforming areas fell quite rewarding and fun.
All the enemies follow certain patterns of attack and becoming accustomed to them is a must, bosses have unique and fun patterns to master, that makes you feel quite rewarded for defeating them.

Story - 6/10 - (Fine)
The story is quite simple and the classic damsel in distress trope. The girl who is Juan's love interest gets kidnapped by a group of villains and the hero has to save her by defeating the evil bunch. It is simple, but Cohesive and cute enough to serve as a background to the game.

review:
This game is absolutely amazing! Out of all the free games I have gotten over the years (which I have gotten over 60 free games), this is the best one.

Metroidvania fans would absolutely adore this game (as well as get a kick of the blatant metroid shout outs). 

This game does everything well, the artstyle, the gameplay, the characters, the collectibles, the ost.

10/10 would recommend getting this game.

I only wished this game was longer, but then again, this game is already incredibly long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088952907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1596029885}
review:
[h1] El Tigre May Cry [/h1]

[b] Is Samus Aran a Spanish name? [/b]

[b] Metroidvania! [/b] Mostly on the Metroid side this one, is an entertaining stylish air combo filled brawler  side scrolling platformer. 

The strongest part of this game is definitely the combat. If you're good enough, you'll be juggling enemies half a minute at a time like Dante beating a pinata hanging from the Qliphoth tree. The heavy attacks that also double as path openers and traversing methods are mostly well utilized, inside and outside of combat. One of the heavy attacks feels janky but the level design accommodates it well enough that it kinda works? The enemy designs encourage you to use all of the given heavy attacks, so the encounters can be overwhelming if you're not paying attention. The boss fights are pretty great too, not too restrictive in your approach to combat, not too punishing at least on Normal difficulty.

The platforming scenarios and level designs vary in quality. Some parts are cool and feels rewarding to participate in, others especially the late game extra platforming challenges can be awfully frustrating. Awfully.

Striking visuals; the Spanish DÃ­a de Muertos festive aesthetic is definitely uncommon in video games. This game is blindingly expressive with its bright colors, cartoon art style, and the levity's there. At least the Easter eggs and video game references in this game isn't as obnoxious as Borderlands'.

This game is a love letter to Metroid front and back, and it is a solid game overall.
Get it.

Lo Ãºnico malo que le encuentro (por buscarle algo malo, ya que esto no es algo negativo para todos, es mÃ¡s una queja personal) es que no tiene jefes secretos; si bien tiene bastantes zonas secretas, en su gran mayorÃ­a son plataformeo que en ocasiones llega a volverse tedioso, sobretodo cuando quieres pasarte el juego al 100%, me hubiera encantado que en vez de un parkour de 25 minutos hubiera un jefe opcional, los cuales son inexistentes en este juego. Por lo demÃ¡s: jugabilidad divertida y bien pulida, un apartado grÃ¡fico muy bonito, una banda sonora preciosa, mÃ¡s de 20 horas de juego (sin guÃ­as), deja de leer esta reseÃ±a de mierda y compralo ya, que es tremendo juegazo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994970298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2378, 'last_played': 1594597460}
review:
I think what I like most about this game is that it's easy to either play in short bursts or lose hours in the game. It's also pretty funny at times and the skills are pretty unique for a metroidvania, at least in my experience. 

What I didn't like is that the controls felt wonky at times, often doing the wrong move or going the wrong direction, etc. It could just be my fat fingers, of course, but I don't have the problem to such a degree in other platformers. Still, it's tolerable after making some adjustments and focusing on precision. 

It does feel a bit dated compared to some newer titles, lacking some QoL and polish that it could have benefited from. 

Still, it's a fun game and definitely worth giving a shot. Oh, and my playtime is inflated by idle time - my in game time totalled about 21 hours to get 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561199051092775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1595383359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106281795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1579305096}
review:
I got this game when they were giving it out for free a while back, which I think made me enjoy it more than if I had to pay full price for it.

The color palette for the game is gorgeous and moving around feels really fun.

I will say, though, that some of the level design is kind of bland and the humor and writing of the game is very tryhard Internet humor that's already aged poorly.

But besides that, you can really really feel the heart and care that the team had making this. The game feels like a fully realized vision. While it's not my favorite game, it was an enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118041806', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1597097801}
review: Yeah, it is pretty good. The metroidy elements that you have seen get tiresome because it is all the same kind of stuff turned into wrestling moves, but the combat is fun and probably the highlight. The story is goofy enough and has stylish flair in decent numbers with cool character design to forgive its otherwise copy paste shortcomings. Sometimes there is so much going on in a combat situation that it can get too frustrating and my dodge roll is almost always half a frame too late get avoid a hit from those yellow goons which is really annoying because I a feel like my timing is perfect. I also usually realize that I have the wrong costume for an encounter after I have already grinded my way through it, but that is my fault. If I am really going to pick at it, I would also say that movement is just a hair to sensitive for some of the platforming, but you also respawn in the same room giving you more than enough attempts, so that is a wash. I have a lot of complaints, but it is a pretty enjoyable game, though I rarely find myself having loving it. I can't point to any level design elements (aside from the visuals I guess) that strike me as imaginitive. The move set is varied enough that fighting hoards of occasionally too-spongy enemies is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307292138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1594265419}
review:
La jugabilidad es hermosa, mientas mas jugÃ¡s mas copada es y mÃ¡s divertida, eso hace que el juego sea mas divertido mientras mas poderes aprendas y puede ser que al inicio no te guste pero de a poco te empiece a copar.
Lo malo: los plataformeros no merecen buenas historia parece, todo debe ser culpa de mario y su princesa no parece que necesiten o busquen mÃ¡s. 
La historia no atrapa y hace que las cinemÃ¡ticas estÃ©n por estar lo mismo con el final, me daba igual como terminaba solo lo jugaba por que es divertido pero no atrapa. Juan tiene menos carisma y personalidad que personaje de Disney en star wars 9.
Por Ãºltimo, el humor no es gracioso, el multijugador no lo probÃ© pero suma.
Recomendado, no indispensable pero si lo inicias vas a ver que va a pasar a ser indispensable para vos terminarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960596166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1594134860}
review:
I enjoyed this game, the art style is fun and it scratched my metroidvania itch.

That said, it's very short and is somewhat lacking in depth.

Get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198879759692', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1593870694}
review: I bought this game during the steam summer sale and really really liked it. Would recommend to anyone who likes the metroidvania genre of games. There are also beat-em-up elements involved for the combat that I found enjoyable. It wasn't super difficult on the normal difficulty (the only difficulty I played on) but there were some platforming sections that game me some trouble. I personally am a big fan of the art style and all the Mexican cultural references and other fun references to other video games through out the game. While the story is not super complicated or anything too memorable, the excellent gameplay and charm that the game exudes more than make up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198813426536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1591623744}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition es un metroidvania al mÃ¡s estilo mexicano, con una banda sonora preciosa y con una ambientaciÃ³n que te va a ser creer que realmente estas en Mexico. El juego comienza con un campesino llamado Juan que vive en un pueblucho habitado por otros campesinos muy cordiales, nuetra misiÃ³n inicial sera ir a la iglesia para ayudar a Fray Ayayay (sacerdote del pueblo) a ayudar con los preparativos para un festival. Cuando estas ayudando al sacerdote aparece la hija del alcalde la cual invita a nuestro personaje a una fiesta que ocurrÃ­a en la noche. Luego de todo eso debemos ir a ver que ocurriÃ³ en la mansiÃ³n del presidente puesto que estaba en llamas. Al llegar vemos que de la nada nos aparece un esqueleto llamado Carlos Calaca y 2 ayudantes suyos quienes fueron los que iniciaron el incendio hacia la mansiÃ³n. Carlos nos reta a un combate en el cual morimos de un golpe ya que somos una persona normal. 
Terminamos apareciendo en el mundo de los muertos donde luego de caminar unos metros nos encontramos una mascara de un luchador y vemos tambien que se nos aparece una luchadora llamada Tostada que es la guardiana de la mascara que dice que si nos ponemos podemos regresar al mundo de los vivos y tambien que nos ayudara a derrotar a Carlos Calaca.
Luego de ponernos la mascara volveremos al mundo de los vivos y nos contaran que el villano principal secuestro a la hija del presidente. 
Nuestro objetivo sera salvar a la hija del presidente de las garras de Carlos Calaca ya que tiene pensado utilizarla para un ritual que harÃ¡ que el mundo de los vivos y el de los muertos se fusionen y asÃ­ poder dominarlos con sus poderes.
El juego es muy entretenido, con una historia decente, una banda sonora increible, enemigos no del todo dificil al principio pero que mientras vas avanzando en la historia se ponen mÃ¡s complicados llegando algunos a ser tediosos. Mi valoraciÃ³n es: 8,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198795667007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3168, 'last_played': 1642477539}
review:
un divertido metroidvenia que no se toma en serio, muchas referencias a juegos, franquicias, memes etc.. con mecanicas interesantes. 
el unico detrimento que le veo es que es bastante lineal, en cuanto al avance en las diversas zonas, pero es algo que se compensa con los secretos que tiene escondidos. 
Conseguir el 100% no es realmente dificil pero si es muy entretenido.
si gustas de los metroidvenis compralo, pero juegalo en dificil de inicio, para que sientas un reto real

author: {'steamid': '76561198029093963', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1589980948}
review:
An abosloutly fantastic platformer. The graphic is good. The music is excellent. The gameplay is fun, and varied. Is fast , its again varied with different combos, and abilites. I also like that there is different outfits with different abilites. The story/plot is decent. The platforming is excellent , where you have to react pretty fast. And excellent platformer well worth a buy, and I would go as far and call it a masterpiece :) 

Do you like platformers, that is hard enough,  with enough varied, decent combat and good platforming this is well worth a buy

And the bosses is excellent too. Highly recommended :)

review: Juegazoo, excelente metroidvania. Es desafiante, mecanicas interesanes y sobretodo MUY entretenido. AdemÃ¡s, SI ESTA EN ESPAÃ‘OL, en la configuraciÃ³n del juego puedes cambiarlo sin problemas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979785007', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1620762633}
review:
One of the most entertaining games I've played so far.

The combat is best thing it has to offer (aside from the colourful graphics, the chickens, the music and other game references). Punching and smashing enemies is so satisfying.
You can go for the 100% completion and don't get bored with it. If anything, it makes you want to play it again on hard mode.
10/10.

review:

Lo unico malo es su durabilidad, si bien se alarga con los coleccionables, el final secundario y los desafios en el infierno la historia es un poco corta, ademas de que en algunos puntos tienes que recorrer partes del mapa muy largas varias veces.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207307879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1558553563}
review:
[h1] 10/10 would beat it again. [/h1]
I never play all of my games in my library, but I wanted to give this one a try.
This game shocked me with how enjoyable it is, the mechanics are tricky but fun, graphics are fairly simple and really cartoony, and the gameplay is really good, making it hard to get bored of this game until you finally beat it. There's also some things you can do after beating the game, but you have to find it out yourself because otherwise you won't be able to enjoy figuring out everything by yourself and having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059361840', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 1030, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1593130241}
review:
After playing the game for 15 minutes I decided to close it. A month later, I was going to write a negative review about itâ€¦ starting with: â€œI donâ€™t know why this game series is so popular.â€

This is my first Guacamelee game and I personally didnâ€™t enjoy it at the beginning. But I decided to give it a second chance. And that was definitely the right decision. This time the game really got me.

The art style is colourful, Mexican and really adequate. It spreads positive vibes.

The gameplay is pretty simple and the story isnâ€™t extraordinary, but it was somehow still fun. I will keep playing this unique beat-em up game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053754931', 'num_games_owned': 2188, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1651970866}
review:
[b]Agrega un final secreto, nueva zona y nuevo jefe. Si jugaste el anterior vale la pena igualmente re-jugar la S.T.C.E.
[/b]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36430761-KurareMHM/][quote]Para mÃ¡s recomendaciones hace click wachin[/quote][/url]

Como ya reseÃ±e la primera parte de las aventuras de Juan Palta, quiero hablar de que trae exactamente esta version, que es algo que no vi que muchos remarquen lo nuevo (parece que ni jugaron el anterior).

Aunque no se centra en su lore o transfondo, en esta ultima re-ediciÃ³n se agrego zonas completamente nuevas, un jefe adicional (el trio peligro) y un poco de lore, donde se nos dirÃ¡ quiÃ©n es Tostada y el origen de los esqueletos que enfrentamos durante todo el juego.

Personalmente me gusto mucho la nueva zona y lo que agrego al lore. En si, no es muy largo, o quizÃ¡s no lo fue para mi por que ya habÃ­a terminado el anterior y dominaba ciertas bases del juego, pero sin dudas es muy bueno lo que agrega, la zona si no dominas los saltos y eres imaginativo se te puede complicar un poco, pero sinceramente creo que vale la pena jugar esta re-ediciÃ³n, a mi me divirtiÃ³ la nueva zona, nomas me hubiera gustado que fuera mÃ¡s "hardcore" para ser un reto dificil para los que ya habÃ­an terminado la versiÃ³n anterior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311267097', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1592753689}
review:
I remember as a kid watching Mucha Lucha and thinking, what's the matter with Mexicans? they insist on wrestling with masks on -granted it was a lot of fun to watch, but it always made me wonder as a kid-
then I find this game and I was not surprised when I saw the same tradition being followed here, actually, on the contrary, it made quite happy :)

In Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition, you play as Juan,  Tostada, or maybe a chicken? whoever you might be, in whatever dimension you are, you will always be the brave Luchador of Santa Luchita and its kindhearted people, the Luchador that outsets on an adventure to save his beloved lass and soon enough realizes that he is saving the entire world also.

The world of this small Mexican universe is premeditated to be the best it could be, you never feel lost, out of place, or confused on what's that you are doing or supposed to do and each world is unique -to a certain degree- in its theme and music.

The more you advance in this game the more techniques and abilities you unlock, more combos,  juggles, and throws and new movements that allows you to access locations that weren't accessible before, it makes the game more complex and more fun to play. if this is a downside to you, then this game's only downside is that the closer you get to finishing it the better it gets.

This Metroidvania is Mexicans vibes heavy, humorous, challenging, entertaining to a level I didn't expect, and fun, more fun, and even more fun. I loved this game.
recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017684563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1592497742}
review:
Genial juego tipo metroidvania. En principio no me atraÃ­a mucho, pero cuando lo probÃ©, me enganchÃ³ su sistema de lucha, su aspecto visual, sus secciones de plataformas, sus pequeÃ±os puzzles, sus desafÃ­os, su sistema de progreso,,... 
Luego estÃ¡ lo tÃ­pico de revisitar Ã¡reas con nuevos poderes para acceder a zonas que antes no podÃ­as, que le da mÃ¡s profundidad al conjunto. 
A destacar el sistema de combate, que cuando vas viendo cÃ³mo funciona, te engancha a ver el mayor combo que puedes hacer y probar a matar los enemigos de diferentes formas.
El Ãºnico punto negativo que le he visto es la mÃºsica, que se me hace muy repetitiva al rato de estar en la misma zona.
En general juego muy recomendando para pasar unos buenos ratos y que me ha sorprendido para bien!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062113238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1592266311}
review:
Good metroidvania, mostly linear overall but there are plenty of chests to backtrack and get once you get new skills, the combat is fun and fluid, and the skill progression is well paced so you never get bored of the skills you can use, plus there are puzzles to solve that require you to use the skills in order to progress, which was always fun.
My only complaint is that some of the platforming sections require very tight timing & positioning, and even though you respawn very close to the start of the section it can get a bit frustrating, other than that it was a very fun ride and highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141400402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1592191548}
review:
I have to be honest; I hate Gaucamelee Super Turbo Charged Edition. I have heard that the Gold Edition may be a bit better but I believe I would have many of the same problems. I wanted to hate the combat but the move set started to grow on me a bit by the end of the game; however, throwing enemies around and racking up big combos is the only thing keeping the game from being an absolute bust for me. The game claims to be a Metroidvania but I really do not get the feeling of a Metroidvania. I donâ€™t feel that it was ever worth exploring other than when I found pieces of a Luchador mask because the game gated me so hard from exploration early on that when I was told I had 15 statues of power-ups by the old man, I always thought I was going to hit an impassable obstacle. A typical atmosphere of a Metroidvania is lonesome and even fearful. So, when a developer differs from that typical story formula, there needs to be a good reason. There was a good reason to differ and make the story more colourful and light but my god the humour is terrible with some really weird jokes and way too many minor characters. The side quests make this game feel like Zelda where the player is literally rewarded heart pieces. At least the side quests do not tell me exactly where to go like the main game did. I finished this game in one sitting because it just tells me where to go.  Some Metroidvanias have waypoints on a map that are not painfully obvious how to navigate to but the segmenting of the map DOES make it painfully obvious where to go. The world design has no depth! The player gets a blue punch power up; walk out of the room and follow the immediate path with the blue block in the way. Only play this game if you want a more complicated Castle Crashers because it is worthless as a single player experience.
The bosses were pretty bad. There was one cool boss but it ended up not very hard after I got the hang of it. I do not even want to talk about the bosses much because they were just short, straight forward, and the final boss literally made me shed tears of disappointment. I played the entire game to see what was at the end and I wish I had ANY reason to want to look for the pieces of the Luchador mask for the good ending (I presume that is what it is for)â€¦ and I do. When I am feeling lifeless, I will try Gold Edition and I might try to get the Luchador mask pieces. For Gaucamelee Super Turbo Charged Edition, the final boss was so terrible with an unfair first phase and only a slightly better second phase that is just as garbage as most of the other bosses in the game.

review:

Tanto la mÃºsica como los escenarios y la estÃ©tica son muy buenas, tiene de esas canciones con las que te acuestas a dormir o vas caminando y empiezas a recordarlas sin poder sacÃ¡rtelas de la cabeza. Ahora, a la hora de rejugarlo o tratar de sacar el 100% es otra la historia, se notan mucho mÃ¡s y son aÃºn mÃ¡s desagradables las peleas que te meten para alargar el juego y terminas muchas veces hartÃ¡ndote y dejando de jugar por esta razÃ³n. 

Finalmente, lo recomiendo, vas a pasar 15 horas muy entretenidas jugando a un metroidvania hermoso estÃ©ticamente, con mÃºsica pegadiza y con unos controles simples pero que siempre responden bien. 

PD: A pesar  de haberlo pasado 3 veces y sacarle el 100% aÃºn no me dan cromas, tu puedes Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071914233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1591271857}
review:
At the very least, don't play this version of the game.

The game is designed to annoy you. Shields on enemies, shadow/light swap, all of that only exists to make battles annoying. Sometimes VERY annoying. 
Mechanics-wise it's extremely wonky as well. Controls are not intuitive and can't be changed if you use a controller, which is even recommended by the game, so a lot of control fighting is going on. Dodging is a concept, but not practical. The game expects you to be way too precise with all the not very precise movement.

And all of that just gets to the maximum and makes you hate everything in the new and completely enforced content. That was bad. Really really bad. Otherwise it's actually okay. Must've been a typical case of "we did everything with our mechanics that's reasonable, but now we need to make more content for a new version". Please. Next time make it optional. Thanks, That mindset would've saved the game from bad things like the Intenso mode and changed battles for it as well.
