author: {'steamid': '76561197967876062', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1590954773}
review:
For the most part Guacamelee! STCE is a fun Metroidvania style platformer.  The game is very colorful and has a fun soundtrack.  My SO is a Day of the Dead enthusiast and as such I'm around it a bit, so I found the Day of the Dead theme of Guacamelee! to be interesting and enjoyable.  The game also made a ton of references to old retro platform games like Super Mario Brothers, Mega Man and Metroid, plus a number of pop culture references to wrestling, and oddly a large number of Star Wars references, which while amusing, seemed out of place in this style of game.

The Luchador's abilities, that are earned in the same vain as Samus from Metroid, were all fun to use and a blast to chain together into combos during combat or use to get additional air/distance when jumping between platforms.  I'm not good at completing Metroidvania style games, but this one was enjoyable enough that I was able to finish the game within an okay time frame.

The only thing that kept Guacamelee! from being a truly standout game to me was that there were a couple areas that required pinpoint precise jumping that included powers that required such precise timing that I couldn't get past, so it was more preferable to ignore them instead of get frustrated trying to get through them.  I am okay with jumping challenge mechanics, but when the required precision is measured in pixels then it turns from challenging into frustrating tedium then I'm done at that point.  Also, all the Star Wars references in the dialogue just didn't fit an a game with a Hispanic heritage theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046905523', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1679903993}
review:
[h1][u]The Short and Sweet[/u][/h1]
[u]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/u] is a hybrid beat-em-up / Metroidvania game based on Mexican culture, with a large emphasis on combo-based combat, intelligent approach, and platforming. The story revolves around a farmer named Juan, who is killed by the main antagonist while attempting to save his friend, only to come back possessing the power of a magical mask, which turns him into a powerful Luchador intent on punching, suplexing and bodyslamming his way to victory.

As the player progresses through the game, they unlock more types of powerful attacks, such as large uppercuts and bodyslams, or utility abilities like clinging to or running up walls. Many of the combat abilities end up playing critical roles in platforming segments for their mobility, increasing the depth of the system. Additionally, some enemies can only be defeated by certain attacks, preventing the player from simply using brute force to make their way through any and all situations.

[b][u]Pros[/u][/b]
[list]
[*] The combat requires adaptability and precision from the player, making it a welcome challenge.

[*] Co-op with up to four players is supported, and is Steam Remote Play compatible.

[*] The art style and music is a pleasure to experience, both centered around Mexican culture.

[*] The combination of platforming and solid combat mesh well together, often overlapping for even more entertainment.

[*] The story and dialogue are entertaining throughout, and are definitely not a detriment to the experience.
[/list]

[b][u]Cons[/u][/b]
[list]
[*] Metroidvaniaâ€™s style of backtracking can be a major turn-off for many players. Getting a lot of the upgrades requires backtracking, as does the â€œTrue Endingâ€. Both can rapidly become tedious if you choose to pursue them, but they are not necessary to complete the game, and can be ignored if desired. However, you are missing a large amount of content if you choose to do this.

[*] Playing with more than one player can quickly become absolute chaos during platforming, as the game has a few key mechanics that all players can control, but need to be precisely handled for successful platforming. Intense coordination can be required to surpass even the simplest of obstacles if playing with friends.
[/list]

[h1]Short Conclusion: Recommended[/h1]

[h1][u]In-Depth Analysis[/u][/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Guacamelee is a beat-em-up first and foremost. It primarily focuses on the combo system, encouraging the player to chain together as many hits as possible for the maximum amount of damage. This is fueled by the combo meter, a bar that shows the player how many times they can use their upgraded combat abilities before having to recharge. This, just like the health bar, is made larger by gathering upgrade pieces scattered across the game. 

Many enemies are coated in a colored shield that requires the player to use the matching ability on them in order to do damage. Multiple enemies can appear in a single area, each with a different shield color, and all shields eventually regenerate if not damaged for a few seconds, meaning Guacamelee expects the player to be a fast strategist and a good brawler. Combos are satisfying to pull off and deal large amounts of damage, helping to secure a kill before moving on to other enemies.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2114577601

The platforming is what you would expect from a platforming game, but gains extra depth with the implementation of the same abilities one would normally use for combos. A jump can be made higher with an uppercut, or longer with a dash. Many times a specific color-coded block requires a specific move to destroy, just like shields. This makes the platforming more enjoyable than the vanilla jump-n-climb every veteran gamer has become accustomed to by now.

Unfortunately, in order to unlock the â€œTrue Endingâ€ of the game, the player must backtrack to reach multiple additional areas that are filled to the absolute brim with pure challenge platforming and combat. Two of them in particular are very, very time consuming and can be a major pain for players that donâ€™t care much about challenge for the sake of challenge. Iâ€™ve been told [u]Guacamelee! Gold[/u] does not have these problems, as it was released before this edition, but as I have not played Gold or the original, I cannot speak on these problems.

 [h1]Story[/h1]
The story is entertaining in execution, but simple in overall plot. You are the hero going to rescue the girl. The player interacts with a wide variety of characters in this quest, some more interesting than others, and nearly all very entertaining to listen to. 
The game is absolutely riddled with comedy and references to other forms of media, making it almost worth playing for the story alone. But this story is merely the glue that holds all the combat and platforming together to form the Guacamelee experience.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
Guacamelee takes inspiration from Day of the Dead culture and Aztec designs to form a pleasing hybrid of rugged, chiseled shapes and decorated displays that I wholly enjoy looking at the entire time I am playing.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2114582753

The design of the game is very angular and sharp in nature, avoiding a lot of curves on important pieces. This strong and stylized form of art helps it to stand out among other games. The visuals are definitely a plus for Guacamelee.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
Punches have impact and abilities give satisfying thumps, but the real winner of audio for Guacamelee is the music. Just like the art, it takes a heavy influence from traditional Mexican music, with a focus on guitars, trumpets, and vocals that are a joy to listen to. Thereâ€™s just something about that combination of instruments and vocals that I canâ€™t seem to get enough of. If you like mariachi music, like me, youâ€™ll like Guacameleeâ€™s music.

[h1]Technical[/h1]
[u]Specs:[/u] GeForce 840m 2GB, 8GB Memory, i7 CPU, Windows 8.1

I had zero problems running Guacamelee at 60fps, 1080p. However unlike most games, I experienced very noticeable and very annoying amounts of screen tearing with V-Sync turned off. Thankfully, the game is easy enough to run that turning on V-Sync had no impact on my ability to play at 60fps.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
While the Metroidvania nature may turn away some prospective gamers that dislike the focus on backtracking, most of the backtracking can be safely ignored if desired, allowing the player to focus solely on the solid combat / platforming gameplay, engaging story and culture-rich atmosphere. While it is perfectly fine solo, beware some gameplay complications if playing with a friend. 

Overall, at $14.99, I would say it is worth the price if you are a fan of the Metroidvania style, but it also goes on sale quite often at 50% or more. It is a competent game worthy of consideration by any player that finds these features exciting.

[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/23741321]Follow our curator page[b] Alexander's Club Curations[/b], if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

La historia es simplona y divertida y el estÃ­lo grÃ¡fico es genial, con una iconografÃ­a mexicana bien lograda (un poco estereotÃ­pica pero muy agradable) llego de guiÃ±os y referencias tanto a la cultura mexicana como a los videojuegos y cultura del internet, Tiene modo de multijugador y obtener todos los coleccionables puede ser desafiante pero justo. Mas que del lado intenso de jugadores experimentados este juego apunta un poco a lo casual, pero sin duda hay algunos retos difÃ­ciles y un poco frustrantes. Lo recomiendo tanto que es uno de los juegos que he regalado en mÃ¡s de una ocasiÃ³n. review:
[h1]EstÃ¡ Bien[/h1]

[b][i]Guacamelee! es un beatÂ´em up estilo metroidvania divertido sobre cultura mexicana que no se me hizo ni muy largo, ni muy cansado, a pesar de tener partes muy tediosas.[/i][/b]

[u]Los personajes[/u] estÃ¡n bien construidos, todos tienen sus razones personales para hacer lo que hacen y personalidades definidas.

La mayorÃ­a de [u]los enemigos[/u] son genÃ©ricos, pero con mÃºltiples variantes, que irÃ¡n apareciendo a medida que la dificultad del juego crece. 

[u]La trama[/u] es una lÃ­nea recta de principio a fin sin giros de vuelta rebuscados. Se sabe hacia dÃ³nde va la historia y como va a terminar es obvio, pero aun asÃ­ da ganas de jugarlo.

[u]La Jugabilidad[/u] es clÃ¡sica de un beatÂ´em up con la excepciÃ³n de que a medida que se progresa en la partida se le van otorgando al luchador â€œhabilidadesâ€ (como escalar, doble salto, volar, etc.) que tambiÃ©n puede utilizarlas como movimientos de peleas.

[u]Los grÃ¡ficos[/u] son cÃ³modos y algo minimalistas ya que no muestran gran cantidad de detalles. Personalmente creo que se ajustan bien al juego y funcionan correctamente resultando agradables.

[u]Este juego[/u] cuenta con un modo New game + y un final alternativo. AdemÃ¡s, aparte de las misiones principales, existen mÃºltiples misiones secundarias para quienes quieran explorar mÃ¡s el mundo.

[u]Los atractivos[/u] principales de este juego son sin lugar a duda las peleas y la mescla con la cultura mexicana.

[i]Es un juego que no lo recomendarÃ­a comprar a mÃ¡s de 100$ (argentinos), sobre todo por lo corta que es la historia, siendo que a mÃ­ me duro menos de 7 horas y no me dejo ganas de seguir jugÃ¡ndolo y completando todas las misiones secundarias.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198128570751', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1942, 'last_played': 1590412754}
review:
Guacamelee is interesting to say the least, going in to this game you might want to be a fan of metroidvanias, a unique art style (enhanced in guac 2) or be a fan of Mexican interpreted games (I don't believe there were many if any Mexican developers or artists working on this game-  correct me if I'm wrong). Anyway onto the pros and cons of buying this game, cause although this is probably one of my favourite games it still had me very conflicted at some points.

PROS
-Cool art style with unique looking characters and creatures, one of my favourites being Alebrije
-Love the soundtrack and unique boss sounds
-Mostly a good level of challenge that isn't frustrating
-Can play as casual and get through the game in about 8+ hours or for achievements, which for me was 32 hours
-People often say the humour is outdated, such as the references through signs but considering the game is older, is still refreshing to see
-Anyone can play, I think some younger kids would also quite like to play with some help from parents or siblings as the game is suited to both younger and older audience
-Can play local co-op
-I like being able to turn into a chicken

CONS
-Flashing lights when you finish a upgrade (this gets worse in guac 2) can become a bit much after playing the game a while
-Furthering my last point- I wouldn't play for long periods at a time as the game is bright
-Definitely wouldn't recommend playing with a key board, if you're going to buy this game, have a controller you can plug in
-I also wouldn't play too long because it can become irritating to play some of the rooms (where enemies spawn and you have to kill them all before you can leave), especially if it involves the red lava which is basically a restart for that room, also those stupid exploding fly's are a bit excessive and pissed me off but its a challenge I guess

Overall I would recommend this game, it's really fun, I love the story and endings. If anyone is trying to chose between Guacamelee and Guacamelee 2, I promise you Guacamelee 1 is better. Not to diss on 2 but it gets impossibly hard to the level of the optional disappearing platform room in Guac 1. Guacamelee has a good balance of difficulty and you definitely won't regret playing it (as long as you have a controller, cause keyboard is just a death wish)

author: {'steamid': '76561198410735612', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1558642266}
review:
Guacamelee! es, en resumen, un muy buen juego plataformero/beat'em up. Aunque se suele englobar tambiÃ©n en juegos del tipo metroidvania, en mi opiniÃ³n destaca mÃ¡s como acciÃ³n, plataformeo y hostias, ya que, por ejemplo, tampoco le recuerdo nada de backtracking (tener que volver a sitios del mapa). Principalmente avanzas sin complicaciones para orientarse ni puzles, repartiendo "caramelos" y, segÃºn vas pasando partes, vas aprendiendo nuevos tipos de golpes.

AÃºn asÃ­, no es un juego sencillo, la dificultad estÃ¡ bien ajustada, y tiene una jugabilidad basada en diferentes golpes/combos muy entretenida y dinÃ¡mica. El control estÃ¡ pulido y es gratificante, como debe ser en un juego de este estilo.

GrÃ¡ficamente y musicalmente estÃ¡ bastante bien, todo en consonancia con su inspiraciÃ³n humorÃ­stico-mejicana con un aire muy fiestero y de jolgorio, muy colorido todo. La historia es sencilla, y una mera excusa para el juego, no es el punto mÃ¡s importante en este juego. El juego tiene su punto de humor y se hace simpÃ¡tico.

En definitiva, un juego muy divertido y recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035100973', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 766, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1590270333}
review:
Disclaimer: My scores/reviews are almost always based on having bought the game at close to the "lowest historical price" on steam at time of purchase.

Quick score: 5/5

Notes:
-Easily one of the best metroidvanias, highly recommend. Would rate it as high as hollow knight personally.

-Normally you have to beat the game to unlock hard mode, but if you are someone who enjoys a challenge, you can enter a code at the menu screen of the game to unlock hard mode to do it on your first playthrough instead. If you are someone that goes for 100% achievements, this will also save you the insane amount of time it would take to replay through the entire game a 2nd time. I was able to beat it on hard mode my first playthrough without too much issue so personally I would recommend it to anyone for their first playthrough. Though be warned, there is no "switching" back to normal mode once you start the playthrough on hard. So don't do it if you aren't prepared to struggle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053280003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1589761329}
review:
Loved it.

Goddamn! The balls to have such an ending! YES! That makes the story so much more meaningful and important. Loved the bonus art.

That's some grade-A gameplay. The variety of moves is baffling and FORCING you to use them depending on the variety of enemies and introducing multi-colored shields... good idea. After a while fights feel like puzzles where you have to figure out how to beat it instead of simply killing the baddies as fast as you can. Some could get frustrating near the end, but this is definitely some well-thought platforming.

It's really incredible to see someone using the Mexican culture like this; hardly anyone acknowledges it even exists. Excuse then, an exclusively Mexican comment about it:

Chale, quÃ© cabrÃ³n estuvo esta madre. Se pasaron de lanza en ciertos vatos; la neta si estuvo pelado ya cerca del final; me agÃ¼itÃ©. Inche Calaca poderosa y luego la escena uno no se la puede brincar. Lo bueno es que con tanto pedo el jueguito dura dura. Al cien, carnal. Estuvo perrÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983671955', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1589112726}
review:
[h1]NO ESPERABA NADA...[/h1]

Y me ha sorprendido muy gratamente el juego. Es un juego de plataformas con toques de metroidvania muy entretenido y que no llega a ser desesperante. La historieta y los personajes tienen su gracia; ademÃ¡s, los escenarios resultan muy vistosos. 

La verdad que creo que todo el mundo puede disfrutar de este juego, me ha costado compeltarlo [b]unas 7 horas[/b] pero no he ido a completar el mapa a 100% ni intentando descubrir todos sus secretos. Seguramente se me haya quedado alguna misiÃ³n secundaria en el tintero. Es un juego recomendable para matar un par de tardes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075403106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1588999040}
review:
Fantastic presentation with a beautifully unique art style, and great music.
One of the best platform games ever.
It is an outright joy to play.
Run through a path with a consistent, engaging art style, and meticulously perfected controls and level design.
Guacamelee is remarkable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198442703421', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1588639772}
review: Guacamelee foi uma surpresa pra mim. Consegui ele gratuito e deixei ele guardado na minha biblioteca por um tempo gigante porque achava que era "sÃ³ mais um joguinho de luta". Fico feliz em dizer que me enganei. Guacamelee tem uma histÃ³ria bem envolvente e engraÃ§ada, com vÃ¡rias referÃªncias Ã  cultura pop que foram muito divertidas de achar. O jogo tem vÃ¡rias combinaÃ§Ãµes de golpes e estratÃ©gias (que me estressou diversas vezes), entÃ£o dÃ¡ pra vocÃª decidir como vocÃª gosta mais de jogar, escolher uma roupa adequada e ir em frente. NÃ£o consegui terminar todas as conquistas por terem desafios incrivelmente difÃ­ceis no jogo, entÃ£o para nÃ£o estragar minha experiÃªncia com ele repetindo o mesmo desafio 999 vezes, decidi terminar por aqui. Recomendo bastante o jogo pra todo mundo que gosta de uma histÃ³ria leve e diferente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030476404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 743, 'playtime_at_review': 2912, 'last_played': 1712270081}
review:
This game is amazing. The aesthetic is novel and interesting. It's a fun take on a Metroidvania that blends a compelling storyline with a BBEG you hate, with a bunch of great comedy. It's also a really interesting celebration on Mexican culture and history. Turns out Lucha Libre is officially recognized by Mexico as part of their cultural heritage, alongside themes of Dia de Los Muertos and pre-colonial civilizations.

Also it's just fun as hell. The inclusion of fighting game grappler mechanics is a cool way to add depth to MV hackandslash, and the polymorph and live-dead world mechanics further the complexity in really challenging ways. 10/10 imo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141361396', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1588375718}
review:
Sem dÃºvida um dos maiores destaques dentre um mar de jogos da mesma categoria, Guacamelee traz ao mesmo tempo vÃ¡rios elementos que consagraram metroidvanias combinado junto com um humor genial,  uma lore muito interessante e vÃ¡rias, vÃ¡rias referencias. O jogo Ã© todo ambientado em tradiÃ§Ãµes mexicanas, tendo como base o famoso 'Dia de los Muertos'. Voce Ã© Juan, um cara normal sem nenhuma particularidade (exceto sonhos quando crianÃ§a), que logo apÃ³s ser morto no ataque Ã  vila acaba ganhando poderes de um verdadeiro Luchador e agora estÃ¡ em busca de resgatar o amor de sua vida.

Guacamelee traz uma jogabilidade muito precisa e satisfatÃ³ria ao jogar, sendo muito menos burocrÃ¡tico e pesado que outros jogos como Ori (nÃ£o estou falando mal de Ori, mas convenhamos que Guacamelee Ã© muito mais solto). Isso sem falar no Multiplayer, que aceita atÃ© 4 jogadores na campanha, coisa que nÃ£o lembro de ter visto em outro Metroidvania (ao menos nos principais).

Recomendo muito esse jogo aos jogadores, principalmente Ã  quem curte esse estilo. Sem dÃºvida um jogo Ã  se adicionar a lista de jogos futuros (mas tem que jogar, porra).

"PerdÃ£o pelos petardos, Amigo."

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 42455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42455, 'last_played': 1587195545}
review:
Guacamelee! is absolutely sublime. Not just because of the horrible pun of its title. Metroidvania with a luchadore is something the gaming industry hasn't seen before (not counting the Strong Bad adventure titles) and it truly is something the gaming world had needed.

The game is absolutely hilarious, has very spot on controls, lots of variety, a simple yet fun combat system, lots to explore, lots of different mechanics and considerable length for an indie title. The art design is unique and the entire game is full of cultural references to Mexican mythology. To myself this was an absolutely refreshing and unique experience, which says a lot considering how many games I've played.

If you ever wanted to play a REAL hero, then the mask donning main protagonist is Guacamelee is absolutely your guy.
Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432363827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1527368610}

Amazing platformer with some very challenging but fun sequences. I liked the humour and the characters. The story is nothing too complicated and thats a good thing for this type of game (but with 2 endings !). The Turbo edition is vastly superior to the gold one so get this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136993256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1237, 'last_played': 1621859052}
review:
I grew up playing NES, Sega Genesis, and DOS platformers and I adore this game. It has all the same charming qualities that my favorite retro games had; it reminds me most of Wizards and Warriors/Ironsword. It's challenging enough to keep you frustrated but it's beatable enough to keep you coming back.

I enjoy the fact that you can explore the maps freely as you advance through the game; the maps don't get locked out once you pass through them. Even after you beat the game, you can continue collecting achievements at your own leisure.

The art and music are unique and beautiful. The characters are funny and endearing. The ONLY negative I could point out about this game is that the Spanish does not seem to have been proofread. Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416439152', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1580020606}
review:
PROS:
-La tematica mexicana es bonita, los escenarios, el lore y los estereotipos.
-Es bonito graficamente.
-La banda sonora esta bien.
-Los poderes son muy creativos.

Contras:
-Los diseÃ±os no me gustan.
-Pelear se vuelve complicado, y no es malo, pero no es tan divertido como para compensar la complejidad del compabte.
-Los escenarios son tan grandes que se sienten vacios, y no me refiero a tamaÃ±o de mapa, si no al tamaÃ±o de las cosas, como los bloques por ejemplo.
-La historia es supeeeeer meh.
-En momentos intenta ser graciosa y la verdad no me causo gracia nunca.

Conclusion:
Pecado criticar un juego no terminado. Aun asi quize dar mi punto de vista, y veo que a todo el mundo le encanta, a lo mejor y el problema soy yo.

Nota:
4/10

review:
Delirio e botte da orbi!

Guacamelee Ã¨ uno dei miei giochi preferiti. L'ho ottenuto gratuitamente, ma anche se l'avessi pagato a prezzo pieno sarei piÃ¹ che soddisfatto. Non ha una storia lunghissima, ma per questo tipo di gioco una main quest lunga servirebbe solo a stancare; i livelli sono davvero intriganti e necessitano di svariati tentativi, ma riuscire a platinarlo da una grandissima soddisfazione. Consigliato se volete una sfida interessante, nonostante gli anni!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079059535', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1586493526}
review:
Joguei em live, para quem quiser conferir o gameplay: https://www.twitch.tv/collections/FlyQ-wg4BBYJvw
Live de jogos variados em: https://twitch.tv/loboshow

Guacamole, como gosto de chamar, Ã© um jogo de pancadaria e plataforma com uma pitada de metroidvania. Nele controlamos o "Luchador", que tem que sair para enfrentar as forÃ§as do mal depois de sua vila ser atacada por seres de outra dimensÃ£o, que no caso Ã© a dos mortos. 

O combate do jogo em si nÃ£o apresenta tanto desafio, a nÃ£o ser os chefes finais, mas no fim se resume a memorizar os golpes deles e esquivar. Acredito que o desafio mesmo seja as partes de plataforma, onde algumas vezes exigem bastante mecÃ¢nicas, nÃ£o sÃ³ pular. 

A histÃ³ria Ã© muito bem contada via animaÃ§Ãµes e diÃ¡logos melhores ainda. Recomendo muito o jogo para quem curte a cultura mexicana e ainda mais a famosa data deles "dia dos mortos" (ou algo assim).

author: {'steamid': '76561198070083619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1619816672}

On regrette cependant que la transformation en poulet ne soit pas plus mise en valeur car en plus dâ€™Ãªtre un sacrÃ© gag, elle vous ouvre bon nombre de passages secrets. Les passages accessibles en cassant des blocs de couleurs correspondant Ã  vos diffÃ©rents coup aux noms ridicules ne sont quâ€™au nombre de quatre : rouge, bleu, vert et jaune donc pas besoin de faire mille aller-retours pour tout obtenir. De la mÃªme faÃ§on que certains passages ne sont accessibles quâ€™en brisant un bloc de couleur correspondant Ã  une technique, certains ennemis sont protÃ©gÃ©s par un bouclier de ces mÃªmes couleurs, vous forÃ§ant donc Ã  les taper avec la dite technique pour pouvoir les tuer. Peu de variÃ©tÃ© parmi les ennemis, mais il nâ€™y a pas besoin de plus vu la durÃ©e de vie. Les boucliers et les monstres Ã©lites, Ã©videmment plus forts, viendront lÃ©gÃ¨rement combler cette lacune. 5 - 6h, câ€™est le temps nÃ©cessaire pour complÃ©ter ce jeu, relativement court. author: {'steamid': '76561198360925988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1585377321}
review: So as an adult man who's never played Metroid or Castlevania, I'm suddenly finding myself getting hooked on Metroidvanias. And to be honest, I wasn't really too sure about Guacamelee when it first popped up on my radar: I thought it was over-hyped and I wasn't really impressed by the combat I saw in the trailers. But then I bought it on sale, and when I realized I could suplex and piledrive my enemies into dust... man I was sold. This was a lot funner than I expected - it basically took what I love about beat-em-ups (punch!, kick!, dodge!, dash!, launch!, grab!, SLAM!!!) and mixed it up with everything I've been enjoying about vanias (big maps, hardcore platforming, secret areas, new skills). Everything else is also pretty great - the art-style is stellar, the humor is silly but endearing, there's a lot of neat little easter eggs to find, and the music was really fun. Hell, there's one track in particular that I can really only describe as Mariachi-Dub. It is glorious. Def recommended, and after I clear some of my backlog I'm definitely getting the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330888468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 507, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1560526983}
review:
A darn silly, flavorful and fun game.
It is at it's core a side scrolling platformer. As the game progresses our hero learns more moves to progress across a pretty large map. There are interesting people to meet and items to purchase, all the beslls and whistles you would expect.
The one real bummer, for me, is that the game is really designed for use with a controller. I tried to play it with key-board controls, and found it to be quite difficult at times. 
That said, if you find this on sale, and enjoy the cartoony world of Lucha Libre, I think you would enjoy this one. Ole!

author: {'steamid': '76561198423528110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1619191772}
review: Great hard!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079516923', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1583459779}
review: Got this game through Humble Monthly and I am really happy I did. This beat-em-up/platformer felt amazing to play, with all the combo's you could perform on the enemies along with all the abilites you unlocked on the way. The level designs were all unique, especially since they all introduced new mechanics, even to the very end level. Beware of the final boss though, compared to the other bosses, he is a pain in the ass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981206810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1584590913}
review:
Fantastic game, excellent platforming, tight controls, visually pleasing, some performance hiccups and no ultrawide support.

A great upgrade from the original game.

Getting 100% is not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141809540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1680984809}
review:
Really enjoyable game, both the platforming elements and combat are really satisfying and have quite a lot of depth to them. The level design also really complements these mechanics most of the time.

The game is open world, but it guides you along the story by gradually giving you abilities that let you get to new areas of the map. You're incentivised to go back to areas you have visited, once you have new abilities, to explore parts that you couldn't previously reach and there is often collectables/upgrades that you can get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326126497', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1584152723}
review: A very satisfying Metroidvania Guacamelee is a very challenging but fair game the game-play can be frustrating at times, but when you over come the challenge the reward you feel is indescribable. The art-style of Guacamelee is very pleasing on the eyes along with the humor and the charm of this game, but one thing i was disappointed in was the sound there are a couple of tracks and unfortunately the characters lack voices.

review: Um otimo jogo de luta em estilo mexicano,Guacamelle conta a historia de Juan um cara normal que Ã© morto por tentar salvar uma "princesa" CLICHE,dai ele vira um lutador que eu acho q ta meio morto pois ve duas dimensoes ;-;.Enfim o jogo em si Ã© otimo,tem varios golpes e lugares dificeis de se encontrar orbes,alem de ter fantasias customizadas,tem uma trilha sonora que parece que ta sendo tocado de um radio de caminhonete de um mexicano que ta atravessando a fronteira,mas isso n interfere no jogo que por si Ã© mt incrivel e para mim teve um tragico final.

review:
Amazing action-platformer with a great OST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018083697', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1583076634}

author: {'steamid': '76561198167325715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1583534907}
review:
Amazing gameplay! A mix of (pretty forgiving) platforming, side-scrolling beat-'em-up and a bit of "metroidvania-ing" (for completionists, kinda easy but nice), all garnished with supreme c-c-c-combo delight!
Seriously, some combos that you can squeeze out of the attacks and specials and jumps and rolls all combined together do look and FEEL extremely good when pulled off!
Oh! It's also full of easter eggs and references to gaming culture, movies... well, mostly nerdy culture...
The mood of the game then - well! It is definitely gonna stick with me for a while... 
Just grab it, it's worth every penny! Even more if it's on discount!

author: {'steamid': '76561198261881798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1666233841}
review:
I absolutely love this game. I got it initially on PS3 when it first came out and now I'm playing again here. 

Same great experience. There's something about the art and the music of it that it's supper soothing and comfy.

The movement is great. The humor is (mostly) hit and the main characters are colorful and very distinctive from one another. 

All in all this is a fun game that will put a smile on your face

I will say tho, once you become used to connecting techniques and dodging  you're practically invincible. Even hard mode and the Infierno challenges will taste like nothing if you learn the flow of combat. It makes it satisfying wipe out an entire room without breaking a sweat, but it unavoidably makes the game kinda boring, more so in your second run

author: {'steamid': '76561198106939391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1582897779}
review:
Man, this Shantae game is good. Wait. This isn't sexy ladies and whipping stuff with your hair! What is this?! Well, it's luchavania! Luchadores? Tequila? Kicking ass? Yes, this is it! But how good is it exactly? Let's explore the ups and downs of the game (+, +/-, -, ?):

+Guacamelee's art style is great. Great use of colours, nice designs.
+The soundtrack and sound effects are great.
+The gameplay is tight. Kicking ass feels so good! Skeletons flying and dying everywhere! Yes!
+All power ups and mechanics work well.
+I love all the characters! Beautiful stuff, great monologues!
+This game can definitely make you laugh out loud.
+/-The story is almost interesting. I kept zoning out from time to time. When it comes to the story, the writing could've been better. It's a telenovela, right?
+/-The dungeon design is okay. Going back and forth can suck a lot. But, you know, fast travelling is well done and it makes this less of a problem.
+/-The game is quite short. If you're a speedrunner, you might like this a lot.
-Why's there so much emptiness? At times, I felt like something was missing from the game or maybe the levels could have been designed better.
-The map sucks. Yes, you can see almost everything you need to but... Zooming out? Nah, why'd you need that? The again, zoom iiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiin! Yeah that's useful! *Hotel Mario voice: "No"*
-The boss fights are way too easy. I had more trouble with regular enemies and platforming than any of the bosses.
-I just finished my first playthrough and I have to say, I don't feel the game. This is one of those games that is fun to play, but you'll forget it soon.
? Is this the best version of the game? I've heard that Gold Edition is better. I feel I can review this version better after playing that one.

Guacamelee STC Edition is fun, but it's missing stuff, especially something that would make it really stand out. Great artwork and theme alone just isn't enough for me. For you, this might be a treat, but to me, this game feels similar to Shantae: Half-Genie Hero; It's a good, but flawed game and it is easy to forget. I'll play more of this game and update my review sometime in the future. Currently, I'd give this game a 7,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1558115161}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#189 out of 555)... it's time for Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition.

I'm not sure exactly why this "Super Turbo Championship Edition" needs to exist as a separate listing on Steam, especially when the original version of the game had already been upgraded to "Gold Edition." In other cases I'd assume it was done to wipe away all of the negative Steam reviews and start over with a fresh slate (as usually tends to be the case) but my understanding is that most everyone loves Guacamelee. And with good reason--it's one of the best and most refreshing metroidvanias in years.

Which I guess makes my opinion on the game pretty obvious: I love Guacamelee. It's got a snazzy art style, catchy music, fun characters, a world that's fun to explore, and really solid combat mechanics that are only very rarely frustratingly difficulty (usually when they combine combat with platforming). The only real complaint I have is that the game supports two-player co-op, and as part of that has a secondary protagonist: a female luchador. So far so good--the problem? Even though you can play the game as the other character, the story is still written with Juan as the hero: it would have been much more fun if the game reacted to the player character, using the appropriate nouns and pronouns and so on. Oh well: plenty of other games have missed better opportunities, so I suppose I shouldn't be too harsh here.

So, yeah: it's a brilliant, imaginative metroidvania with a unique setting and confident humor. If you're fond of the genre, it's most definitely worth your time.

Note: also played on Sony Playstation 4, Sony Playstation Vita and Nintendo Switch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197417975', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1675449150}
review: Que decir, el genero Metrid-Vania me encanta y este es un muy buen juego, buenos graficos, espectacular banda sonora, una buena historia con varios finales y muchas referencias tanto a otros videojuegos como a la cultura mexicana, la jugabilidad es bastante buena con un sistema de combate a base de combos como en un juego de lucha con ataques normales y ataques especiales, el plataformeo esta muy bueno tiene su dificultad y me gusta como implementaron las habilidades muy recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561197991769067', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1689517956}
review: Superfrantic but real fun to play! Ok I'm not used to this kind of game, but Guacamelee is a nice addition to any  library. The cartoonish graphics works really well, the soundtrack is amazing and by the end of the gime I will surely find my fingers tied in knots!

review: So, I haven't played this for very long, but I can already tell it's a good game. It's really funny and fast paced, and has a definitve style of its own. If you're considering getting it, do it. It's a fun light game that can be played with up to 4 people, but use controllers.

review: So, I haven't played this for very long, and I didn't think it was going to be very good, but this game changed my opinion, and I can already tell it's a good game. It's really funny and fast paced, and has a definitve style of its own. If you're considering getting it, do it. It's a fun light game that can be played with up to 4 people, but use controllers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011368344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1613258496}
review:
An incredible, incredible game. 
One of the most original and outstanding titles I've ever played. 


Several challenges are an exercise in frustration, and sometimes the control won't do exactly what you need, but the overabundance of secrets will keep you searching for everything.
Easier than Super Meat Boy, harder than Ori and the Blind Forest.

And the combat is AWESOME, the highlight of this title.
It never gets old and it feels great, but you'll curse a lot during the process. 

Graphics + Design = 8.5 /10
Music +SFX = 8.5/10
Control = 8.0/10 

A Must-Buy for Metroidvania enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198914107634', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1579356586}
review:
[quote]THRASH: Looks are deceiving: It focuses on being a tricky platformer & puzzle so much that it forgets that it's a metroidvania & why it was created in the first place: to punch, kill, and have fun.[url=store.steampowered.com/curator/36549724-GEM-or-THRASH/] Click here to follow the curator: GEM or THRASH[/url][/quote]
[u]Full review:[/u]
Guacamalee! loses interest in itself right after its first few minutes. Its story becomes irrelevant, as its whole focus shifts from interacting with people, exploring and punching stuff to being a trickster platformer and a mediocre puzzle. 

Metroidvania action is what you were supposed to get by default, but it's actually something you get to experience as a reward after completing unnecessary objectives and solving inessential, redundant puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083889544', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1579440356}
review:
Semplicemente Stupendo.
Guacamelee! Ã¨ una vera perla videoludica. Non avevo mai sentito parlare di questa serie. Ricevuto insieme ad un altro acquisto e giocato tanto per curiositÃ . Bene mi sono ricreduto. Altro che gioco di serie B!
Divertente , frenetico e impegnativo. Storia semplice ma intrattenente. Spettacolari i dialoghi sempre maliziosi e pieni di battute. Tema molto interessante per quanto riguarda il Folklore messicano. Level design e grafica interessante in quanto disegnata a mano e bidimensionale, che regalano ogni tanto spettacoli grafici. Soundtrack da dipendenza. Adoro questo gioco e ho comprato subito il seguito. Lo consiglio vivamente, rigiocabilissimo sia da soli che in co-op fino a 4 giocatori anche in locale.
Voto 9/10

review: Sempre que inicio esses â€œminis-reviewsâ€, tento encontrar uma frase que defina bem o jogo que eu terminei. Para Guacamelee vou ser bem piegas. NÃ£o que eu jÃ¡ nÃ£o tenha sido extremamente piegas anteriormente, mas fazer o que nÃ©?! Eu amo joguinhos. Guacamelee Ã© aquele tipo de jogo que nÃ£o tem medo de ser jogoâ€¦ Eu sei, eu sei, vocÃª deve estar se perguntando: â€œqual o jogo que tem medo de ser jogo?â€ hehehe, vou te explicar. Sabe aquele jogo que a cada fase que vocÃª passa, nÃ£o dÃ¡ vontade de parar? Sabe quando vocÃª fala para si mesmo: â€œEu vou jogar por uma hora e jÃ¡ vou dormirâ€, e quando vocÃª percebe o dia jÃ¡ estÃ¡ amanhecendo?! Ã‰ esse o sentimento que o Guacamelee passa. Por mais que ele seja um jogo que necessita de um jogador um pouco experiente nesse mudinho dos â€œvideogamesâ€ para pegar todas as referÃªncias e escolhas que a equipe de desenvolvimento teve, eu vejo o mesmo com uma curva de aprendizagem tÃ£o natural que mesmo vocÃª que nunca jogou um Metroidvania vai conseguir ter esse sentimento. Ele tem tudo que um bom jogo nesse estilo tem que ter: habilidades para upgradear, poderes para acessar uma certa Ã¡rea, inimigos que evoluem conforme o progresso do jogo, Ã¡reas secretasâ€¦ Esses e muitos outros aspectos. Eu diria que Ã© um jogo obrigatÃ³rio para quem gosta do estilo Metroidvania/plataforma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265296868', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1578845659}
review:
Carlos Calaca has kidnapped El Presidente's Daughter, and he plans to sacrifice her in order to merge the World of the Living with the World of the Dead.

Juan Aguacate, an agave farmer who stumbles upon a Legendary Luchador mask, must find the strength and courage to become the Hero he's always dreamed of being and put a stop to this.

Guacamelee! is a Metroidvania-style action-platformer set in a magical world inspired by traditional Mexican culture and folklore. The game features melee combat, parallel dimensions and same-screen co-op. The original Guacamelee! received wide critical acclaim and was a finalist for both IndieCade and the Independent Games Festival's Excellence in Visual Art award.
Key Features
Non-Stop Fighting Action. An extensive move list, advanced combo engine, and anti-gravity grabs
Multi-dimensional Platforming. Instantly swap between the Worlds of Living and Dead to traverse impossible terrain
Combat moves double as movement, uniting platforming and fighting in a way never seen before
Diverse, detailed world containing lively towns, dark forests, flowery canals and fiery volcanoes
Drop in/out 4-Player local co-operative play, featuring independent dimension swapping
Multiple boss characters (each with unique back stories), wide range of foes, and elite-class enemies
Spectacular player abilities: The Rooster Uppercut, Frog Slam, and â€œIntensoâ€ turbo-combat mode
Create new custom costumes and share these with others via Steam Workshop
Steam leaderboards, achievements and trading cards, support for multiple save slots, persistent cross-save-game costume unlocks
Chickens. Lots and lots of chickens.

*** Please note that the â€˜Super Turbo Championship Editionâ€™ of Guacamelee! is an updated version of the previously-released Guacamelee! Gold Edition. ***

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1578661007}
review: [b]Guacamelee[/b] features a rather interesting mix of metroidvania and beat 'em up genres. Absolutely stellar artwork and music, fun gameplay mechanics. On the downside it can get pretty repetitive at times, especially since the difficulty is so casual (very generous dodge roll, many ways to regenerate health, very easy to string combos) and the playtime is padded by very similar challenges (e.g. beat 20 enemies in this room for the doors to open). Don't expect any meaningful exploration, the game is almost entirely linear and you have a quest marker telling you where to go and what to do. Still, I enjoyed my time with the game. If you're running out of metroidvanias and/or 2D action platformers to play, then this is definitely worth picking up.

I also appreciated that when you beat the game without the true ending it will restart you just before the final boss fight on your save so you can go back and get the pieces to complete the game instead of making you play through it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836490647', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1647072327}
review: Guacamelee STCE is a brilliant platform game with unique combat system. The color and art style is very vibrant. Story is  captivating, with funny characters and comic references from other video games. Music is really pleasing. talking about combat system, you can perform long combos and there are various power-ups, abilities and costumes(many costumes have unique and rewarding quirks) to unlock, which makes it more fun and immersive. Its always fun to perform bigger combos. It is an overall great game i enjoyed from start to end. but game's UI could have used some improvement, like including retry button, it's map can be sometimes hard to understand while grinding and looking for treasure and completing achievements. But that doesnt spoil the overall experience that guacamelee offers. it is great game i enjoyed very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271070442', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1577643681}
review:
[h1] Canta y no llores, porque cantando se alegran cielito lindo los corazones [/h1]

Uno de los mejores metroidvanias con su toque mexicano que he jugado en mi vida.

[h1]Historia:[/h1]
Guacamelee nos presenta la historia de Juan, un tipico pueblerino el cual lleva una vida tranquila trabajando cuando por azares del destino es llamado para luchar contra el ejercito de esqueletos que se han levantado para unir el mundo de los vivos y los muertos dependiendo de ti de que esto suceda.


[h1] Jugabilidad: [/h1]
El combate es uno de los aspectos mÃ¡s importantes de Guacamelee, ya que nos tendremos que abrir paso por varios tipos de enemigos los cuales podemos machacar con nuestros combos a disposiciÃ³n lo que lo hace mÃ¡s interesante.

Una de las mecÃ¡nicas interesantes es el cambio de mundo, con lo cual Juan puede alternar entre el mundo de los vivos y los muertos, ya que cada secciÃ³n o pueblo cambia segÃºn el mundo en el que estamos se convierte en una gran tarea explorar todos estos rincones.

Por otro lado muchas partes del mapa cuentan con escondrijos o pasadizos ocultos a los cuales podemos acceder con varios superpoderes lo cual lo hace bastante rejugable por si queremos hacernos con todos los objetos y ademÃ¡s del [spoiler] final oculto. [/spoiler]

AdemÃ¡s del combate, las plataformas, puzzles y exploraciÃ³n que nos encontramos, llegando a ciertos pueblos podemos decidir si queremos ayudar o no a algunos de sus habitantes pero recuerda que estos podrÃ­an tener cierta recompensa buena. 

[h1] GrÃ¡ficos: [/h1]
Es un plataformero en dos dimensiones que cuenta con fondos interactivos que van cambiando dependiendo de la zona de donde nos encontremos y conforme vamos avanzando se nos muestran mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s detalles.

[h1] Banda sonora: [/h1]
Al estar ambientado en MÃ©xico Guacamelee ofrece una banda sonora bastante divertida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133323230', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1577746873}
review:
Guacamelee ist ein wirklich schÃ¶n gestaltetes kurzweiliges aber auf keinen Fall langweiliges jump`n run/ beatÂ´em up spiel. Dabei kann man mit bis zu 4 Spielern Ã¼ber einen Splitscreen spielen, oder es auch ohne grÃ¶ÃŸere Probleme alleine durchspielen, wobei man an Manchen Stellen etwas Geduld benÃ¶tigt, es sei denn man ist mit dem Genre schon sehr vertraut. Man benÃ¶tigt ca 10 Stunden zum durchspielen, wenn man alle Errungenschaften haben mÃ¶chte braucht man ca. 20 Stunden, wobei das Spiel nicht mal richtig langweilig wird. Ein Controller ist dabei allerdings Pflicht. Man kann auch Ã¼ber die Tastatur spielen, die Kombos, die man im Spiel ausfÃ¼hren muss werden dadurch allerdings teils unschaffbar. Die Grafik ist meiner Meinung nach echt schÃ¶n, wobei das sicherlich geschmackssache ist. Dabei lÃ¤uft es auch ohne Probleme in 4k auf einer gtx 1650.
Allem in allem wÃ¼rde ich eine totale Kaufempfehlung geben, wenn man nicht zu schnell frustriert ist oder wenn man so ein Genre sowieso schon mag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040882512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1564610124}
review:
Mr. Act and I sat down to play this together and after about 30 minutes he turned to me and said, â€œThis is a terrible game.â€ He was right. He has continued, over the past few days, to intermittently remind me that he hated this game, which frankly is as passionate as Iâ€™ve ever seen him about a piece of media.

Ugh, I donâ€™t even know where to start. Probably the worst thing was the level design. The levels were confusing, obtuse, and recursive. Neither of us had any idea where we were or where we had to go in the dungeon at any point, and using the minimap didnâ€™t even help. The puzzles were unintuitive and uninteresting. The way the screen suddenly flashed as you moved from room to room instead of a smooth transition was jarring and disorienting. The button-mashy combat was repetitive and unfun, and button combos were infuriatingly unreliable. The whole thing was a chore to experience.

The game was also stupidly misogynistic. The three women are a) the damsel in distress, about whom everyone says itâ€™s sad sheâ€™s in distress because sheâ€™s hot; b) the non-story woman second-player character whose tits bounce around; and c) the evil woman who speaks in double entendres and starts freaking out because sheâ€™s omgsojealous of the bad guy capturing a hot woman, because women, so emotional. All the male characters, including townies, do nothing but talk about screwing women. Like, the mentor guy who gives you powers introduces himself by talking about fucking your mom and then like, threatens to have sex with her when he thinks youâ€™re slacking off? Itâ€™s so goddamn weird. I am also HIGHLY suspicious of three guys named Chris Harvey, Ryan MacLean and Graham Smith writing Mexican people as lecherous assholes. (It also makes the obsession with womenâ€™s bodies feel like a fetish thing.) Iâ€™m suspicious of them writing a game based on Mexican culture in general, but honestly I couldnâ€™t even get far enough into it to complain about that.

And this is beside the point but also indicative of the amount of thought it feels like was put into this game in general: the title has nothing to do with fucking anything. This is one of those once-in-a-lifetime-sentences: This game is completely unrelated to guacamole. They just chose a random ~Mexican~ thing and made a stupid portmanteau out of it. They didnâ€™t bother to find an actual word in Spanish and make a clever pun, they just went HUR HUR YOU CAN GET GUACAMOLE AT MEXICAN RESTAURANTS SO LETâ€™S CALL OUR GAME THAT.

Iâ€™d be very curious to know if there are any games out there about Mexican/South American culture by a Latinx team/head writer/etc., because this seems like a cultural moment in which that kind of art is super necessary, but this is very very much not that game. (Update: Aritana and the Harpyâ€™s Feather has been on my list for a while, canâ€™t believe I forgot about it. Also, some googling has led me to Mulaka and not much else.)

review: Solid metroidvania type game. Certainly has some heavy button mashing scenarios and definitely recommend a controller (I used a PS4 controller). Maps make going back through previous levels more straight forward instead of trial and error finding stuff. Easy to sit down and play a few sections if your play time is limited. Overall recommended!

review: C'est le genre de jeu oÃ¹ pour moi y'a pas de demie mesures, soit on accroche direct, soit c'est pas la peine d'y passer des plombes.. C'est le deuxiÃ¨me cas pour ce jeu (en tout cas pour moi). Ã‡a fait penser Ã  Hollow Knight, le genre de jeu oÃ¹ il faut faire des trucs, mais tu sais pas pourquoi alors t'y va mais Ã§a devient ennuyeux trÃ¨s vite. Car moi qui ai fais tous les Castlevania, tout les Metroid, tous les Megaman, du coup niveau plateforme y'a rien de nouveaux si ce n'est que c'est super beau faut le dire. Mais on s'ennuis. On sait pas pourquoi on avance, y'a pas de challenge il faut avancer c'est tout. Pourtant y'en a des turies en plateformes rÃ©cemment, comme The messenger qui est sublime, ou Battleblocks theather, oÃ¹ tu joue pour le challenge, pour terminer le niveau. Dans Guacamelee tu erres sans but ou tu le comprends pas, et c'est chiant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138207476', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1561, 'last_played': 1577082467}
review:
E aqui estou eu, as 5 da manhÃ£, escrevendo essa anÃ¡lise antes de dormir. Ã‰ um jogo que me surpreendeu muito de inÃ­cio, por ter conseguido de graÃ§a. Fui testar para ver como Ã© e que jogo!

Guacamelee Ã© um jogo no estilo Metroidvania, ambientado na Lucha Libre Mexicana e todo o seu folclore, sobre a histÃ³ria de Juan, um rapaz que nÃ£o seria um bom luchador, mas apÃ³s a filha do presidente ser raptada por um morto-vivo, na qual ele Ã© apaixonado, ele acaba sendo morto pelo mesmo, com o espÃ­rito da mÃ¡scara o chamando para reencarnar como um mascarado. 

Seria um enredo simples de Mario e Princesa Peach que dÃ¡ certo, porÃ©m dÃ¡ pra ver que a histÃ³ria, mesmo mais simples, foi pensada com carinho. AlÃ©m da histÃ³ria, a jogabilidade Ã© o ponto principal. Ele Ã© feito para joystick e sÃ£o controles fÃ¡ceis e intuitivos, porÃ©m a combinaÃ§Ã£o de golpes podem gerar combos cabulosos. Lembrando que o game pode ir atÃ© 4 pessoas, com funÃ§Ã£o de Remote Play tambÃ©m, el alguÃ©m da sua lista jogar contigo.

Nesse game dÃ¡ para ver referÃªncias de outros games tambÃ©m, inclusive o clÃ¡ssico "sua princesa estÃ¡ em outro castelo" Ã© mencionado, fora imagens de Grim Fandango, Detona Ralph, Minecraft e, principalmente, Castle Crashers, que Ã© o que mais me lembra esse game em seus combos. AtÃ© mesmo os poderes ficam em estÃ¡tuas semelhantes a Metroid. 

Eu que nÃ£o sou super fÃ£ de metroidvania adorei esse game, pois a ambientaÃ§Ã£o e o fato de voltar aos mapas novamente, para desbloquear segredos, itens de melhoria e colecionÃ¡veis, nÃ£o fica tÃ£o difÃ­cil, sentindo que Ã© um mapa super complexo e que vai ser perder com facilidade, um ponto positivo do level design. 

A trilha sonora Ã© bem legal, ambientada, com instrumentos tÃ­picos mexicanos, deixando o jogo com uma identidade Ãºnica. 

AlÃ©m de tudo isso, ele Ã© bem desafiador. A maioria das fases sÃ£o intuitivas, mas tem algumas fases, principalmente as secretas, que precisa de paciÃªncia, pois sÃ£o complicadas e atÃ© memorizadas, no estilo Megaman, porÃ©m Ã© possÃ­vel passar por todas elas. 

Minha dica Ã© jogar da forma que a trama principal segue, atÃ© desbloquear todos os poderes, para, assim, desbloquear os mapas, pegar os colecionÃ¡veis, fazer os desafios da caverna e de el infierno (que Ã© uma das partes mais difÃ­ceis) e atÃ© encontrar itens secretos de um novo final para o jogo.

De um game que nÃ£o fazia ideia de seu potencial para um dos meus favoritos da minha conta. RecomendadÃ­ssmo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198795627031', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1576849578}
review: this game offers a very fun experience. You play as a luchador going through several obstacles to save el presidente's daughter. In this you dont start off feeling very strong but by the end when you have all your upgrades, it gets amazing to control your character. It's mostly melee combat, hence the word melee in the title. You get to fight off different variations of skeletal monsters and it gets really crazy. The game runs amazingly too, the artstyle is very well done and overall: definite must-play if you're into 2d melee games

author: {'steamid': '76561198880508565', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1616261846}

author: {'steamid': '76561198158905982', 'num_games_owned': 10694, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1576801416}
review:
Se me hace que el mercado esta saturadicimo de metroidvanias , pero aun asi llega estos luchadores mexicanos que se hacen un zarpado lugar en medio de todo y encima, se hacen destacar, lindos colorcitos que se te meten en la retina quedando todo bonito y lo beat em up esta muy bien logrado con un montonazo de combos.

Bocha de nachos, luchadores grandotes todo transpirados cagando a trompadas a cualquier esqueleto que se meta enfrente, y muchos pollos metele que ta bueno

author: {'steamid': '76561198053201135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1579328533}
review:
This is an amazing game. I haven't beaten it yet, but I'm having a GREAT time getting there. The music is cool, the writing is funny, and the controls are spot on. My only negative so far is that the combos are limited and the soundtrack could use a few more songs.

All in all, though, Guacamelee is worth your time. So far, so good.

review: I loved this game platforming was wonderful the art direction is very tasty, the only thing Im sad about is that there is no online co-op I dont have any friends to couch co-op with (or they just are busy rather or dont want to) and It would be a blast to load this game up and play online with someone. The sequel doesnt have it either, its a very missed opportunity for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293425713', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1576443577}
review:
EDIT: I can't delete any of my saves so fortunately I won't be able to play again this crap.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
After getting 100% of achievemnts and finishing it, I must say: not funny, nor pleasant.

If isn't free, don't buy it. If is free, play something else. Maybe minesweeper, it's more exciting.

- Isn't a fighting game, is a jump-avoid attacks and smashing-keyboard game.
- The AI is so stupid that always follow the same path. Most fights will be like jump-jump-jump, wait for the enemy to stop attacking, then punch him once. Repeat that.
- There are combos but you need to go further with the story to unlock special moves, and probably you will do the same attacks to everyone because some of them can escape combos for no real reason. 
- Exploring the map is lame. They give you one move that lets you fly left and right across the screen, and one that lets you run up almost any wall. You will need to figure "how" to go somewhere and not "where" to go. It's not discovering the map, it's "they wan't you to go there".

author: {'steamid': '76561198176964233', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1575491508}
review:
Un juego que me llamo la atencion por su tematica y su precio accesible (en descuento), al principio no me convencia, sentia que el combate era un poco simple y las zonas de plataforma muy faciles, pero conforme vas avanzando en el juego el combate empieza hacerse mas entretenido y hasta cierto punto un poco dificil, y el plataformeo uff, se sentia muy dinamico, y esto es gracias a los combos simples pero fantasticos de hacer. Ademas de que puede ser rejugado con una dificultad mayor.
El unico problema que le veo son los controles (en teclado) ya que pueden ser un poco dificiles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090287532', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1574735478}
review:
This game has a very strong foundation. It's so strong that it almost became one of my favourite Metroid-vania games of all time. Unfortunately, the game doesn't build upon this foundation to any significant degree. In fact, it actually detracts from it and therefore ends up just being a great game rather than a fucking awesome game.

The foundation of this game is very simple. You have your 3 hit attack combo. When you hit enemies with your attacks enough time, you can "grapple" them. This grapple has 3 functions:
	â€¢ AOE attack: After you grapple an enemy, you can throw an enemy in any direction. When thrown, the enemy will knock down any other enemies in the way.
	â€¢ Attack reset: Right after you throw an enemy, you can repeat your 3 hit attack combo. Surprise surprise, most enemies can be grappled after 3 hits.
	â€¢ Invulnerability: While you're grappling an enemy, you're invulnerable to any damage. This allows you to dodge attacks and carefully aim enemies to fly in the direction you want them to.

Because of how useful the grapple is, the developers have been able to create a combo focused system witch just 2 attacks (3 hit combo and grapple). Simple and effective.

As you progress in the game, the combat slowly gets built upon using special moves. These special moves are basically heavy attacks that attack in a certain direction (up, down, left/right, stationary). These special moves ALSO reset your attacks. This is very useful for big enemies that can't be grappled. So far so good. You can use grapples to take on multiple small enemies and special moves to take on large enemies.

I thought the combat would progress to link all of these attacks together so that you would be doing really long combos while fighting many enemies all at once. That would've been really coolâ€¦.. But unfortunately the enemy design stops this from happening. The small enemies' health pool is too small, so they die in like 2 combos (e.g. 3x attack --> special move ---> 3x attack = dead enemy). You can't do a long ass combo on an enemy that dies so quickly. The big enemies' don't get stunned, and they attack in the time it takes you to do 2 combos. Therefore, unless you want to take damage, you're forced to dodge and restart your combo. 

While the above is limiting, the late-game enemies are the worst. This is where the foundation of the game starts deteriorating. Late-game enemies, including bosses, automatically dodge after taking a certain # of hits in the MIDDLE of your combo. This was a really bad design decision. Note that it's the # of hits, not the damage. Therefore, combat against these enemies is all about spamming your special moves since they do the most damage per hit.  You almost never want to use your regular attacks OR grapple and so combat is actually more boring in the late game compared to the early to mid-game. Keep in mind that special moves take energy, so you'll be spamming your special moves, waiting until your energy recharges, and repeat the process.

To be fair, combat definitely becomes more challenging as the game progresses. This is because of the way fights are designed. You're not really fighting enemies 1 on 1 as you move throughout the world like in most Metroid-vania games. Instead, most fights happen in square arenas (e.g. you can be exploring and then walls appear to the left and right of you. Enemies start spawning in and you can't leave until you beat all the enemies). These arenas can have various hazards and multiple enemies can spawn in an arena, forcing you to take on multiple enemies while being wary of your surroundings. Furthermore, late game enemies have "shields", which require a very specific special move in order to break the shield. Late game enemies also have some attacks that can't be dodged, forcing you to double-jump/wall jump over them. So while YOUR attacks get more limited (i.e. you're just spamming super moves rather and not normal attacking and grappling), the enemies' attacks and defenses get more varied and interesting. I died multiple times on certain groups of enemies and got a great feeling of achievement when I beat them.

There's only 5 bosses in the game, but they're all very distinct from each other and require mastering their unique attacks. I particularly liked this boss that's 3 skeletons combined into 1. In the second phase, each skeleton covers a portion of the screen (1 in the top, 1 in the center, and 1 at the bottom). They attack with laser beams that can't be dodged, and always attack 2 at a time. In order to dodge them, you need to use your super moves to stay in the 1 portion of the screen that the skeleton is not attacking. This was a great way to make "spamming super moves" an interesting affair and I wish all of the bosses and enemies made spamming super moves as interesting as this. 

While the combat gets slightly stale near the end, thankfully the platforming stays engaging throughout the game. This is some of the best platforming I've seen in any 2-D game. Your character can wall jump and double-jump. Also, the special moves are worked into the platforming since the move that makes you attack up is effectively another jump, and the move that makes you go left/right is crucial for certain platforming sections. Furthermore, your character can dimension swap between 2 dimensions. In 1 dimension there are certain obstacles/platforms while in another dimension they're different. Swapping between these dimension quickly when platforming is crucial to succeeding, and it made the platforming sections so satisfying to beat.

The progression system is well done. Beating enemies awards you currency which you can use to buy stuff at checkpoints. You can buy health ups, energy ups, costumes, etcâ€¦ You can also find health ups and energy ups in chests while exploring. There are a LOT of chests to scattered throughout the world, so it's always rewarding to go off the beaten path and explore. So you're rewarded for adventuring, so that's fun.

There's a story that's fairly typical. A villain kidnaps a girl and you as the main hero have to save her. What's not so typical are the characters themselves and their dialogue. This game doesn't take itself too seriously and the characters can be genuinely hilarious sometimes. They have unique personalities and there's a lot of pop culture references. There's a scene straight from Star Wars in one scene and I laughed out loud when I saw it. 

Overall, this is a great game with a very strong early game. It's unfortunate that the late game was not as engaging, but what's here is still a great package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296503876', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1574823954}
review:
Pros:
-You're a Luchador
-Easter Eggs... tons of Easter Eggs
-Easy to understand mechanics
-Story isn't too deep, very linear and a wee bit predictable, but you will get immersed (well I did) and you will still get some feels.
-You're a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing Luchador!

Cons:
-Unforgiving, like a good old 80-90's game: a few (or one) false move can destroy you or impede your progress - luckily this is still a modern day game, so they threw you a bone: infinite lives - when you die: you respawn at a checkpoint, your progress beyond the checkpoint is lost, but that's it. no "X4 lives left". -whew.
-Uncomfortable key mappings (this is for gamepad) that cannot be changed. Paired with the former cons, this makes the game more frustrating than it should.

9/10; not giving 'em a 10 not untill they fix the controller problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972444090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1574645677}
review: Great game, highly recommended.  The art style is gorgeous, and creates some really memorable visuals.  The Metroid inspired (right down to upgrades via Chozo statue) gameplay rarely falters, the level design is inspired.  Some things fell flat for me - the humor was a little too meme-y, some of the difficulty spikes were outrageous - but never enough to really dampen the overall experience.  From the moment I started playing, I couldn't stop until the game was finished, and I immediately bought the second one.  Anyone with fond memories of Super Metroid who hasn't checked this out already, should do so.

review:
Metroidvania que en teorÃ­a hace todo bien pero se queda corto y aburre.

El arte, sonido, movimientos del personaje, todo en general es muy bueno pero... el juego en sÃ­ es blando, los npcs dan todos igual, las ciudades si bien tienen distintas caracterÃ­sticas no se sienten con personalidad, los enemigos son muy poco variados, el juego es fÃ¡cil (casi un paseo, no hay desafÃ­o ni en batalla ni en plataformas).

Destaco la infinita cantidad de referencias y tributos a juegos como Super Mario Bros (el de NES), Castle Crashers, Super Metroid, etc.

Para resumirlo: a pesar de estar tÃ©cnicamente todo ok se queda ahÃ­ en "ok" y para mi no vale la pena el tiempo. No es malo pero hay muchos mejores juegos de este estilo/gÃ©nero (de todas las Ã©pocas) en el que yo creo que es mejor invertir el tiempo.

review: This is an exceptionally well-made game, with great controls, platforming and combat mechanics, and wonderful humor. Well worth the time and money to invest. Also, if you're not a completionist, the game can be completed in less than 4 hours, which makes it a great game for people with very little time to dedicate to games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046261756', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1574461322}
review: It's great fun to play with a friend using the new Remote Play feature. The gameplay is simple yet fun, the art style looks very nice, the music is a great fit for the setting and the overall characters and interactions are interesting and memorable. There are a lot of subtle references to other games too, and it's pretty clear that this game was a passion project for the dev team. I'd say the game is well worth it even at full price, but on sale it's just a steal. Grab it if you've got a buddy to play with.

review: Aunque lleve tiempo de estrenado este juego, definitivamente se recomiendo mucho a quien busque un 'metroidvania' bien estructurado, pero que incluya retos dentro del juego que requieran su respectiva habilidad y maestrÃ­a en los controles. Ya sea que se juegue en cooperativo, o solitario; solo la historia, o en estilo "complecionista"; este tÃ­tulo ofrece de forma funcional el estilo de reto y juego que se busca. En cuanto al arte, como Mexicano admito que se nota una clara inspiraciÃ³n por parte del creador, aunque a ratos sÃ­ caen en cierto estereotipo. AÃºn asÃ­ no es ofensivo y, por el contrario, crearon un mundo colorido que se disfruta.

review:
Art style, music, references to other games, battle variety, pacing, abilities, dialogue, bosses, environment design, colors, cultural references, characters, all A/A+ It took me way too long to pick this game up. 

The only flaws: The game is too short. It has a terrible title! I always thought it was some kind of brawler. Lo and behold, it's an extremely pleasing metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093222732', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1573963571}
review:
game's gud
Fun metroidvania beat 'em up, combat feels tight and responsive, overworld is pretty big. Main quest isn't very long, but it's not too short either. Movement upgrades aren't terribly unique, but they're fun to use nonetheless, and along with the world switching mechanic is surprisingly well integrated into both combat and exploration. Props to the writing, humor's pretty good, and even when it didn't have me laughing, it'd get a chuckle or a smirk out of me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088611852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1685465586}
review:
Got this game in one of those G2A random key bundles, and I have to say I'm quite happy with this one. Its a solid platformer with an awesome Dia De Los Muertos flair. It looks great, the combat is simple to grasp, and the music is very fun. If you dont know what Dia de los muertos is, just quickly watch Pixar's Coco for a quick introduction. Its a lot more fun if you know what the story behind the holiday is. 

Definitely a fun game.

review:

Tem umas coisinhas extras que os NPC's vÃ£o falando caso vocÃª interaja com eles mas nada de mais, basicamente uma historia para tapar buraco e nÃ£o parecer vazio.

Trilha Sonora: [Simples, porem legal e nÃ£o enjoativa]
Bem essa parte nÃ£o sei bem explicar, nÃ£o Ã© algo marcante nem muito bom, mas vocÃª nÃ£o se enjoa de ficar ouvindo a musica desse jogo, basicamente uma ou duas musicas para cada cenÃ¡rio, uma musiquinha diferente para eventos diferente coisa padrÃ£o.

Bem, esse nÃ£o Ã© um jogo difÃ­cil entÃ£o nÃ£o espere muitos desafios, mas ainda sim Ã© divertido, as boss Battles por exemplo conseguem apresentar volta e meia mecanicas interessantes que podem fazer vocÃª morrer uma boa quantidade de vezes atÃ© vocÃª pegar a manha.

- Interface: [Simples a quase Nula]
