author: {'steamid': '76561198099231050', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1573580057}
review:
J'ai eu ce jeu au moment ou il Ã©tait gratuit sur Steam, je n'y ai pas jouÃ© tout de suite parce que je croyais que ce serait un jeu de baston en coop, mais je me trompais totalement ! 

C'est un trÃ¨s bon jeu de plateforme-action ! Je suis assez fan des jeux de plateformes avec beaucoup d'objets cachÃ©s permettant d'amÃ©liorer ces compÃ©tences (vie, endurance et compÃ©tence spÃ©ciale dans ce cas ci)
La difficultÃ© des phases de plateforme n'est pas trop Ã©levÃ©e pour la quÃªte principale mais il y a de nombreux petits "dÃ©fis de plateforme" pour atteindre certains collectibles, plusieurs quÃªtes secondaire, et l'apprentissage de nouvelles techniques qui oblige le joueur Ã  revenir dans des lieux dÃ©jÃ  visitÃ© pour redÃ©couvrir de nouveaux passages (j'adore ce concept). Les phases de combats et les ennemis sont assez variÃ©s, mÃªme si ce n'est pas ce que je prÃ©fÃ¨re dans le jeu. Seul moment qui a failli me rendre fou, ce sont les 17 dÃ©fis bronze/argent/or qui sont obligatoire pour le trophÃ©e des 100% d'exploration et qui m'on fait recommencer des heures un mÃªme dÃ©fi en boucle pour l'obtenir 

Je n'ai pas testÃ© la coop, mais le jeu est dÃ©jÃ  trÃ¨s bien en solo (pas besoin de coop pour le 100%)

Au final, je le conseil aux amateurs de jeu de plateforme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122813329', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1581838250}
review:
Un Juego bonito con ganas, con mucho respeto por mi cultura, la mexicana; se siente el calor de la gente de los pueblitos del bajÃ­o, que son representados fielmente, sobre todo de la parte sur del paÃ­s, aunque no se tomen tiempo en explicar el por quÃ© del aspecto de los enemigos y personajes,  alguien cercano a la historia y mitologÃ­a de del territorio mexicano y/o alrededores sabrÃ¡ o identificarÃ¡ muchos monstruos de la misma, ademas la musica de "electro-mariachi" recuerda a cosas que precisamente sirvieron de inspiraciÃ³n en lo jugable, como castlevania o metroid que hacen un excelente trabajo ambientando la experiencia.

Sin temor a equivocarme el juego es retador mas NO dificil, solo requiere un entendimiento del espacio y los tiempos para poderse superar, lo mejor es que si caes o mueres no tardas nada en volver a intentarlo lo que te hace menos frustante el constante "prueba y error", para el ultimo tercio de la experiencia no aparecen enemigos nuevos solo "re-skins" con mas vida y mas daÃ±o, pero en el 80% de la experiencia se mantiene solida y desafiante.  Lo juguÃ© acompaÃ±ado por mi hermano, se vuelve mas divertido aun aunque la cÃ¡mara era incomoda para el segundo jugador puesto que solo sigue el primero, esto es mas evidente en las secciones de plataformas donde necesitabamos estar coordinados en exceso, si el segundo jugador es mÃ¡s hÃ¡bil y lograba pasar la secciÃ³n tendrÃ­a que esperar a que el el primero tambiÃ©n lo hiciera en tiempo.

Cosas que me hubiera gustado del juego.

- Los combos son muy faciles de interrumpir por los los diferentes enemigos resulta casi imposible realizarlos, ademas de que son muy dificiles de memorizar.

-Mas y mejores secciones de plataformas con enemigos, mas que nada para aprovechar ambas mecÃ¡nicas.

- La cÃ¡mara para dos jugadores o mas no es ideal.

- Y que te dieran mas indicaciones para las misiones secundarias o algun incentivo mas que el ser caritativo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069664556', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1573340956}
review:
[u]Ewen Top10 2019[/u]

Mucha lucha y muchos memes

Comecei a jogar com uma baixa expectativa, mesmo sabendo que Ã© um jogo bem avaliado por muita gente, e Guacamelee me surpreendeu positivamente.

O game acompanha a aventura de Juan para tentar salvar sua "amiga" do vilÃ£o Calaca. Para isso, ele acaba ganhando poderes que o transforma em um lutador de wrestling e Ã© utilizando muitos socos e chutes que ele vai acabar com todos vilÃµes ao longo de sua jornada.

Seguindo um estilo Metroidvania, por mais estranho que isso possa parecer, Guacamelee consegue estar bem acima de outros do gÃªnero, com uma boa histÃ³ria, Ã³tima construÃ§Ã£o de personagens, inovaÃ§Ã£o nas habilidades aprendidas, alÃ©m de um cenÃ¡rio e trilha sonora muito bem trabalhados.

Em questÃ£o do gameplay, Ã© pancadaria da boa o tempo todo e diversos puzzle a serem resolvidos e que nÃ£o deixam o jogo ficar tedioso, mesmo que vocÃª esteja em uma segunda gameplay no modo hard. HÃ¡ tambÃ©m a possibilidade de jogar com um player homem ou mulher, sendo que as animaÃ§Ãµes de combate sÃ£o Ãºnicas para cada um, e muito bem feitas, o que faz ficar interessante zerar o game usando cada um.

NÃ£o posso tambÃ©m deixar de comentar sobre a gigantesca quantidade de referÃªncias a outros jogos, os memes. Ã‰ piada, estÃ¡tua, cartazes, achievements, tem de tudo! Quando vocÃª menos esperar, terÃ¡ uma referÃªncia no cenÃ¡rio para vocÃª tirar uma foto e guardar de recordaÃ§Ã£o.

Guacamelee Ã© um jogo muito bom que vale a pena conferir

author: {'steamid': '76561198093793712', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1581852626}
review: Very nice and hard game, but since I finished it its doable because Im no master in hard games. I liked story its simple but funny and many instances of reocuring tutorial/"howtoplay" dialogues made in funny way. I liked moving around because controls feel smooth and tight and combos feel rewarding. Jumping and platforming is really nicely done and quite inventive. I havent played any game similar to this I think but I would really recommend this amazing mexican experience to anyone who feels like he is going to like it. (start of the game might feel slow but after a while you will be hoping around map with ease like trained gymnast)

Guacamelee Ã© um game de plataforma muito divertido e interessante, bastante estreÃ³tipado, porem grande parte dos estereÃ³tipos sÃ£o realmente verdades, possui piadas de duplo sentido realmente engraÃ§adas, e a grande diferenÃ§a de outros jogos de plataforma Ã© que ele tem uma beleza e um level design Ãºnico para cada Ã¡rea, acabei me apaixonando pela arte e pela jogabilidade do jogo, tendo momentos bem difÃ­ceis e que te tiram da zona de conforto habitual.
No geral, o game Ã© algo bem gostoso de jogar, pois Ã© divertido, nÃ£o Ã© nem um pouco cansativo apesar de ter  momentos frustrantes, mas todo seu esforÃ§o compensa apenas para ter aquele sentimento de jogo bom concluÃ­do no final.
No geral, a arte e as referÃªncias do jogo sÃ£o 10/10, a jogabilidade pode ser classificada com 10/10, a histÃ³ria podia ser um pouco mais incrementada, podendo ser considerada um 8/10.
O game em si Ã© muito interessante e realmente vale a pena cada centavo gasto, vai te proporcionar horas de diversÃ£o.

review: Good metroidvania-type game. It starts out a bit slow, but you end up unlocking a bunch of powers that make traversing the world interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061837685', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1572772946}
review:
Guacamelee is a brawler action puzzle platformer, with a heavy emphasis on platforming. While the platforming can get pretty challenging, it isn't near-impossible, like Hollow Knight's Path of Pain. This is pretty much Rayman, except with Luchadores. 
I personally found the start of the game a little dull, because the plot is really just the Mexican version of Mario's quest to save Princess Peach. Plus, combat also started off slow, with only basic hand to hand combat. But thankfully, it got a lot more fun once I unlocked more powers. So many ways to beat your enemies to pulp!

There's also probably 12+ hours of gameplay in this, assuming you attempt to get all the collectibles. 
Guacamelee is a true gem of a platformer, and definitely worth the buy even at full price. You don't even need to take my word for it - considering the amount of effort it takes to get the alternate ending, it actually says a lot about this game that 16% of its players actually made the effort to achieve it. 
While frustrating at times, there's no denying Guacamelee is a ton of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048695648', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1572667838}
review:
Curioso y sumamente divertido tÃ­tulo metroidvania. Todo su estilo estÃ¡ basado en la cultura mexicana y el humor es genial. Con personajes carismÃ¡ticos y una ambientaciÃ³n super colorida, este juego ofrece una gran experiencia en el gÃ©nero.

Tiene algunas mecÃ¡nicas curiosas, como por ejemplo la habilidad de convertirnos en un pollo(lo cual me parece hermoso) o la posibilidad de alterar el tiempo para completar diferentes zonas.

Sugiero encarecidamente jugarlo con mando, ya que los controles con teclado pueden volverse un poco frustrantes aunque no imposibles (lo juguÃ© con teclado).

Recomiendo mucho Guacamelee, es un juego muy simpÃ¡tico y un buen aporte a los tÃ­tulos de este estÃ­lo.

[spoiler]CALACA FOR MAYOR[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198078867381', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1571508788}
review:
First of all, I have much more than 3 hours of gameplay. Something like 8 hours I think, but the Steam is only showing 3 hours because I played this game a lot without internet.

When I started playing this game it was in a time I just didn't want to play anything, and other games were not hooking me. But I continued playing because it was a game I could play while doing something else, but after a while a became hooked and used any spare time I had to play it. If you're like me who don't know what to play or do right now, this is a good game to make you play again.

The game is a metroidvania that has a combo-base melee combat, that is somewhat deep and fun. Also, it does not focus a lot on finding your way, since just following the map and the indicators, you'll basically never get lost. It has the doors locked by special powers, but you'll never need to remember, since when you get that upgrade, the game is going to direct you to where you need to be. Since I was a little impatient at the time, I liked it. But at the same time, the other paths leads to not only powerups but fun platforming. I ended up going after almost all powerups.

One very fun thing is the jokes. It's a funny, very silly game, with very clever and adult jokes mixed with the most stupid (and good) jokes you'll ever see. Even if the story isn't good or important, it's characters and dialogues are very fun and made me want to see the game through.

If you want something very deep, maybe this isn't for you, but if you just want to play something that is good and light, this is a great game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352285118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1571657040}
review: Guacamelee is a one of better metroidvania out there you can get. The main focus of this kind of game would be gameplay, and it delivers. The control is snappy and responsive, with a good level design and colourful background. The game progressively getting harder, introducing new mechanic every time you move on to the next part of the game, such as realm change which can be tricky at first. Difficulty is not the hardest, but it is not cakewalk either. I would not say this one is my favourite, but I can see why it is for others.

review: I am generally not a big fan of metroidvania games, but I genuinely enjoyed playing this game. There are so many great things about this game. The combat is very easy to learn and has an easy to learn combo system, an interesting storyline, references to other classic games, great humor in the writing, and great writing in general when it comes to the character dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209696779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1625556385}
review:
A damn fine metroidvania game. 
Fun to play from start to finish with satisfying moves, great combo mechanic, an amazing soundtrack and fun boss fights.
This is one metroidvania that you won't regret playing.
And yes, playing with friends is an option. Though don't expect to get much progress done unless you're both equally talented.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976408337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1570880198}
review:
[h1]Overall = 7 / 10[/h1]

A fun and enjoyable metroidvania with a great setting and plenty of jokes / referential humour to make you smirk (or groan) that ultimately struggles to stand out from the crowd.  The game is bright and colourful and a real treat to look at and listen to, but the gameplay, level designs and mechanics all feel a bit flat and basic.  The combat is mostly unsatisfying, either being too easy or too hard, and pulling off combos of special combat moves, which are required to progress through some of the platforming sections, is tricky.  Combat is mostly segregated into small arenas, some of the toughest platforming challenges come out of nowhere, and the bosses are pretty unmemorable.

I enjoyed my shortish time with it and heartily recommend it as a functional and good open platform game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998817967', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1558293685}
review:
A pretty looking metroidvania that isn't as fun as it's bright and colourful.

To get straight to what makes it unfun: a lot of puzzles, area traversals and combat scenarios require very precise usage of ability combos to progress, and most of abilities you unlock in this game are just a variation of charge or jump, and as they pile up you have to perform more torturous actions, like say to tripple jump in one area you hafve to jump, then perform up-charge, and a forward-charge. This is... frustrating, and the game isn't very forgiving about it, with some lengthy precision combat requiring areas sending you way back at start if you make a single mistake. The combat is kinda better since it comes off more close to fighting games than metroidvanias there, but some boss fights and intense battles still require really precise combo-ing to get things done. Honestly this is exactly why I can't recommend the game and have little to not interest in sequel (which I heard is pretty similar in this regard), it's just too frustrating.

Now, the good part: the world is pretty fun, it's like this caricature of Mexico with lots of stereotypical aspects like sombreros and skeletons and, well, the luchadore masked wrestlers play a crucial role in this world, wielding mystical powers and fighting injustices. You end up as one, too. I'm not sure if all these stereotypes and cultural symbols could be considered offensive, if you ask me the game blatantly doesn't take itself serious while at same time shows these cultural aspects in a pretty affectionate manner, everyone from country bumpkins to other strangers are pretty sympathethic even if they portray some negative stereotype. The music is also really on point and memorable. What is a bit annoying is how full of pop culture jokes this game is. Like, very single advertisement or business banner is a reference to other game, which I can forgive as this solidarity with other indies and desire to subtly promote their game, but it doesn't stop at them and the pop culture references are endless.

Overall, I feel like it could have been more forgiving, and while I am sure there will be people who enjoy pulling off precision combos, I really cannot recommend the game. Esp. when there are other metroidvanias like Ori and the Blind Forest which are also pretty but have more interesting abilities and aren't as demanding for precise combo executions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080296630', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1572791425}

review:
Un juego hermoso, con un arte muy original, con paletas de colores bien hechas, con ambientes y lugares bien construidos, y mucho juego entre la construcciÃ³n visual, musical y la constituciÃ³n propia del juego. El juego mismo es una referencia a la cultura mexicana, que explota gentilmente hasta su Ãºltimo rincÃ³n. Tiene mucho humor, mucho respeto, e incluso miles de "easter eggs" de la cultura pop mundial.

La jugabilidad es buena, el progreso de las habilidades del personaje es brutal, la re-jugabilidad es bastante alta, y la mecÃ¡nica de los puzzles y zonas muy difÃ­ciles (donde mueres mucho) es bastante amable con el jugador. No es un juego difÃ­cil, pero presenta muy buenos desafÃ­os.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013073925', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1637948508}
review:
Remember that cartoon on Cartoon Network called Mucha Lucha, that made some of our childhoods that much better? Well ,I 100% think that if you liked that , you'll love this game. I'm not that big on platformers , but this one was fun. Although the combat and enemies' RNG on moves can be a bit bullsh*t at times , you have plenty of moves of your own in the arsenal and the checkpoints are established in appropriate locations so you don't have to waste much time walking around the level if you die in one room or at one boss, you can just retry right away. At the beginning of the game it might not look like much gameplay -wise, but it gets better as you unlock moves and abilities.

The music and the aesthetics are so good , even though there's no voice acting they managed to give each villain their own personalities and traits. The game has 2 different endings also, and plenty of collectibles and even side quests.

You can play as 2 different characters , and as far as couch co-op goes, up to 4 players can join the game at the same time.
There's even different skins that give your characters different stats.

So, go Â¡Â¡INTENSOOOOOOOOO !! and wrestle around skeletons and bad guys to save the world ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198427721787', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1568855330}
review: Pretty fun, combat gets slightly repetitive but that's the nature or a metroidvania. Kind of linear but I don't like backtracking too much so it was fine with me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983451928', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1567305800}
review: Oh man this game was goofy fun times. A bit simplistic as a Metroidvania, but there are so many secrets to hunt for and so much possible variation to your fighting style that it stays fun throughout. The writing is hilarious, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207779407', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1687044488}
review: I have to say, this game is good fun. Normally I don't like platformers, but this one is too good to pass. It has a cool combat system, where you can combo moves for higher multiplies. Cool art design, and excellent music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141245930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1569101342}
review: Short, fun and kind of a funny take on Mexican culture. Some of the memes haven't aged very well but the combat mechanics remain tight and engaging. Great option for a break after finishing a big AAA game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003332807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1569064011}
review: Fun combat-platformer with a dash of Metroidvania.  The graphics are bright and colourful and very stylistic, the music is great and contributes to the upbeat atmosphere, and the game is just the right length at around 9 hours.  Downsides: combat was a bit stiff, with frequent "i'm locked in this animation so I can't avoid the incoming attack" moments, I couldn't aim my throwing attacks reliably (maybe that was me?) and the character upgrades are dull.  But definately recommended for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040177498', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1619337210}
review:
Got it when it was 75% off, totally worth it even without the discounts. The gameplay is fun and has a fair but challenging pace, based on what little I've played. If you're a fan of MetroidVania games, and like the Dia de Muertos/Lucha Libre theme of the game (and of course the mariachi-inspired soundtrack), then you're in for a treat. 

DO NOT pick up the Gold Edition, get this version instead. The Super Turbo Championship Edition removes some seizure/epilepsy triggers that were in the original and Gold Editions, plus this one has features that render Gold Edition pointless.

review:
Melee metroidvania. very well made - can highly recommend it.

Jumping puzzles can be tricky, but are generally skippable if it's just for a chest.
Unless you are a completionist.

But yeah, those jumping puzzles are very tricky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039782332', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1431, 'last_played': 1568389139}
review:
[h1]Recommendations/Considerations before buying[/h1]
[b]Hardware[/b]
[list]
[*]Get yourself a proper gamepad.  Preferably an Xbox-style, Xinput controller.
[/list]
[b]Single- vs Multi-player[/b]
[list]
[*]Because the entirety of the game is the same for single player and multiplayer, neither mode wholly benefits.
To see which you prefer, try playing the game with a different total number of players.
[u]Multiplayer Pros[/u]
[*]Friends can revive you and and help punch bad guys.
[u]Multiplayer Cons[/u]
[*]Combat situations become more erratic as bad guys change targets, get hit and change position, or die before you land a blow.
[*]Due to the camera's focus on player 1, platforming that doesn't contain the entire environment on screen becomes more frustrating.  Players 2 through 4 often feel(s) forced to put down their controller just so Player 1 can drag the team's revive-bubbles forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163372579', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1568245305}
review:
Honestly... This game is fun. But that's about it. It's just dumb fun. There's no real challenge. There are some video game references (mostly Nintendo games) but the jokes get old really quick.

And something's really wrong with this game's audio mixing. Some sound effects are obnoxiously loud and the music really overstays its welcome. I'm not sure if it gets better later on but the game really holds your hand, showing you where your objective is and where you should be going next. You can't really sequence break either as you need to follow your objectives to get your power-ups one by one. This game felt like a really shallow Metroidvania.

The sprites remind me of SpeedRunners and the cutscenes are very nice. But the gameplay... It just bored me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440481721', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1568049169}
review:
This is by far the best plat-former I've ever played. 
The things i loved -
â€¢  The visuals - I've legit taken 50+ screenshots of the game, every location and set piece is so stunning and beautiful.
â€¢  The combat  - Although you don't have a lot of moves in the first half of the game, the last few hours of the game is f*cking awesome-with a WIDE variety of jumps, attacks and a few more awesome surprises XD.
â€¢  The difficulty - I'm not a big fan of really difficult games, but Guacamelee! hits the sweet spot. Its difficult at the required spots yet rewarding at the same time. Not gonna lie, the boss fights took more than a dozen tries which made the victory more rewarding.
â€¢  The character dialogues - There is no voice acting, but the dialogues are a masterpiece, i constantly found myself cracking up throughout by play-through. (The highlights are the puns)

All in all, a must play for plat-former lover and even if your not i would recommend you try the game! The art-style and combat will keep you hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027999543', 'num_games_owned': 1444, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1567863457}
review: sometimes needlessly difficult, including the fact you may have to remember a lot of key combinations and then properly use them, buuut.. it was certainly a very fun local co-op game which makes me feel bad for that initial impression from the store page ("don't want to play this, next") that made me completely ignore this game until it was given away for free. controller is somewhat nice to have. oh and there aren't many character appearance options, but it has a mod support for character skins and there are few really talented designs with dozens of custom animations which really made the game shine ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1566929697}
review:
This game is by no means a "bad" game, not in the general definition of bad. The artstyle is great, the movement and combat flows well and the music is pretty nice.

My problem with this game, however, is this: 

The Repetition. This game is just repetitive in the worst way. It is (supposed to be) a metroidvania, so you go through areas, fight enemies, collect new powers. Fighting enemies is very repetitive, platforming is simple and - well, thatÂ´s it. Puzzles and platforming consist of 90 % walljumping, whereas combat consists of "mash X 3 times for the basic combo, then use one of your 4 special moves, and maybe occasionally grab an enemy". The game is also incredibly easy, and it is one of those wonderful games where you donÂ´t unlock the harder difficulty unless you play through it once (always a genius move in any game!)

While the artstyle is great, the areas are just boring and badly designed. Go through linear hallway, arena appears, fight a couple enemies, walljump up two walls, go through another hallway, arena appears, fight a couple enemies, rinse and repeat. There is never a challenge in the game, you never have to think. The "metroidvania" part of the game is also very light; you learn 4 special moves as the game goes on (as well as two movement abilities), allowing you to break coloured blocks in earlier areas. But the actual discovery aspect of this game is so light that you only find one of four objects behind those walls; health and stamina upgrades, money, or orbs for the different ending.

Really, my problem with the game is just that it is so boring and without drive. It just goes through the motions. Everything is just way too easy and repetitive. Boring forest, lifeless volcano, some snow mountain, a town with 4 buildings you can enter, boring combat, boring bosses, boring story with a bad ending that can only be upgraded by finding 6 hidden orbs.

If the game would be a little more challenging, more creative, would consist of more than just hallway to enemies to simple puzzle/platforming to hallway, then I probably would recommend it; the artstyle and music are the reason why it stings a little to downvote it, too. But I am rating a game here, and it was very hard to find one under the pretty facade. Maybe you will like it more than I did, but buy it on sale if you do.

As for me, it was a boring, uninspired metroidvania-supermegalite, especially compared to some really good similar games like Hollow Knight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031059556', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1566655397}
review:
Guacamelee!, es un juego de plataformas y "Hack and slash" en scroll lateral. En este juego con ambientaciÃ³n mexicana tu misiÃ³n es avanzar a lo largo de las pantallas para derrotar al jefe final y asÃ­ rescatar a la "princesa". Guacamelee! es un juego que claramente logra aquello que busca. No pretende llegar a ser el juego insignia del genero, pero con un toque de humor estupendo y una jugabilidad maravillosa se ha hecho un hueco entre los juegos que me han gustado bastante.

De los aspectos a destacar por encima de todo pondrÃ­a el tema de la presentaciÃ³n de habilidades y el aprendizaje de ellas, es decir que el juego, en este caso presenta varias habilidades que te permitirÃ¡n mejorar en combate y en plataformeo de manera simultanea, y lo hace de manera ordenada y con una pequeÃ±a prÃ¡ctica a lo largo de la aventura para que aprendas a usarlas de la mejor manera y te acostumbres rÃ¡pido.

El humor y la mÃºsica estÃ¡n bien llevados a cabo a lo largo de la aventura, y el plataformeo no se hace pesado, lo cual es de valorar, ademÃ¡s los cambios de escenario hacen que no se haga pesado en ningÃºn momento.

Como puntos negativos mÃ¡s destacables pondria una historia mas bien pobre (pese a que no sea lo que se viene a buscar en este titulo) y un sistema de teletransportes en el mapa que no me han acabado de convencer y a penas me he visto en la necesidad de usarlos o cuando los necesitaba estaban demasiado lejos.


[b]Mi nota para este juego es: 7.76[/b]

review:
Juan Agacate, cultivateur d'agaves dans un petit village mexicain voit sa tranquille vie de fermier chamboulÃ©e lorsque le machiavÃ©lique Carlos Calaca, nouveau seigneur du monde des morts, kidnappe la fille d'El Presidente. Sans attendre, Juan risque sa vie pour la sauver... pour tomber lamentablement sous les pouvoirs surpuissants du vil Calaca. Cependant, en mettant la main sur un masque de luchador magique, Juan reviendra des morts, prÃ¨s Ã  devenir le plus puissant des lutteurs mexicains afin de venir Ã  bout de Calaca et de ses sbires, et de libÃ©rer son ancien amour de jeunesse.

Dans un univers tout droit sorti du pays des cactus, des sombreros colorÃ©s et des tacos dÃ©goulinants de salsa, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition nous plonge dans un monde colorÃ© des plus dÃ©jantÃ©s. MÃ©langeant jeu de plateforme, beat 'em all, metroidvania, lÃ©gÃ¨rement assaisonnÃ© de die and retry, ce jeu va mettre Ã  rude Ã©preuves toute notre adresse pour venir Ã  bout d'une foule d'adversaires allant des squelettes armÃ©s de sabres, aux tatous gÃ©ants, en passant par des titans dÃ©charnÃ©s, tous sorti du folklore mexicain. On devra ainsi les affronter Ã  travers d'innombrables couloirs et arÃ¨nes sous la musique endiablÃ©e des mariachis.

Tout au long de notre pÃ©riple entre le monde des morts et celui des vivants, que ce soit seul ou Ã  deux, on dÃ©veloppera peu Ã  peu nos aptitudes de luchador grÃ¢ce aux enseignements de nos vieux mentor se dissimulant sous les traits d'une chÃ¨vre dÃ©crÃ©pie, lequel nous sortira de la poussiÃ¨re les anciennes techniques de combat, tel le Coup du Coq ou la Claque de la Grenouille. De notre cÃ´tÃ© on pourra renforcer notre corps de cultivateur d'agave en se dÃ©nichant de nouveaux habits de luchador, mais avant tout en dÃ©veloppant notre mode Intenso permettant de dÃ©cupler les pouvoirs cachÃ©s de notre masque.

Se parcourant assez facilement, malgrÃ© certains passages pouvant se montrer assez ardus lorsqu'on est pas encore au niveau, Guacamelee se termine en une petite dizaine d'heures, bien qu'on peut compter environ le double pour complÃ©ter le jeu Ã  100%. DiffÃ©rentes arÃ¨nes de dÃ©fi, mises en place par El Diablo, vont Ã©galement venir tester nos talents de luchador, et nous mettre Ã  rude Ã©preuve pour venir Ã  bout du mode difficile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972836357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1566161732}
review:
Well-made little brawler with Metroidvania elements. Guacamelee! follows the classic "save the princess" trope, with a striking visual style, framework dipped in Mexican culture and humor that lands more often than not. There's not a whole lot to say about it; combat is simple button mashing with the option for combos if you're feeling particularly skilled, as well as power moves for both combat and exploration. The campaign takes anywhere from 5 to 8 hours, depending on how much of a completionist you are and the whole thing is just really fun. The side-quests aren't too demanding and add character to the world, there's a whole lot of pick-ups to challenge your OCD and the game is just smooth and amusing from beginning to end.

It's not perfect, though. For one thing, running the game fullscreen causes constant stutters, which means I had to play the game on windowed mode (and borderless doesn't exist, due to the game's age). In fairness, this same issue appeared on Giana Sisters recently as well (when it wasn't a problem before), so there's a chance some accursed Win10 update just broke the game.

Also, the difficulty curve leaves something to be desired. The game is perfectly beatable and it's not overly challenging; however, in its third act, it's choke-full of excruciating platforming sections that rely on split-second reactions with utilizing a number of different moves to traverse the environment and dual-world switching on the fly, which can get tedious. The game has the decency to (usually) not kill you when you fail (it just puts you back on a platform to try again), but it can get frustrating, especially as the controls can screw you over. Same goes for some combat arenas, the design of which can be especially asinine (I'm looking at you, bombs).

Lastly, as beautiful as the game is, it's perfectly possible to lose track of the player character when there are too many enemies on-screen or even during boss battles. The final boss, for example, has a very easy to decipher pattern, but took me way too many tries because the screen got too busy to keep track of what was going on.

Having said all that, I really enjoyed Guacamelee! despite its shortcomings. I picked it up for free (I believe it was a Humble giveaway) and I'm so used to giveaways being utter trash, I was surprised with the level of quality on display here. I'll definitely be picking up the sequel next chance I get.

review:
One of the most entertaining beat 'em up I've played in a while. 

Controls are good, easy learning curve, but you will die a lot if you don't pay attention, good navigation puzzles. No bugs, story is a tiny bit cheesy but very entertaining too. Very Mexican, which is good.

Really liked the powers mechanic and enemy shielding. Add a some variety. Excellent game for when you are bored from 3D world and AAA titles.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198120331550', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1565222821}
review:
Overall a good Metroidvania with unique visuals, Mexican culture, and excellent music themes throughout the experience.  Combat feels very rewarding while you find new ways to string long combos on enemies and being able to dodge at any time keeps fights fast and engaging.  Despite the game's content primarily being fighting it never felt too gratuitous due to the various platforming and side-quest objectives sprinkled about.  

While I appreciated the fact that each area displays it's own separate completion rating of 0%-100% there were times where I felt the unexplored secret areas could have been vaguely shown on the map screen better.  The colored blocks were shown on the map very clearly while narrow tunnels are practically invisible.  Save/Warp icons on the map also caused me to miss progression / secret areas due to the game occasionally placing branching paths near them. 

The difficulty of the game is very easy overall, deaths only reset your progress to a 1 minute progression loss at most, auto-save locations are found on practically every facet of the map + fill your health back to max. Hard mode does a decent job at encouraging a second playthrough of the game.  I appreciated the extra care that went into bosses in that all of them (save from the final boss) play differently in various ways.  The earlier parts of the game are practically the same as normal mode until it ramps up near the end.

Had fun with this and would recommend it as a good starting point for those looking to get into Metroidvanias.   Guacamelee does a good job with it's short and legible map layouts that tells you all you need to know about a level, constant progression via ability unlocks, and very fast loading screens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271916016', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1563469098}
review:
Guacamelee is an extremely stylistic Metroidvania game and Itâ€™s great. This game highlights the beauty of Mexican culture so absolutely well in itâ€™s Aztec/Mayan Style of art, clever cultural integrations (Olmec heads as teleporters), and most prominently to me the Soundtrack. Holy shit if you like Mexican music youâ€™ll love this game - very unique twists using D minor in the soundtrack as well. The art design may not be for some though, and is overall simplistic. This game also features a LOT of references to other games which are really fun to find and read.

The game features an ability to swap between the world of the living and the dead which in turn changes the ENTIRE surrounding areas with incredible attention to detail to both art AND sound design. This combined with the other abilities creates some pretty unique puzzles and timing obstacles. However, a few rooms simply donâ€™t have a world of the dead version and thus force you back into the real world. Animations can be a bit unnatural when this happens as well as with ability use near odd geometry, but itâ€™s a decently old game so It makes sense.

Combat is incredibly combo based and really fun to mess around with. There are a multitude of ways to beat up and manipulate your enemies and furthermore manage your intenso bar. The major complaint here are the boss fights. In all honesty they felt extremely drawn out and unfitting to fight. Enemies range from annoying to extremely annoying, which ultimately adds to the pleasure of beating them up like a luchador.

There are a decent amount of collectibles to find and costumes/upgrades to buy, as well as steam workshop integration so you can import your own skins if you want to. Guacamelee does have a simple but charming story and as well as local co-op integration. NPC dialogue is also pretty funny at certain moments.

Guacamelee is the Mexican Metroidvania nobody asked for and I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283464054', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1590166386}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042724897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1564968876}
review:
Paltamelee, aunque no ponga nada nuevo sobre la mesa, es un juego que no creÃ­a que me iba a divertir, parte de la premisa es ser un tipico metroid-vania, tiene de todos los cliches del genero, pero el videojuego se los toma con un sentido del humor como ningun otro, debo de admitir que algunas veces me saco una sonrisa, pero encuentro que donde el juego donde mas brilla es en el sistema de combate, que es bien simple, un boton para atacar y otro para hacer especiales, ademas de otro dedicado para agarrar a los enemigos, y lo satisfactorio es que puedes combinar todo esto para hacer combos, que aunque no llega a ser un hack and slash al uso, es increiblemente satisfactorio, tambien la disposicion del espacio y los enemigos ayuda, cada uno tiene distintos ataques y cuando se juntan es cuando sale a relucir todo lo anteriormente mencionando, que es bien, lo unico malo es que el juego tiene un problema al esquivar los ataques, no parece que funcione bien y varias veces piensas que vas a lograr esquivar un ataque pero al final los enemigos igual te atacan y algunos ataques de los enemigos, sobretodo los mas pequeÃ±os, no estan bien telegrafiados o no se notan, siendo a veces imposible verlos atacar.

La parte de metroidvania no es la mejor, y es donde digo que hubiera sido mejor una aventura lineal que lo que acabo siendo, lo mismo que digo con ori, no es muy agradable hacer "backtracking" cuando tus escenarios son bien lineales, y eso es lo que me desanima en sacar todos los secretos, ademas que los lugares en donde te puedes teletransportar en cada parte del mapa central estan tan alejados, que tienes que pasar por todas una serie de obstaculos que ya haz pasado por n veces para poder llegar a ellos, y aun asÃ­ no sirven de mucho porque solo hay un punto para teletransportate en cada mapa, y como los mapas son increiblemente largos,  hubiera faltado si pusieran mas de estos puntos para que sea menos frustrante (Al menor en ori eran concientes de ellos y se podia). Tambien decir que es de los metroidvanias mas basicos que he jugado, lo que quiero decir es que son demasiado obvios donde estan los secretos, que no es malo, a mi no me gusta que el genero haga lo contrario y muchas veces los secretos son demasiado dificil de ver, pero aca te lo muestran practicamente en la cara y se pierde eso.

Si mas un juego regular, pero bueno, [i]tiene un poco pa' todos 9/10[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198129961090', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1554231103}
review: juego Metroidvania, con una historia que cumple, habilidades bien integradas en el transcurso del juego, uno de los combates mas satisfactorios y divertidos que he probado, contenido post game y rejugabilidad gracias a la dificultad dificil, desbloqueada al pasarse el juego por primera vez. Sin embargo la historia no dura mucho, alrededor de unas 8 horas. Visualmente se ve muy bien y tiene buena banda sonora, un monton de referencias a otros juegos y por si fuera poco tiene un workshop que permite cambiarle el traje y las animaciones a nuestro personaje. desde Lara Croft hasta spiderman, pasando por samus e incluse el heavy de tf2.   recomendado sobretodo en oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031888186', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1564873260}
review:
Very very repetitive gameplay. Hit man, use Y to combo him into other man. Rinse and repeat for the entire game. You can change character in the game which was fun until I found out that the other chracter can't get past certain parts of the game like the other character can. This means if you dare play with a friend they have to quit out the game once they reach certain parts as their character physical can not get past certain parts of the levels.

Poor design. Wack

Wish I could get a refund of the time spent in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050245307', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2597, 'last_played': 1564764762}
review: Very cool game with a very long name. It's filled with action, fighting (duh) and environmental riddles. I liked the humour- from the dialogues to the various chickens, not to mention the posters with wacky versions of Mario Brothers, Goat Simulator and Castle Crashers to name a few. It was very relaxing up to the Tule Tree hidden mask bit, that wasted a LOT of my nerves, and then came the one with disappearing platforms with was the opposite of fun. The hard mode was cool, difficult but fair, apart from the part when you escape from lava- that was unnecessarily irritating. Overall the game is good, even better if you play it with friends.

review:
Mucho Fun. Das Spiel ist mit jede Menge Humor gespickt. 
Mal sind es Anspielungen an andere Spiele, mal ist es einfach ihr eigener Humor.
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist optimal (sowohl auf Normal als auch auf Schwer) und man hat nicht das GefÃ¼hl, das sich die "levels" oder die Bereiche in die LÃ¤nge ziehen.
Auch ist die Kombination aus verschiedenen Skills (die man freischaltet) und den paar Upgrades gut gelungen.

Von mir auf jedenfall eine Empfehlung 

P.S. die 100% achievements sind auch machbar (bei mir mit ca. 15 stunden)

author: {'steamid': '76561198102945378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1564431521}
review:
OK... I hate "fighter" games like FIST FIGHTER and MORTAL COMBAT and such.  Basically, this is one of those.  I got it free from HUMBLE BUNDLE so I thought I'd try it.  I tried.  I'm done.


Don't get me wrong, it's kinda cute is some ways.  There is some kind of story line, but I just couldn't get into it. 

The soundtrack is good, and I'll listen to it....probably.... Maybe while I play WOLFENSTEIN or SERIOUS SAM or DUKE NUK'EM or something.....or .... maybe I won't.

review: fortuna che l'ho trovato gratis, mi aspettavo un troiaio non troppo immenso ma abbastanza divertente e le mie aspettative non sono state deluse, a parte il fatto che a volte i controlli fanno pena e ci sono decisamente troppi comandi di cui tenere di conto. Avversari programmati appositamente per darti eccessivamente fastidio piÃ¹ che una sfida vera e propria il che rende il gioco noioso ed inutilmente frustrante nonostante sia facilissimo, livelli alla fine tutti uguali con trappole ed ostacoli messi per complicarti la vita, solito discorso come per gli avversari, un gioco che lascia il tempo che trova, non mi ha trasmesso niente, i poteri che sblocchi sono fighi Ã¨ vero, con nomi simpatici e citazioni buttate li a caso. Su una scala da 1 a 10 questo merita un bel 3

review:
Es un juego 2D con temÃ¡tica mexicana, comenzarÃ© con su historia, no es tan larga y tampoco tan corta, entretiene al jugador con saber que pasarÃ¡ despuÃ©s, ademÃ¡s de tener pequeÃ±as misiones secundarias que se necesitan de las habilidades que se obtienen al progresar la historia, el villano es bastante caÃ³tico que siempre tiene a su grupo que te harÃ¡ difÃ­cil tu viaje; la jugabilidad es  intuitiva, por lo que si fallas, ya es tu culpa. Los grÃ¡ficos son coloridos tanto en el mundo de los vivos como en el de los muertos, puedes interactuar con personajes secundarios, como las personas en el pueblo, patear gallinas :v, etc.
Es un buen juego, tiene el modo cooperativo de hasta 4 personas creo o 2 eran :v para pasar el modo historia y derrotar a los jefes, mÃ¡s al jefe final, que esta mamadisimo :v 
Creo que tiene un modo multijugador local para jugar en compaÃ±ia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999103262', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1562088606}
review:
No me malinterpretÃ©is. Mi pulgar hacia abajo no significa que no sea buen juego, sino que no recomiendo jugarlo. La razÃ³n es sencilla: tampoco me parece bueno.

Hoy en dÃ­a tenemos cientos de juegos a los que acceder fÃ¡cilmente para jugar. Para mÃ­ los prioritarios son aquellos que tengan algo especial. Y Guacamelee para mÃ­ no lo ha tenido tras un par de horas de juego.

Hasta donde yo he visto, tenemos un metroidvania de manual: vas ganando habilidades que te van abriendo nuevos caminos en sitios por los que ya pasaste. Incluso algo que hemos visto en otros metroidvanias como es cambiar entre dos versiones del mundo a travÃ©s de portales.

Viniendo de jugar a The Messenger, este me ha sabido a poco. Especialmente el combate, me ha parecido torpe en comparaciÃ³n con otros juegos similares como el mencionado The Messenger, Dust: An Elysian Tail o Outland (juego que tampoco me parece destacable, pero el control era bueno). Lo mÃ¡s destacable me ha parecido el aspectro grÃ¡fico y la ambientaciÃ³n en general. Pero tampoco me ha mantenido enganchado. Otros me enganchaban mÃ¡s por la historia.

Si te gustan los metroidvanias, adelante, este juego te va a gustar porque no hace nada mal. Para mÃ­, el problema, es que tampoco hace nada especialmente bien.

review: It is an incredibly nice and fun game to play. It has a great fine balance between complex jumping combination, fights and story. It feels very rewarding to complete challenges and most of the time possible from 5-10th attempt. Of course, if you go for a 100% score it will become quite complex. But it is not needed to enjoy the game and complete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131204289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1561211967}
review:
Full frontal chicken action!
You want a classic tale of heroes and princesses, of villains and henchmen but all the others have had too few body slams, pile drivers and headbuts in them? Then this is the game for you!
Hard but not unfair as you jump and run your way through Mexico and the land of the dead. 
The controlls are tight but you might want to buy a comfortable controller or your thumbs will start hurting.

Rated W for Woolie

author: {'steamid': '76561198092862237', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1561575455}
review:
Put on your mask and bring friends! 

Guacamelee! is a metroidvania action platforming video game developed and published by DrinkBox Studios.

On the Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead), evil skeleton named Carlos Calaca attacks the small village in Mexico and kidnaps El Presidente's Daughter, Lupita. You will play as Juan Aguacate, a simple agave farmer who now becomes a Luchador, with a task of saving her! 

Gameplay is a combination of metroidvania and brawlers. Like all of the games from metroidvania subgenre, Guacamelee has open and non-linear world you can fully explore. Obviously some of the areas are not available at first and you need to progress before entering them, to keep the difficulty and progression system on track! In those areas you can progress in storyline, or start looking for secrets, yet it is better to do that later when you have decent amount of skills. Secrets vary from stamina/health increase, to chests with coins. It's fun to collect them, and they really help you! 

Game has a ton of platformic elements. At first it might look simple enough, as you just have to jump from ledge to ledge, but later on as more abilities are gained, you use them to boost your jumps, wallrun, double jump, dodge specific objects, the usual when it comes to those types of games, so it's not for everyone. 
Coordination is required, and for some, a controller aswell. There is a reason game recommends a controller everytime you launch it. It simply offers better mapping of combos you need to perform, and smaller chance of missing specific buttons because of stress. It's easier to hit bumps and triggers rather than small keys. But it dosen't mean it's impossible to beat it! Look at me, I played the damn thing on keyboard and my fingers are mostly fine, can't say that about mental health so better pick a controller to avoid frustration. 

Combat has same difficulty curve as platforming. At first, enemies are pretty weak and feature two or three types only, you can easily dodge their attacks and defeat them. As you progress, game adds shields, attacks you can't dodge, bigger and tougher enemies, and so on.
Enemies drop coins after being defeated, health orbs to regenerate health!
Because you are a Luchador, there is a ton of combos you can perform, like in most of the brawler games. Throw enemies in the air, combine abilties, avoid attacks!

Abilities you collect are used everywhere. Need to climb onto something? Destroy a specific block or shield? It requires a specific ability. To use them, you need to have stamina, if you run out of it, just wait few seconds and it will recharge! 
Same can't be said about health, to recharge it you either need to hit a checkpoint, or you need to collect health orbs. 

Checkpoints in the game are also shops, in which you can spend coins you collected. Game features two types of those-normal coins are used to upgrade Juan and his skills and silver coins, used to buy costumes, those change the way you look (duh) but also have pros and cons. Regenerate slowly health, but regenerate slower stamina? Deal, yet take more damage
at the same time? It's your choice which costume you will pick!

You need help? Ask a friend to play with you! Game features coop for 4 players, but if I recall, it's only local and you need, obviously, 3 other controllers.
Besides coop you also have Hard Mode, which as name suggest, increases difficulty of the game. And while I didn't notice improved platformic difficulty, fights are definitely harder, with enemies packing a punch. 

It's optimized very well, I had no issues when playing so I can't really complain, can I. 

Because it is set in Mexico, soundtrack composed by Rom Di Prisco and Peter Chapman is filled with traditional Mexican music. It really adds to the game, I loved it! And you can focus on it even more as there is no voice acting in the game. 

Relentless yet enjoyable combat, great platforming gameplay, and fantastic soundtrack, Guacamelee is a must play for metroidvania fans! A bit short. 8/10! 

If you enjoyed reading that review, check out [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31947302/] my curator page! [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991524842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1562877872}
review:
This game definitely has its moments. If you like platformer-metroidvanias, and don't mind punishing difficulty and a more linear experience, this game does have some clever puzzles, interesting combat, and eccentric characters.

Overall, I can't recommend this game because of issues with its controls and difficulty, which drain the fun from what would be an otherwise light and well-paced game.

Probably the first thing you'll notice, is that the player character has binary movement. Either he's sprinting, or he's standing still.  The result is that your control of the character feels imprecise. This isn't a great start for a game that is at least 50% platforming.

The second thing you may notice, is that the inputs seem sluggish. Timing jumps or attacks starts to become very frustrating, since you'll have to do every action what feels like 1/3 of a second in advance, because the game can't keep up. Eventually you get used to it, but this is one of the only games I've experienced this problem with. Tack on overly punitive hit boxes on hazards like spikes, and you'll really start to grind your teeth.

Lastly is the difficulty. The two above factors wouldn't be such a issue if the difficulty of the game wasn't tuned so tightly. By tight, I mean that around 20% of the puzzles in the game are basically tuned with no margin for error. You execute them exactly as the designers intended, or you fail and start over. Each puzzle still feels like it could have been good, but either the timing is too tight, or the number of steps is too many. The result, is that frequently you can complete 90% of the puzzle flawlessly, but you'll end up smashing your face on it repeatedly trying to get though that last 10% over and over. It's not fun, its just tedious and frustrating. Each of these puzzles comes down to rote-memorization and luck, and eventually you'll get through. Some of the combat challenges also suffer from this, but it doesn't really become an issue until near the end of the game.

Overall, while the game doesn't do anything new for the genre, it is well paced and fun for the most-part. If the controls issues and incredibly punishing 10% of the game were removed, I'd be off enjoying it and not sitting here writing this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112084909', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1562803965}
review: It has a cool story, cool gameplay and amazing art. From the middle to the end, the levels require that you use a lot of "mechanics" and timing to move foward. I found that a little bit too hard for normal difficulty as I expected to be more of a "I'm just casually killing stuff to see how the story unfolds" difficulty. However, nothing that someone as slow as myself can't do after a few tries, to think about the solution and to learn the enemy's patterns. Good game overall and certainly worth its price in full.

author: {'steamid': '76561198394732752', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1567382425}
review:
This is a Platventure, but the hook is that you have Fighter moves as both attacks and ways to reach new areas.  It starts out simple enough, and does a very good job of easing you into new moves and what to do with them.  That said, it gets to be quite challenging by the end, especially if you're trying to grab all of the game's treasures.  This leads to some really cheap moments, and some of the move inputs clash a bit with general design, so there is the occasional frustration.  The combat gradually gets harder, too, especially if you're trying to rack up big combos.  Though the time between hits is very forgiving, and you can get extra hit bonuses for killing enemies or hitting them with special moves, take one hit and your combo ends.  Luckily, they're mostly for personal gratification, and if they do increase the amount of money that you receive - I didn't take notice - it doesn't matter much, because you'll likely have enough to buy all of the upgrades by the end, so long as you're diligent.

Beyond the dynamic combat and clever puzzles, what stands out is the Mexican theme.  It's not too often that you see this in a game, and they did a great job with it.  The way that it's presented is a good way to really get interested in the culture, even if it's not exactly educational; over the few days I played this, I kept subconsciously slipping in and out of Spanish, without being overly tired or stressed.  The music helps with this, too, because it's traditional music that's been remixed to give it an exciting new feel.  The visuals are neat, too, starting out with the usual yellowy desert, but getting into some mysterious ruins, and a whole other world, where all sorts of strange visual phenomena come out to bloom.

The humor's a little hit-or miss, unfortunately.  It's a pretty funny game, overall, and when a joke lands, its over-the-top presentation really makes it pop; by the end, I was still chuckling every time I got a new ability.  A lot of it, though, is semi-funny, but mostly pop culture references (the majority of which are to video games) that don't make any sense here.  Sure, with the luchador theme, a Strong Bad reference makes sense, but there's a broken wall with exposed bricks in the shape of a Mega Man sprite at one point.  Every once in a while, they're funny, just because they come out of nowhere, smack you upside the head, and fly off into the distance before you even figured out what happened, but there are so many that they start to just seem out of place.

All in all, a few unreasonable expectations aside, there isn't anything wrong with it; if you're looking for a fresh, new experience, and don't mind a challenge that's especially high for this subgenre, then give this a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198287698045', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2447, 'last_played': 1708198733}
review:
-Guacamelee es un plataformero al estilo Metroidvania con muchÃ­simas referencias a memes, otros videojuegos, cine, arte; entre otros. De hecho, su argumento en sÃ­ es una de ellas.

-Es Ãºnico en el gÃ©nero por sus mecÃ¡nicas (aunque es verdad que un poco molestas si se juega con teclado) bien trabajadas y que serÃ¡n necesarias para desbloquear cada uno de los cofres y secretos que se encuentran en los mapas. AdemÃ¡s de ello, funcionan a la perfecciÃ³n porque ninguna se queda obsoleta a medida que se avanza.

-Los logros suponen una dificultad moderada, pero es bastante satisfactorio obtener cada uno de ellos luego de algunas frustraciones en el infierno. 

-La historia se queda algo corta, que es el Ãºnico inconveniente que le encuentro a este tÃ­tulo.

Por eso, y por todo lo demÃ¡s que deberÃ¡s descubrir, recomiendo comprarlo sÃ­ o sÃ­ (aunque lo obtuve gratis), pues se merece cada centavo de lo que cuesta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355006901', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1555705668}
review: As much as people say this is a metroidvania, it doesn't feel like it. The level design consists of this block is yellow so you can't go there yet. When you play through it feels linear with a hub to divert the paths. It doesn't feel like you accomplish anything once you move on. Not to mention there isn't really a need for the collectables. They're all split up so there's no immediate reward when you get a collectable, not to mention its mostly just health that matters. In Metroid the collectables are fun to collect for the final boss, so that you can just wail away, throwing everything you've got, while not having to pay much attention to your health. Collectables just don't have that use and/or feel in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049216736', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1562596230}
review:
It's a good game.
There were some super frustrating fights.
Design lacked a bit in the final chapter, it felt more like spam of hardest enemies than anything else.
Boss fights were okay. Some were really annoying sometimes, due to RNG elements. However they gradually increased in difficulty and were enjoyable. 

I kept getting new abilities to the very end of the game, which is always amazing. The  game kept utilizing these new abilities in mini platforming puzzles. Small sections with no enemies that require utilizing your special abilities to pass. They were often hard at first, but always had a logical solution that you would get after a couple of tries. Or a dozen more tries :P 

But in general it's an amazing game with awesome humor and cool style. It lasts about 5-6 hours on normal mode and it has a lot of hidden content that you can explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256034506', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1563529252}
review:
Guacamelee is an awesome game. It has a fancy art and creative worlds.
Here is a small overview with [b] Pro [/b] and [b] Contra [/b]

Pro:
+ Creative world
+ Awesome game mechanic
+ Funny and Colorful Artstyle
+ Funny and long Story
+ Many levels

Contra:
- Sometimes you dont know where to go / what to do
- Some jumps are too difficult

At least this is a funny game and i recommend it to everyone who likes 2D platformers with a comic art style.

review: Recently a freebie, definitely an oldie but an absolute goodie. The controls can seem a little floaty but you soon become accustomed to the mechanics. This stands alongside Shadow Complex as one of my favourite Metroidvania titles, Guacamelee is an outstanding platformer boasting a simply yet charming story, sublime soundtrack and outstanding art direction. Unquestionably a (relatively) modern classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321069902', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1562075372}
review: Guacamelee is a curiously entertaining and action packed game about a luchador coming back from the dead to rescue the president's daughter. He meets a slew of whacky and comical characters who will aid the luchador in his journey by either teaching him new abilities or guiding him to the right path. Although there is a linear and coherent story that anyone can understand the game itself is open to the player in a more semi metrovania styled open world game where some places require certain abilities and power ups while others don't. You could in theory go wherever you want from the very start although you won't go far. To my surprise I thought that the game would have to heavily rely on the gameplay which I expected to be the average metrovania type but in reality it has a nice balance of story and gameplay. The story being a wild adventure across the desert, rivers, and jungles to save the president's daughter all while facing off with other luchadors and criminals. There are side quests you can partake in but it's all optional in fact none of the ones I've played have really given me anything which is unfortunate because helping the local grandmother in town make her specialty was honestly fun enough to have warranted at least a stupid joke reward. For the gameplay I was pleasantly surprised with the combat; I like the grappling which admittedly I'd use a lot despite it not always being a reliable way to cause damage. I also found the combos interesting but they never really felt like I had to learn them in order to play and win it had always felt like I could just wing it but having the option is still nice. Although the achieving of these combos was rather annoying and cute. In order to learn combos you have to find a luchador chicken (which is just a regular chicken that can speak for some reason) to teach you using the skeleton of a dead luchador. It's hard to master and annoying just to unlock the entirety of a combo move of which I'll probably never use the entire sequence of if not never use it at all. The platforming can be just as difficult at times but thankfully they aren't too hard that it ruins the experience of the game I just think they went a bit too far with the things they expect you to be able to pull off. One thing I really enjoyed about the game was the inclusion of being able to play as a girl luchador to which I did and still am playing only as her. I love those inclusions because although I don't need it to enjoy the game I enjoy it a little more with the inclusion. Don't get me wrong I can play a game where your only playable character is a man but if I had to choose I'd choose a woman. Overall I feel that this game is worth the money it takes to play this game; whether you buy it on sale or simply buy it at full price. I enjoyed it and I know others will and others won't. It's a cute little game about whacky characters in a fantasy cartoon violence world filled to the brim with Mexican culture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197688925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1642210970}
review: Guacamelee is a metroidvania beat-em-up game.  It has a set path that is dictated by various abilities that are necessary for breaking different colored blocks.  The game play is simple but, as the combo teacher will teach you, it can get pretty intense and complex.  Personally, I went the easy way and relied on grappling, but each of my friends found their own play style.  Play styles can be further developed with the addition of various costumes which give buffs and debuffs like better throws but your punches deal less damage.  One of the greatest points, and weakness, of the game is the multiplayer function.  It is always amazing to finally find a game my siblings and I or my friends and I can play together without buying four copies.  However, with Guacamelee, the difficulty drops exponentially with the number of players in the game.  The enemies remain at the same strength and number whether you have one player or four.  This makes it more friendly to players who don't want to learn the 27 hit combos from the teacher but can be boring if you are that one hardcore gamer in the group.  Overall, I rate this a great 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011544317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1658498310}
review:
Thanks for this one, Humble Bundle. And now, for something completely different.

Es casi difÃ­cil demostrar cuÃ¡nto ha crecido este juego desde que lo instalÃ© y, para ser honesto, al principio no sabÃ­a quÃ© esperar. Honestamente pensaba que con un nombre como Guacamelee, pensaba a medias que serÃ­a como un juego tipo Smash Brothers, solo para sorprenderme gratamente de que estaba mÃ¡s en la lÃ­nea de un juego tipo Metroidvania, pero se aferraba a elementos como luchadores enmascarados, El dÃ­a de los muertos y cosas que realmente muestran la cultura mexicana.

Abandonando ese tema, el juego comienza contigo jugando como Juan, tu tÃ­pico hombre que solo estaba atendiendo su campo de agave cuando una figura sombrÃ­a destruye la casa del presidente y luego un grupo de matones secuestrÃ³ a su hija con la intenciÃ³n de fusionar la tierra de los muertos con la tierra de los vivos. Durante esto, intentaste detener a este grupo, solo para ser enviado rÃ¡pidamente, pero el destino conspirarÃ­a de otra manera. Una mÃ¡scara reluciente en la cabeza de una estatua le da a Juan una nueva oportunidad de vida, por asÃ­ decirlo, y desde allÃ­, se te da la fuerza, las habilidades y el misticismo de un luchador, donde puedes infligir movimientos daÃ±inos como un suplex, patea tu Los oponentes se alejan, los acumulan en la tierra o les dan una patada como si fueran un balÃ³n de fÃºtbol.

A pesar de todo esto, este juego comienza bastante simple, pero se incrementa con una curva de dificultad de construcciÃ³n lenta hasta que te enfrentas a todo tipo de peligros locos, como cuchillas de sierra, pÃºas, lava, enemigos con cÃ³digos de colores y mÃºltiples golpes. Los enemigos blindados, los que vuelan, los gigantes, los explosivos, algunos que llevan espadas y esquivarÃ¡n rÃ¡pidamente cualquier cosa que intentes lanzar, incluidas muchas otras, por lo que es mejor que estÃ©s preparado para comenzar a derribar. Pero bueno, no tienes nada de quÃ© preocuparte porque en el camino, te encuentras con varias mejoras para tu salud, resistencia e indicadores de intensidad que puedes comprar en la tienda, o encontrarlos en el enorme mundo asÃ­ como mejoras para tu arsenal de movimientos, asÃ­ como una variedad de disfraces que pueden agregar beneficios o aumentar el desafÃ­o. Sin dar demasiado lejos, comienza a acumularse en un punto y lo dejarÃ© asÃ­. Otra cosa que olvidÃ© mencionar es que cuando se agrega Steam Workshop, incluso puedes agregar disfraces que la gente haya creado.

Ahora, Â¿recomiendo esto? Apuestas tu culo a que yo hago. Esta es una agradable sorpresa que no debe perderse. Lo Ãºnico que puedo decir en contra es que solo hay multijugador local, asÃ­ que si quieres reunir a algunos amigos de todo el mundo, necesitarÃ¡s un programa llamado Parsec para que disfruten de la experiencia.

The only joke part about this is that the main body part of the review was written and then translated with Google Translate. So yeah, get this game, ya nerds.

review:
Do you like metroidvanias? Do you like good soundtracks? Do you like beautiful artstyles? Then this is the game for you.

Full of platforms and colorful enemies, this Mexican inspired game is going to absolutely blow your mind. From doing dungeons to fighting bosses and discovering all kinds of secrets, this is a game I'll recommend doing 100%, trust me, it'll be worth it

It has some flaws and glitches, and sometimes the combat is a little unfair, but overall, it's very good

review: Guacamelee might not be particularly long, but it provides a very tight and enjoyable metroidvania experience which seems to nail everything it sets out to do. The combat leaves plenty of opportunities for players to experiment with the wide range of moves and create free-flowing combos. In between the combat segments are fun platforming sections which can sometimes take a few tries to get, but never enough to hurt the pacing of the game. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198961683445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1590188205}
review:
[h1]IntroducciÃ³n[/h1]
Guacamelee es un videojuego de plataformeo en 2D que desde mi punto de vista esta algo sobrevalorado resultando ser el ejemplo perfecto de "contenido repetitivo" para rellenar tiempo. En este caso analizarÃ© dividiendo lo positivo y negativo (cosa que nunca he hecho pero probarÃ© esta vez).

[h1]Negativo[/h1]
La historia es la tÃ­pica de la "damisela en apuros" dÃ³nde el "hombre musculoso" debe rescatarla (tÃ­pico clichÃ©). Los personajes estÃ¡n todos estereotipados a propÃ³sito y la verdad no me llama la atenciÃ³n en lo mas mÃ­nimo. Videojuegos como Binary Domain hacen estos estereotipos pero de una manera mas inteligente y va como anillo al dedo mientras que Guacamelee se basa en repetir modismos Mexicanos una y otra vez sin sustento alguno.
Por otro lado los enemigos se repiten continuamente variando solo los jefes finales (los cuales son sencillos en su mayorÃ­a), por ende, resulta demasiado tedioso continuar con la aventura ademÃ¡s de la cantidad innecesaria de puzzles que debes resolver para obtener diferentes cofres, los cuales no compensan tus esfuerzos. Tienes 2 opciones: Recorrer el mapa y buscar rutas alternativas (cosa que siempre hago en todo videojuego que me lo permite y resulte interesante) o la Ãºltima opciÃ³n que es pasar el tÃ­tulo sin rebuscar en ningÃºn lado. Bueno, como comentÃ© "Busco rutas alternas siempre que me lo permitan y me resulte interesante", en este caso me lo permiten pero es otro factor que resulta tedioso debido a que los puzzles son demasiados, las rutas demasiado largas las cuales, a su vez, estÃ¡n repletas de enemigos y las recompensas por seguirlas no valen la pena. SumÃ¡ndole a esto los controles algo imprecisos lo cual resulta imperdonable siendo un plataformero repleto de puzzles que tienes que resolver con precisiÃ³n quirÃºrgica.

[h1]Positivo[/h1]
El humor que posee si bien es algo "simple" da resultado, los nombres de las transformaciones, de los personajes y algunos modismos dan gracia. Pero como bien dije: Cuando esos modismos son utilizados en exceso se vuelve tedioso.
El componente RPG es de lo mejor que tiene el videojuego pudiendo comprar atuendos los cuales tienen pros y contras ademÃ¡s de subir de nivel tu salud, fuerza y diferentes poderes que poseerÃ¡s a lo largo de tu aventura. Los ataques especiales te servirÃ¡n para derrotar enemigos y, a su vez, para abrir caminos. Cada uno de ellos sÃ³lo se puede ejecutar en una direcciÃ³n concreta (de abajo arriba, de arriba abajo, a los lados). De ese modo, aunque encuentres un obstÃ¡culo podrÃ¡s atravesarlo y seguir con tu camino. De esa manera se consigue que no sea trivial desbloquear caminos con poderes que ya tenÃ­as.

[h1]ConclusiÃ³n[/h1]
Guacamelee es un videojuego "distinto" pero mal planteado. Con varios errores en sus diseÃ±os de niveles ademÃ¡s de la falta de variedad de enemigos, sus puzzles algo complicados debido a sus controles imprecisos y su historia mal llevada a cabo y repleta de clichÃ©s vistos miles de veces en otros videojuegos. Por otro lado tiene un humor funcional y un buen componente RPG. Desde mi punto de vista es un videojuego con grandes ideas pero mal llevadas a cabo.

Mi nota: 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322101866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1561936771}
review:
A very fun Metroidvania with a great variety of moves to use and enemies to use them on all unlocked after a period of time. It's a Metroidvania that is filled with culture in the music and in the presentation with unique mechanics that make it stand out from your typical Metroidvania. The boss battles were also excellently designed, while being fairly tough the attacks were always telegraphed nicely and made beating the boss rewarding. If this game looks like your cup of tea from the screenshots I would say give it a shot for sure. There is also local Co-op which I played with one of my friends and it was chaotic and incredibly fun every time we played. 

A.K.A Game good

author: {'steamid': '76561198046049434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1559321200}
review:
Got this game a while back on steam for free at the time when they released their second game. I'm mainly writing the review because of steam summer sale event but I shizz you not, this game is an adventure. I don't play a lot of platformers and beat em' ups, but I tried this one out and I was blown away.
P.S. Please, mind one thing - do not make shortcuts in the game you are not meant to take since it breaks the game and you'll have to try over. Yep... I experienced this myself when I went from Santa Luchita to Sierra Morena without ability called "goat climb" and usind only wall jumps. As you might imagine, I had to start the whole game over........ yeeee......
