author: {'steamid': '76561198010283078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1562110709}
review:
This "Metroidvania" has a focus on platforming and combat. While not as complex as Super Metroid or Symphony of the Night, the game is easy to pick up and play. Your upgrades amount mostly to health and meter upgrades along with a handful of combat techniques that also double as movement enhancers. 

Though some of the end game platforming can be fairly difficult, most of it is optional and players looking for a relaxing time can find that here. This is doubled by many of the map's quality-of-life features. It shows you your percentage completion of each area (based on number of treasures left), the color-coded blocks and treasures you encounter but don't break, and even a quest marker that points you in the general direction of the next story objective.

The game also has co-op, but unfortunately, it's only for local play. You won't be able to play online with your friends.

Overall, this is a quick, but solid and relaxing title with end game content to challenge those who want to go above and beyond.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230704080', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1631558119}
review:
Ended up being way more fun than I wanted to give it credit. A bit sad that for some reason my trophies didn't unlock despite finishing the game but ah well. Still an absolute blast to play and a solid Metroidvania. 
To summarize this game, luchador el chicken rises up from the dead to kick the local skeleton overlord's ass with some spicy sriracha sauce. Includes a furry jaguar too. Whole package.

Also paid a homage to Henski with the Chicken powers. That's how you know the game's good.

The real challenge in the game came on hard mode.

review:
Tight controls, fluent game play, never a dull moment.
Very good game and highly recommended.
You get new abilities at a good pace allowing you to not only traverse the map in a different way, but also change your combat style with new moves.
A must play if you like Metroidvania style games.

review: AWESOME AWESOME Metroidvania game! It was supposed to be a short break i take during exam......but it ended up being a 6 hour spreeeeee......the controls are tight and the game is far, I did find the puzzle segment where you have to earn extra power up a bit too hard though, it was like one of the hardest platformer I have played, where i have played most Castlevania games, finished the whole Bionic Commando Rearmed 1 and 2 (2 on Xbox) and among others. Reccommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071302028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1560636029}
review:
Pros:
- Top notch gameplay that includes a nice variety of moves allowing for simple yet crazy movement options.
- Fun to interact with characters.
- Decent amount of replay value.

Cons:
- Short.
- Replay value comes from wanting to 100% the game, nothing special like secret bosses.
- While the movement is simple, some less experienced players might have trouble getting the controls down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993984165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1563694430}
review: Bad puns, more cheese than Wisconsin, and groan-inducing Spanglish are the fine sprinkle of delicioso on the robust cake of Santa Muerte's brawling and jumpy action platformer. Bright palette punches you in the mouth harder than the evil you pummel and there are mucho collectibles and secrets feeding OCD fan service. Plus pollo. Gigante poll, angry pollo, loco pollo - lots and lots of pollo. Muy, muy bien. Arriba, aribba! Andale, andale! Buy, buy!

review: I can't believe I hadn't played this game sooner. It's a fun side scrolling beat em up, with a silly story full of memorable characters. review: Un metroidvania lleno de sabor mexicano, el sistema de combate es genial y muy pulido, la navegacion en los niveles es increible y se nota el detalle en los mismos pues tiene algo que no se encuentra en muchos metroidvanias hoy en dia y es la combinacion de todas las habilidades que has obtenido para combninarlas en verdaderos retos plataformeros. El arte es hermoso y se premia la exploracion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237833636', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1590475704}
review:
[h1] Mexicano, Stylish, Fair and Fun [/h1]

The game did perfect in bringing the Mexican style inside the game, the combat is really, really good.
the humor in this game is well used in the right areas in the game.

I enjoyed the game alot finishing the (EL Infernio) challenges to get a unique combat technique that is only obtainable through finishing this challenges.. and that's fine/fun to me.

That's right that the game has hard areas that'll take you a significant amount of time to pass, but at the end the game will reward you through the new areas + New gameplay techniques that you'd gain throughout your gameplay.. 

[h1] The game is hard, but fair	[/h1]

 no need for you to play the whole new area again just because you died because of a stupid move you did, you respawn just right before the area you died at.. and that's a huge thing to alot of people who don't like to play hard and a bit-challenging games.

[h1]In the end[/h1] 

I absolutely recommend you to play this game if you already got it for free (like me) or if you are thinking of playing a great stylish game that'd take 10-18 hours out of your time.


I am not spoiling the game, it's a note.
[spoiler](wouldn't you give me some rate ups because I didn't post a "nice" review to get that stupid achievement out of the sale's event?) [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198846757946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1698249928}
{'steamid': '76561198386104818', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1568300039}
review:
Guacamelee! is a metroidvania meets beat em up with a unique art style that is charming and really fun to play. This is videogame at its purest form, great fun with no paywall whatsoever

The Good:
+ The artstyle of this game is just breathtakingly beautiful. The use of color palette in the environment really make this game stand out.
+ The soundtrack is downright amazing. The lively environment is supported by the uplifting music that always plays through the entire 5-6 hours campaign. It might get repetitive to some, but i was too busy enjoying the music to notice.
+ Platformer meets beat em up gameplay that is a cross between castlevania in terms of platforming and streets of rage in terms of fighting. Where other games might have one aspect that is better, Guacamelee! excels in both areas. The controls for this game is excellent, easy to learn but hard to master. Platforming is straightforward in the beginning but as the game progress, Guacamelee! gives the players a lot of platforming-puzzle sequences that are enjoyable and frustrating, but never impossible. Combat is also another thing of highlight for the gameplay, as it can be pretty deep. Like platforming, combat seems like just another button mash at the start but in a few hours time, you'll be using long combos to defeat that gigantic skull titan.
+ The story is really good. Without spoiling anything, it tells a revenge story meets end of the world scenario that is enjoyable to watch from start to finish. A bit of a shame that our main character doesn't talk. The cast of characters that we get to meet on the other hand are laid in variety and hilarious personalities. The goat-man is my personal favorite, reminding me of Rafiki from The Lion King
+ Comedy in this game is just pure gold. It doesn't try too hard to be funny, but tells jokes and lays hilarious scenario at just the right moment.

The Bad:
- A part from a few frustratingly annoying platforming sections and enemy types, this game have very few flaws

The Verdict:
Buy it. Even at full price I feel it is worth every cent. I got it for free and I feel guilty for not spending anything to play this game

author: {'steamid': '76561197984199910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1558915741}
review:
I'm a little embarrassed to admit that I didn't purchase this game, and got it as part of a Humble free giveaway. The only reason I say that is because this game is amazing! 

The summary:
* Super tight platforming and side-scrolling beat-em up game play - no slippy or laggy input on the controls. SUPER TIGHT!
* Metroidvania style game with lots of fun side quests and areas to revisit as you learn more moves.
* Excellent combo system that utilizes pop-ups (ala Marvel V Capcom) that ramps up and becomes more complicated and satisfying the better you get and as you unlock more moves.
* One of the most well written games I've played in years. Laugh out loud dialogue and homages to classic games are everywhere.
* One of the most beautifully stylized games in recent memory.
* Super fluid animations.
* Challenging boss fights, but they are fair. You never feel like you lost because the game was cheesing you. 

Would body slam again. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198845980668', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1561815029}
review:
Quite a fun experience since I wasn't expecting much from a 2D movement game. Stories pretty much on the same level as the sonic games meaning its just there to justify whats being shown and no serious thought was put into it but the true meat of the game is shown through the game play which was surprisingly satisfying with some creative level design which was fun to progress through. 

For free it was well worth my time but whether I'll actually sit back down and finish it off is a myth since these types of games just aren't for me personally.

review:
[h1]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/h1]
En esta gran aventura encarnaremos la piel de "[b]Juan Guacamole[/b]", un campesino normal y corriente que un dÃ­a de forma trÃ¡gica, pierde la vida intentando salvar a la hija del alcalde de su pueblo. Cuando esta en el mundo de los muertos se encuentra una mascara la cual le convertirÃ¡ en el "Mejor Luchador de Lucha Libre".
En su aventura con estilo metroidvania, donde tendrÃ¡ que rescatar a su amada, se encontrara con diversos tipos de enemigos y de nuevos poderes con los cuales derrotara a su archi-enemigo "Calaca".
[h1]Lo Bueno:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Historia sencilla, pero bien desarrollada.[/b]
[*][b]Buen sistema de combate y de jefes (Sobre todo Jaguar Javier) donde tu Ãºnica arma son tus puÃ±os.[/b]
[*][b]Buena mÃºsica ambientada en la cultura mexicana.[/b]
[*][b]Personajes carismÃ¡ticos y divertidos, ademÃ¡s en la ediciÃ³n anglosajona los nombres de lugares y personajes que estÃ©n en espaÃ±ol seguirÃ¡n con su nombre original.[/b]
[*][b]Buena estÃ©tica y diseÃ±o de mapeado y personajes que lo hacen ver mucho mÃ¡s colorido y mexicano por supuesto.[/b]
[*][b]Referencias de otros juegos, Internet y buen humor que te harÃ¡ sacarte una sonrisa si entiendes las referencias.[/b]
[/list]
[h1]Lo Malo:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Hay un bug que se me hizo molesto mientras jugaba, que consiste en que en algunos puzzles se necesitan unas plataformas para poder pasarse. Lo que ocurre es que en algunos puzzles estas plataformas no estaban y habÃ­a que reiniciar la partida para que volvieran a aparecer.[/b]
[/list]
[quote=Marloncha]POLLO POWER![/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197960905909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1561829413}
review:
It's hard to find games that are good in both platforming and combat, this game does it wonderfully.

It's another metroidvania, if you played one of these, you'll know what to expect. It has a nice and colorful artstyle, the characters are fun and likeable, the soundtrack is incredible. As you progress, you get new power-ups that you use to break blocks that block your path. They're also needed for breaking enemy shields, doing some sweet combos and going through some very well-made platforming sections. So the game gets better and better with more power-ups, and ends with one final level which will throw everything at you. There were a few small problems I had when I searched for all the remaining chests after beating the game. There was some boring backtracking and many chests had money, but at that point I already bought everything. The difficulty (in normal mode) is just right.

Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition gets a 10/10
Now off to hard mode

Update: Hard mode beaten. It honestly wasn't as hard as I expected it to be. Enemies do more damage, have more health, bosses are a bit different, etc. If you beat normal mode without much trouble and know some good combos, this mode won't be so hard for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003021103', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1526269588}
review:
Have to say, even though I knew about this game for a while, I still had a blast playing it from the very beginning all the way to the challenging end.

PROS
-Fantastic level design
-Great moveset that let's you traverse and utilize that excellent level design
-Satisfying but simplistic combat that's very responsive
-Fun boss fights that test your combat skills

CONS
-Annoying old memes in some of the areas (Looking at you HUB area)
-One or two of the secret areas you had to get to receive the secret ending were kind of annoying and obtuse

author: {'steamid': '76561198237096312', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1694210077}
review:
Guacamelee is a short and sweet Metroidvania with an emphasis on its combat.  Throughout the game you unlock new moves to both aid you in combat and make new areas of the game accessible through platforming challenges.  Personally I found the platforming more interesting than the combat because the feeling of stringing together half a dozen different attacks to pass a plethora of obstacles was amazing.

The game overall is not particularly challenging though that keeps the pace fast.  It will likely take 6-10 hours to finish the game if you are picking up collectables such as health and stamina upgrades throughout.

The game works well when using a controller or a keyboard.  A small possible issue is that controller bindings cant be modified in-game, though using Steam's controller setup tool this can be fixed.

Overall a solid game which I would recommend to most people who enjoy platforming.

review: This luchador-styled metroidvania should not be missed! Iâ€™ve recommended it to as many people as I possibly can, because I enjoyed it so very much. Vibrant, colourful graphics, very tight controls, enjoyable soundtrack, and fluent combat and movement system all come together with a lighthearted story to make a very memorable and enjoyable experience. The grapple, throw, and punch combo-system leads to rewarding combat that feels engaging instead of repetitive, local co-op is a blast, and the added â€œEl Intenso!â€ power makes the player, who is already plenty strong, feel like an unstoppable tank. I cannot say enough good things about this game, and would say that this should be part of your library regardless of the kind of games you play. Do yourself or a friend a favour, and pick this gem of a game up, especially when itâ€™s on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162516536', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1559424664}
review:
Well, I have to start with that it is one of the funniest platformers with the touch if emotions and love I have ever played. On top of those, it has a lot of interesting and indulging Side Quests. The Graphics, Controls, Story, Sound & Music and the Amazing Environment with lots of variety in terms of enemies, stages and Boss Fights, Oh I love boss fights in this game.
No doubt this is a masterpiece; a must buy game and I am surely gonna get its next instalment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013252716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2153, 'last_played': 1624815129}
review:
Ein tolles Spiel im Geiste der alten 2D-Klassiker (vor allem Metroid und Castlevania), das nicht nur mit eigener AtmosphÃ¤re und schÃ¶ner Grafik punktet, sondern auch mit guter Steuerung und eingÃ¤ngiger Musik. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad sollte dennoch nicht unterschÃ¤tzt werden.

PersÃ¶nlich denke ich aber, dass die unzÃ¤hligen Verweise und Referenzen auf andere Medien der groÃŸe Pluspunkt dieses Spiels sind. Mit liebevoller Freude am Detail werden alte und aktuelle Spieleklassiker und Filme zitiert, was im Spielverlauf eine gÃ¤nzlich neue Herausforderung stellt: Wer kann alle Zitate erkennen?

Eine kleine Sammlung habe ich hier zusammengestellt:

http://pixeldiskurs.de/2015/05/28/das-kulturelle-verweisfeuerwerk-in-guacamelee

author: {'steamid': '76561198391273080', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1731, 'last_played': 1565577175}
review:
This is one of the best Metroidvanias I have ever played.

It has a decent story. 5/10
It has amazing and fun controls. 8/10
It makes excellent use of its mechanics in puzzles and challenges to earn rewards. 9.5/10
It is simply a challenging game if you put the effort in to get 100% like i did. (still haven't beaten on hard mode)
Guacamelee! STCE is really good and fun to beat. Its areas are complex with lots of secrets including ones you have to go back for to collect.

This game really rewards you for the time you spend to complete it. Overall a good game, really fun if you have some friends for some quick and fun sessions. 
Overall: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165472733', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1607654764}
review:
As a mexican myself I have to say that this game is really well documented and despite the plot is a big cliche, it fells funny beacuse is really well executed; you cand find references to real mexican culture, and I have to say that it's really nice to see apreciation to our country from foreigner developers. 
Anyway, behind the tematic you will find a game with very polished  mechanics in their combat system that can be boot a button smasher or a well worked combo system. The level desing is good and the art is colorfull and cute, and I rally liked the music wich is like a kind of electro-mariachi. 100% recomended.

review:
Guacamelee Ã© um jogo do tipo Metroidvania com uma temÃ¡tica baseada no Dia de los muertos. A histÃ³ria do jogo Ã© bem divertida e seus personagens sÃ£o cheios de tiradas e vÃ¡rias referÃªncias as outras obras do entretenimento (destaque pra uma referÃªncia do Super Mario haha). O gameplay do jogo Ã© bem dinÃ¢mico e a dificuldade do jogo cresce junto com o jogador fazendo com que o jogo tenha seus momentos difÃ­ceis, mas que em nenhum momento se tenha uma sensaÃ§Ã£o de que aquilo nÃ£o serÃ¡ possÃ­vel de se passar. 

O jogo Ã© cheio de segredos e pra quem gosta de explorar e procurar por cada cantinho vai acrescentar mais um bom tempo de diversÃ£o. 

Como um apaixonado por Metroidvania, Guacamelee foi um jogo que me agradou muito em todos os seus aspectos. Super recomendo!!!

review:
That's a really nice game. I thought that it's going to be another button clicker fighting game, but surprisingly no! :)
Game is well made, lots of levels, challenges, side missions and orb levels which were the most difficult.

The only thing I do not like is sierra morena. This map is basically made for one special move, so it's quiet repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166721094', 'num_games_owned': 967, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1561440136}
review:
[h1][i]Quick Review:[/i]Hollow Knight has company[/h1]

As the title suggests, this is honestly on of the absolute best, cream-of-the-crop metroidvania platformers in existence. It is the perfect emalgamation of both genres into a visually stunning and well-packaged experience that I am unlikely to forget.

Take a break from metroidvanias after Guacamelee, because nothing else will ever hold a candle to this experience.

review: What a fantastic game!  Beautiful art style with elements of humour throughout, all topped off with a good dollop of challenge!  Plenty of little easter eggs to find for the keen gamer too.  I enjoyed thoroughly though I found some of the later levels and puzzles were a true test!!

review: Pretty chill metroidvania game! Plenty of combat options, nice visuals and some sick platforming sections (Treetops was expecially amazing)! My only complain is that it's a tad too easy and i wish the hard option was avaiable from the get go...

author: {'steamid': '76561198873837238', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1594635020}
review: A really fun metroidvania, short, but with very interesting mechanics and level design, the wrestling atmosphere fits very well too. The history it`s not relevant, but punching skeletons in the face really compensates it

author: {'steamid': '76561198046334739', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1616896191}
review:
As you can see I checked that I received the game for free, but don't think that's why I highly recommend it, I would have happily paid full price for this had I known how much enjoyment I'd get so far. 

This is definitely a must have for anyone who enjoys metroidvania type games or even 2d platformers in general. 
With it's;

Creative level design that rewards you for paying attention to the map and remembering all of your acquired abilities

Satisfying combat with diverse enemies and types 

Distinct, clean art style paired with a soundtrack capable of getting you better into the groove of the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198051407386', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1561312658}
review:
He seguido Drink Box studios desde que compre tales from space mutant blobs attack   para la psvita y quede encantado de lo colorido de su juego, al igual de lo divertido de su jugabilidad, con guacamelee no es diferente, mesclan todo lo bueno de un juego plataforma con un diseÃ±o tipo metroidvania pero sin tener mucha profundidad. 

Colores alegres, un soundtrack al ritmo del mariachi y con una fuerte influencia de la cultura Mexicana.

Con un gran diseÃ±o de niveles con multiples habilidades de combates con multiples tipos de combos para tener un poco mÃ¡s de variedad y sobre todo un diseÃ±o artistico aunque es algo minimalista, tiene mucha personalidad.

Lo negativo es que dura solo 5 horas asÃ­ que te quedas con ganas de mÃ¡s. 

Yo recomiendo este juego fuertemente, no he jugado el 2 pero caerÃ¡ pronto y pueden creerme que la mayorÃ­a de los juegos de drink box son bastante divertidos tanto que han ganado mi interÃ©s para seguir este estudio  y ver que mÃ¡s nos pueden traer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007660744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1561228831}
review: It's a good game, like Guacamelee was, but there aren't a lot of changes. I don't think it's worth it if you already played the original, but otherwise this is a solid choice. The combat is fluid, the platforming is challenging but rewarding, there are plenty of secrets to find and optional challenges, and the graphics are great. The Intenso Mode (super mode that you can activate basically whenever) does cheapen the combat, but you don't gave to use it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265934985', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1563100122}
review:
Great co-op fun with a friend if you have an extra controller, totally recommend it to anyone who's ever enjoyed a platformer. Pretty fun, addictive combat system and some cool gimmicks, especially when it comes to using the different dimensions and special attacks/moves for platforming puzzles. 

Only problem is that it sometimes becomes a hassle when both you and co-op partner are trying to do the same puzzle and you keep messing each other up or going off screen. In those situations it's just more convenient to have the second player turn into a bubble that follows P1 and just let him do the puzzle in peace. The game gets pretty challenging near the end, but never too much. In fact, we beat the entire thing without realizing you could scroll down on the ability upgrade list in the shop and upgrade a bunch of other things (lol). Fairly short, but I'd say you definitely get your money's worth. Good times!

review:
From FAQ :
"My controller doesn't work properly.
If it's an XBOX or XInput-compatible controller, it should just work."

Reality : no it does not beause you made a beginner mistake to only listen the index 0 instead of requiring a button press to determine the controller assignment.
Elementary technical requirement flaw = user experience ruined = bad review.

If it was not for that, great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027949508', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1560725668}
review:
This game is just the right balance of everything: not too hard, but not too easy.  Not too long, not too short.  A decent amount of attack combos, but not so much that you have a hard time memorizing them.  Most of the time, checkpoints are close enough that if you die, it isn't frustrating to get back where you left off.  Visual style is simple but unique; it isn't yet another boring pixel-art game.  I also really like the differences between the world of the dead and the living, and the gameplay mechanics revolving around that.

I do have some minor gripes though:
* Why do all the people have a serious case of jaundice?
* Coins are way too easy to collect, but silver isn't.  A lot of the secret or locked-away areas give you coins as a reward, which frankly just isn't worth the time and effort it takes to reach them.
* Music is good but there needs to be just a little bit more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042590081', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1560882852}
review:
Quite an enjoyable game so far, rewards you for keeping landing and maintaining combos.

The combat itself is pretty fun and challenging, but...

Sadly some of the "boss" fights are a disappointment due to them having only few attack patterns and they don't act reactively towards the player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002134811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1560744797}
review: Guacamelee is a good game, with a few flaws, but fun to play in general. I played single player, so I can't comment on co-op, but the brawling metroidvaina gameplay was pretty satisfying. The graphic style was a little basic, but still very colorful, fluid and unique. The frequent checkpoints kept me going, as well as the thrill of winning a tough battle. There were plenty of times that a fight felt kind of cheap and unfair, and some pretty brutal platforming challenges, but mostly it's pretty doable. I just wish it was a little more consistent with fewer spikes in difficulty. The way the character feels can be a little stiff, it's not as fluid as a game like Ori or Hollow Knight. Overall I'd give it the recommend, but I felt a bit too frustrated too often to give it a very strong endorsement. It's very creative, so if some challenge doesn't put you off, it's worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027453870', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1605384108}
review:
A great mexican themed Metroidvania.

Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is a revised version of the original Guacamelee Gold Edition, featuring new content. the game is a Metroidvania where the main focus is platforming with enemies to take out all set in a Mexican styled world. For my very first Metroidvania it was a wonderful experience with good gameplay and solid combat mechanics and plenty of extras.

Gameplay, Guacamelee's gameplay is simple but solid featuring basic platforming with a extensive move set that you use both for platforming and combat. It is very easy to get used to Juan's (Main Character) jump arc and be able to land jumps. Plus along the way you moves will increase so you can pull off some awesome combos. Speaking of combos, Guacamelee's combat is also a major portion of the game, encouraging you to build large combos with a variety of moves. as such with extensive combat, there are enemies galore with many different ways of combat and different ways to deal with them. Dodging from attacks is very crucial to survive. 

Story wise. It's fairly simple but it does have parts of a more deep story. But Guacamelee just gets to the point since the game also has a comedy side to its sinister story featuring both living and undead worlds being fused together. I mean this a game with giant chickens tutoring you how to perform complicated combos. Yeah, this game likes their chickens.

Another major aspect of Guacamelee is it artstyle and ambiance. Featuring a more angular style, fitting in with the Mexican style. Since you switch between the two worlds of living and dead, each area has 2 different visual style. Also is the absolute banger of a soundtrack, which is featured in this version for free. Its kinda a mix between traditional Mexican music and the more modern style of music creating a very catchy and unique style. Finally as sort of a minor feature is custom costumes brought by the Steam Workshop, while I didn't use the stat changing costumes, the feature of the custom costumes add a nice touch to this fantastic Metroidvania. Also, I adore the references in the game.

Overall, Guacamelee was probably the best Metroidvania to play for a first timer. Its solid platforming and satisfying combat really seal the deal for this game. I really wished for a lot more from the game outside of the extra content, luckily there was a sequel released and I'm excited to try it out. 

Also screw you steam for not letting me get free card drops 3:<

author: {'steamid': '76561198448984535', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1560339757}
review:
Guacamelee! is a great game. The first thing you'll notice about it is how well-tuned the controls are. It's fast, fun and responsive. The game's overall difficulty level is neither too easy nor too tough. It manages to be just right without being unfair or sudden in its difficulty spikes. The music, though limited, is catchy and will get stuck in your head. The platforming is simple enough and slowly scales up in challenge as the game progresses. There are a few optional side activities which are nothing to write home about. The metroidvania style exploration is fun but there's not much reason to backtrack through the games levels unless you want health buffs/stamina bars, etc... And last but not least, the game's humor is actually funny which is pretty rare in videogames.

My only beef with the game is that the so-called "real" ending is locked behind an optional side activity. If you're really good at platformers, you can get through the game in about 6 or so hours but if you're just average at them like me, it will take you a bit more. Guacamelee! is a solid game I would easily recommend.

Final verdict: 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412433006', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1559277582}
review:
Hola a esta reseÃ±a, no se cuantas llevo pero esta vez le toca a Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition y asÃ­ como en las otras reseÃ±as aquÃ­ tambiÃ©n dirÃ© los puntos positivos, negativos y mi conclusiÃ³n de este juego.

Puntos Positivos.
1: La Jugabilidad del juego es genero metroidvania por es obvio que tendrÃ¡s que re-explorar las zonas del principio tiempo despuÃ©s aunque los movimientos son los clÃ¡sicos del genero.
2: El Soundtrack del juego la verdad no decepciona aunque hay pocos temas que no son tan buenos como otros.
3: Los Jefes me gustaron mucho por lo diferentes son todos y cada uno de ellos.
4: Los DiseÃ±os estÃ¡n bien ya que no son simples por que hasta los enemigos genÃ©ricos tienen buen diseÃ±o asÃ­ que no hay ninguna queja.
5: La DuraciÃ³n esta bien por que depende en el como sepas jugar a este tipo de juegos.

Puntos Negativos.
1: La Dificultad en varias partes de la partida se nota muy desbalanceada o muy injusta para el jugador por lo menos eso no pasa con los jefes.
2: La Historia es la tÃ­pica de secuestro a lo mario por lo que no necesito decir mas.

ConclusiÃ³n: El juego lo recomiendo mucho a todos los jugadores amantes de los metroidvanias y si nunca has probado uno esta es tu oportunidad de probarlo.

review: One of my favorite games ever. Very challenging, especially near the end, but extremely well-made. Can be frustratingly tough at times, but combat is relatively fluid and fun. I've beat the game twice - once on normal and once on hard mode and enjoyed it both times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1560276260}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is a really great game, I am unashamed to say. I picked up the original game around the time it launched on Xbox and I have really enjoyed the series ever since. I am looking forward to Guacamelee 2, and I would easily recommend any of the Guacamelee games to fans of metroidvania style gameplay, or fans of beat'em ups and platformers in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080534723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1560082090}
review:
Got it for free on Humble. Didn't expect anything, but got surprised.

The metroidvania part is solid, but what makes it special is the mix with the mexican wrestling prince of persia setting. Nice artwork, some humour, easter eggs and cool level design.

Played it to 100% and looking forward to play its sequel in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062229668', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1560071255}
review:
Didn't have high expectations when I got the game. Boy, was I wrong. This is a very solid game! Pretty art direction, a soundtrack that is always fun to listen to, snappy moves and mechanix. It's a blast to plow through enemies and activate the 'Intenso Mode'. There are some parts that might be a little frustrating to get through but those far and few in between. 

However there is one big problem with this game: the final boss. The difficulty curve suddenly goes up to the point you feel that it's almost unfair. He has two phases, the first one being quite easy but it's the second one that feels unfair.

But I can definitely recommend this game if you like a metrovania style brawler that oozes style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036127803', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1560112460}
review:
Guacamelee is a 2D Metroidvenia styled platforming beat'em'up. A game genre almost as convoluted as the game's name.
There's not much to be said here that hasn't already been said by the hundreds of other people here.

It's got tight, fun platforming. However, it can be a little clunky getting up certain ledges.

The fighting is challenging but not unfair. If ever I find myself getting hit a lot, its good to try different tactics. Adaptation is key in this game. There are tons of moves you unlock overtime, with endless possible combos that are both fun and satisfying to pull off, which keeps the combat from getting stale.

Fantastic game overall. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198102700771', 'num_games_owned': 2113, 'num_reviews': 823, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1559982686}
review:
Guacamelee is one of the best action platformer games that I played.

+ Gameplay is perfect and satisfying.
+ Very nice art style.
+ References.
+ Funny jokes.
+ Challenges that are hard as ****
+ Secrets and collectibles.
+ Alright characters.
+ Game was playable without a controller at least for me.
+ Difficulty scaling so hang in there, action will come.
+ Possible local co-op.
+ Music fits in with this theme.
-/+ This type of story is nothing new but I liked it anyway.
+ Large world.
+ Chickens.


- A lot of backtracking if you want more collectibles.
- Sounds could get annoying.

Luchador your princess is in another castle 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088446752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1560064429}
review:
Guacamelee has a lot of what I liked about the mechanics of Hollow Knight, but without feeling like a ripoff. The controls don't feel as tight in a way I can't quite put my finger on, but at the same time the metroidvania platforming if anything gives you even more chances to feel like a master than Hollow Knight did. I find the humor to be very fun and the characters to be entertaining and interesting.
My only real complaints are that the PC controls aren't great (they say that using a controller is recommended, and they mean it), and that I don't know enough about Mexican culture to be 100% sure it isn't super offensive, but I don't think it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014140422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1559832036}
review:
It's an incredibly silly, fun take on platformers meeting lucha meeting silly memes meeting a bad dio de los muertos, and I'm pretty sure it'd be absolutely worth recommending if it were listed as a "controller required" game.

However, I played using the keyboard, and a couple of hours into the game the controls - which are effectively the main puzzle in the game - become so convoluted it just isn't actually fun (well, maybe in a Dark Souls kind of way, but that doesn't really line up with the silly story).

As such, I can't actually recommend playing using the keyboard, so I won't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286829743', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1639136457}
review: Great 2D brawler and platformer. Metroidvania elements boil down to a big box that you need a specific power to break, but they all add to the combat so they don't just act as keys. Great music, if a bit repetitive, great aesthetic, great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092638112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1559816940}
review:
It's not a bad game, but I am not going to ever be able to finish it.
Why? Because I don't have a controller.
There are literally as many buttons are their are on a controller that all control very essential things related to maneuvering your character and without a controller you'll end up with very bad hand cramping and will often hit the wrong button. It's simply not rational to try this game without a controller. You seriously need a controller to have the most fun with this, otherwise you won't be able to manage the buttons and remember properly what you're doing. 

Seriously; keyboard layout is just weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034579111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1559737489}
review:
Ein wirklich gutes Jump'n Run Adventure.

Spiele als Juan, einen jungen Mann, welcher in einem Mexico nachempfundenen Land gegen DÃ¤monen aus der Unter- bzw. Totenwelt kÃ¤mpfen muss, um die Welt und seine Freundin zu retten.
Werde von einem armen Bauernjungen zu einem groÃŸen Luchador (im Grunde Profiwressler) und bekÃ¤mpfe die Armee und Gefolgsleute des bÃ¶sen Carlos Calaca.
Erwirb neue FÃ¤higkeiten und lÃ¶se RÃ¤tsel oder erfÃ¼lle Nebenaufgaben und suche nach geheimen Truhen, deren Belohnungen und Inhalt dich stÃ¤rker machen und wappnen, im Kampf gegen die dunklen MÃ¤chte.

Es ist ziemlich liebevoll gestaltet und bietet zumindest fÃ¼r etwa 6 Stunden (+/- 2) eine Menge zu entdecken und zu erleben.

Einzige zwei Punkte, welche ich bemÃ¤ngle, ist die Steuerung, welche nicht immer genau so will, wie man selbst das will und das einige Aufgaben meiner Meinung nach zu schwierig sind bzw. nicht richtig funktionieren - bspw. kann ich die letzte Aufgabe im Trainingsdojo des Huhns nicht erfÃ¼llen, da die Tastenkombination leider nicht einwandfrei anwendbar ist. 
Zudem sind die Zeit- und Kampfaufgaben in der Unterwelt meiner Meinung nach zu schwierig, bis fast unmÃ¶glich um auf Gold zu kommen.

fÃ¼r 14â‚¬ kÃ¶nnte es zwar etwas lÃ¤nger gehen bzw. mehr Inhalt bieten, kann man aber trotzdem machen. Vor allem heutzutage, bekommt man fÃ¼r weit mehr teils weit schlechtere, unvollstÃ¤ndige und minderwertige/mangelhafte Spiele. Somit kann man eigentlich durchaus zufrieden damit sein.

Meine Wertung 8 von 10 Punkte

author: {'steamid': '76561198021141277', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1559723554}
review:
"Crouching" or "moving low" is to become a fucking chicken/10.

On a serious note, good game, but its not very forgiving. You do the same damage from when you start the game or get abilities than when you are fighting the final boss, although enemies dont change that much, and every single damn hit from the enemies or anything that can hit you as little as possible is gonna give you the same huge flying knockback that makes you useless for about 3 seconds. Being stunlocked until death is easy and has happened. You will rage at least some with this game. Still good tho. Kudos to the music department.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100896635', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1563365574}
review:
This kind of game is the one I am looking for, simple graphics, Platform Gameplay, good story line (even though I haven't beat the game yet). Brings back the old games when you play games like this on arcade, Family computers, and Gameboys. 

It doesn't give you stress, but makes your brain work on solving simple problems... which is good for kids too.

5/5 overall for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063185086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1592696228}
review:
I told my friend "I really, really wish there was some kind of Metroidvania based all around melee combat and creative movement abilities" and my friend told me "you should play Guacamelee!" and when it was available for free, I did.

Totally worth it! Really punchy, flashy, fun. Combat is totally killer. The platforming actually gets *more* challenging the more abilities you unlock and uses them all to their full extent. Scouring for hidden items isn't frustrating and just running around and punching, headbutting, and suplexing things is wonderfully cathartic.

If I had any gripes it's that the difficulty can be unbalanced in your favor; if you save up your silver coins you can buy the game-breaking alternate costume less than halfway in. The story is pretty cut-and-dry and a lot of the humor seems to be "referencing other popular games", but all that is tolerable...

If you're into Metroidvania games this one's worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836554158', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2104, 'last_played': 1559412760}
review:
It so happened that, due to different reasons (mainly real life issues hitting like a train), I've completely skipped/missed on this game back in the days when it came out on consoles and PC, and didn't had a chance/time to get my hands on it ever since. I haven't been around Steam for more than a decade either, making a new account only just recently, and...I was pleasantly surprised to see this particular version of this game, which is essentially a definitive release (if not counting console-exclusive DLC and achievements), was given out completely for free, just a couple days ago from when I'm writing down this review.

So, please, when you read this review, do take a note that: a) I've never ever played Guacamelee before until just very recently, and I essentially didn't know anything at all about this game until I've started playing it, b) I got this particular release/version completely for free when it was given out for a short time, so my perception is obviously going to be skewed a bit because, hey, a completely free thing is free no matter what, even if some bad games can be given away freely too (gladly, this one is not such of a case).

Now for "pros"/"cons".

Pros:
1. Colorful world that's brimming with energy.
There's constantly something going on and it's always pretty to look at. Despite this game's deliberately stylized cubic 2D presentation, almost everything in the game is lighted up and shadowed properly, making things "pop" beautifully and don't look any "flat" at all. This is a living, breathing world that you're getting instantly immersed in.

2. Meticulous design that definitely stands out.
The game has it's own unique "face" that can't be mistaken for anything else. Considering that this was initially an indie title by newcomer devs, it's actually a very well done work and definitely a hit in the bullseye right from the get-go. A massive success from the first try, is what I'm saying. I've played a lot of indies of differing quality levels during my life, and Guacamelee definitely stands out as it's essentially a "no less than AA" tier of an indie product, it's way above majority of indies that are available on Steam, sheer "attention to details"-wise.

3. Gameplay mechanics and movement/fighting control quality are insanely solid.
The game controls extremely well, be that moving the character around, doing platforming and puzzles, or fighting. Every single last press of a button/key is very responsive, fast, and exactly correct. Timing is also not bad or very strict at all and allows for big delays between presses, so you really don't have to be a professional fighting game tourney player with an arcade stick, to master this game's fighting mechanics all the way through and through. And this game definitely rewards anyone who has experience of dealing with fighting games in general, since fighting in this game feels very natural and smooth, for me personally it was almost right at home. Regardless, you can play this game well even if you don't play fighting games at all, as game's well-constructed timings totally allow that. This game is a feast for both the seasoned hardcore gamers such as myself and for complete newbies alike, no one gets left behind. Huge kudos to the developer team for doing gameplay so well, and at the very first try no less.

4. Very good sound/music.
The musical tracks are unique, there's a plenty of them (though it gets just a little bit repetitive at the end),  and their arrangements differ depending on the state of "plane" you're currently in, which is always a welcome addition. It almost never gets boring. Sound clips in general are very well done too, though I personally would've liked even more variety in sound cues for characters, chicken, and etc. But for the first attempt this is a definite success nonetheless.

5. Saving feature is very well done.
"Checkpoints" are aplenty, automatic saving is done constantly, it's absolutely not intrusive and insanely fast on both save itself and loading later. Quite honestly, the saving/loading mechanic of this game is so barely even noticeable, yet absolutely solid in it's implementation, that I don't even treat "save points" as being ones, but rather just as mere "checkpoints". It's just THAT fast and easy. I should note, however, that my game is installed onto a fast SSD, so maybe it'll be a bit less smooth and seamless for people who still use HDDs even nowadays.

6. Plenty of content and challenge.
This game is a Metroidvania all way through and through, alright. There's a ton of nooks and crannies, hidden rooms and secret locations to which you can get only by getting and using particular skills, and even full combinations of several different skills altogether in unison is required to accomplish especially challenging tasks at some points. Yet, despite that, this game is balanced just SO WELL that it doesn't as much present a "challenge" necessarily, rather than attempts to sincerely TEACH you how to play WELL games of such genre/type. Guacamelee's platforming and puzzle "challenges" are definitely of that kind where you have to use both your hands and your head well, and by doing it correctly you're always guaranteed to obtain a good/worthwhile prize, so sense of accomplishment is ALWAYS present and NEVER lets go right until the very end of the last "stage". Especially when you see that "golden medal" and a "100%" marked under the location on the "world map". To say that Guacamelee's developers knew what they're doing and where exactly to hit to poke at all of the classical "gamer satisfaction" spots, is to greatly underestimate things. Guacamelee isn't just a very good game in on by itself. It's a VERY high quality "Metroidvania". I'm not going to exaggerate it even one slightest bit by saying that it's right up there next to ones of the best Castlevania games ever released out there. Yes, it's no Hollow Knight or etc., but, hey, Hollow Knight was after. It's also no Super Metroid, but it sure as hell got pretty close to that point. I sincerely cannot friggin' wait now to try Guacamelee 2 soon and see if this already-perfected formula was greatly expanded/improved upon even further by these devs.

7. Unique characters and story.
Every single character, as well as almost every NPC and enemy type, all of them have their distinct unmistakable looks, designs, and behaviors. The story is short, but it's well written and it even deconstructs some of the cliches such a scenario tends to present. In the end it's, of course, a pretty simple and straightforward tale, but there's some NPCs that are right out-of-this-world to specifically mess up with your perception of this game, which is quite funny, and there's also more than one ending, which makes character development even more solid in the end. And TON of constant Easter eggs/allusions/references/nodes to other games and movies, their characters, and etc., some of which are SO bizarre that only a truly seasoned and very knowledgeable hardcore gamer such as myself could instantly recognize/remember them. Huge kudos, devs. You know your stuff, alright.

Almost (almost, but not ALL of them..read below for the cons) every last thing in this game was polished to the state of absolute perfection, essentially.

Cons:
1. There's currently (as I'm writing this down) a bug/glitch present in the game, which can completely lock you out of obtaining a particular achievement during very first play-through, thus essentially forcing you to start the entire game over from scratch/via Hard mode.
This is a bad thing and I sincerely hope that this wasn't actually intended by the devs, so I eagerly await for them to do a fix/patch, so that it won't ever happen again to anyone else after me. I've learned about this from my own bad experience, so I believe that developers must act. Here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/275390/discussions/0/1644290458825505662/.

2. Analog (DualShock 4) is finicky while in the air/jumping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198426287042', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1580003884}
review:
First of all, Guacamelee is a fantastic game. It combines Mexican culture with the Metroidvania style, creating what I like to call a comedic mexican Hollow Knight. To the topics: 

Graphics: Really good, they have put a lot of attention on the details, and putting to account that every inch of the map had to be made twice because of the Dimension Swap abililty, they did a very good job. Loved it.

Gameplay: Exactly the same from start to finish. You punch bad guys, then you learn new ways to punch badder guys, but you know what? That is not bad at all. The gameplay is fluid and fun, when you start learning more about the special moves you will start chaining them, killing bad guys with style and efficiency.

Music: It's good. No, it's really fu*cking good. For real, from the Forest to the Canals, the Pico de Gallo to the Temple of Rain, it is really well produced. And even better, every song has a World of the Dead remix, since everytime you swap dimensions the song changes. Loved the music.

Audience: Any age, simple story and gameplay made for everyone.

PC Requeirements: Not much, since it is a 2D game. My PC sucks dick and I was able to play it smoothly as TBoI.

Difficulty: Easy to learn, hard to master. The main game is actually pretty easy, but as soon as you reach the Inferno challenges and the Hard Mode, get ready for some next level stuff. Challenges like 15, 8 and 3 might be a pain, just as hard mode Flame Face and Jaguar Javier. Buy I managed to finish everything in less that 24 total hours, so a little bit of determination and you're good to go.

Story: Usual plot, a farmer finds out some dark lord got a princess hostage for some evil plan and now he has to use some new magical power he got from a unusual item to cross worlds and save her. Jokes aside, the plot is good, well structured and it has two endings, so hell yeah!

Game Time: For me, less than 24 hours I completed the game, but it depends on skill, a lot. For the usual casual players, it might be like almost 30 hours. The story can be completed in less than 8.

Price: I got it for free, but it's damn worth its price.

Bugs: Didn't see any, the only problem I got had to do with hitboxes.

It's a fun game, for everyone to enjoy. Buy it, get 100%, then go look up on others complaining about it on reddit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090985587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1559283176}
review:
Antes que nada dirÃ© que me tomÃ© la molestia de terminarlo con su final bueno y casi 100%

Algunas cosas fueron disfrutables. Tiene muy buenas ideas pero la ejecuciÃ³n me pareciÃ³ bastante mala. Los controles son horribles y reaccionan igual de horriblemente. El cabezazo amarillo a veces ni sale y te quedas como un salame recibiendo tortazos a la cara, otras veces sale en lugar del puÃ±o derpderp. A veces el movimiento se detiene en seco. La manera que se pega a las paredes y corta todo momentum es espantosa. Los trow y los slam la mitad de las veces hace el que quiere. 
Toma por dificultad tirar un montÃ³n de enemigos que se enciman y te dan de a saques mientras no puedes encargarte de todos ellos juntos porque tienen escudos o no pertenecen al mismo mundo. En el aspecto plataformero estÃ¡ bastante bien, se pone algo frustrante y tedioso para el final y ni hablar del infierno, pero en general es decente e ingenioso. Lo malo es que tendrÃ¡s que hacer cada "puzzle" cada vez que quieras investigar un Ã¡rea para buscar ese cofrecito que quedÃ³ por ahÃ­ suelto ya que te faltaba algÃºn que otro movimiento; el sistema de fast travel deja que desear.
La mÃºsica parece buena al principio, pero tras un tiempo escuchando lo mismo una y otra vez comencÃ© a detestarla, es como darte de a taladrazos en las amÃ­gdalas.
Lo que sÃ­, grÃ¡ficamente es muy bonito. 
Pero en fin, las cositas buenas no consiguen dejar la balanza a su favor para mÃ­. Si lo conseguiste gratis, bien, probalo. Â¿Comprarlo? ComprÃ¡ Hollow Knight mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228104384', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2042, 'last_played': 1559139517}
review:
So it was a freebie on humble recently, but I got around to reviewing just now because I only now finished this.

I would say this game is definetly far from perfect as metroidvanias go, it doesn't take long to start comparing very similar abilities, level design tropes and other similarities to other metroidvanias you played, so far most of my mechanical comparisions turn out to be against Ori and the Blind Forest, but the abilities mostly remain somewhat consistent anongst all games, just that Ori had set the bar pretty high.

[h1]Exploration[/h1]
Well anyway, the metroidvania exploration doesn't feel very fun with most of the abilities being mostly combat oriented and with little application in the world beyond breaking color coded blocks. The few abilities that seem rather fun, unique and help you traverse the world the most are coincidentally the final two. The uppercut to extend your jump, wall jumping and the double jump were okay too, but those are a standard for these types of games and they weren't mechanically cutting edge either.
The dash is underwhelming due to the short range and inability to chain it, meaning it is just an offensive and not a defensive move. The headbutt exists just to pad out the abilities with more colored blocks to break, it is just really a strong attack you'd expect to start out with. Ground slam is okay, working as you expect it too, no complaints there. The final two are definetly unique ways to traverse the world and get used in a cool boss fight centered around them, they save face for the underwhelming early game ones for sure.

[h1]Combat[/h1]
The best part of the game is the combat, though it is not perfect either, with my biggest gripe being how almost all of the special moves are bound to being B + Directional Key/Standing Still which is bizzare given dimension swap and dodge have two buttons dedicated to each of them. Which makes it easy to pull off the wrong moves, as well as make the headbutt hard to trigger since you have to let go of the directional keys but the game does have some degree of input queueing which is annoying since some enemies have shields that can be broken with that move only.
The grapples are good though, one of the challenge rooms disables your special moves and you really get to see how much mileage you can get out of the various grapples you can do.
The boss fights are pretty good, the enemy variety is sufficient enough, some enemies being in the background dimension makes it more varied not letting you cheap out of everything with aimed throw, and hard mode does add aditional hazards into arenas instead of just buffing the enemy damage values.

[h1]Platforming[/h1]
Now here's a mixed opinion on this, it's rather good by itself, staying rather fresh with how it shifts styles from being something like Celeste in some areas while being more like Super Meat Boy in others, some dimension swap goodness, plus the two unique abilities providing something very special in the other places, most of the filler areas that aren't challenge rooms or collectable rooms are rather bland.
And the game lacks some good platforming design features, like being able to look down to not make a leap of faith(most levels do not have you going down above death pits but you can definetly rage because of this in those that do), as well as not have a level preview spot in the harder platforming bits, which doesn't help that the cross-dimension platform outlines do not show which walls and platforms may have slippery surfaces and where. Something you would benefit from being able to look up and swap around dimesnions as you do to plan out your route.
Plus there are some questionable design choices like a time attack room being filled with breakable blocks to make you lose time, but the blocks not respawning making it pointless beyond making you not succeed the first time through, also the things that deal damage to you, falling off a cliff doesn't, but hitting spikes does, some areas are rather forgiving on failing, others will kick you back far to the last checkpoint if you happen to fail in a specific way too much, just why.
In short the platforming is alright in platforming areas, but if you want good platforming as a priority, get a different game, a dedicated platformer, as the metroidvania filler platforming is rather bland.

[h1]World and Story[/h1]
The story premise is just the basic you are the hero, save the princess and the world thing.
The worldbuilding and the theme is the truly special part, though I'm a bit annoyed at just how many obvious video game references are crammed in there all over the place.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Even though this game is far from perfect I had a pretty good time with it, the combat is good, as well as the occasional dedicated platforming sections, the overall metroidvania experience may not be that hot, but it is saved by the dedicated challenge areas that provide interesting platforming and combat scenarios without the filler of the general commute around the world, which is gorgeous the first few times, but you get annoyed at how slow general traversal is because the really helpful moves are so situational.
I enjoyed my time with it and did not dread having to replay it, so a thumbs up from me, I'm actually looking forward to playing the sequel someday as it looks mechnically more polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408172270', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1559949878}
review:
como ya es costumbre reseÃ±o los juegos antes de acabarlos jjeje, pero que puedo decir


lo bueno:

los graficos son muy buenos, te sumergen en el nivel y la verdad recuerdan mucho a los de rayman origins o a los de rayman legends

la jugabilidad las mecanicas de los ataques especiales y el backtracking que tienes que hacer cuando las desbloqueas lo hace muy divertido, me encanta esa parte

la inspiracion que tienen en la historia y personajes recuerda bastante a la cultura mexicana efectivamente, sobretodo a el sector "mas pobre" o la mayoria, lo que lo hace muy bueno a mi parecer puesto que reprecenta la verdadera cultura

lo malo: 

la historia es un poco monÃ³tona y aburrida, tienes que rescatar a una mujer indefensa de un villano y viajas a traves de etapas en donde derrotas a uno de sus esbirros o subditos, Â¿no les suena muy parecido a cierta saga de videojuegos? 

los dialogos, pueden ser muy simples y fuera de lugar, o que te topes con gente que en tu vida as visto/conocido y derrepente te dejan entrar a su casa y te dicen que les traigas queso tortillas y salsa, aparte de que tocando el mismo tema de la historia es muy aburrida por asÃ­ decirlo

el lenguaje es muy "politicamente correcto" no es algo que deba enorgullecernos, pero a decir verdad no es un juego mexicano sin un "chingados" "madres" o "pinche", aun asÃ­ logran captar el lenguaje mas mexicano con palabras como "neta" "carnal" (ejem rosa de guadalupe ejem) 

en resumen: 

recomiendo el juego mucho, es muy divertido por el plataformeo y eso no logra tener una historia tan divertida como la de rayman, pero lo que importa en este tipo de juegos es la jugabilidad, asÃ­ que comprenlo si le tienen ganas y si no lo conocen aprovechen las rebajas (hace unas semanas estaba al 100% de descuento, asi lo obtuve yo jeje).

pd: me encanta que el espaÃ±ol sea espaÃ±ol latinoamerica y no espaÃ±ol-espaÃ±a eso parece que no tiene importancia pero es un muy buen detalle xd

author: {'steamid': '76561198088028147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1606680796}
review:
This game was made by someone who lived and breathed retro gaming. I didn't think i would be into it as it was free and I had no idea what a guacamele is. On normal I'm really impressed with it for the most part enough to recommend it. I love the art style of it how at day time (lets call it) it's usually warm colors, yet at night time it's these cool blues and purples and the game play is addictive to say the least. 

You've got from references or inspiration from super mario, super metroid, donkey kong 2, zelda or similar turn the night on/off sort of games or dare i say oddworld on PS1 and all in all the playing style is great, it's not too easy and not too hard. Though so far there was one jumping puzzle i saved for later. It's a beat'em up with platforming and puzzle solving similar to before metroid made the mistake of going 3d, those games were garbage in my opinion. There is combos and you slowly learn new skills and if anything it somewhat also reminds me of Tomba 1 which is another gem I'm mentioning the original PS1 one a ton of people overlooked. The game does a great job of implementing stuff, you get a skill and have to get out of a level using the skill enough to master it. The combos get better as you learn new skills, you mercilessly do combos throwing enemies around the room and unlike the later resident evils after 4 the enemies don't blend together. I turned the game off and still remember what i was fighting. It's nothing is too hard, you've got a dodge button and honestly the 2 days on and off i played this game when i had nothing better to do flew. I was giving up on steam games but this revitalized me in some ways. 

Before fighting the flame guy some lets call them puzzles go from ok or average for experienced gamers to screw this difficult. You do this gigantic leap using every skill. You do get more skills to make some puzzles easier but it kind of takes from the experience in my opinion that you just go in and boom! two seconds instead of working our butts off doing it the way we think is only possible. I hate anything to do with lava in this game. acid and all doesn't kill you and you have no lives, just like ninja gaiden keep going until you give up. I love the auto save this game has as well. 

What I didn't like was switching between the living and dead worlds mid air every half a second near the end of the game. It was fun at first but it gets too extreme near the end. My least favorite part of the game is when standard enemies all get magic shields. I'd give them a reduced amount of damage but not invincible. Sure you can do combos on them to get that special move in but it's a chore. I enjoyed it on normal. I don't speak spanish so some parts I'd love to have subtitles at the bottom. Usually context gets you by but some sentences are pure spanish from people.

the jaguar boss is very cheap as you got to have the reflexes of a cat (no pun intended) and the final boss was not fun without the devils suit. Only one puzzle I had to go on youtube to figure out was the one where you got to fly through the dozen or so teleports. I can imagine this game would be a blast for those who can come over and plug a controller in as well. The difficulty gets progressively more difficult but it's not rage quit or insane for the most part until you get those gold medals in el inferno the developers made for this to get more money out of us. At least it's not just about every original nintendo game hard where you get so far, give up and buy another game the next payday. There was one level where the enemies shields were green and the background distorted it making it look yellow but besides that they did a fine job. 

I do not recommend playing this game on hard. Some enemies even on normal have instant death moves like the purple balloon thing where even if you do 100% of the game it can kill you. Sure it's hard it's supposed to be hard catering to those who have no lives and it's the end of the world if they ever beat a game but it honestly just gets sickening where every battle you can't skip you're using intenso or having to rely on the devil suit. draining the enemies health Sometimes the enemies get so many on the screen you got to either pause the game or take a hit as you forget where you are. 

The quest that should never have been so hard is the 3 chicken one in that town. It's for 1/3rd of a health bar upgrade or something. Not a super secret costume that gives you instant deaths or invisibility. Why is it shadow enemies can harm you but you can't harm shadow enemies that is hypocritical of the game. If you're in their realm and a shadow appears shouldn't you be able to hit it too? 

I feel they could have done more with the throws other than the odd time you throw someone out of bounds or to a ceiling of spikes. Possibly get other powers when you are in intense mode. I'd love to see some voice acting in the next installment of this I haven't played yet. I have no idea why i can only do the blue dash or uppercut once without touching a platform again. Maybe the costumes can do other powers as well sort of like megaman. I did the whole game with the normal costume because it was the most balanced. El inferno's challenges get cruel and sick where you have seconds to spare to get them and good luck getting the one with the three sliding objects you got to jump under without the flying chicken. One of the worst being the obstacle course where you got 15 seconds to do this really specific jump with powers, glide , jump, more super specific jumps with powers in under 15 seconds. Just stick with the original version. Why do game developers think these half arsed extra modes which are slapped together at the last second count as extra gameplay. Just add a level or 2 , an extra power based on complaints or an extra boss or something. The last set of combos I feel aren't fluid as if it's the biggest combo to do in mortal kombat deadly alliance or tekken tag where you do king or armor king to nina williams ultimate throw combo where the only way to pull them off is by reassigning  the shoulder buttons. But you've actually got to spin around while the enemy is flying towards you and keep a combo going is annoying. 

for anyone with 90% at santa luchiata however it's spelled you're missing a quest it's not a hidden treasure, for anyone who wants 100% and a useless achievement in el inferno you got to do all those pointless gold medals.

all in all a great game for a boring weekend. I beat it in around 6 hours. To get 100% you'll need either adderal (ADD medication) ,  cheat engine to slow the game down as it gets way too quick to react or have absolutely no life as some of those gold medal challenges in el inferno are ... el.. insert spanish curse word.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297303373', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1558975993}
review: Got it on Giveaway as most of the game i have, but thankfully i installed and launched this to play with my younger brother as he insisted, Well i didn't regret it. It's amazing Mash-it-up action reminds me of Cadillac and Dinosaurs back in those Arcade machines days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269505103', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1558894301}
review: Got this game for free as a promotion (it was free on Steam for a couple days) and was expecting to get some fun out of it. Honestly, I cant't even say that it was remotely fun. The cutscenes are long and unskippable, the keyboard controls extremely clunky, and the fights just don't scale with an increasing amount of players. I'm sorry if I offend fans of this game, but so far I can only say this game is relatively bad, that doesn't include the sound or visual design, but only the gameplay, even though I normally enjoy games of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198397464077', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1558725943}
review:
Guacamelee Ã© um game de aÃ§Ã£o e plataforma em 2D, Metroidvania, com uma temÃ¡tica mexicana, cenÃ¡rios coloridos e repleto de diÃ¡logos e situaÃ§Ãµes para te arrancar algumas risadas. 

A histÃ³ria segue Juan, um homem comum, ate que durante as vÃ©speras do Dia dos Mortos, (uma celebraÃ§Ã£o popular do povo mexicano, pois de acordo com o que dizem nesse dia os mortos tÃªm a permissÃ£o divina para visitar seus parentes e amigos ainda em vida, por esse motivo pessoas enfeitam suas casas e se vestem com fantasias e mascaras coloridas de esqueletos em um dos festejos mais animados do paÃ­s) sua paixÃ£o de infÃ¢ncia, conhecida como a filha do El Presidente, Ã© raptada pelo vilÃ£o Carlos Calaca. Quando tenta salva-la, Juan Ã© mandado para o mundo dos mortos, onde uma lutadora misteriosa o entrega uma mÃ¡scara, que te permite andar entre os dois mundos, tanto dos vivos quanto o dos mortos, e ele se torna o Luchador. Tudo isso acontece ainda nos minutos iniciais do game. Dando seguimento a histÃ³ria o bando de Calaca deseja usar a jovem em um ritual para unir o mundo dos mortos com o mundo dos vivos. No geral toda a histÃ³ria do jogo puxa para aqueles enredos ao estilo das telenovelas mexicanas galhofas, mas em nenhum momento isso se torna um ponto negativo, muito pelo contrÃ¡rio, esse Ã© um dos fatores responsÃ¡veis pelo bom humor e diversÃ£o que o game proporciona.

O foco do game fica na exploraÃ§Ã£o de ambiente, gÃªnero que atualmente Ã© conhecido como Metroidvania, uma homenagem a Metroid e Castlevania, pioneiros do gÃªnero. Ao decorrer da histÃ³ria o jogador vai ganhando novas habilidades, que o permitem passar por caminhos que antes estavam impossibilitados de serem explorados, algo tambÃ©m caracterÃ­stico do gÃªnero. Ou seja, isso sempre vai te obrigar a retornar a Ã¡reas antes jÃ¡ visitadas, porem Guacamelee dispÃµem menos de passagens escondidas ou coisas do tipo, mais abordados em outros jogos, tudo fica muito bem marcado no mapa, te ajudando a nÃ£o ficar tÃ£o perdido. Sem contar que alÃ©m de tudo isso, ele tambÃ©m tem uma das melhores habilidades que eu jÃ¡ vi em um game, o poder de se transformar em uma galinha... SIM, UMA FUCKING GALINHA. Isso jÃ¡ demonstra o quando o game Ã© muito bem-humorado. 

A apresentaÃ§Ã£o a cultura mexicana foi muito bem abordada em vÃ¡rios pontos, como a sua identidade visual extremamente colorida, na cultura dos luchadores e ate em criaturas de lendas locais, como o Chupa-Cabra, criatura que nas histÃ³rias era responsÃ¡vel por ataques a animais em Ã¡reas rurais, alÃ©m de muitas outras coisas. E durante todo esse processo ainda Ã© possÃ­vel encontrar muitas referÃªncias a cultura pop, como a outros games, e provavelmente vocÃª vai acabar notando uma ou outra de vez em quando. A sua duraÃ§Ã£o media Ã© de pouco mais de sete horas, mas para quem buscar os 100% pode passar de dez horas. AlÃ©m de tambÃ©m contar com um suporte para multiplayer local.

Foi um game divertido, que em muitos momentos me arrancou varias risadas.
ConclusÃ£o: Muy Bueno

author: {'steamid': '76561198027049068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1266, 'last_played': 1558985593}
review:
Got this game as a part of a promotion deal, but I can only leave a negative review. 
The visuals are great, the music is ok, the story is not deep, but it's not a problem. 
The problem is that the game is really unplayable on keyboard, which becomes completely obvious mid-game. Both combat and platforming challenges become tedious and disappointing because of this, there are levels I would never wish to revisit. 
The final boss fight is ridiculously unbalanced and difficult compared to the rest of the game. 
The fact that you can't dodge some attacks with control created specifically for dodging is irritating. The most dissapointing thing is that you can't explore some parts of the world if you don't complete a number of super hard challenges, where you have to desperately try to reach some arbitrary planks. 
In a nutshell: if you want a good metroidvania game, buy Hollow knight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056890665', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1558894435}
review: The art and music are cool. The main story is very linear, and after the first two hours you almost never have to revisit an area. You get all of your "gate-unlocking abilities" very early in the game and then you just use them to move forward, escaping rooms and arenas designed around pulling off different combos that require extreme dexterity. The amount of frustration makes this game a chore to play.

review:
Un juego muy entretenido, y que vale la pena.

En algunas partes, el juego puede ser un poco complicado, pero tiene sus momentos.
Hay cosas que al principio pueden parecer imposibles de pasar, e incluso cosas que parecen estar de adorno y ya estÃ¡. Pero que luego tienen sentido a medida que vas jugando.

Me pasÃ© el juego un poco muy rÃ¡pido, pero de todas maneras lo conseguÃ­ gratis en una oferta del 100%.
Aunque recomiendo comprarlo, debido a que es un juego muy entretenido para pasar el rato.

8.9/10 Un buen juego, el cual recomiendo.
