author: {'steamid': '76561198104042806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2106, 'last_played': 1517458525}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Chamionship Edition a very fun Metroidvania-style game with solid controls, a fantastic soundtrack and challenge to beat (especially when collecting all the mask pieces). The Infierno challenges will REALLY put your platforming and speedrunning skills to the test. While for the most part, the challenge is fair, there are some parts that are downright frustrating (I'm looking at YOU Tule Tree and Sierra Moreno mask pieces!) but if you keep at it you will eventually get the hang of it and come through victorious. If you are a fan of the Metroidvania genre, this game is a must buy!  8.5/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126423888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1501875512}
review:
It is a 2d side scroller with fun, 'beat-em-up' style combat, and as the game progresses you learn new combo moves that will help you in combat, as well as in navigating the world. 

So many tricks and nuances to the combos make this game require both skill and strategy to progress. 

Great fun, and replayablility! You can also select characters with different strengths and weaknesses based on your gameplay style. 

I first played Guacamelee on my cousin's PS4 when it was available as a free download in the PS store and I LOVED it.
Since I only own a PC, I waited patiently for the game to go on discount in the Steam Store. I got the Guacamele Complete for 4 bucks (what a deal!). 

I started playing instantly but had one major challenge.... no controller! This game is quite difficult and clunky on a keyboard. I was only able to play for about 30 minutes on a keyboard before reluctantly giving up. 
I am now waiting anxiously for Amazon to ship me an x360 controller so I can once again play Guacamelee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016365353', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1494028845}
review:
Un metroidvania semplice e lineare, dai colori vivaci e scanzonati, divertente e mai frustrante. Bello da vedere, divertente da giocare, grazie ad un buon sistema di combattimento con il quale sbizzarrirci a suon di suplex o pile driver, calci acrobatici e capocciate atomiche: ci metterete qualche secondo ad abituarvi alla tempistica dei comandi, ma in breve diventerete padroni del pad e del potere dei luchadores.
Se vi piace il genere, Ã¨ un buon titolo con cui spassarsela.

Cheers...al maestro capra!

author: {'steamid': '76561198210979096', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1492462474}
review:
Iâ€™m not giving this review a non-recommendation because this is a bad game, maybe it just doesnâ€™t float my boat.

I like the music in this one, they are unique and fits each area just right, the Mexican folklore is awesome and very well done, but thatâ€™s about everything I like about this game.

Iâ€™m confused with the graphics choice here, I feel that sometimes it wants to be a 2D HD game, and sometimes it wants to be a Pixel Art or a Retro kind of graphics, it wasnâ€™t easy on the eyes.

Also the gameplay have its share of imperfection, you only have a limited type of enemies, and the combats are so far in between the platforming sections, there is no joy in leveling up or killing enemies simply because there is not enough reward in doing so, you can only collect hearts and skulls to slightly upgrade your stamina and health, and few more boring abilities to buy.

The platforming is good, although itâ€™s majorly flawed by some confusing and dull mechanics, like the portal that you have to go into to make some platforms appear and disappear, or the climbing up and down to reach new areas, they all sounds good on paper, but the execution is awful in my opinion.

The map is confusing, even the mini maps are confusing, you donâ€™t know whatâ€™s what until you start to memorize areas.

Again, maybe it just me that canâ€™t enjoy this one, it felt like a chore in the 4 hours I spent in, itâ€™s boring and uninteresting. Couldnâ€™t beat and the game and donâ€™t have an interest to do so, this game gets an eyesore of 4 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077185468', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1491485925}
review:
Having finished Guacamelee Gold Ed. back in the days and being really convinced by it, I also decided to give the STC Edition a try after getting it on Humblebundle. I finished in two days because again I couldn't stop playing. The extra content is not really that much, though, but still well-implemented.
The whole Luchhador atmosphere immediately dragged me in again with it's nice design and soundtrack. Also, the game is still one of the best Metroidvanias in terms of gameplay and coop because it runs supersmooth and the controls feel natural. I will try to 100% this as well, because I will definitely come back for finishing hard mode and the extra challenge rooms.
For all that don't know this yet, expect about 20 hours of superfun wrestling your way through hordes of skeletons to rescue your love,

Also, the Devil is a chicken, how can this get any better?

9/10, because the upgrade to STC Edition should be patched in to the main game. If you haven't played Guacamelee, get this Edition. If you already did, only get it if you are a big fan like me, the extra content is not that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990419262', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1491854707}

author: {'steamid': '76561198290238998', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1484746732}
review:
I just want to say first that Guacamelee has great gameplay. However, good gameplay can only go so far and the rest of Guacamelee's element fall short.

The thing about Guacamelee is that it has a good premise. It looks really fun, colorful and wacky and all these qualities hints that you are about to enter a wonderful and original world full of spectacles. But it is sadly not the case and you start realizing it when you notice that there is barely no interesting NPC hanging in the couple of towns there is and all the temple look like one another making hard to remenber your adventure in Guacamelee. Even the music is pretty bland and forgettable. Then come the bosses. They all have cool design and are indeed interesting by themselves, but they still end out as flat and boring. They try as hard as they can to have emotion and something interesting to say, but all that effort is wasted when Juan (the protagonist) just stand there, emotionless, waiting for them to shut up so he can move on.

It was a mistake to take the silent protagonist route with Juan and if, they had to do it, they should have done it the same way Zelda does by having the hero emote and having a lot of interesting NPC filling the void that Link leave.

Overall, I still had fun with this title and the ending sequence is the only part where I can say, weirdly enough, none of these issues I mention are present and I really felt satisfied at the end. But still, I though there were going to be more charm and personality in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025187473', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1491593977}
review:
Good platformer, but not a fun game, the difficulty climbs to absurd levels.
This game is good, but it is not meant to be fun.

I was looking forward to beating it up until the final boss's second form.
The final boss spams screen-wide attacks and is invulnerable to damage until you break his regenerating shield for a few seconds to do minimal damage to him no matter what you do.
The final boss also does large chunks of your health per hit, if I did not have maximum health I would not have been able hot survive five hits.

You need to master the game in order to beat it, which is bad game desgin, at the very least you should have to get good to beat the game, not be forced to master it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977088954', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1490182938}
review:
Guacamelee.. es un juego de plataformas muy entretenido.
Tu eres un luchador que tiene que rescatar a la hija del alcalde de las garras de Calaca.

La jugabilidad es muy buena, los enemigo son lo suficiente variados para no aburrirte y con los movimientos y ataques que aprendes cuando avanzas en la historia hacen que las peleas sean divertidas.
Graficamente se nota que lo han hecho bien, no tiene unos graficos como el Battlefield ni nada de eso. Son mas bien de la epoca de los 90 aunque mas detallados.
La ambientaciÃ³n es muy buena, tanto la mÃºsica como el tiempo o el entorno acompaÃ±an siempre bien y no te cortan la motivaciÃ³n de avanzar.

Lo recomiendo. La verdad es que me ha gustado y tiene el puntito ese que te hace seguir un nivel mas y otro y otro.
Se me ha hecho corto. jajaja

author: {'steamid': '76561198038366350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1638224310}
review:
I enjoy platforming games and this one has nice platforming challenges alongside a great soundtrack and very colorful theme.

[h1]Platforming[/h1]
The platforming evolves to be more difficult as you progress to take advantage of your power-ups. There's also locations early on that you can revisit once you have those power-ups to find secrets or to just unlock new areas. The mechanic i hate the most in platforming games are the insta-death traps (usually spikes). Fortunately, this game doesn't have much insta-death traps; i think it's just the lava levels and the grinders. At least for those, there's a save point nearby so it's not a big deal. The platforming involves skills like accurate jumps, timing, and switching phases. There are some tricky spots, but you never need to be "pixel-perfect." Sometimes backtracking is a real PITA though. There are stone heads you can talk to to warp between areas but you have to get to the stone head; you can't just warp wherever you want.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
I played this on a Dualshock 3, and you're definitely going to want to use a gamepad to play it. There's no input lag or sloppy controls, but you do have to be somewhat precise. If you're a button-masher when it comes to combat, you may struggle a bit especially since trying to change direction will NOT interrupt. There are special moves to unlock and you can chain them together like a basic fighting game. Doing the special moves depletes stamina as well, though it regenerates quickly when you stop.

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
The soundtrack es muy bueno, i think it's worth buying if you can afford the extra cost. Every area has it's own theme music for each the living world and the world of the dead (so two songs each). I didn't buy this soundtrack because i didn't have the extra money at the time, but when i bought the sequel, i made sure to get the soundtrack too.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
The theming in this game is fantastic. It's full of bright color and culture. There's plenty of art to admire in the backgrounds as well. The living world and the world of the dead contrast significantly and completely change the scenery (and NPC's!). There's plenty of tributes to things like Strongbad, Castle Crashers, Metroid, and more.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This is over 7 years old but it's still worthy. I liked it so much that i bought the sequel too (on another platform).

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1574468862}
review:
Great game. A mash-up of a side-scrolling brawler and Metroidvania with its own proper spirit and art style. Fun and funny, albeit short (under 12 hours for full completion). A 100% for-sure buy for those who have yet to play the game.

I'd like to play through the game with a friend, but alas, there is no online co-op, even in this penultimate version of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067476568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1489707622}
review:

O que houve depois foi um limbo: nÃ£o teve metroid no Nintendo 64. SÃ³ voltariam a existir Metroids novamente na forma 3D, na sÃ©rie Prime, ou no GBA, finalmente em 2D, mas dÃ©cadas depois. 
Guacamelee prova que um metroidvania tem ainda muitas possibilidades de mecÃ¢nica sem precisar ser hermÃ©tico. Ã‰ um jogo divertido, engraÃ§ado, e com easter eggs por toda parte, recompensando a exploraÃ§Ã£o, nÃ£o sÃ³ com itens, mas com lembranÃ§as. Fica evidente que os desenvolvedores puseram muito amor no jogo, porque sÃ£o muitas homenagens, tornando tudo muito pessoal. Joguei o jogo no modo normal e o desafio foi na medida. De qualquer forma existe um post-game bem tÃ©cnico e segredos para os jogadores mais exigentes, como num bom metroidvania. Outros destaques sÃ£o a trilha sonora, que fica na sua cabeÃ§a depois que vocÃª para de jogar, principalmente a do Canal de las Flores e a direÃ§Ã£o de arte, que foi um ponto decisivo para eu comprar o jogo: tudo Ã© muito minimalista e vibrante ao mesmo tempo. A temÃ¡tica mexicana Ã© constante e atÃ© a adaptaÃ§Ã£o dos poderes do luchador seguem a temÃ¡tica. Super recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273445941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1489098427}
review: Pretty fun game. Starts out really simple, but gets progressively better as the main character gains new abilities and a wider variety of enemies are introduced throughtout the game. The attempted humor falls pretty flat, but it's never too cringeworthy, and the lighthearted art style works really well. Definitely worth a playthrough at a good price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173443603', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1500865892}
review:
One of the much better platformers i've played, with a decent story line to boot!
Here's the lay down: 
Graphics are good, nothing crazy but all the art is done really well, and the animations are nice and smooth as well.
Gameplay and combat is fun, regular fighting doesn't get old quick, and there's a variety of special moves to work with.
Enemies are good for the most part.
All around a really good game worth the price tag!

EDIT: The fact that the workshop lets players customize create and share new costumes makes the game at least 25% cooler and worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083488873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1491498059}
review:
Guacamelee super turbo championship edition Ã¨ un esplosivo gioco indie platform/azione in 2D, sviluppato e pubblicato da DrinkBox Studios. Il gioco Ã¨ stato rilasciato il 21 agosto 2014 per Pc, Ps3, Ps Vita, Ps4, Xbox One, Mac OS e Linux.

La storia, che ha luogo in una localitÃ  messicana in cui elementi sovrannaturali e leggende del folklore si intrecciano, narra dei piani di conquista del mondo dei vivi da parte del grande Carlos Calaca, il signore del regno dei morti. Per poter attuare il suo diabolico piano, egli rapisce la figlia del presidente di un piccolo villaggio di contadini. Juan, un uomo forte e coraggioso, innamorato della ragazza, cerca di fermarlo ma invano, venendo ucciso con poco sforzo da Calaca.
Mentre finisce nel regno dei morti, viene a contatto con una misteriosa maschera che non solo lo resuscita, facendolo tornare tra i vivi ma lo trasforma anche in un potentissimo luchador, in grado di affrontare lâ€™esercito di morti di Calaca e i suoi eccentrici compagni. Con lâ€™aiuto di Tostada, guardiana della maschera e degli strani poteri elargiti dal vecchio maestro Uay Chivo, Juan comincia il suo viaggio, per fermare i folli piani di Calaca, liberare la figlia del presidente e salvare il regno dei vivi e quello dei morti.

In questo gioco, leggende del folklore, personaggi strani e animali antropomorfi si intrecciano a formare una storia epica, dai tratti malinconici ed esplosivi. Durante il viaggio da una localitÃ  allâ€™altra, con foreste, miniere, caverne oscure, cittÃ  piene di vita, templi abbandonati protetti da creature feroci, deserti roventi e vulcani, dovremo farci strada attraverso orde di scheletri, chupacabra e molti altri nemici che compongono lâ€™esercito di Calaca, da sconfiggere a suon di pugni, calci, lanci pazzeschi e poteri come la schiacciata del rospo o il montante cedrone.
Il design delle zone, dei personaggi e dei vari nemici Ã¨ ben realizzato, le musiche sono esplosive e coinvolgenti in ogni localitÃ  che esploriamo, con segreti da scoprire grazie ai vari poteri che sbloccheremo nel corso del gioco. Inoltre, per poter risolvere alcuni enigmi o per sconfiggere certi nemici, dovremo destreggiarci tra il mondo dei vivi e quello dei morti, completando anche una serie di quest nelle varie cittÃ  in cui andremo, per ottenere monete per acquistare nuove abilitÃ  e potenziamenti per i personaggi.
 
La storia viene narrata attraverso i filmati di gioco ma anche tramite le varie situazioni assurde e i siparietti comici tra Juan e i vari personaggi della vicenda. Le zone del mondo, i nemici, i personaggi e gli scontri contro i Boss sono realizzati in maniera eccellente cosÃ¬ come le straordinarie musiche che ci accompagnano nel corso della nostra avventura.
Rispetto alla versione Golden, la Super Turbo Championship Edition puÃ² vantare nuove sfide, nuove zone da esplorare, nuovi poteri (come la modalitÃ  Intenso, uno stato mistico che ci permette di buttare giÃ¹ anche i nemici piÃ¹ ostici), nuovi costumi con abilitÃ  pazzesche (lanci piÃ¹ potenti, stamina che non si esaurisce, eccâ€¦), nuove varietÃ  di nemici, la fantastica possibilitÃ  di giocare in co-op fino a 4 persone in contemporanea e nuovi Boss da sconfiggere. Nonostante le zone del gioco non sia molte da visitare, grazie alle nuove modalitÃ  Normale e Difficile la giocabilitÃ  Ã¨ assicurata, sia giocando in singolo che divertendosi con altri amici in co-op, grazie anche ai nuovi nemici di classe ElitÃ¨, nuove abilitÃ  e arene esplosive, dove massacrare gli avversari con stile, violenza inaudita e potenti bombe pollo.

- Trama 8.4/10
- Personaggi 8.8/10
- Grafica 8.8/10
- Sonoro 8.6/10
- Rapporto QualitÃ /Prezzo 9.0/10
- Sviluppo della Storia 8.4/10

Voto Personale 8.6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052982921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1488603432}
review:
So, first things first, controller is greatly required to play this one. Default key mapping is pretty crappy, but at least it allows you to remap keys to whatever you want. Fun fact, it is the literal first controller support game I play, that doesn't recognize my cheap PS2 knockoff at all, no big deal tho, just used Xpadder. Another detail is that the game randomly crashes when switching areas, had it crash twice at temple of rain, and one when returning to Santa Luchita. Laptop hugely exceeds requirements, so not a specs issue.

On to the game, it feels pretty fine, a well done mashup of a platformer beat-them-up, altho the tutorials feel somewhat clunky and, by the time you reach the guy who explains your moveset, you already had to clear your way thru a few baddies and thus, already know what he has to teach. Fighting feels fluid and not overly complicated, just button mash and dodge at the right time, platforms make good use of your moveset and feel compelling.

The atmosphere feels pretty colorful and lively, and while the mexican theme is laid out quite a bit over the top, it feels right in sync with the rest of the game. Colour palletes are well used and the game feels right. Story is not the most original and character names are... wonky, but work well with the atmosphere the game is trying to set.

Got this one as part of a big Humble Bundle along with lotsa other stuff, so I paid like a buck for it, ofc at that price, game's a steal, and well worth what I paid for it, but even at full price, it's worth its salt. Haven't tried out local multiplayer, which is a feature less and less games seem to still carry now, so a big plus for that, however without true controller support, I wouldn't be able to either way (Xpadder only turns controller into a makeshift keyboard), and honestly, I'm not coughing up the cost of a XBOX controller for one game, when every other recognizes my generic one just fine. Other than that, sure, get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1489345571}
review:
This is one of the best Metroidvania's I've played in recent memory. Combat is great fun, with all your special moves being fun, useful and feeding into fluid combos. Enemy design is good. Level design is very good, and makes excellent use of each power you gain. I especially love all the creative ways they used the light-world/dark world mechanic. It's got secrets and extra challenges galore for more hardcore gamers.

Also, the heavy mexican and day-of-the-dead themeing does a lot to make the game feel fresh compared to other videogames, and thematically cohesive. It also has a good sense of humor.

Criticisms: Using a keyboard, the controls for some of the special moves are finnicky--you can't do the rising uppercut unless you let go of the left/right arrow keys, for instance. And for people who have trouble with even mild colorblindness, you'll have a lot of trouble with colored shields some enemies (and bosses) get which can only be broken by the corresponding move. The red and green ones are very similar shades and they can get muddied further by ambient lighting effects in some areas (ie fire). The game would have benefitted from a colorblind mode.

Other than that though, this is a solid game that I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286075366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1492310341}
review:
Guacamelee es un juego repleto de sorpresas del cual no esperaba nada salvo divertirme tirando madrazos como todo buen luchador. Pero poco a poco me fue atrapando la belleza de sus escenarios, la solidez de su jugabilidad y, sobre todo, la historia, que es muy, muy triste...

Una joyita.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040766410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1490484341}
review:
9.3/10

This is the Metroid game we've been waiting for! With zero frustration, because the game does not punish your mistakes by sending you back to the last save point that often, cutscenes play only once, puzzles do not rely on hidden secrets, Guacamelee plays smooth as but-, I mean Guac! and drop dead gorgeous! Go smash things up luchador!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001600041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1488007224}
review:
Guacamelee! is a Metroidvania style beat 'em up. I've played this game two times through. Once with this edition and once in the Gold Edition. But there is a few things that really ruined things near the end for me. 

[h1] Care [/h1]
The first issue I found was what felt like a lack of caring for this game from the developers. I understand that this is the third time this game has been sold, and it was originally a PS3 game. However, if you play as Toastada, none of the dialogue is changed, originally she was intended as the player two character Why should I get the option if they're not going to do anything to identify the fact I am playing as a different character? Not to mention the UI, because Drink Box made this as a four-player party game, which the tight platforming sections would beg to differ. The developers stuck Press Start 3 times across the screen at the top, it is very distracting and ugly.

[h1] Difficulty [/h1]
The next problem I have is the difficulty. The game is very stilted and boring in the majority of the game. The game is well placed but there is a lack of enemy variety that becomes apparent after the desert section of the game. Which post that area of the game, you hardly see new versions of enemies until they give 5 or 6 enemy types "Black" versions, which are the same in every way but they randomly break your combo and flow by teleporting.

[h1] The Story [/h1]
I had no feeling for any of the main characters. The writers spent too long trying to make you feel for the antagonists. The only thing I supposedly know about the love interest is "She is smart and Beautiful" A quote from an old lady in the beginning of the game. I don't know her name because she is called "El Presidente's Daughter" I've played it twice and that's the only name I know her for. Beyond that the new section of the game added in the DLC from Gold Edition, is to explain Toastada's past. She saved a village from a volcano. I'd argue it's the best written portion of the game, but even that is lacking in the writing department.

[h1] Fighting [/h1]
The fighting was dry, just mash X or whatever your basic attack is, until you can grapple, supplex, repeat. Outside of that, having to switch dimensions on the fly in battle adds the smallest layer of interest, outside of that switching between the two worlds only serves to add frustration, because you can't impact enemies in the other world at all. As for the shields, they either come back too quickly or are pointless. Essentially the shields come in two varieties, either you must combo a white shield away in order to dish out damage, or use a super move to break it. Also on the occasion I felt the controls glitch out, using a super move then going to attack on the occasion will launch you into another super move.

[h1] Intenso [/h1]
Intenso gives you the ability to buff your character temporarily. I'd argue this could be the best part of the added content. Intenso let's you bust through the combat and murder enemies outright.

Spoilers down here!
[spoiler] [h1] Mask Pieces [/h1]
There are five mask pieces to get at the end of the game for the true ending. Unless you're going for completion, it's pointless to get them, it doesn't add anything besides flight for chicken mode. Which flying only is helpful for people looking to get 100% of the maps. Each mask piece offered little challenge to me, except for the one in the second to last temple or so, Sierra.

[h1] Final Boss [/h1]
The final boss has a random difficulty curve. In his first form Calca teleports around the screen, which at first feels unfair, but once you understand the general pattern and how to avoid him, it is easy to avoid him and it is rather well put together. His second form mad me originally quit the game. Two years ago when I 'finished the game' I couldn't because his fight was poorly put together and expects you to last throughout the gauntlet of health he has. On my second play through Intenso made him kneel before me, and with the devil suit I easily survived the fight. This is the only portion of the game I'd argue is hard, but it is for the wrong reasons.

[/spoiler]

[h1] Art [/h1]
Okay the game is beautiful. The artist(s) used a Mexican-Inspired artstyle and it shines throughout the game and it truly charms me. I believe the only reason I played this game again is because I thought it looked awesome and I needed to beat Calca, not many games I haven't beaten because they were too hard and only because of that.

[h1] Memes [/h1]
This game suffers from being of it's time. All over towns you can see posters referencing other games, or internet memes from 2012 or so. And it feels like it's trying to force you into liking the game.

[b] I'd rate this game a C+ [/b]
Which is not okay from a developer releasing this game for the third time. If a company like Nintendo or Blizzard did this with a game being released three times within 2 years or so, I'd be a splotch on their credibility as a company.

I'd say that you should get this game on sale. It's worth it.

But DAMN that final boss is hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1487371715}
review:
(This game was a gift from ArtificialRaven.  Thanks, bro!  Ironically, it comes from Humble Bundle, the same place I got the previous version from.)

[i]Guacamelee!  Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i]...what a mouthful.  For the sake of this review (And to make it easier on the eyes), we'll snip it to SCTE.  Yes, I played the Gold Edition first...which was 3 years ago.  I heard about this edition and added it to my wishlist, I forgot about it until it landed in my lap.  So...another game, another review!  ( http://steamcommunity.com/id/Shrodu/recommended/214770  Link to the review of the Gold Edition)

So, what makes STCE so special?  Well, like it's previous counterpart (a brawler/platformer hybrid that's fun to enjoy), but with MORE content, including a few additional levels, an additional boss, an additional power, Up to 4 player Co-Op, and...MULTIPLE SAVE FILES (Gold only had 1).  STCE has half the achievements that Gold had, but it's still a nice experience.

There aren't any real gripes about this version since it essentially fixed what was wrong with the Gold Edition.  I would personally say that this game would be great at a price of around $12.  If you're thinking of getting Gold Edition, I can't stop you.  I only suggest that you get this version instead since you're getting more bang for your buck!

8/10  A great experience and a lost gem on Steam that you should definitely have in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095082555', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1487538316}
review:
[u]Pros[/u]
+Beautiful art direction.
+Great soundtrack.
+Memorable characters and levels.
+Decently intreguing story.
+Extremely fluid and satisfying combat.
+Plenty of great secrets and extras.
+Great humor and funny refrences.
+Mod support.
+4 player co-op.

[u]Cons[/u]
-Occaisonal fights have severe difficulty spikes.
-Not many graphical options.
-Very noticable aliasing around some models. Antialiasing option in the menu only helps slightly.
-Differences between Super Turbo Championship Edition and the Gold Edition are extremely limited. (But they're the same price so who really cares?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035101495', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 656, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1487104422}
review:
No doubts this one is best original platformer of 2013, unique puzzles and abilities, engaging and adrenaline rushing fights, beautiful art, mexican theme, story that is fun and serious when it has to be so, a lot of various collectibles, 4 player co-op, soundtrack that is still good after 10 hours of gameplay, difficulty that's right in the middle (nether too easy or frustratingly too hard).

Knack for GOTY 2013

review:

Como eu estava errado.

Guacamelee Ã© um dos melhores jogos plataformers que eu jÃ¡ joguei na minha vida. Com um estilo totalmente metroidvania, ele consegue capturar o charme dos jogos antigos na sua jogabilidade e controle de personagem impecaveis, artes lindas e uma dificuldade impressionantemente frustrante certos momentos do jogo.
O jogo tem uma variedade de movimentos diferentes que nÃ£o servem apenas para usar no combate, mas que combinados tambÃ©m sÃ£o essenciais para passar no plataforming.

Jogo muito bom que conseguiu alcanÃ§ar a lista dos top 10 melhores jogos que jÃ¡ joguei.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963627405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1486579816}
review:
Why must these new age games be so dumbed down?

Every secret or progression point i encountered was highlighted or in a different tile color, making it super obvious that you have to use your abilities to proceed. 

If you are looking for an old school metroid feeling of exploration and uncovering secrets, look for other games like Axiom Verge.

Got bored after 1,6 hours.

Otherwise great game if you like straight forward button mash. I got it on 70% sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262329408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1468804842}
review:
I love fighting games! I love them too much. Heck, I don't even like video games that much, honestly. Fighting games are usually the only games I play... but Steam sales. Oh, Steam sales. Lord Gabe gave Guacamelee a price of one... little... dollar... and a few cents. So, I picked it up because... Steam sales. All I can say is that it is alright. Not something I'll come back to, as there are way too many fighting games out there. They're all waiting to be mastered. I can't get myself to play this again for fun!

Sans has stole the president's daughter and now it is up to you, Zangief, to save the daughter for mutha russia. Yeah, I don't pay attension to stories of video games. I mean, if I did, then Street Fighter would I confused me so much... 

Anyway, this is a fun beat'em up with lots of platforming and combat. The combat is satisfing and there is plenty of enemy varity. The enemies are never unfair, just challenging and tough in numbers. 

Combos are REALLY satisfing in this game. They are performed by using all of your unique attacks in anyway you want. This game feels like playing 3.0 PM Mewtwo or Melee Fox in turbo mode. YOU'RE UNSTOPPABLE! Want to cancel shoryuken into headbutt? Feel free to. The best part is you can upgrade your abilities to wombo combo your enemies even more. You can upgrade your stamina bar to cancel into more special moves in a combo. Want to add a belly flop into that uppercut head combo? BOOM! You can now once you get the upgrades. It is easy and VERY satisfing to come up with a long combo yourself out of moves that you didn't even consider that useful in a fight. It is so tasty to try all your combos against unique opponents who require different methods of comboing. 

Heck, battles don't feel like they come often! Your mostly platforming, fighting bosses, and reading or seeing a bunch of video game/culture references. Bust it Bill: The black, angry Ralph. A wood sign that resembles Cactuar. Using an axe to cut down a bridge that a monster tries to cross to kill you to then be told your princess is in another castle. However, these jokes can be very corny at times when ALL of the games you play pretty much constantly make these references. This game does but a lot of twist on these classic references to other games, but not enough to not come across as corny. But that could be just me. A lot of people love these random references for some reason...

Great game! Pick it up for prices anywhere below 30 dollars. Except if you are me and you have too many fighting games to play. In that case, buy it if it is... a dollar. 7.5/10, above average.


PLEASE TAKE NOTE THAT I GOT THIS GAME FOR A DOLLAR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263130832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1531515584}
review:
The golden age of metroidvania revitalised 

This game hits all the right notes of the metroidvania subgenre while introducing its own unique mechanics and style. The arcade-style beat-em-up combat is excellent, the art style is cool and evocative of traditional Mexican culture, and the platforming is challenging yet fair. My only complaint is that the humour seems hit-or-miss and sometimes totally out of place. Possibly the best modern 2d platformer, I reccomend this to any fan of super Metroid or Castlevania: SOTN or any fan of platform games in general

author: {'steamid': '76561198046311355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1625344384}
review:
A defined and fascinating artsyle in two different worlds, that you can flip to on the fly, combined with easy to pick up and play gameplay highlight the brilliance of Guacamelee. Drinkbox really branches out with this game from the Blob games, which were great in their own right if more simplistic.

Guacamelee has personality to spare, engaging and true metroidvania gameplay, and never really outstays its welcome. If you are at all interested in the artstyle that alone is enough to play. This one is a beauty, and I really enjoy being able to switch to the dead world when I want to. It is worth it to see this in 4K. Its mechanics are all sound as well to my liking, and quite honestly the theme and tone are so creative and unique I cannot imagine metroidvania fan wanting to miss this.

Challenge can be basically chosen by the player as there are a variety of skins you can unlock. I love playing with the fragile character that gains more money. It makes the game about a perfect difficulty, and much more akin to something like Ori. And it's up there with that game too.

The writing can grate at times, but in general it's pretty cool and even funny. The Spanish language background to everything is glorious. The traditional upgrades and RPG elements round out an impressive package that was heavily upgraded itself from the Gold edition released before it. Extra levels and additions complement beautiful art and elements of Mexican culture.

At 4K with some injected SMAA along with the in-game AA you basically have very few jaggies. Looks better on PC than PS4 this way for sure. Outstanding game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999339775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1484104542}
review: Combine the satisfying, exploration-heavy platforming of Metroid with the fluid and forgiving combat of Smash Bros, and you have the foundation of Guacamelee. Add to this how faithful the developers are to Mexican culture, and you have yourself a charming and colorful game. The memes within Guacamelee will date fast, but I was impressed with how the game still managed to engage me outside of the gameplay. It feels as if they were added as a safety net, but Drinkbox makes it pretty clear that they don't need to fall back on pop culture references to create a captivating world. Not quite Grim Fandango, but surprisingly close. One last thing worth noting; if you feel the game could've ended on a better note, keep playing. You'll find some great closure if you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226846980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1502157522}
review:
This game is a gem, a pleasure to play through, with hidden wit everywhere and great challenging gameplay. While the story is not very long, It was good enough that I wanted to complete it 100%, which ended up being a reasonable challenge. I like that the acheivements are actually attainable unlike some games that would amount to "kill 1,000,000,000 skeletons." I enjoyed it immensely and would recommend it to any one who:

- likes a bit of a challenge
- enjoys small details (there's so many small details and references that make the game amazing)
- likes destroying everything
- has a sense of humor
- likes to complete things 100%

I would not recommend it to anyone who:

- doesn't like having to figure things out on their own
- only plays a game until they "beat it" (meaning the final boss)
- doesn't get much out of decimating barrels and skeletons

author: {'steamid': '76561198044010520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1483391286}
review:
This little indie game of 2013 is a pearl on it's own.

Following the Metroidvania genre, this game is about rescuing a girl while punching skeletons (and some other things) luchador style. In order to progress, you'll learn a bunch of moves that help you navigate the world (a shoryuken to get some height, a ground pound, etc...). Each move can break one type of blocks and while those moves is good for traveling, they works really great for fighting as well.

While the game is mostly inspired by the mexican culture (from the design of the characters and background to the music), you'll find tons of references to other video games franchises. For an indie game, this is some of the smoothest animation I've seen of a 2D game, no movement feel clunky or out of place. Sadly, the different area are a little too cliche and don't expect a deep story, it's about the same level as a Mario game.

The game is filled with collectibles and optional challenges. The difficulty is well balanced (while the beginning seem quite easy, some enemies become tricky to fight and the platforming tight. If it's still too easy for you, you unlock hard mode once you beat the game (basically, enemies has double hp and inflict double damage). The game isn't that long but if you try to 100% it, it'll take some time (it took me ~10h to get all but one achievement : beating the game in hard mode)

You can play local coop in this game to make thing more crazy. There is even a workshop to download custom skins, without altering the gameplay. The sad thing is that the community isn't very active and there isn't that many skins to download (97 for the gold edition, 52 for this one).

Speaking of editions, on PC you can chose between 2 editions : The gold edition and the Super Turbo Championship edition. 
The gold edition is the base game, a port of the original from PS3/Vita.
The STC edition is a tweaked base game with tons of stuff added (new abilities, enemies, areas, etc ...)
Since the price of the STC is just 1â‚¬ more than the gold edition, there is no real point to get the gold edition (unless you REALLY want those extra custom skins)

Overall, a really solid game, not that ambitious but with very few flaws. I still would recommand to wait 'till it's on sale though (it dropped below 5â‚¬ this last winter sale).

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 756, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1483578321}
review:
Decently enjoyable Metroidvania that loves to throw all sorts of aggressive video games references at you.
Revisiting this title sometime after playing the â€œGold Editionâ€ and found both enjoyment with and frustration towards similar aspects of the game through both playthroughs. However, I suppose that â€˜Super Turbo Championship Editionâ€™ as a tad easier due to adding the Super Meter and perhaps just getting better with time. There is still the insane challenge secrets if youâ€™re looking for some tough stuff to get mad at.

Dislikes:
The, well, Special Moves with the B button usually have a lot of lag on them making some platforming delayed and janky. I get that for combos itâ€™s supposed to feel good when you cancel into them but 
I love references to other games within games but, especially in the town area, itâ€™s a bit much. Keep the references as easter-eggs or subtle things. Donâ€™t just make the power-ups statues straight up Chozo.
Backtracking feels sluggish, there is a sort of dash but requires a wall and a straight shot. Thereâ€™s a lot of open and straight planes that take a while to traverse with you want to check a lego block that you havenâ€™t smashed yet.

Disclaimer:
[Game playable with four friends. Will make you feel lonely if finished by yourself.]

Basically:
Take it or leave it, itâ€™s not a bad game. Buy it if you like Metroidvanias, have friends around and have some extra cash to spend. Donâ€™t go for 100% unless you have ballz of steel.

Note to self: Lol, review for Gold Edition was very salty. My B.

review:

Edit: finally got all the orbs, now I'm trying to get 100% completion. I stand by my 10/10 rating. Best platformer I've ever played. Perfect balance between difficulty and abundance of save points. You can finish the game with a moderate amount of difficulty or you can be a completionist and get your ass handed to you for a while. However, this isn't one of those poorly made platformers with bad contact detection (or whatever they call it), if you screwed up it's on you. But all puzzles are doable, they all have a strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144005088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1482455844}
review:
Beat 'em up and metroidvania combined? This game makes it work better than you'd think. The moves are integrated seamlessly for both combat and platforming, especially the red and blue moves. And it's actually a good thing that it gets easier to get upgrades as you gain abilities even though they were accessible with an earlier ability. You'll be thankful, as this game goes from somewhat easy but not too easy early on to downright brutal in the later levels, though thankfully not too much harder between any two succeeding levels. Sadly, I lack the raw skill to take down what seems to be the final boss[spoiler]'s true form[/spoiler], though it's still apparent, as it was when I struggled on earlier bosses and level segments, that it really is my own skill keeping me from winning, and it was my own skill that carried me to victory up until now.

The plot and villains are nothing to write home about, but they're still lovable and entertaining and, importantly, carry the excellent gameplay.

The Mexican style is a nice touch, though sadly the style of music is not to my liking (and the boss music especially doesn't sound much like boss music), but I'm being more fair to this game because of that.

So, overall, if you want either a beat 'em up or a metroidvania and can tolerate the other, especially if you'd appreciate both together, this game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198320092347', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1505008395}
review:
Un verdadero juego de plataformas...

Muchos aÃ±os han pasado desde que un gran jefe, se convirtierea en un SEÃ‘OR jefe, la juagabilidad es esquisita, y durante todo el juego esta bien diseÃ±ada la manera de aprenderla y dominarla, combinado con sus casi nada discretos guiÃ±os se vuelve un verdadero juego de plataformas con ese toque sandbox que es necesario para ser una aventura no epica si no intensamente epica, (quienes lo haya jugado entedera el juego de palabras), la estetica es si duda brillante, la musica esta a punto y los chistes pasados de la linea infantil a el humor adulto equilibran de manera interesante el juego.

Bien si este juego sin duda tiene el potencial para volverse una joya, la falta de INTENSO en su historia tanto principal como de las secundarias (mas claro en las secuandaria), no lo vuelven malo al contratio, pero nos deja ese sabor de queres mas, de saber que se pudo explotar esas historias a su maximo potencial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006768995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1481797367}
review:
Es geht um HÃœhner.

Einleitung:
Guacameleea ist ein Mix aus Plattformer, Metroid-Prime, Double Dragon und viel Hommage an bekannte Spieletitel. Ich wollte es zuerst aufgrund der KoopfÃ¤higkeit kaufen, hatte aber dann keine kompetenten Mitstreiter gefunden, bzw. Ã¼berhaupt jemand, der gerne diese Art von Spiel mit mir spielen wollte. 
So unscheinbar es am Anfang auf mich wirkte, sodass ich nach zwei drei lÃ¤ngeren Spielesessions die Lust verlor, so hat es daraufhin irgendwann diesen sÃ¼ÃŸlich schweren aromatische Geschmack wie Club Mate entwickelt, der zwar anfangs befremdlich doch dann immer angenehmer wird, bis man schlieÃŸlich immer wieder gerne davon nippt.

Geschichte:
Man(n) ist Juan, ein Luchador, naja, erst mal ein Junge vom Felde, der dabei zusieht, wie die Tochter des BÃ¼rgermeisters entfÃ¼hrt wird und nun darauf aus ist, sie zu retten.
Sein Gegenspieler ist Calaca und seine Untergebenen, die alle ihren eigenen Charme versprÃ¼hen und zu den guten BosskÃ¤mpfen gehÃ¶ren, die das Spiel zu bieten hat. Der Humor kommt dabei nie zu kurz, auch wenn mein einglisches Vokabular nicht ausreicht, um alle Verweise 100% zu verstehen.

Spielstil:
Das Spiel ist ein Beat-Em-Up, in dem man von Areal zu Areal wechselt und dort Gegner mit Kombination (Juggling) WÃ¼rfen und Spezialattacken vemÃ¶belt. Hinzu kommt die FÃ¤higkeit noch auszuweichen, was seinen sehr angenehmen Spielfluss ermÃ¶glicht und man gerne auf den ZÃ¤hler in der linken oberen Ecke schaut, wie viele Treffer man verteilt hat, bevor man selbst getroffen wurde. 
Dabei setzt das Spiel gekonnt auch auf Pausen innerhalb der AusfÃ¼hrung einer Animation, sodass man Angriffe sehr gut aneinanderreihen kann, ohne das GespÃ¼r eines Street Fighter Profis besitzen zu mÃ¼ssen. 
Neben den KÃ¤mpfen kommen ganz viele HÃ¼pfpassagen ins Spiel. Die sind dabei so groÃŸartig und frustierend, aber schaffbar ausgearbeitet, dass diese mir bisher mit am meisten Freude bereitet haben. Wer Rayman Legends gespielt hat und die Herausforderungen mochte, wird auch hier seine Freude haben.
Zu den Richtungen kommt Ã¼brigens noch eine weitere Dimension, die man beachten muss, wenn man solche Passagen erfolgreich schaffen mÃ¶chte. Wer Giana Sisters gespielt hat, weiÃŸ, was ich meine. 

Zu diesem kommt das Finden weiterer FÃ¤higkeiten, die wie bei Metroid andere Wege freischalten kÃ¶nnen.

Grafik
Das Spiel ist konsequent in einem Stil gehalten und der ist angenehm fÃ¼r die Augen, auch wenn manchmal die Charaktermodelle klein wirken. DafÃ¼r hat man wiederrum mehr Ãœberblick Ã¼ber die ganze Situation, was bei einer MassenprÃ¼gelei auch von NÃ¶ten ist. 
Das Spiel geizt dabei nicht an Farben, ist aber auch nicht Ã¼berladen und behÃ¤lt diesen mexikanischen Flair bei.

Sound
Es gibt leider keine Sprachausgabe, aber die Hintergrundmelodie ist sehr unterstÃ¼tzend fÃ¼r die ganze AtmosphÃ¤re, sodass man sich selbst fast ein Sombrero aufsetzen mÃ¶chte um dann getreu die Musik mitzusummen. 

Fazit
Guacamelee macht alles richtig. Es ist nicht zu lang, hat keine unnÃ¶tigen Strecken, hÃ¤lt sich mit unnÃ¶tigen Nebenquest zurÃ¼ck und bietet ein gutes Kampfsystem, gute Charaktere, viele AnpassungsmÃ¶glichkeiten, HÃ¼hner und das fÃ¼r einen ordentlichen Preis

review: I recommend this game, but it can be very frustrating wtih some of the jumping puzzles and theres about a billion of them in the game. It gets a little easier as you go along because you get movement related abilities but even then it can be a headache. The combats pretty fun, the artstyles great and the story is okay, nothing amazing but okay. All in all its a good game and if you can get it at a good price pick it up.

review: Uno de los mejores Metroidvanias que existen; divertido, desafiante, con un humor gamberro y lleno de referencias a otros videojuegos, ademÃ¡s de muchos secretos y extras que lo hacen un juego excelente. Ya seas asiduo del gÃ©nero o quieras iniciarte es una compra segura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158899342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1584283267}
review: Yo creia que este juego iba a ser bastante mediocre y que las criticas eran benevolentes pero al jugarlo cambie de opinion. El juego es uno estilo Metroid con muchas plataformas y mecanicas de lucha bien implementadas. El protagonista cuenta con muchisimos poderes que son usados tanto para derrotar enemigos como para avanzar por los laberinticos niveles. Yo lo recomiendo ya que es realmente entretenido y desafiante cuando se lo propone. 100% recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561197993293074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1504171299}
review: Fantastic Metroidvania with a awesome fighting game mechanics...

author: {'steamid': '76561198312578330', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1510414228}
review:
I must admit, I wanted it out of curiosity in the beginning, but I couldn't expect how much fun it could actually be.

The fighting system feels fast, responsive, and with a lot of potential for combos, and juggling enemies in the air. Each move you have has a specific purpose and is clearly differentiated from the others, creating a small yet varied set of tools at your disposal. Yet one can't help but think that a couple more moves wpuld help make battles more varied and interesting. The tactical side of things, later on with the addition of shielded and alternate dimension enemies you can't just  take them all on at once, you have to be more methodical, to decide which targets are a priority, which should be knocked down for later. 

The game can be pretty tactical, yet not so much so as to become slow or unenjoyable. The game doesn't ask you to make big plans about each fight, but to assess the situation and make on-the-fly choices to defeat you enemies in the most efficient, safe, fashion. And that makes it actually rather enjoyable. 

Unfortunately, however, the difficulty from battles comes more from the ammount of enemies rather than the individual enemies themselves. They never really feel dangerous on their own right, all of them being rather slow and having pretty big tells for when they're going to attack, making it easy to avoid them. Instead, the danger comes from having to keep track of a lot of enemies at once. Yet, at the same time, it makes sense, since it helps keep the flow of the game, whereas single, difficult enemies might make it slower. Overall, the combat is good and has quite a lot of potential

The art style is indeed pleasing to the eye, it looks really colourful yet clean and simple. It's nice to look at and adds character to the game, it works with it, whereas a more realistic approach, at least in my opinion wouldn't have been half as charming

However, one thing the game does suffer from, is it's really short length. I finished the campaign in about ten hours, and I really took my time and 100%'d it. And while it's true that it's better to not overstay your welcome and instead leave a good memory, I'd say Guacamelee!, however, left too early, leaving you wanting more but without much else to do, as the game doesn't really have much in the way of post-game content, other than the El Infierno and Caverna del Pollo challenges. Granted the game does have a good ammount of exploration to do to get all the secrets, it rather goes by fast

Another small problem the game has, is it's lack of online co-op capabilities. While it's understanable that it could cause a lot of problems and frustration with an uncoodinated group, it would also be great fun when it worked. It would be a really nice feature to have when your friends aren't available for some Luchador action.

As I have rambled a lot, and with purpose of making the list more approachable, I'll include a list of pros and cons:

Pros:

+Very solid and entertaining fighting style that doesn't get old
+Well differentiated moveset where every move has its clear purpose
+Lots of enemies that make for varied encounters and strategies to beat them
+Colourful and clean artstyle that adds charm to the game and has just enough ammount of detail to not feel boring
+The enemies, thanks to the art style are inmediately recognizable, and thus you are rarely confused about what you should do
+A good amount of costumes, with their own effects, that allow even more variety in your battles, and in my opinion, look pretty nice
+Chickens

Cons:

-The game suffers from a really short length, leaving you wanting more with no real way to ease that craving
-Not much in the way of post-game content. It's a small game
-The movelist, although differentiated, is rather small. It could have done with some more moves
-The platforming requires good eye-hand coordination late-game. Can become frustrating if you have poor reflexes
-A little too heavy on the memes
-No online multiplayer support

The game, overall, is really good and I enjoyed it inmensely. I'm also impressed in how well the extra areas are included in the game, I didn't know they were add-ons until I looked them up due to how well integrated they are. The only real complain I have about the game is the short lenght. It's a small game, but a really good one. I would definitely recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561198123215917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1677073417}
review:
Graphiquement trÃ©s joli faÃ§on cartoon, guacamelee offre un beau challenge, mÃªme en difficultÃ© normale.
La progression est assez linÃ©aire avec des powerups permettant d'avancer plus loin dans le jeu.
Les coups sont assez diffÃ©rents les uns des autres et on se prend rapidement Ã  exÃ©cuter des combos pour le plaisir.
L'humour est prÃ©sent et agrÃ©able.

Le seul point nÃ©gatif est la difficultÃ© Ã  obtenir tous les achievements.

Pour conclure, une trÃ©s bonne surprise qui m'a tenu en jeu une bonne cinquantaine d'heures et auquel je rejoue de temps Ã  autre en co-op.

review: Ay Dios Mio, me encanta mucho esta juego! My only problem with Guacamelee! Gold Edition was it was painfully short, but there are two gorgeous new levels to deal with that. It looks beautiful, the music's excellent, the story's exciting, and the gameplay is just right. One of the only games that has motivated me to get 100% and beat Hard Mode (still working on that). One or two glitches, and "Trolololol!" is not an acceptable boss laugh, but who cares, it's a brilliant game, get it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025290431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1451930556}
review:
A Metroid inspired game with a creative world design and solid controls. There are multiple abilities that are gained throughout the game to allow the player to progress to areas they could not previously, as well as the option to upgrade your character, and purchase/unlock costumes. The game also offers interesting challenges outside of the main storyline. 

The characters, story and game environments are all vibrant and charming; this is something that really brings the game to life and gives it a lot of personality. Overall itâ€™s a wonderful game and I had a blast playing it. I'd recommend it to anyone who has enjoyed playing a Metroidvania styled game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966429024', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1561831008}
review:
So, what if instead of a sexy blond babe in power armor, you were a mustachio'd luchador? And what if instead of blasting energy-sucking amoeba, you piledrive skellingtons into the ground? That's basically Guacamelee, a metroidvania with a healthy helping of spicy hot salsa.

Ok, so it's got the Mexican flavour gimmick. What else? How about those supertight controls for that unusually deep combat system for this type of game? Fabulous lucha action in well though-out levels? A surprisingly nice story with memorable characters? Maybe some excellent audiovisual design with a toe-tapping soundtrack? A sense of humor and plenty of Easter Eggs? Split Screen co/op? Chickens?

This game is a champ and probably one of the best metroidvania available on pc.

I rate this game 5 out of 5 bananas.

What my ratings mean:
1 bananas - Crap. Turn around & donâ€™t look back.
2 bananas - Bad. Not really worth it.
3 bananas - Average. For fans of the genre or a sale.
4 bananas - Good. Won't waste your time.
5 bananas - Superb. A definite must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122873080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1529682290}
review:
I only played this version of the game, so i can't say anything about whether it's better than Gold edition or not...

But it's a very very well executed game. Everything fits together. The mechanics are well integrated and there is just the right amount of checkpoints and difficulty

And also, although you wouldn't expect it from a game like this: It has a story. The ending is the best ending i have ever seen... i think a tear fell from my eye.

Also: References. Lots and lots of references. Keep an eye on the first boss ;) you'll get it

If you're even remotely interested I assure you, this game is better than you expect it to be

author: {'steamid': '76561198255030790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1606280467}
review:
Totalmente recomendado, visualmente es una joya, las animaciones, las paletas de colores, los diseÃ±os de personajes y escenarios estÃ¡n integrados en un todo que te absorbe rÃ¡pidamente, sumando una buena banda sonora y un sentido del humor muy efectivo, el juego esta garantizado para desafiarte y hacerte reÃ­r una y otra vez.
Tiene un gran sistema de combate, va diversificÃ¡ndose y se mantiene fresco a lo largo del juego, aunque los enemigos se repiten una y otra vez, se disfruta cada pelea.
Los niveles estÃ¡n llenos de secretos y caminos a los que no se puede acceder en un solo recorrido, si eres de los que gusta sacarle el 100% a un juego esto es para ti.
Las plataformas son muy divertidas y pueden llegar a ser muy desafiantes, aunque el juego es muy benevolente al momento de 'fallar' un escenario o perder una pelea, los checkpoints estÃ¡n ampliamente distribuidos en los escenarios y si fallas alguna de las plataformas el juego rÃ¡pidamente te reposiciona para otra oportunidad sin ninguna clase de castigo.
-PROS
+Excelentes grÃ¡ficos, animaciÃ³n y banda sonora.
+Hermoso diseÃ±o de niveles y plataformas.
+Modo de combate amplio y fresco con gran nÃºmero de habilidades a descubrir y utilizar.
+Gran jugabilidad con insuperable programaciÃ³n para jugar tanto con controlador como con teclado.
+Modo Multijugador
+Gran valor de re-jugabilidad.
+Divertido, lleno de referencias y tributos a los grandes videojuegos de las primeras generaciones.
-CONTRAS
-No tiene penalidades ni sistema de derrota.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109561147', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1697577819}
review:
Awesome metroidvania with engaging combat, great soundtrack and some hard ass puzzles if you want to 100% the game. 

Definitely a must buy for any platform fan out there, yep.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962958113', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1775, 'last_played': 1446928896}
review:
Moi qui pensais que tout avait Ã©tÃ© fait dans les jeux de plate-forme, j'ai pris une belle claque en dÃ©couvrant Guacamelee.
La rÃ©alisation de ce jeu est superbe jusque dans les moindres dÃ©tails.

- Les graphismes colorÃ©s tout d'abord, et ce style graphique si particulier.
- La jouabilitÃ© impeccable, les commandes rÃ©pondant au quart de poil (manette Xbox trÃ¨s fortement conseillÃ©e). Les actions s'enchainent Ã  un rythme d'une fluiditÃ© dÃ©concertante.
- Le gameplay qui introduit de nouvelles possibilitÃ©s d'actions Ã  mesure du jeu, permettant de bien maitriser les acquis avant l'aller plus loin, et offrant d'avantage de combos Ã  chaque "dÃ©blocage" d'une nouvelle manip.
- La difficultÃ© bien dosÃ©e. Terminer le jeu reste assez simple, accÃ©der Ã  la bonne fin demande plus d'acharnement. Pour ceux qui veulent s'acharner Ã  rÃ©cupÃ©rer tous les items, il y a du dÃ©fi. Et le mode difficile porte vraiment bien son nom.
- La musique exceptionnelle, complÃ¨tement dans le ton. Une mention spÃ©ciale au Boss Theme.
- Le rythme, qui alterne correctement les phases de castagne, de plate-forme, et recherche et de dialogue.
- L'humour, du gros LOL en perspective Ã  des moments souvent inattendus. Le titre annonce un peu la couleur.
- Les rÃ©fÃ©rences geek, le jeu fourmille de dÃ©tails, de rÃ©fÃ©rences vidÃ©oludiques, et autres QR-codes. La encore, le "SUper Turbo Chanpionship Edition" du titre est Ã©vocateur.
- Le multi sur le mÃªme Ã©cran, pas testÃ© mais a le mÃ©rite d'Ãªtre prÃ©sent. Peut constituer une aide prÃ©cieuse pour venir Ã  bout du mode difficile.
- La capital sympathie, basÃ© sur l'ensemble des critÃ¨res ci-dessus, au top car on ne s'ennuie jamais.

En bref, une excellente surprise que je recommande plus chaudement que des enchiladas sortant du four !

review:
Pro:
-Fluido e da approccio immediato
-Una bella grafica colorata
-Ottima atmosfera con una colonna sonora immersiva 
-Combat system ben realizzato e molto variegato con tantissime combo a disposizione 
-Enigmi e sfide divertenti da risolvere

Contro:
-Poche missioni secondarie
-Poco o nulla di trama
-Qualche volta potrebbe prendere male i comandi 

In conclusione: Guacamelee Ã¨ un bel gioco simpatico e veloce che consiglio assolutamente a tutti, perchÃ© Ã¨ il classico gioco da una partitella e via per rilassarsi. Molto divertente e immediato sin dalle prime ore di gioco con un crescendo (in difficoltÃ , personaggio ecc...) ben organizzato e appagante per certi versi.

Voto:8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198138816979', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1459081705}

author: {'steamid': '76561198247174736', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1476245215}
review:
Con poco mas de 6 horas de juego, me atrevo a escribir este analisis para Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition, el cual es el siguiente:

Apartado tecnico:
[list]
[*]Tenemos un cuidado y colorido apartado grafico (tomando en cuenta que es un port de PsVita) escenario vistozo, buena iluminacion, todo se adaptan a lo que desean reflejar.
[*]Una maquina con caracteristicas decente, lo corre sin problemas (no poseeo un pc poderosa pero si lo suficientemente 
capaz de correrlo sin problemas)
[/list]

Historia
[*]Puede escucharse un poco "normalita", cliche e incluso tosca, pero no es asÃ­, todo lo contrario; tenemos una histora buena, con buena narrativa, no podemos pedirle mas a este juego.
[*]Los enemigos son algo que tambien se tomaron del folklor MÃ©xicano, como mÃ©xicano me alegra que nos tomen en cuenta.
[/list]

Jugabilidad
[list]
[*]La combinacion de ambos mundos (vivos y muertos).
[*]La secuencia de los combos, no es muy dificil adaptarse a ellos, en unos cuantos minutos de prÃ¡ctica, seras todo un experto.
[*] Los poderes que vas ganando confrome pases juegando, es otro plus que mejora tu experiencia de juego.
[/list]

Banda sonora
[list]
[*] La mÃºsica suena a su ritmo, tiene muy buenos OST que ambienta perfectamente la escena.
[*]No son lo  mejor que puede haber en el juego pero, le funciona perfectamente. 
[/list]

En conclusiÃ³n, el juego es bueno, tendras unas 10 horas de juego, 20 si quieres sacar todos los logros que tienen en steam, pero esa ya es cuestion de gustos. Recomendada la compra, mas si lo consigues en rebajas, no puedes perdertelo.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198024992116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1636783852}
review:
So from playing both versions of Guacemelee! at 100% achievements, I can give a proper review.

This version of the game has more features and levels than gold edition but this also made the game easier (looking at you intensio). The achievements were cut in haft (so 30 achievements to unlock unlike 60 in gold) and getting costumes with special abilities require silver coins where they are found from completing arenas or chests (by the way Pinata costume doubles any chest, this includes silver chest so you may want to invest into that early).

They remove some stuff like the flashing lights from getting power ups (thank god) and some undodgeable attack that some enemies have. 

Overall, I still have fun and this version supports 4 players instead of 2 apparently! 

I'd recommend this over gold.

Have fun admiring all them references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027307542', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1474463366}
review:
I want to love this game way more than I do.
This is by no means a bad game, in fact, it's an extremley good one. While the puzzles are pretty easy and I never thought twice about what to do, even though it's a metroidvania, the combat, level design and overall charm is wonderful. However, I don't think I will ever revisit this game again as the final hour of the game is filled with tedious challenges, awful enemy placement, to the point of entire sections of the game where the most difficult enemies are just packed in, and an atrocious final boss completely soiled the very fun experience I had with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995246089', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1476239131}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084769256', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1476009538}
review:
Rapido, divertido y, en algunos puntos, desafiante.

Un metroidvania mas que recomendado en el que encarnaremos a Juan, un luchador mexicano con la misiÃ³n de salvar el mundo y a su amada (simple y efectivo). Un juego rebosante de guiÃ±os, diversiÃ³n y acciÃ³n. Con un apartado artistico genial y una banda sonora igual de buena. De su jugabilidad dirÃ© que, aunque no juguÃ© con mando, son faciles de aprenderse lo basico y si los dominas (tarea un tanto complicada) puedes hacer combos capaces de derrotar a 20 enemigos en menos de lo que canta un gallo sin que te rocen siquiera. Aunque debe destacarse se duraciÃ³n, ya que solo con 24 horas de juego yo me lo he pasado y he conseguido todos los logros.Pero aun asÃ­ debo decir que es un gran juego que deberias plantearte comprar muy seriamente si te gustan este tipo de juegos.

Mi opiniÃ³n? Un juego de 8.5/10. Deberias comprarlo? Si.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011957165', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1475366349}
review:
Contrairement Ã  la version classique de Guacamelee! 
Cette version super Turbo championship Edition dispose de nouvelles zones et de nouveaux ennemies, et c'est lÃ  que commence les problÃ¨mes. En effet dans la version normal, cette nouvelle version tout comme sa petite soeur est d'une facilitÃ© Ã©vidente, quelques heures et essais et le jeu est fini. 
A la diffÃ©rence, la version difficile est hallucinante de stupiditÃ© et de difficultÃ©, les nouveaux ennemies se feront une joie de vous empÃªcher complÃ¨tement de continuer de jouer. 

Bref, pour la version normal je dis oui, et amis chasseur de succÃ¨s, pour la version difficile, je vous conseille de jouer avec une vieille manette facilement remplaÃ§able et cassable !

review: Guacamelee es el mejor juego de plataformas que te tocado en muchos aÃ±os, su historia sencilla graciosa pero brusca, entretenida y rapida. Con respecto a su diseÃ±o para mi es genial, muchos colores vivos y originalidad en el mismo, se nota ser un juego mexicano debido al respeto y contacto con los muertos, puedes cambiar a una fase "astral" a gusto para poder pasar ciertos desafios, y por el lado auditivo la mÃºsica no te aburrira, todo lo contrario. El modo de peleas es una amalgama de juegos, preciso bastante intuitivo, muy entretenido, a medida que vas avanzando por el mapa vas consiguendo nuevos poderes, como un shoryuken o doble salto. A cualquier jugador de metroid, megaman, o cualquier juego arcade sidescroll, le recomendarÃ­a mucho este juego, pero la verdad lo recomiendo a todo mundo, no te arrepentiras!

review:
QUE.
JOGO.

Tem uma histÃ³ria bem curta, mas se buscar completar 100%, dÃ¡ umas boas 20 horas de exploraÃ§Ã£o e de uma das melhores experiÃªncias de Metroidvania que tive nos Ãºltimos tempos. Vasculhar tudo e desenhar todos os mapas por capricho se torna muito recompensador no final, que te dÃ¡ vontade de comeÃ§ar outro save imediatamente pra completar tudo de novo. 
Comandos precisos; temÃ¡tica muito interessante; diÃ¡logos bacanas; cenÃ¡rios lindamente desenhados; trilha sonora tambÃ©m; gimmicks; segredos; easter eggs e referÃªncias a memes, videogames, filmes e cultura pop... Um dos melhores jogos indies que jÃ¡ tive contato, e o meu atual favorito na minha biblioteca da Steam. 
Se ainda nÃ£o tiver a versÃ£o original, corre e compra logo e sem pensar duas vezes essa Super Turbo Championship Edition. Tem bastante conteÃºdo adicional, que vÃ£o alÃ©m de uma DLC: Visuais aprimorados; novas Ã¡reas; novo boss; roupas que aplicam efeitos alÃ©m da utilidade estÃ©tica; o modo "intenso"; trÃªs slots para save (no original, tinha somente um); fases retrabalhadas e aprimoradas... Ã‰ o suficiente pra atÃ© quem tem o jogo original possa aproveitar mais que o suficiente dessa nova versÃ£o do jogo, que Ã© de fato a definitiva.
No mais, COMPRE.

review:
TL;DR Mexican Metroidvania, great action, funny dialogue and characters, rendered in a cartoon style with excellent hat-drops to past and present games (in Tech Mex style ;-) ).

Bought after recommendation from a game design podcast suggested it was a near-perfect Metroidvania and I wished to study the style for potentially creating my own.
Great fun.

Would die at the hands of skeletal death and embark on a "the princess is in the other castle" quest as a reincarnated Lucheros again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043404278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1473302345}
review:
Guacamelee is a Metroidvania style game that takes place in Mexico. It has a nice mix of combat, platforming, with clever writing and charming characters.

The story is simple but is interesting and keeps you motivated to play through. You play as Juan, a simple Agave farmer living the simple life and are asked by the church to help set up for the Dia de Los Meurtos celebration. The priest who asked you there also asked the presidents daughter, who is your childhood friend/sweetheart to show up and help as well, and after a touching reunion she asks you to drop by and say hi. That's when Calaca, leader of the dead rises and attacks, kidnapping the Presidents daughter you and killing you (don't worry, you get better). Now you gotta stop Calaca from merging the worlds of living and dead and save your sweetheart. But your princess is probably in another temple.

The gameplay is pretty solid. Combat flows nicely (in a sort of beat'em'up style) and focuses on trying to juggle enemies to keep a combo going. There are only a few times I felt like I got stopped do to something out of my control in combat, but the penalty is minimal (it usually respawns you in the last room) so it wasn't too bad. In terms of the platforming they make full use of every single mechanic in the game, including an uppercut (that you'll use often as an extra jump), a dash (that you'll use to extend your jump or reposition yourself), wall jumps/climbs/boosts, hell even the headbutt that only stalls you in mid air is used for movement. The only complaint I have about combat is sometimes the controls feel a tad clunky, as in I will use an uppercut and nothing will happen.

Music is catchy, and I never felt bored listening to it. Few games have me go "I just want a new songs" so it was nice to see this avoid that, even if the same song plays for extended periods of time.

As a Metroidvania game it suits the genre pretty well, even if a lot of secrets are pretty obvious where they are (I can jump here, I bet there is something there). This is made more apparent by giant colored blocks that stand out so much you could probably see them from a mile away, and they only restrict you from getting there until you have a set ability. There is only one secret I had to search up a guide for and I still don't know how I was supposed to piece it together. [spoiler]You have to press a switch, run 3 screens over to find a now open hole in the ground that is only apparent if you open up the map and has no other indication[/spoiler].

The game isn't too challenging unless you are going for 100%, and even those parts aren't too terribly punishing. Most punishments just send you a couple screens away.

Also if you like references this game has a LOT. We are talking about posters that advertise "Bust-it Bill", main villain quoting Star-Wars... everything you can think of and more is probably referenced here, even simple memes like TF2's "MENTLEGEN?"


Overall Guacamelee is a solid Metroidvania game that makes great use of all the mechanics it gives. The gameplay is smooth, with only a few issues. Definitely suggest it if you are interested in a good Metroidvania game.
