author: {'steamid': '76561198141182042', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1489096799}
review:
This game is THE Metroidvania game of the 2008+ years. As long as you have a controller to play with it is a good game to learn to speedrun, casual fun, co-op with the girlfriend or just a classic hardcore gaming session.

I have had hours of fun 100%ing this game over and over again. Lots of replay value, all around fun and the fighting as well as platforming are very very satisfying.

Highly reccomended for anyone for any reason. I was hesitant at first because it seemed cheesy but now I'm having trouble finding games that compare to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999004973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1473105021}
review:
It's not perfect, but it's a blast.

I got this for free on PS4 a while back, and I had some trouble. I decided to purchase it on sale on Steam, so I could enjoy it with my 360 controller. I didn't put it down for 4 days. As far as the gameplay goes, it's the proper amount of infuriating, as a Metroid/Castlevania clone should be. And make no mistake there; don't even waste your time trying to play this without a controller. 

There is little for wrestling fans here, despite the theme. It does a good job being entertaining, and despite a load of DANK MEMES in the set dressing, the game is relatively unobnoxious in regards to visuals. Although I played through the game as Juanita, the main character is entirely silent, and the 


Expect an 8-hour story and twice that if you are a completionist. Or half that if you're a speedrunner, this game is a speeders dream.

Advice: You'll have to use your GPU Vsync because the in-game VSync cuases awful input lag, and without it, there is a bunch of tearing. However, the game runs great, and I've been playing it for days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290946251', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1476015689}
review:
This is my first review and english is not my mother language, so take it easy.

Guacamelee is one of the best plataform games i ever played, every time you think that the game have no more to show, it shows a new mechanic that shows you another form of perspective of the scenarios (and the scenarios also have one of the the most beautiful art that i had ever seen ;-;). It also have a lot of back-tracking in a Castlevania map style to got some money, health, stamina and other collectibles, plus the epic boss battle.

PROS:

-Awesome plataform puzzles
-Cool throwing battle system
-Interesting replay
-Co-op multiplayer *-*

CONS:

-The characters could have a voice ;-;

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041996180', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1529804064}
review:
Just finished the game 100% and I can say, whoo. That was really fun.

On the plus side, first thing that comes to mind is the gorgeous visuals. The whole game is just a work of art from beginning to end. You can probably tell just looking at the screenshots.
The combat system starts out really simple but ramps up with each new ability you get, where by the end of it you're basically an unstoppable LUCHADOOOOOORE and it feels fantastic. <3
If you're into "mexican" music, the soundtrack's pretty damned good too. The one song I didn't enjoy was for the Canal area.
Lastly, ff, the characters are really neat. I love the flame headed alcoholic guy. I actually felt bad after taking him and a few of the others out.
Downsides? I'd say the story feels a little hastily written. Not much there but it works. Kinda like the old school "Princess peach has been kidnapped, gotta go save her" sorta dealio. That and sometimes the challenge is absurdly difficult. I'm looking at you, Sierra mask piece. FUCK YOU.

If I were to rate it, I'd give it like an 8.5/10. Lots to love.
If you like it, also check out Ori and the Blind Forest, very similar feel to it, just with a different theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036851880', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1471796052}
review:
I have just 100% this game and put in more than 70 hours into this game. So this review will be from the persective of actually playing this game all the way through.

I am a huge metroid fan and this game completely filled that nitch. the progression of added abilties as you go through the game was spot on for me. there are some times were it was annoying having to backtrack. however it is not entirely required if you are not going for 100%. Also there are (olmecs??) to help with the travel so you dont have to run for a hour to get somewhere.

I also enjoyed the RPG elements of the game. being able to upgrade though the money system was a nice perk. the costumes were also a nice touch and came in handy for the inferno rooms to help with different trouble spots

the difficulty ramped up nice and steady. I never felt like it curved up to sharp. The inferno rooms are the hardest part of the entire game so if you are looking for a challenge in this game that is were you should go. It reminded me allot of the VR rooms in bionic commando rearmed.

music, sound and art style are great. I enjoyed the visuals allot and the music was a nice mix of authintic with some electronic elements added to it. A good comparison might be donkey kong country returns. while not the same it has the same illustrated feel.

gameplay was tight however i did have some quirks that i had trouble with. when playing the combo chicken arena i often had issues with the controls pushing juan the oppositie direction of what i pushed. in other wards doing a uppercut to the left instead of the right. breaking the combo fow. outside of this though it wasnt to much of a problem with the rest of the game. I also liked how things were mapped to the controller. in fact the feel there was more like the metroid prime series (visors) then say super metroid. 

as for the beat em up style this game uses. i normally get tired of these type of games. (think heavenly sword, or final fight maybe) but this game switched things up so much i really did not get tired of it tell around the 60 hour mark which was fine as i was playing back through it on hard mode by that time.

speaking of hard mode. It really is hard mode. If you just want to rush through the game and beat calaca hard mode isnt that much harder. you loose more health, there are more enemies, and the bosses have some extra patterns. Now if you want to 100% hard mode, that is difficult. especially the inferno rooms. my advice is try to 100% as much as you can before going to inferno.

In the end i love this game and is one of the games i platinumed this year. I dig the style, the cheesy and funny lines from the NPC were entertaining. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoyed the metroidvania style of games as this is one of the best ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065071708', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1471897595}
review:
Guacamelee! takes the throne as one of the best 2D action Metroidvania platformers.  It is a giant bag of eye and ear candy with masterful level design, intuitive controls, and a fresh spin on a familiar story.  The pacing feels just right between stages and power-ups.  Some of the platform puzzles can be tricky but rewarding once they're figured out and fun to solve with the arsenal of cool abilities and combos (a controller is pretty much imperative). With plenty of checkpoints and fast travel locations, progression and backtracking never really feel like a chore.  Previous levels are a joy to revisit once Juan (or Tostada) becomes a mighty luchador and can blow through them with ease.  The enemies and bosses are varied and entertaining.  Spend coins to unlock costumes and buffs, all of which make Juan, well, super buff (but with slight nerfs in certain areas depending on the costume).  At a certain point, you will feel like an OP beefcake.

The game does quite a bit of handholding, however, with so many checkpoints and conventient respawn locations.  Sometimes it feels like there is very little at stake, and so Guacamelee! might seem a little too casual for more hardcore gamers.  There are, on the other hand, enough in-game and Steam achievements to warrant multiple playthroughs and serious skill-honing.

Ou plutÃ´t, on est pas bien sÃ»r de comprendre si câ€™est voulu ou ringard. Et on commence le jeu avec une petite apprÃ©hension que ce soit mal dosÃ© (non, faut pas une dose de cheval, Perceval). Mais, sans vous dÃ©voiler tous les gags, câ€™est au final trÃ¨s rÃ©ussi ! Ca mÃªle des histoires de tÃ©lÃ© novÃ©las, de croyances latinos, de moments kitschs et certainsâ€¦ Vraiment WTF. Niveau graphismes, son, ambiance : câ€™est rÃ©ussi. Câ€™est pas â€œbeauâ€, mais câ€™est propre, cohÃ©rent, bien fini, bien pensÃ©. Câ€™est agrÃ©able, et au service du rire et du gameplay. Parlons gameplay : il ne fait pas partie des plus prÃ©cis, ni des plus complexes. On a cependant assez de profondeur de gameplay avec les diffÃ©rents coups puissants, les variantes, les prises, le mode â€œhÃ©rosâ€ qui booste les dÃ©gÃ¢ts, les double sauts et rebondsâ€¦ Et bien dâ€™autres choses encore ! Vous risquerez de vous Ã©nerver un peu sur certains passages de plateforme, mais rien dâ€™horrible non plus. Mes seuls regrets sont peut-Ãªtre la relative facilitÃ© de se dÃ©faire de la plupart des monstres, et mÃªme des boss qui ne demanderont pas forcÃ©ment un timing prÃ©cis ni une grande rÃ©flexion pour trouver la technique dâ€™approche.

review:
The silliest and sunniest metroidvania I've seen so far. Beat skeletons up. Prance in a rooster costume. Learn spanish from the million gaming and pop culture references scattered all over the game (I lost it at El Nino de Carne.)

Don't get fooled, though, you still need to keep an eye out for those pesky secret passages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020554', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1468809169}
review:
Because I own over 1000 games, I never really bothered to look at this game before. However, in the 2016 Summer Games Done Quick Marathon, Guacamelee was played and it seemed fun. So I decided to give it a go.

To start, Guacamelee is a platformy fighter kind of game, but since you are reading this review, I'll spare you the trouble of repeating what the description already says. The gameplay is really smooth and really good to say the least. The physics are consistent, the platforms are good, the hitboxes of enemies are consistent and normal, and the game just does a very good job with all the platforming and abilities. To put it short, you won't rage at this game because of some glitch. You have some basic moves and you pick up more along the way which allow you to continue your journey on. The difficulty gets harder and harder as you progress through the story and because you start unlocking more abilities, the need to combo them and use them correctly adds to how it gets harder. However, no matter how hard it got, the game always gave ample save points and checkpoints that wouldn't punish you too much. Some of the platforming parts and fights actually took me so many tries (over 20 with some). The boss fights for this are also very smoothed out. Almost all of the bosses had two "phases" or more where they have a different attack pattern or form. You go in blind, die to their attacks because you don't know what they are and then go in again and learn from your mistakes. It is a Dark Souls type of boss fighting experience, but easier. Lastly on the gameplay, there are a LOT of secrets and extra exploration areas to go to which make the game quite interesting.

Aside from the gameplay, Guacamelee has an interesting story, even if some parts may be intentionally cliche. Since we are on the story, there are certain parts of it that are actually funny and sometimes they even make meme jokes and references. The art of this game is also super crisp and nice. It also features a unique style of art which I enjoyed quite a bit. There is also nothing to complain about with the music as it fits the game perfectly and is just quite good.

Overall, I really cannot find many faults with this game at all. It is just simply fun, smooth, and well done. I really appreciate SGDQ for introducting this game to me and I would recommend this game to anyone.

Rating: 9.0/10
Recommend Price: $10 or under

author: {'steamid': '76561198025524179', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1459021889}
review:
Metroidvania extramemente divertido! A histÃ³ria Ã© bem padrÃ£o, mas os dois finais disponÃ­veis sÃ£o bem legais! O jogo Ã© desafiador na medida certa, e tem um visual e direÃ§Ã£o de arte fenomenais!

O sistema de combos Ã© excelente, e vira uma mistura bem bacana de beat'em up com exploraÃ§Ã£o a lÃ¡ metroidvania, mesmo que mais simples do que um castlevania ou super metroid!

Me surpreendeu positivamente, foi mais divertido e mais bonito do que imaginava! Vale a pena, principalmente para fÃ£s de beat'em ups ou metroidvanias!

author: {'steamid': '76561198163765788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1453216914}
review:
Genial metroidvania, simplemente. El control es perfecto. Las mecÃ¡nicas no se han repetitivas ni aburren. Los personajes son carismÃ¡ticos y la historia te hace querer saber mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s. Hasta la mÃºsica estÃ¡ cuidada.
Tanto la parte de plataformeo, como la de puzzles, como la de combates estÃ¡ perfectamente equilibrada. Me durÃ³ unas 10 horas, y eso que no completÃ© casi ningÃºn reto ni logro.
Mucho humor, muchas risas, mucha lucha libre. Merece la pena a precio completo, aunque suele estar rebajado de vez en cuando.
RecomendadÃ­simo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108724857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1474838101}
review:
Guacamelee is a metroivania platformer set in a cartoonish, hilarious Mexican world. You play as Juan, a humble agave farmer turned undead luchador. As you progess, you will unlock more and more fighting moves to allow you to access new areas. The platforming challenges are very good, and will test your ability to use all of Juans move to progess, or get to hard-to-reach rewards. This game is full of well hidden secrets to discover. The biggest highlight is the combat system. It may feel unintuitive at first, but after some time and additional moves unlocked, you will be dishing out "CARNAGE!" to hordes of unique enemies. The boss fights are also very good as well. It took me about 15 hours to 100 percent the normal game, though the time it takes may vary depending on completion level and skill.

Note: THIS IS THE VERSION OF THE GAME YOU WANT TO GET. Super turbo championship edition has additional levels, challenges, bosses, features, etc. that the gold and original version do not have.

This has become one of my favorite games on steam. I would recommend this to anyone craving a platformer game, especially to someone with a metroidvania craving. The game has enough content that I think it would be a worthwhile buy even at full price. If on sale, BUY IT WITHOUT A SECOND THOUGHT.

review:
I'm glad I finally tried this game out and its one of those metroidvania types, which I really enjoy. The game is more casual then challenging but I haven't yet played it on the hard mode which is unlocked after you complete it. Also it felt like the gameplay was about 70/30 or 60/40 of puzzle/combat, but that depends on your willingness to obtain powerups and money.

The game was fun and I'm pretty sure other people will enjoy it if they are fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237397026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1467217048}
review:
After watching The Book Of Life, and i saw this game! Vibrant colour and simple clean Art style attracted me and I bought this game straightly. Simple fighting mechanism platform, collect coin for different suits with different bonus, 2 dimension ( living & death ) and some puzzles to solve with Hero's skill. Fighting bosses isn't hard, the hardest in the game is the pain in the ass jumping / swipe dimension quest. Storyline 4/5, music 3.6/5. 

Overall 4/5. 
P/S. It is easier to play with a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048847167', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1969, 'last_played': 1467911201}
review:
Genre: Lucha Libre-themed Metroidvania beat 'em up platformer.

Caveat: I don't care about player skins or multiplayer, so I refrain from judging those. The story is about saving a damsel and the world. Everything else...

Great sound, visuals, mechanics and level design, with a fresh brand of humor added in. The game is always conveying a feeling of liveliness and the grappling mechanics make the fights interesting. My only (minor) gripes are that the 'Intenso' feels like a cheat, rather than something that the game was designed with in mind, and the side questing and chicken-mode felt underdeveloped.

The gameplay mixes metroidvania-esque exploration with beat'em up combat, with a focus on moves that not only deal damage, but also improve mobility when platforming.

The pacing is good and ends at just the right time imo. I've spent about 18hrs exploring 100% of most areas. The game helpfully shows you on the world map which areas you've fully explored by gilding them; there are 15 areas in total.

Difficulty-wise, it's not hard at all, unless you decide to explore off the beaten path for extra challenges. If you do, you may get a few extra hours' worth of somewhat more difficult gameplay. It's by no means infuriating though, Guacamelee is not and isn't trying to be a super-difficult game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299541432', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1468334132}

author: {'steamid': '76561198181175874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1465960670}
review:
You'd think with a title like Guacamelee, this game would have guacamole be some sort of central thing to the plot or something. It's not. The title's just there to sell the game's aesthetic. And you'd think that a game like this that goes so far out of its way to give life to its little cartoon Latin America would try and capitalize on what Latin American culture has to offer in terms of themes storytelling, sort of like what 2015's Book of Life ended up doing, or like what Clover did with Okami and Japanese folklore.

But wow. Not Guacamelee miss its chance to do that, it dives off a cliff to avoid it.

Gorgeous animation, beautifully thematic visual design are all wasted here in a game who's core is bogged down by an overwhelming amount of lame, blatant references to other video games have nothing to do with this one (I still can't wrap my head around the Hotline Miami billboard) and 2013 era memes that not only cringy and extremely dated, but break the immersion the art and music worked so hard to encourage. And if you want to give the game props for being mechanically functional and satisfying, that's fine, but there are better games that are better at even just being metroidvanias than Guacamelee is.
Pair that with writing that's clichÃ©d but alright at best when itâ€™s not busy explaining its jokes and winking to the audience and youâ€™re left with just a hollow, cynical shell of a game that thinks pleasing a crowd is the same thing as being good. It thinks that a cultural aesthetic can be worn and sold like a costume. It's gross, it's cringy, but it's worst of all just plain lazy. And that's a damn shame. 

Don't buy this game.

review: Like metroidvanias? Then boy do I have the game for you! This game is incredibly fun, the combat is fast and caters to both high and low skill players. The main story is really fun, but whats really great is trying to get all of the orbs to the hidden mask! Its in 6 or 8 parts, and some of the challenges are the hardest ive ever faced! I actually couldnt get the good ending because one is so fucking hard to get! And thats my only real gripe is how I got literally everything except ONE orb, and I get the shitty ending! Even though it usually rears its head around top20 or 10 hardest gaming challenges lists online. Oh well, still great game, and its also really funny and seeped in mexican culture. Pleasure to play, and to watch!

review:
Simply love this game! The references are wonderful, the play controls are fun (a little wonky with the wrong controller, but that's not the game's fault), the artistry is excellent and colorful - it's just a great little game!
The story is thin and fairly hackneyed, but that's not why you're there, and it feels a bit short, but those are pretty much the only faults I can find. Just go play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077097354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1465353601}
review:
Get gold edition. 
Intenso literally breaks the fucking game making it a cake walk. 
>Break any shield with ONE punch
>Recharge Health
Amongst other things.
End game becomes less fun and more tedious
Also, Developers haven't realased Mod Assests so creators can edit the Intenso character sprite.

So, thats virtually dead. Also, the implemented skins (Which they charged console users for), are hilariously lazy. Recylcing the same sound effects for every character except the female one. 

Buy Gold.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002986817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1465349050}
review: Yes, this is a very good game for the 2 bucks I spent. It's a pretty long game and very challanging. It has a very good storyline that likes to bring in ideas from other games while having its own personal humor. The only issue I have with the game is that its so fricken hard. The problem is its hard for hards sake not that its overly challanging. The hardness comes from platforming thats extremely complicated and fights that are the same kind of fight over and over again. Plus you can't get the "good" ending unless you do a huge mess of extremely hard challanges. The diffaculty of the game is what really dampens the game in my opinion. It isn't super meat boy hard but it's still really tough. Still, it was a fun game and I reccomend it for all for a few bucks. Also, it is better with a controller but I played the entire game without it and its totally possible and it doesn't destroy your fingers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125937547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1464701612}
review:
Guacamelee! es un metroidvania con un arte basado en la cultura mexicana. Apenas sÃ© algo sobre la cultura de MÃ©xico pero este juego se centra sobretodo en la festividad de el Dia de los Muertos, la cual es Patrimonio Cultural Inmaterial de la Humanidad, que no es poco.

El juego es colorido y divertido, repleto de "guiÃ±os", que mas bien sÃ³n homenajes a otros videojuegos mÃ¡s o menos famosos. TambiÃ©n cabe destacar el humor propio que esta presente practicamente siempre que se interactua con los demÃ¡s personajes, ya sean los pueblerinos, los muertos e incluso los propios enemigos. 

Como metroidvania que es, iremos desbloqueando distintas habilidades para poder avanzar y explorar el mapa pero sobretodo para explorarlo y descubrir secretos o bonificaciones extra.

Los logros no son excesivamente dificles para quienes quieran comlpetarlo al 100%. No hay demasiados y algunos solo requieren tiempo y/o dedicaciÃ³n.

Como ya he mencionado, Guacamelee! mantiene el humor durante casi toda la aventura pero en el final y los creditos, al menos a mi, me ha dejado reflexionando (no quiero spoilear) el ver como algo tan simple y natural ha estado presente durante toda la experiencia. No es un tema nuevo, pero a mi me ha dejado buen sabor de boca. Todo encaja a la perfecciÃ³n y es simplemente genial. 

En conclusiÃ³n, compra muy recomendada para aquellos que disfruten de los metroidvania y busquen algo original y sobretodo, con personalidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173842847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1461674069}
review:
Dip your chip into this tasty treat.

With Guacamelee: Super Turbo Championship Edition, Toronto-based indie developer DrinkBox Studios mashes up 2D Metroid-inspired exploration and platforming with brawler-style combat, then seasons it all with heavy doses of Mexican culture, video game nostalgia, and lively humor. The 2013 original skipped Nintendo hardware, but luckily Wii U owners get to experience this expanded, definitive take on the game with new areas, abilities, and enemies.

Guacamelee: STCE stars Juan, a lowly agave farmer bestowed with a super-powered luchador mask after a brave--but failed--attempt to rescue El Presidenteâ€™s daughter. Juanâ€™s ensuing journey is presented in a cartoony manner that rarely wavers from a peppy, humorous bent, though I found the narrativeâ€™s handful of serious notes surprisingly compelling, as well. That being said, the story is never really intrusive. It doesnâ€™t overpower the gameplay, but flavors it well, combining with a Mexican setting and vibe rarely explored in video games to form a vivid, refreshing personality thatâ€™s a tremendous asset to the experience.

Juanâ€™s adventure takes him across a series of gorgeously rendered locales, and the Metroid-inspired progression in regards to new abilities yielding newly accessible areas is pervasive throughout. The game does a good enough job with this structure, and its world is fun to explore. Thereâ€™s always another hidden health or stamina upgrade to be found or perhaps an amusing easter egg referencing video games or pop culture lurking somewhere around. The ability progression makes it so that things really open up over time in terms of combat and navigating the game world.

However, Guacamelee is admittedly a bit lacking when it comes to the pacing and environmental intricacy that are so key to the best titles in the â€œMetroidvaniaâ€ genre. For instance, the map is segmented in such a way that environments feel set apart from each other, and there are loading screens separating the individual areas. The maps can be quite well interwoven within these discrete zones, but they donâ€™t overlap with each other in significant ways. Also, the color-coded barriers that gate off areas until the acquisition of the proper abilities seem a bit paint-by-numbers and inorganic. All these elements dissolve a much-desired sense of seamlessness.

Fortunately, other aspects make up for these small deficiencies. Combat in particular improves significantly once more moves are unlocked. In the beginning, battles feel stilted, samey, and very chore-like. In the late game, when enemy types are more varied and the player has a wider array of super-powered moves available, combos become far more creative and stylish. The design structure still tends to rely too much on kill rooms, but the surprisingly deep and fun combat system that emerges over the course of the game mostly mitigates this flaw.

The way new attack moves also increase mobility (e.g., a Dragon Punch-style uppercut allows one to make it to previously out-of-reach platforms) is a nice touch that makes gaining new abilities feel more meaningful and adds extra texture to the gameâ€™s solidly-designed gauntlet of platforming challenges.

The only issues with Guacamelee are simply minor quibbles that keep it from true masterpiece status. Itâ€™s hard to worry too much about these slight imperfections when the game hits so many right notes, ranging from the lavish presentation to the deep combat and platforming. On the whole, itâ€™s a brisk and refreshing joy to play, with a lively personality that's eminently endearing. Guacamelee is a fantastic Metroid-inspired platformer that shouldnâ€™t be missed.
Summary
Pros

    Exploration is a joy
    Fun presentation and personality
    Nice ability progression
    Outstanding art style and graphics
    Surprisingly deep combat

Cons

    Imperfect implementation of Metroidvania structure
    Overreliance on kill rooms

author: {'steamid': '76561198035996721', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1621792064}
review:
Wow! Bought this game on a steam sale years ago and just finally got bored enough to play it and with my little expectations I was BLOWN AWAY.

Everything from the art style, to the humor, to the gameplay, even the narrative left a very postive taste in my mouth. It's like a 2d version of my favorite game of all time ocarina of time. You go to a new place get a new power to help you solve incresingly diffacult puzzles just like a zelda, but this game adds in interesting challenges by adding moderately difficult platforming while fighting against hordes of baddies.

The action is everywhere, if I had to nitpick i'd say there are too many enemies, but a large portion of the enemies are optional battles. That being said combat is very fun. Its easy to string hits but you can do some pretty narly combos. And I love how baddies scale in this game, instead of taking a billion hits to kill late game they just start to dodge and become pseudo boss attack patterns.

And each area concludes with a boss battle. The inner sadist in me wishes they were harder, but they are epic feeling. Every boss is unique, has a progression to how they attack, and once you figure out their patterns are very rewarding to kill.

The narrative is pretty moving. The plot is pretty straightfoward but the combination of the art style and the unique setting of the game really helps disguise the fact that it is basically dude rescues the princess platformer. The characters are memorable, the dialog is good and the cutscenes are powerful.

The comedy style of this game is gold for me I could see it being a detterant for someone who wants their game to be taken seriously, but its an indie game. At one point the devs run out of new ability names so they litterally say sorry we ran out of names and give you a move called "Dashing Derpderp".

I just beat the game on regular mode, but in order to get the complete narrative I have to go back and play on a new game plus type deal and I'm ECSTATIC. I wanted to replay the original game almost immediately after beating it it was so good, but now I have a reason to continue gaming.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142067369', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1462988594}
review: Honestly the most fun platformer/metroidvania I've played... Well, since Super Metroid. It features a super fun combat system borrowed from fighting games, mostly and obviously Street Fighter, although it's much more simple and not strictly timing based for the most part. Platforming is the most challenging part of the game, requires precision and timing but game is not very punishing so it won't get on your nerves quick. If you're looking for an amazing platforming action then you just must try this game out, I can't tell you even a single reason against it, cause that is a 10/10 game. Well, maybe if you hate mexican culture really really much then... You still must play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014507805', 'num_games_owned': 1543, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1534792786}
review:
One of the absolute best Metroidvania games I've ever played, now in the most definitive release!

Don't even know where to start. It has great humor, very intuitive controls (get a gamepad though), fun level design (now with even more areas!) and the ability to play in fan-made costumes is just the icing on the cake. 

Masterful music, fantastic presentation, colorful graphics...really, it's very hard for me to find any flaws with it.

Gold Edition is good, but the Super Turbo Championship Edition is far superior!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129156439', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1462796610}
review:
Lots of fun over all with an ok story.

The gameplay was a lot of fun. The moves all pretty much a directional slam but the throwing along with them made comboing out fun and different then most games like this. The puzzles were challenging on both timing and figuring it out but not to the point they were to hard.
The story was fine but could have used some text sound. doesn't need speaking but just like the beeps like in megaman or random noises in banjo kazooie. It pretty predictable but its fun. 
The game looks great over all and has a lot of little easter eggs hidden in the towns. The music is great but again i wish there was text sounds.

if you like these type of sidescrollers like i do this is a must

author: {'steamid': '76561197997607430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1468763296}
review:
Overall I liked the game and it's definitely worth the price on sale for ~4hrs of entertainment. However there was a slight issue I didn't notice early enough that I'd like to warn people about.

When this game goes on sale, it'll also have the gold edition and this one bundled up in one. Pay attention and don't buy the bundle, just buy this edition.

review: Fun metrovanian platformer with challenging puzzles and gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136673690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1461709791}
review:
This game let's you play as "Bad Ass" Danny Trejo in a gimp mask & apparently all the women (in this game) love themselves a side order of burly tattoo chested gimp mask wearing Danny Trejo.

Do I recommend this game? [i]Â¡por supuesto![/i] - of course.
Why? Because it's a [i]hell-of-a-lot-o-fun![/i]

& moving on... You get to play as plain old regular peasant Juan, Gimp Trejo & as a "Bad Ass" chicken with a pecking fetish. What's not to love? By the way, did I mention I really like Fajitas? What!? I didn't... well, I do, so now you know. ;)

No this game isn't all about fajitas, tortillas, chickens & Danny Trejo. You also get to do a lot of face smashing (& statue smashing much to the chagrin & protestations of a bleating old goat), with a side order of hazardous exploration, brain inducing puzzle solving & general exercise workout regime in the form of reflex training for your thumbs & fingers that would probably even tire out Wolf from the (super old) Gladiators TV show.

10/10/10/-1: Best spandex wearing gimp simulator (ever).

author: {'steamid': '76561198295211675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1462111510}
review:
This game is a true gem! From the graphics, game play,  level design , story, everything about this game is a real delight. Some of the challenges can get frustrating, but it's never so bad where you won't want to try it over again. Visually, this game blows my mind with the fantastic style. Controls are tight and everything feels responsive,  but it can  get hairy when you're battling a big group of enemies, but that's part of the fun ( and I guess the reason for the Intenso meter)
The interaction with the people and NPCS is always sharp and funny. This game has everything you could wish for in a metroidvania,  and brings plenty of twists to keep it feeling fresh.
In short, I really love this game and can't recommend it enough!

review:
Â¿ QuÃ© puedo decir que no haya sido dicho ya ? En aproximadamente 10 horas Juan ( o juanita ) desvelarÃ¡ una conspiraciÃ³n para fundir el mundo de los vivos con el de los muertos. A travÃ©s de enrevesados puzzles, con la ayuda inestimable de un viejo chivo, juan se abrirÃ¡ paso por los diferentes niveles, repartiendo una somanta de ostias a todo aquel que se interponga en su camino, con el fin de salvar a la hija del presidente de la que estÃ¡ enamorado. 

Si te gustan los beat em up, los puzzles y las historias de amor y violencia, este es tu juego.

review:
I was unsure how this game was going to end up but once I started playing I could not stop. Extremely fun side scroller beatem up style game with a combination of beating the crap out of the badies and using ya noggin to work out puzzles.
10/10 game. Will be sad once I've completed it. If only it had online multiplayer.

review: Guacamelee is a perfect blend between metroidvania and arcade gameplay, resulting in minimal backtracking but more linear gameplay. The game is stricly balanced that all of your abilities are useful till the end of the game. Fantastic art direction, lots of references, great audio, satisfying combat. If you expect this game to be slow burning experience, it's not. Guacamelee is fun right from the start till the end

author: {'steamid': '76561198107796249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 2177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2177, 'last_played': 1459080507}
review:
[quote=][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/12146432-La-Cruceta-Inquieta/][b]La Cruceta Inquieta[/b][/url], mentor de Steam[/quote]

Tras el limitado ciclo de vida de un videojuego, el paso de los aÃ±os y, con suerte, alguna que otra reediciÃ³n, al final, y de forma natural, otros nuevos ocuparÃ¡n su lugar y superarÃ¡n los conceptos que en Ã©l y en su dÃ­a fueron exitosos y rompedores. No obstante, como en todo, un selecto grupo lograrÃ¡ resistir el embate del tiempo, permaneciendo en nuestra memoria e inspirando futuras creaciones. Esto es lo que me atrevo a aventurar que ocurrirÃ¡ (y puede que ya estÃ© ocurriendo) con Guacamelee!, que aÃºn no ha perdido, y dudo que lo haga, nada de la frescura que en su momento lo llevÃ³ a convertirse en uno de los "indies" mÃ¡s apreciados desde la popularizaciÃ³n y el asiento de esta forma de crear o entender los videojuegos. Y es que el mundo indie permite rebuscar en lo ya ensayado (y muchas veces ya olvidado o, aparentemente, ya superado) para encontrar sus puntos fuertes y actualizarlos en su aplicaciÃ³n en nuevos productos adaptados a los nuevos tiempos.  AsÃ­, Guacamelee! no oculta sus influencias e incluso las homenajea en lo que muy posiblemente sea un gesto de gratitud a la obra de otros diseÃ±adores y programadores que dejaron su huella con anterioridad. Guacamelee llegÃ³ rescatando viejas fÃ³rmulas para actualizarlas y aportar su granito de arena en la perpetuaciÃ³n de ese gÃ©nero tan acertadamente denominado "metroidvania".

El videojuego que nos ocupa nos cuenta la historia de Juan, un mexicano de a pie que ve cÃ³mo su tranquila y apacible vida se transforma repentinamente en una aventura para rescatar a su amiga de la infancia de las garras de la mismÃ­sima Muerte. Tan "prometedora" puesta en escena no llega en realidad a mucho mÃ¡s, ni a nada trascendental, puesto que lo verdaderamente importante de Guacamelee! es su jugabilidad. No obstante, la ingente cantidad de guiÃ±os que nos harÃ¡n rememorar viejos tiempos y otras sagas y situaciones, asÃ­ como el carisma de sus personajes y el cuidado con el que todo se ha llevado a cabo, consiguen hacernos mantener el interÃ©s y la empatÃ­a hacia el devenir de sus protagonistas, logrando que sÃ­ percibamos la aventura como una progresiÃ³n de eventos memorables. AdemÃ¡s, el hecho de que aun siendo una historia fantÃ¡stica tome como base la cultura e historia (desde los mayas hasta la actualidad) de un paÃ­s real (MÃ©xico, aunque no se haga menciÃ³n explÃ­cita), hace que en cierta medida podamos reconocer costumbres, expresiones artÃ­sticas, atuendos, creencias, maneras de hablar y de ser que, pese a estar estereotipados con humor, acercan la trama a la realidad y, por tanto, la hacen mÃ¡s reconocible y capaz de captar nuestro interÃ©s.
Para concluir este apartado con una pequeÃ±a nota al respecto de esta ediciÃ³n en concreto, "Super Turbo Championship Edition" cuenta con puntuales aÃ±adidos en su argumento (y que afectan a su jugabilidad y duraciÃ³n) y que, al contrario de lo que pudiera parecer, se encuentran completamente integrados dentro del videojuego original hasta el punto de que no nos percataremos de ello a no ser que consultemos el contenido de las primeras versiones del mismo, si no las hemos jugado ya.

Su diseÃ±o grÃ¡fico y artÃ­stico es fantÃ¡stico, original y posee una personalidad propia. Pocos juegos tienen un despliegue tan colorido y a la vez tan sÃ³lido como el del que hace gala Guacamelee! Todo estÃ¡ diseÃ±ado con un estilo "cartoon" que logra plasmar con acierto ciertos aspectos de un paÃ­s tan lleno de contrastes como MÃ©xico, donde lo colorido puede convivir con la, para otras culturas, oscuridad de la muerte. AsÃ­, ya sea en el caso de los personajes o en el de los escenarios, el estilo de dibujos animados se mezcla con los estilos inspirados en la cultura mÃ¡s o menos reciente o en la histÃ³rica (maya) de dicho paÃ­s para crear un mundo fantÃ¡stico en el que a cada paso reconoceremos elementos o situaciones propias del mismo o, en el caso de estar estereotipados, de la imagen que el resto del mundo, seguramente sin mucho acierto, tiene de Ã©l. Los efectos grÃ¡ficos, al igual que el resto de elementos, apoyan y estÃ¡n a la altura del "festival de colores".

El apartado sonoro nos presenta animadas composiciones que, si bien no estoy muy seguro de que tengan algo que ver con la cultura musical de MÃ©xico, logran amenizar los combates con ritmos en el que las notas aportan el correspondiente toque de color como ocurre en los apartados grÃ¡fico y artÃ­stico. De igual forma, los efectos sonoros son igual de contundentes que sus correspondientes en el apartado grÃ¡fico, generando un ambiente en el que los combates se suceden con absoluta naturalidad y fluidez dentro del "gameplay" general. 

Llegados a este punto, restarÃ­a hablar de la jugabilidad, aspecto no marginal en Guacamelee! puesto que en realidad se trata del pilar principal de su Ã©xito. Tal y como se ha comentado al principio, Juan, el protagonista, se embarca en una aventura en la que muy pronto dejarÃ¡ de ser un tranquilo hombre rural para convertirse en un luchador de ese deporte tambiÃ©n tan mexicano como es la lucha libre. Por tanto, Ã©sta se convertirÃ¡ en el pilar principal del que se ha hablado y lo harÃ¡ en base al gÃ©nero popularmente conocido como "metroidvania" por contar como precursores a las sagas Metroid de Nintendo y Castlevania de Konami. AsÃ­, los continuos y enormemente variados combates (esto Ãºltimo gracias a sus mÃºltiples mecÃ¡nicas en reflejo a la progresiÃ³n de los poderes de nuestro personaje) se suceden entre segmentos de juego "plataformero" aderezado con un trasfondo de exploraciÃ³n y aventura que no podremos abandonar hasta haber completado en su totalidad. AdemÃ¡s, si algo tambiÃ©n es caracterÃ­stico de este tipo de juegos es su dificultad, algo en lo que Guacamelee! no se queda atrÃ¡s y es capaz de ofrecer una curva de aprendizaje bien ajustada para cualquier jugador, pero sin dejar de proporcionar determinados retos que pueden llegar a convertirse en una pesadilla para jugadores menos experimentados pero que satisfarÃ¡n las ansias de dificultad de los mÃ¡s exigentes. Respecto a esto, cabe recomendar una segunda partida en el modo difÃ­cil para disfrutar de Guacamelee en todo su esplendor. Como puede verse, ya sea por la dificultad, los retos o la posibilidad de enfrentarnos a una segunda ronda mÃ¡s exigente, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition posee una duraciÃ³n considerable y de la cual, con total seguridad, disfrutaremos de principio a fin.  

Una vez mÃ¡s, se hace obligatorio comentar que la ediciÃ³n "Super Turbo Championship Edition" incluye nuevos poderes y enfrentamientos contra nuevos jefes perfectamente integrados en el total y que harÃ¡n de Guacamelee! un videojuego, si cabe, mÃ¡s disfrutable. No obstante, y para quien pueda interesarle, tambiÃ©n es cierto que esta ediciÃ³n posee un menor nÃºmero de logros desbloqueables que la "Gold Edition".

Para concluir, no cabe sino recomendar Guacamelee! en cualquiera de sus versiones puesto que, independientemente de los elementos exclusivos de cada una de ellas, es uno de los "indies" y "metroidvania" mÃ¡s sÃ³lidos y disfrutables hoy dÃ­a y que muy posiblemente siga siÃ©ndolo hasta que le llegue el momento de formar parte de ese selecto grupo de videojuegos atemporales del cual en un principio recibiÃ³ la inspiraciÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066290628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1535338289}
review:
[h1] Highlights [/h1]

+* Less is more in terms of gameplay
+* Surprisingly meaty combo system
+* Lively, vibrant soundtrack


[h1] Positives [/h1]

+ Definite Replay value
+ Very nice visuals
+ Decent amount of unlockables 


[h1] Negatives [/h1]

- Pretty short 
- Online co-op would be nice


[h1] Concerns [/h1]

-* None really 


[h1] Consensus [/h1]

Outstanding platformer which proved to me that nostalgia wasn't the only reason why I loved platformers like Sly Cooper, Jak and Daxter, Ratchet and Clank etc... The only downside to this game was the fact that I couldn't play it as long as I hoped but i'm sure that will be rectified with the new game plus. 


[h1] 8.5/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991630098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1459810504}
review:
Guacamelee! STCE is the definitive edition of the Guacamelee game, If you're a new player, you should buy this edition.

But should you buy this game?

I like the game's colourful existence with its stunning 2D graphics and detailed art.Its combat system, while limited in moves, has real depth in how you utilise the moves to create combos. Punching an enemy till it's grappeable, throwing it up in the air, uppercutting it again, and then jumping  above it to belly splash is fun to do , never gets old and you get rewarded for it. 
This is a game that loves its combat but there's another thing that it loves. Platforming.

See, this particular Metroid/Castlevania hybrid just loves platforming. Whilst the two games mentioned in the previous sentence aren't too too heavy on platforming, Guacamelee revels in mixing platforming in a 2D space and combat. While you rarely have to platform and fight at the same time, you will be doing a lot of both throughout this 10-12 hr game. I'm not the biggest platforming fan, myself and if you're not a platforming fan, be wary that this game as a lot and some of it is quite tough. The game is lenient in the main path , giving you plenty of checkpoints but sometimes the platforming gets a bit much.

However, the worst part of the game is the music. It's awful. Made with a Latin American style (lots of Mexican type instruments which escape the mind), most tracks are dull, repititive and just boring.There isn't even a boss theme for the myriad of bosses you fight! I recommend putting on your own tunes or podcasts when playing the game, The meme humour in the game also gets a bit much as well. Memes usually are outdated in minutes and while there are numerous nods to many different franchises and games, it might elicit a groan every now and then,

In the end, decide if you want a 2D action/exploration game with a focus on combat and platforming. It's an OK ride but be wary of the music. It's terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070606426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1449873515}
review:
Do you like combos? I know I do.

Do you like Metroidvanias? I certainly do.

Do you like it when a goat who teaches you the ways of the Luchador tries to hit on your mom? I mean, I don't, but maybe that's up someone's alley.

Look, the point I'm trying to make is that this game is pretty good. You should buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007906588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1551448917}
review:
Well, I got this game for just a dollar and then some, but now it's my favorite platformer; I haven't played a lot of them (only Mega Man Powered Up, Ultimate Ghosts 'n' Goblins, and Castlevania 1 come to mind), but I can definitely say that this is the most fun I've had out of the genre.

Visually it's super stylish. The music is fantastic (lalalai lalalai lala~, and the switching soundtracks across the World of the Living and the World of the Dead is amazing), and there are soundbites that I can't help but shout when they play (INTENSO!!!). It's also occasionally hilarious (the power-up cutscenes are gut-bustingly funny). The combat is a lot deeper than it looks - not only are your special moves important for keeping up your spectacular juggle combos, they are also necessary to break certain shields later into the game that makes battles a little more strategic. While most enemies are complete chicken feed, the bosses are most definitely not. Still, none of the combat sections are frustratingly difficult, so no need to worry about being discouraged.

EDIT: I just 100% all achievements and finished the game on Hard mode - I retract my statement regarding the combat sections since I had a difficult time in several fights, particularly Flame Face, as well certain Intenso-dependent sections. I was surprised by the X'Tabay difficulty spike, so...yeah. It gets way harder. I've seen some videos of pre-STCE Jaguar Javier, and it's insanity. Thank God they turned it down here. Having Intenso really helped with the difficulty spike, which is why I recommend you get the Intenso boosts (ESPECIALLY THE SHIELD BREAKER OR YOU'RE GONNA HAVE A BAD TIME) immediately, but only after getting the stun boost first.

What I think what makes this a very notable platformer for me is the difficulty of the platforming puzzles - the last time I was so close to giving up was the Grim Reaper stages in Castlevania, and Guacamelee's Tree Tops brought back all that rage and frustration. Actually, you can opt to ignore in my opinion the hardest sections in the game (Tree Tops and Cueva de la Locura) and still finish the game (albeit the bad ending), but I wasn't having any of that.

It's an amazing game with a lot of mileage for its price, highly recommended! You get the soundtrack too, which is pretty sweet (love Deserto Caliente)!

EDIT: GUACAMELEE 2 IS COMING BABY

author: {'steamid': '76561198095975297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1451473883}
review:
Music is good but becomes quite repititive.  
I guess there are about 3-4 songs.

Art is mediocre.  
Sprites become boring very quick.  There are ugly breakable blocks that appear everywhere.  Very annoying.
Overall art is a strange mixture of acceptable cartoony foreground and bad pixel art background.  Dissapointing.

Too short.

Gameplay/Combat is decent.

Story: nil.  (I don't really care in general , but for a singleplayer game...)

North worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165390757', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1473138490}
review:
+ Great gameplay, super amazing graphics, good music.
+ A bunch of combat movements to test your memorization and controller skills (like old school!)
+ Definitely metroidvania style, huge map and a lot of hidden items.
+ A hilarious goat teaches you the best tricks.
+ Nicely designed monsters some of which will make you think "What the hell" the first time you see them, like that huge sleeping dragon.
+ A looot of achievements to get.
+ And most importantly, it is local-coop!! Up to four players. Nothing better than help.

- The music gets boring after a while, although doesn't bother much.
- I don't like the font on the dialogs. haha.

Score: 9/10 Amazing game.

review: Guacamelee is a bit too dull for me. I like the concept, and it has a great fighting system, but the fighting segments feel too short and somewhat limited. It's like the puzzle, town, and quest segments limit the true potential of its fighting system. I feel like this game is lost between platformer and beat'em up side scroller and needs to find its true identity. The devs seem to have tried mixing the two, but it just doesn't work out for me. :/

author: {'steamid': '76561197970791168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1562355477}
review:
Metroidvania done right! 
Both Guacamelee games are a pleasure to play and have lots of challenge and exploration. I completed Gold before and was skeptic if they could improve on the established formula. Now I can say that the added contend and revamped gameplay fits right in and rounds some edges that were in the flow of the first game. As of writing this review I am on my way of completing Super Turbo 100%. This game was a steal for me when it was on sale and I can reccomend both games to anyone who is into metroidvania games and beat em ups.

review:
it's really a while since i heard about this game, and then also a while i decide to buy it, then for a local co-op, it's not easy thing to play it with another people in this period, after all these have done, i have to say, it's a game worth to pay for the complete price and you can play for a long while.

Sure, the game don't have a masterpiece graphic, but itâ€™s flash-like kind just made man also feel comfortable and the other point I would like to mention here is the in-game music, itâ€™s wild and passionate, itâ€™s just like the graphic of the game, once you thought it was not so fine but afterward you can somehow still remember it, perfect combination to the game itself. 

And since I still didnâ€™t finish the first round till now, I still do hope that I may harvest more surprise in the second half of the game.

I will definitely recommend having this one in your library, itâ€™s simple a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106152551', 'num_games_owned': 1233, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1464635066}
review:
Guacamelee! 
Visto alle apparenze potrebbe sembrare un semplice gioco platform, ma questo titolo si Ã¨ rivelato essere una piacevolissima sorpresa !
Vestirete i panni di un Luchadore, Juan, che cercherÃ  di salvare la bella fanciulla rapita dal malvagio Calaca, necessaria per il compimento del suo piano, cioÃ¨ quello di rendere univoci il regno dei morti con quello dei vivi. 
La struttura del gioco Ã¨ in sÃ¨ semplice : abbiamo vari scenari con nemici, zone accessibili solo attraverso alcune abilitÃ  che sbloccherete man mano durante il gioco e che vi toccherÃ  quindi ripercorrere, boss di turno e piccole quest facoltative.
Nulla di nuovo da un normale platform insomma, eppure in Guacamelee ho trovato qualcosa in piÃ¹ !
 Innanzitutto gli scenari incredibilmente variopinti, con moltissimi riferimenti videoludici, rendono l'atmosfera coinvolgente e oltre a ciÃ² una nota di merito vanno sicuramente alle musiche e allo stile puramente messicano !
I dialoghi vi strapperanno sicuramente qualche risata e il gioco risulta essere fluido.
Discreto livello di difficoltÃ  (devo vedere ora in modalitÃ  difficile) con zone rompicapo ben fatte e non snervanti.
Il gioco insomma Ã¨ piacevole e me lo sono goduto dall'inizio alla fine, assolutamente coinvolgente e senza difetti da sottolineare.
Da avere se siete amanti dei platform ma tranquillamente giocabile e godibile da tutti i videogiocatori.

-Al

review:
- Phenomenal.
- Full of memes.
- "Mucho mexicano humor" 
- Interesting story and (although it gets repetitive over time) gameplay
- You can supplex a skeleton or somersault over a chupacabra
- Unique setting of game's world
- BEAUTIFUL soundtrack AND artstyle (warning: your eyes and ears may melt from awesomeness, play for your own risk)
- Platforming sequences which require skill, not luck
- Challenging and very rewarding 100% completion 
- One of the best metroidvanias in the century

author: {'steamid': '76561197993008418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1452847347}
review:
A solid Metroidvania and a light character action game wrapped in a slick Lucha libre Flash animation-style presentation. Exudes style and confidence, with great level design and the brilliant use of its special attacks both for combat roles and for platforming and puzzle-solving purposes.

Unlike most Metroidvania games, there is minimal backtracking, with each area being mostly its own self-contained "Zelda dungeon" of sorts. This is neither a good or bad thing, as backtracking and no backtracking can both have their advantages (one to familiarize the player with the game world, and the other to focus on progression)â€”but unlike, for example, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse, the moments when you [i]do[/i] have to backtrack aren't exceedingly terrible. Of course, there are plenty of opportunities to return to areas to find secrets and upgrades.

If I had to complain, there's too many memes awkwardly crammed onto billboards in the game's backgrounds. And buyers beware: the discount for owning the original Gold edition of Gaucamelee no longer applies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211238272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1456873239}
review:
Me ha sorprendido gratamente Guacamelee. Es un juego muy entretenido, adictivo y con una buena ambientaciÃ³n mexicana. Tiene ademas muchisimos secretos.

No puedo decir que sea un juego Old School por su dificultad, pero si que tiene una lÃ­nia de dificultad mayor que la mayoria de juegos actuales.

Los jefes finales son muy buenos y exigentes.

Pillate Guacamelee si te gustan juegos estilo Metroid o de scroll lateral de la epoca de la Mega Drive y SNES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026317882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1456586646}
review:
The first thing that surprised me in Guacamelee was obviously the setting. The mexican theme is great. Although i don't know much about mexican culture to know if the game is respectful of it, i appreciate how colorful the game is. Even the "World of the Dead" is full of bright colors. Every single environment is just a joy to discover, because it's all so different than most games.

The second thing that surprised me was the gameplay. Based on the trailers, I was expecting a pure beat them all, but it's actually a fairly original mix of a beat them all and metroidvania (a platformer with a huge map where you acquire new powers to unlock new parts of the map). The two genres are well implemented, and complements each other very well. 

On the beat them all side, you've got an array of attacks available, and it's fairly easy to chain them together, which makes it easy to get huge combos. It's always satisfying to reach 50, 100, or even more than 100 hits combo. Every few screens, you will enter an "arena", where you need to be able to beat a serie of enemies before the exits are unlocked.

On the metroidvania side, you've got lots of platforming, and your beat them all attacks also serves as ways to reach platformers. An uppercut to reach higher ground, a dash to go farther away, etc. As with any metroidvania there is a fair bit of backtracking to do to uncover all secrets, but all secrets are "fair": the game give you tons of hints as to where they are, there is no random guessing to do, and the game gives you a completion rate on each map so you know if you've missed something or not.

Another aspect where the game is fair and fun, is the platforming. Like any metroidvania, there is a fair bit of jumping around, and combining your powers to reach the hardest parts of a level. However, the great thing about Guacamelee is that if you fail a jump, the game will teleport you right back to the last platform you were on rather than throwing you at the previous checkpoint, which might be quite far away. So even though they are some fairly difficult parts, you're never forced to play huge sections again and again, you just need to retry the last bit that you failed. That's very nice for players, it avoids needless repetitions or raging.

However, despite theses mechanisms intended to make the game more accessible, Guacamelee remains a tough game. It's not a hardcore platformer like Super Meat Boy, but it's definitely more difficult than your average platformer. If you like challenging games, you should definitely feels at ease in Guacamelee, which has the added bonus that many of it's more tricky challenges are optional, so it's up to you to decide how much you want to push yourself. 100% completion is totally doable, but will requires some patience.

On the same point, it's fairly obvious the game is aimed at long time gamers. Beside the difficulty, it also packs a ton of references to other video games. Billboards in the backgrounds, specific piece of dialogs, characters...there are so many references spread across the game that I'm not sure anyone has ever been able to spot them all.

At the other end of the spectrum, people who are not familiar with platformers should stay away from the game. Though the mechanisms are fair, it definitely requires you to be familiar with some platformers tropes, and be used to chain powers together to fling yourself into the air. 

Moreover, if you want a relaxed experience, where you're just enjoying the story, the game is not for you, because the story is barebones. Though it introduces some interesting characters, the dialogs are basic, and the story is a stereotypical "knight saves princess" kind of thing. 

All of that means that the pleasure of Guacamelee lies in its travel (the screen to screen gameplay) rather than its destination (furthering the story). With its many references, it's an ode to video games and is aimed at long time gamers. It indeniably succeeds at that task. However you should only try if if you're think that would be the sort of things you would enjoy. Otherwise, you're just gonna set yourself up for frustration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221484468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1460638814}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition... io non so veramente se esistono parole in grado di poter descrivere questo gioco! Devo essere onesto: con tutti questi metroidvania che girano su Steam (praticamente piÃ¹ del 70% indie) ero diffidente nel comprare questo titolo. Forse ancora un metroidvania troppo Metroid o troppo Castlevania... o forse addirittura troppo Shantae visto che, secondo me, sta dettando nuovi canoni per questo tipo di giochi. Ebbene mi sbagliavo totalmente!

Guacamelee rispetta quelle meccaniche tipiche di questi giochi rinnovandole e creando allo stesso tempo qualcosa di mai visto e totalmente originale. Meravigliose le ambientazioni e le (veramente) infinite citazioni ad altri giochi. Uno puÃ² stare giorni a cercare riferimenti ad altri giochi nascosti nei fondali. Molte volte non risultano propriamente ovvie e Guacamelee omaggia questi giochi in maniera magistrale (e senza infrangere le leggi sul copyright). I personaggi sono tutti molto simpatici, ben caratterizzati e divertenti. La storia Ã¨ bella, molto semplice ma Ã¨ raccontata molto bene fra i vari dialoghi e le cutscenes veramente graziose.
Il gameplay Ã¨ qualcosa di giÃ  visto ma le miriadi di combo, mosse, prese e strategie rendono questo territorio quasi infinito! Il punto forte di Guacamelee sono proprio i combattimenti che si incentrano molto sul sistema di combo che aumenta colpendo piÃ¹ nemici in successione senza essere colpiti. Un po' scarno forse il roster dei nemici (esclusi i boss) ma il sistema di combattimento non rende noiosa nessuna di queste battaglie e inoltre nessun nemico Ã¨ mai troppo fastidioso da affrontare. Il sistema light world-dark world Ã¨ grazioso perÃ² a volte il gioco punta troppo su questa caratteristica tanto che a volte, nel avanzare in alcuni punti o tentando di prendere qualche cesta, risulta solamente una questione di timing corretto e non una sfida equa. Inoltre non capisco perchÃ¨ in questi nuovi metroidvania NESSUNO utilizza un semplice sistema di level up! Ad un certo punto in questi giochi il personaggio dovrebbe abbattere con piÃ¹ facilitÃ  i vecchi nemici e incontrare successivamente nuovi nemici piÃ¹ forti e difficili da abbattere. Guacamelee sfortunatamente, nonostante la progressiva acquisizione di abilitÃ  (sia comprate che imparate), non permette tutto ciÃ². Spesso le abilitÃ  acquisite permettono di accedere, come Ã¨ giusto che sia in questi giochi, a zone inaccessibili in precedenza ma nulla a che vedere con la potenza e la crescita del personaggio (che in questo senso non cresce). Magari sotto una diversa luce Ã¨ possibile vedere il level up tramite l'acquisto dei vestiti ma questi hanno sia caratteristiche positive sia caratteristiche negative e difficilmente il giocatore Ã¨ tentato a comprarli tutti. Ho comprato in totale solamente 4 abiti ed avrei tanto desiderato di acquistarli tutti anche perchÃ¨ questi si comprano con l'argento, piÃ¹ difficile da ottenere, e non con le semplici monete d'oro. Purtroppo l'acquisto di questi alla fine risulta molto macchinoso ed ogni giocatore deve scegliere con cura questi vestiti, sopratutto se si vuole acquistare l'abito del diavolo. Altra piccola pecca Ã¨ il multiplayer esclusivamente locale... sarebbe stato grazioso un multiplayer in rete ma probabilmente mi rendo conto di quanto possa essere difficile sincronizzare due giocatori in un gioco del genere. Forse un online avrebbe rovinato l'esperienza... chissÃ !

Nonostante qualche microscopico difetto Guacamele Ã¨ veramente uno dei migliori giochi indie alla quale abbia mai giocato, probabilmente uno dei migliori giochi di questa generazione di videogiochi! Ã¨ veramente incredibile pensare che questo gioco Ã¨ stato programmato da una casa indipendente! Spero tanto che la Drink Box Studios possa consegnarci un nuovo episodio di Guacamelee molto presto. Questo gioco Ã¨ stato decisamente un successo!

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198152815154', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1541218493}
review: I'm sorry, I just don't like it. It's like the devolpers did the best part of other games mediocre. It has the Mexican Culture aspect of Grim Fandango, done so it feels plastic and fake. It has the Medroid-Vania aspect, but done uncreatively with multicolored blocks (You got the red block breaker attack! Damn, were in the past 3 hours have I seen a red block?). It has the battle system of any good beat-em-up, like Castle Crashers, but repetative and annoying. The whole "Press colored button to make colored platforms appear" makes the game more puzzley, but in a aggravating way that clashes with it's high action beat-em-up atmosphere. And all through this I wandering through confusing level design doing the same annoying parts over and over again. The only thing I really liked was the art style and music; the colors popped, and the music like something you really could hear on Mexican Radio. if the DJ had died and the music never stopped repeating itself. Maybe I'm being to harsh, because my entire experience was ruined due to the fact the it didn't register my controller and playing with a keyboard was agonizing. In all, I really, really wanted to like Guacamelee, but when I was honest with myself, I found I really, really disliked the whole experience. Guacamelee trys to everything, and in doing so fails to do any part right.  Skip this game and buy one of the games it's based off; they do it right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131719051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1279, 'last_played': 1501384677}
review:
Fala meu caro amigo, beleza?

Guacamelee Ã© um jogo interessante, cheio de referÃªncias, e que se trata de um jogo no estilo "metroidvÃ¢nia", que Ã© um estilo que eu realmente me interesso, pois tem um bom desafio e sempre novas formas de avanÃ§ar os locais.

O jogo tem uma temÃ¡tica mexicana, onde existe uma cultura, templos, e um outro mundo, que se trata do mundo dos mortos. iremos por partes.

O jogo fala sobre juan, um fazendeiro que ajuda em vÃ¡rias coisas em sua vila. Um dia, juan Ã© chamado pelo padre para ajudar a preparar as coisas para o festival de comemoraÃ§Ã£o a uma data especial, o dia de los muertos. Enquanto isso, a filha do presidente da vila chega e fala com o padre, e entÃ£o vÃª juan e comenta sobre que ele era um grande amigo dela de infÃ¢ncia, e entÃ£o o chama para a mansÃ£o do presidente. logo quando ele vai atÃ© a mansÃ£o, ela pega fogo e entÃ£o juan entra heroicamente. justo quando ele chega, percebe um homem, com roupa de toureiro, chamado carlos calaca, que capturou a filha do presidente. As intenÃ§Ãµes de calaca vocÃª descobre ao decorrer do jogo, assim como sua histÃ³ria. Juan tenta impedi-lo, mas carlos o mata rapidamente. Como vocÃª morreu, acaba indo para o mundo dos mortos. seguindo um caminho, vocÃª chega a uma estÃ¡tua e uma mÃ¡scara se revela a vocÃª. uma guardiÃ£ que guarda a mÃ¡scara fala que ele deve coloca-la, e que deveria impedir calaca, e colocando-a, vocÃª se transforma em um "luchador", e Ã© aÃ­ que o jogo comeÃ§a.

Sendo um metroidvÃ¢nia, o inÃ­cio do jogo Ã© bem limitado, pois vocÃª sÃ³ consegue ir Ã¡ certos locais, mas vocÃª evolui atravÃ©s de itens e vai liberando parte por parte do mapa, fazendo a exploraÃ§Ã£o escencial para completar o jogo. as trilhas sonoras sÃ£o temas mexicanos, assim como o jogo. talvez vocÃª se enjoe por revisitar uma parte e ficar ouvindo um looping por um certo tempo, ele nÃ£o Ã© curto, mas cada um tem sua paciÃªncia. mesmo assim, sÃ£o bem feitas e cada local tem uma mÃºsica diferente. As vezes tu pode entrar numa sala, ouvir uma mÃºsica e mais pra frente no jogo, entra numa outra e tem a mesma. Mas calma, isso nÃ£o acontece com frequÃªncia. a jogabilidade Ã© Ã³tima, Ã© possÃ­vel realizar mÃºltiplos combos que vÃ£o melhorando a medida das abilidades que tu ganha. a arte do jogo Ã© Ã³tima, e o melhor de tudo, Ã© bem leve. mesmo se o seu pc for meio ruim, ele pode rodar de boas.

A jogabilidade Ã© incrÃ­vel, Ã© possÃ­vel fazer diversos combos logo no inÃ­cio e com as abilidades novas, tu pode chegar ao ponto de esmagar os inimigos em 3 segundos, alÃ©m de poder fazer tÃ©cnicas de arremesso fodas que tu fica de boca aberta perguntando como tu conseguiu fazer aquilo.

A histÃ³ria pode parecer genÃ©rica no inÃ­cio, mas fica bem interessante a medida que tu avanÃ§a. Ah, o jogo tem 2 finais, sendo o que eu peguei antes de fazer essa anÃ¡lise me fez suar pelos olhos de certa forma, mas trate de fazer os dois.

E essa foi minha anÃ¡lise de Guacamelee ( no caso, o Super Turbo Championship Edition).

review: Platform spettacolare! Grafica ispirata e ben caratterizzata, design dei personaggi notevole, buon sonoro, trama divertente... Gameplay interessante che mischia le meccaniche di gioco tipiche dei platform game a quelle dei picchiaduro a scorrimento. Qualche piccolo enigma da risolvere, divertenti boss fight, segreti opzionali da svelare, accativante sistema di combo e di evoluzione del personaggio. Un gioco assolutamente consigliato soprattutto gli amanti dei giochi con grafica bidimensionale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097689581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1455581852}
review:
fantastic game. great art style, satisfying punching and comboing and tons of funny video game easter eggs. totes worth it.

edit: after about 20 hrs with the game i have to say that the enemy design and combat system flat-out sucks and makes some of the later challenges (gold medals in infierno) outright impossible, unless you're willing to learn every single enemy animation frame by frame like in a fighting game. enemy reach, invincibilty frames and dash attacks also favour the cpu quite heavily. so, as a casually played metroidvania style game this is still absolutely fantastic, but if you want to do a completionist run you better be ready to put in some serious commitment... and time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027885770', 'num_games_owned': 2412, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1494002327}
review:
Pros:[list]
[*]Great graphics design
[*]Amazing soundtrack
[*]Mechanically challenging
[*]Gameplay never gets old
[*]Co-op play is well implemented
[*]The game is quite self-aware, the atmosphere, the references, the jokes are all refreshingly good[/list]
Cons:[list]
[*]Slightly unfair difficulty in some of the later stages, it could put some people off
[*]It never hurt if the game was longer[/list]

Verdict: definitely 10/10 for me, if only there were more games like Guacamelee on the market.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102020074', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1807, 'last_played': 1452006404}
review:
Un metroidvania con una jugabilidad muy fluida y sobretodo MUCHISIMA personalidad: el soundtrack, los enemigos y sobretodo el estilo de arte hacen del juego un festÃ­n para los ojos. 

Mi unica pega es que quizÃ¡s se hace demasiado fÃ¡cil...aunque con la adiciÃ³n del modo difÃ­cil (que hace algo mÃ¡s que aumentarle el daÃ±o a los enemigos, dÃ¡ndole vidilla extra al juego) y los niveles opcionales se medio compensa. 

No te arrepentiras de comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044413145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1451969892}
review:
PROS: The art style is distinct and enjoyable. This game is HILARIOUS and obviously made by people who love video games, as there are references to other classic games everywhere. The combat consists of a somehwat limited moveset, but it somehow works throughout the entire game. I played with a controller and the controls were responsive and well done. The use of Hispanic culture is well done and gives respect to the traditions that inspired the game ( soTumblr can't say there is 'cultural appropriation' or whatever)

NEUTRAL: At times it can be confusing to know what to do but never anything super serious

CONS: The ending is really difficult. I can't even get to the final boss because the final level is so damn hard. This probably says more abouit my ability to play the gamre more than anything else.

VERDICT: I love this game. Fun, hilarious, original. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197967399452', 'num_games_owned': 1235, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1454803036}
review:
This game is AWESOME. Not perfect, that would be silly, but super fun, super well made, and it fits many kinds of players.
Casual? This game can be brute-forced relatively easily, and give you tools to cheese it.
Hardcore? This game has hard challenges, a hard mode, and tight fighting controls.
Explorer? This is a metroidvania-style game, with very generous final moves to explore everywhere!

To make it shorts: the game controls very well with either a gamepad or a keyboard, the story is good enough to keep you going, the graphics have a very strong style and looks nice all around and the soundtrack compliment the game very well.

There are really no cons to this game; it know what it does and does it well; it's well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084970034', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1610223120}
