author: {'steamid': '76561198049916848', 'num_games_owned': 3275, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1453042757}
review:
Having played the Gold Edition of Guacamelee almost to the end I was hesitant about buying this edition that would require me to restart the whole game as each area was modified and so saves would not be compatible. I'm glad I took the plunge (with a major discount helping) as this is the definitive version of the game.

Guacamelee is one of the finest action-platformers ever made with outstanding level design and gameplay fusing superb and intelligently designed platforming with great beat-em-up mechanics all in a beautiful, colourful and musically pleasing setting. It has a metroidvania-style exploration system where new abilities enable exploring previously locked areas of the game and the map is filled with chests to find and interesting challenges to reach them. Each new move doubles as both a combat-ready combo-expanding ability while also enabling greater environment traversal. The level design smartly teaches you how to apply them while offering extremely creative ways of using them both individually and combined with previous abilities. The story and characters are fun and the music is fantastic and the traiditional Mexican art style is great too.

The gameplay in this version has been enhanced compared to the Gold Edition and the few areas that used to feel frustrating no longer do so, they feel challenging but fair and skill-based. The visual upgrades are a nice touch with enhanced lighting and generally more colour tastefully applied. The new areas are nice additions expanding the backstory and there are a few new secret chests to find with the new Pollo bomb ability. Technically the game engine seems to have been enhanced too as it feels smoother (although that is subjective and may just be an impression).

Just buy this game, it's one of the best games ever made, rarely has a game been so fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179982642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1455060404}

author: {'steamid': '76561198250128808', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1453320129}
review:
First, the good side: this is a really great game (pretty much everybody agrees with it).

Now, the downside: it supports only the xbox type of controller, and buttons remapping is not supported as well. This is for some people, including me (I have an arcade stick) is a dealbraker.

To wrap up: buy it if you have an xbox controller (or if you want to use the keyboard), otherwise, move on and play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142182453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1547420357}
review:
Si es que para hacer cosas buenas solo hacen falta buenas ideas.

Guacamelee es, sin asomo alguno de duda, de los juegos mÃ¡s divertidos que he jugado. Trama entretenida, jugabilidad variadÃ­sima, un diseÃ±o genial, una banda sonora perfecta y encima, sentido del humor. Una de las mÃ¡s gratas sorpresas que he tenido tras comprar un juego.

RecomendadisÃ­simo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010427390', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1472240219}
review: You'll have to bring the best of your reflexes to this combat oriented roleplaying side scroller. Desceptively competitive with clever, saucy writing, its charming animation style will draw you in and push your limits. Don't forget that you can invite a friend into the fray for unbridled, fist pounding fun! A steal at full price. Don't wait for a sale, you won't regret it for a moment, but be ready for a challenge!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138344193', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1452573387}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042990648', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1452518459}
review:
[u]Type: [b]Single Player/CO-OP 2D Platformer Brawler.[/b][/u]

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Fluid and fun combat system.
+ Fantastic visual style.
+ Great sound design and Music.
+ Hilariously witty script and memorable characters.
+ Clever puzzle and level design, which encourages exploration of the world.
+ Steam workshop integration adds hours of community designed levels and character models

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Low enemy variety.

[b]Get this if you enjoyed: The Castlevania Series; The Metroid Series; The Rayman Series; The Shantae Series[i].[/i][/b]

The game poses a fair challenge and will keep achievement hunters busy for quite some time, however the title absolutely shines in co-op. This is the ultimate version of Guacamelee and is definitely worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994185300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1452576884}
review:
This game completely won me over. It's a fabulous combination of music, visuals, and gameplay that rewards you for paying attention and being creative. The game is sufficiently difficult to be a challenge for those who seek it, and easy enough that you can get by with button mashing.

It's one of the best entries in the metroidvania genre of 2D action & exploration. Guacamelee has given me hope that game developers still make awe-inspiring magic in these years of shallow spectacle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960545066', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1452892578}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060870363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1450149902}
review:
Mother always said "If it walks like a duck, talks like a duck, but doesn't look like a duck, then it's some wierd guy trying to be a duck and failing." This is how I feel about this game. It plays like a Metroidvania, Sounds like a Metroidvania, but doesn't look like a Metroidvania. Not that that's a bad thing, but Instead It tries to look like something completely different. Something more interesting and fun, and then fails. 

This game is about an agave farmer who's in love with the daughter of "El Presidente" who you've been friends with since childhood and you secretly love each other and we're already off to a bad start. Your job is to take on the role of super powered masked luchador "Juan" and save the woman you love, who has been taken by a skeleton guy, who drags her into the afterlife to marry her, blah blah blah... prahpecy, blah blah blah... ultamate power. 

"Wait, What about the 'El Presidente' guy?" Who him? I dont know, he's dead or something. "But arent you trying to save his daughter from the afterlife? Cant you save him too?" is he the love interest? "No but..." Then there's no reason to pay any attention to him.

The story goes as you would expect it to go. Travel the world of "Mexican inspired world" and fight hoards of enemies while only going through certain doors at certain times with certain weapons cause Metroid to save her from Villan who wants Ultimate power. you know, the world that has refferences to other, more entertaining video games, except they're all luchadors cause Mexican inspired world.

The gameplay is decent because, well it's Metroid and Castlevania except instead of whips and plasma beams, it's punching and kicking. they didn't even try to hide it, you find a chozo statue and you think "Oh, what a clever easter egg" and turns out that's how you get power ups. certain monsters can only be killed with certain super mover, which you can only use if you have energy in your special meter, and only if your in a specific plain of existance, in a specific place on weekdays, unless it's a holiday.

There's nothing more to say, it's a sub-par Metroidvania that will keep you going only if you REALLY want to play a Metroidvania game. so to refferecne back to the beginning of this. This game is most certainly not a duck. It's more like a cow trying to swim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122034134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1558909206}
review:
Este juego en realidad resulta ser una gran sorpresa en un paquete pequeÃ±o, pues a primera vista tal vez solo parezca "un Metroidvania mas" o un Indie del montÃ³n, pero no es asÃ­.
Guacamelee sabe ganarse su posiciÃ³n a pulso, pues es un gran plataformero, con un gran apartado y direcciÃ³n artÃ­stica, banda sonora de lo mejor, un impresionante gameplay muy intuitivo, e inclusive una historia no muy grandiosa, pero si divertida e interesante para seguirla.
Sus diversas referencias a videojuegos y por supuesto a la cultura mexicana, hacen de este juego una gran caja de risas en el mejor sentido de la palabra, su mÃºsica tan mexicana junto con esos remixes del juego, son demasiado buenos, un soundtrack digno de escuchar y su principal maravilla, el gran gameplay, ya que mientras se avanza en la aventura, se va haciendo mas completo, pasando desde un Juan dÃ©bil, hasta un completo hÃ©roe luchador.
El sentimiento de progresiÃ³n es enorme, pues siempre se siente como tu habilidad crece y la curva de dificultad es excelente, ya que a pesar de que al inicio las cosas pueden parecer difÃ­ciles, mientras se avanza puede llegar ese sentimiento de que puedes ganarle a todos.

En resumen, un gran juego que ningÃºn fan de los plataformeros se puede perder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042984297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1452060158}
review:
Before buying this game I was originally put off by it's over-the-top luchador aesthetic for some reason. I was lucky enough to have gotten the Gold Edition as part of a bundle a few years back though and I've been a raving fan ever since. You don't have to be a particular fan of the culture to enjoy the charm, colors, and wit of Guacamelee! You just need to like playing video games.
  Any version of Guacamelee! is an absolute joy to play. The characters and writing are all pretty funny. The platforming is challenging but not sadistic. The combat is... so satisfying; such amazingly big combos can be pulled off. The bosses are all tough but learnable; I've never beat a boss without getting hit but I've gotten pretty darn close after several hours.
  The game can be 100% in about 10-20hrs for even new players I expect. The STC Edition adds two more levels to the Gold Edition. I thought that these would be optional bonus style levels but actually it's integrated into the main playthrough. The levels maybe add an additional hour or two if you are already familiar with playing through GE. There's a few other minor additions as well and as an owner of GE I still felt like I got my money's worth. This is coming from the guy who played Guacamelee! GE five times though and is well into a second playthrough of STCE on hard mode.
  The gameplay is just so fun, charming, and addictive in Guacamelee! Buy yourself a 360 controller if you don't have one and buy this game.

De estÃ©tica muy interesante y poco convencional, con mÃºsica que acompaÃ±a con diferentes temas, cumple su funciÃ³n.
Y quizÃ¡s lo mÃ¡s remarcable sea la ingente cantidad de huevos de pascua de diferentes juegos, principalmente de nintendo pero no exclusivamente.

Lo recomiendo.

review: I had this game on Xbox 360.  But, recently bought it on sale for my PC.  This game has so many Metroid-vania elements it's no laughing matter.  I like the story and the characters.  Navigating through the maze of this game after discovering a new power-up is easily done  I play with a controller.  And adding on 4 player support really sends this game over the top.  The graphics  are stylish it looks like a cartoon in full motion.  THere are plenty of secrets and tough challenges.  I like the comedic aspects of the game and the controls.   Way to go Drinkbox Studios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169224401', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1451616778}
review:
The gameplay is pretty good and it manages to keep adding new stuff up until the final boss (which isn't all that difficult because it's around 4 and a half hours long). The writing is bad and the story is boring. The music is alright, some tracks are nice and others are annoying. The art is pretty. The UI is ugly. The fighting and platforming are pretty fun.

This game is a metroidvania so long as you chose the play it as one. You can play straight through and follow the objectives and have no problem at all, and that's probably the way most people will play it because the incentives to explore aren't really there. Sure, you could go upgrade your health a little more, but you won't really need to. 

I got this game for a buck fitty and it was worth it, I wouldn't pay full price for it but it's pretty good on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127723485', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1483203905}
review:
The game is a lot of fun. Combos are very satisfying and every game that has a dedicated suplex attack alredy has a good start in my books. Also, i just piledrived a chicken.  

Overall, it's a great game, but if i could say something to the developers i'd tell them to go fuck themselves for making these stupid platform parts. Jesus Christ, i lost the count of how many times i just wanted to throw my controller away in frustration because i missed the last jump in an incredibly long jumping challenge. It's not just a matter of having skill, because i usually get through these in my 10th or 15th attempt, but it hardly feels like i accomplished something when i complete those, even in the optional segments where the challenge rewards you with a heart piece or something like that. It's incredibly rage inducing and i just know that if i ever feel the desire to play the game again, these memories will flash through my head and i'll probably give up.

With that said, my overall experience with the game was great, i loved the humor, the gameplay, the art style, the music, and so on. It's a great game and i think that everyone should give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004155257', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1534964494}
review:
[Normal Difficulty]
This game is really straightforward when it comes to progression; but there is simply a lot to do, and a lot to challenge you.  The game isn't as open to explore as Castlevania SOTN since it's holden to the dreaded power-up curse stopping many explorers from breaking the sequence of the game. You will run into many challenging Scenarios to collect bonuses that are too plentiful to be well hidden. It doesn't take long until you stat running into rather difficult enemies that force you to acclimate to their own attack patter, rather than keeping the rhythm of your combo. You will have many tools to dealing with the enemies including a Suplex with long range AOE effect, a Piledriver with Midrange AOE effect, a Standard Throw, and Da Boot (Stronger standard Throw). 

There are times when this can cause the game to glitch, such as a scenario later in the game that causes the enemy too fall into the pipes in a room filled with a pipe floor making the game itself softlock. You are forced to reload the savefile and try the room again if this happens, good thing the save point is only one room back. I can recommend this game to people looking for a game like the many Metroidvanias out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001117740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1689063906}
review:
*I'm evolving this review over time

While the game has a few more minor things that could use improving, the overall construction of the game is well though out and well executed. 

+ The music complements the theme and pace of the gameplay nicely and has a enough variety for the size of the game. It's also good, well composed music to boot
+ Solid animations and sounds that make you feel every hit you give/take 
+ Great visuals. Has real attention to detail with the Mexican art style and borrows a little from GRim Fandango, while remaining its own style
+ Level design is excellent and Guacamelee STCE should be used as a showcase for great level design to anyone aspiring to build platformers. Each new mechanic is introduced to the player beautifully, then combined with other previously learned mechanics, which provides a progressively tougher environment to fight through. There is also an almost perfect mix of player versus environment and player versus AI and this also gets more challenging at a good pace throughout the game 
+ Fast paced combat
+ Funny
+ Seeds other game art and pop culture art into the game with it's own style e.g. [spoiler] Manny Calavera skulls can be found on posters throughout the game [/spoiler]
+ Cool game mechanics with things like [spoiler] INTENSO (my favourite thing in the game and what an awesome name for it too!), Dimensional Shifting, Playing as a Chicken, etc. [/spoiler]
+ Moddable
+ [spoiler]Has the land of the dead![/spoiler]
+ RPG mechanic is well executed
+ LOTS of save points that are very well spaced out




- Mini map needs level detail, not just room shape
- No quest log for side quests or clues on where to go to finish these
- Enemies can interrupt special moves
- Knockback is more frustrating than it needs to be. You get knocked back too far and it takes too long to recover, which really breaks game flow
- If you die, you have to re-open all treasure chests you opened before dying after last savepoint. This is a minor one, but I feel it breaks game flow a bit
- There need to be more teleportation spots in the game. When revisiting areas to get the extras with new skills, not being able to teleport to the next area without having to traverse a huge amount of ground, becomes very tedious


- Controls while feeling fairly solid, could be better
- The stick controls could handle player intention a bit better e.g. if player is pushing the left stick predominantly up but not perfectly, then the game should still take it as up, not sideways
- If you fight a boss and die, when you respawn your intenso meter doesn't return to the fullness level it had before the fight
- Throws often don't go where the arrow is pointing
- Pushing off a wall for Goat Fly often ends up with Juan just dropping off the wall
- Platform clipping is unforgiving and it gets annoying fast when you're jumping around on floating platforms

- Double jump doesnt work if you jump from holding onto a wall
- The throwing mechanic is broken. Objects will often not be thrown in the direction of the arrow and this is infinitely frustrating during sequences in the game where this is necessary to move on to the next bit
- Intenso meter doesn't return to original state of fullness when you respawn if you die in a boss battle


+- I'm in 2 minds about the wall jumping mechanic in the game. It's one of the biggest, if not the biggest mechanic in the game and the levels are clearly designed to take full advantage of it works with jumping from wall to wall and not being able to jump up the same wall in consecutive jumps. While this presents the player with a challenging mechanic, it's also very frustrating to use while traversing areas because it leaves no room for recovery from slight mistakes. This is really evident in the beginning of the game before Juan gets his dash skills. 
Personally, I would have made the early design decision to go with a consecutive wall jump up the same wall and used a limiter like jump stamina. This way, most of the challenges would still work and the level design wouldn't need to be any more involved for developers to prevent player out of bounds issues.

review:
Guacamelee is one of my favourite games of all time. Based on that alone, you should buy this game :). 
STCE is the definitive edition. 

Pros:
+Great story
+Fun, engaging combat
+Enemies aren't damage sponges
+Wide variety of enemies
+Metroidvania - lots of exploring
+Big world with lots of great locations
+Funny character costumes
+Funny NPCs
+Great artwork

Cons:
-There isn't a sequel yet

review: Its a fun game with interesting mechanics and to me at least a great combat system. There are a few problems I have with the game i.e. they might throw dozens of enemies of varying types at you and to get the good ending you have to really work for it but this did end up really souring the experience for me somewhat of an otherwise great game only hampered by some questionable level design when you attempt to 100% it. I recommend it none the less but if you aren't good at platformers like me avoid trying 100% it and you will enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985665789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1449120390}
review:
Guacamelee has many elements that make it a great game. The combat is engaging and satisfying, because it ramps up at a moderate pace, and the sound design and art give weight to each attack. The environments and enemies are different enough that the game doesn't become stale, especially if you're not a completionist. For those who are completionists, even though some of the backtracking can be tedious, the challenges are reasonable but not too easy, so they present a roadblock that will be fun to overcome.   Also for completionists, the map gives you % complete for each area, so you won't be frustrated that you're at 98% and don't know where to find that last item you missed.

The pace, sound, and art are all things that drew me in, and kept me playing with Guacamelee.  Chances are if you like Metroid or Mark of the Ninja, you're going to get drawn in too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996023989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1372, 'last_played': 1450440964}
review:
+ Gameplay is fast, fun and fluid, a cool melee take on the Metroidvania formula.
+ The world is very colourful and absolutely drenched in a Dia de los Muertos atmosphere.

- The story is a cookie-cutter 'Rescue the princess' plot with little to no variation.

While Guacamelee contains a few cool characters (mostly enemy bosses), the story felt incredibly bland and uninteresting, a stark contrast to the game's visual representation. Nevertheless I had an absolute blast with the game, piledriving hordes of skeletons into other hordes of skeletons. Fans of beat-em-up games like Shank or Metroidvania games in general should definitely give this a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004006208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1450531297}
review: In a gaming industy rife with grainy realisim this explosion of colourful personality goes down like warm coco. An incredible homage to games that paved the way for the genre from mario brothers to metroid this game takes the best of all those that once were with a fresh and slick mexican motif. Tons of finess has been put into every inch of the game from the lovable NPCs to wonderful artwork and top quality music. This is what gaming ought to be about exploration, escapism and ultimalty damn good fun highly recommended especially for the price.

review: Un buen juego 2D con accion, batallas epicas, tradiciones mexicanas una que otra referencia a otros juegos, un maestro cabra raro (casi como el Old man) aunque no vi tacos fue un buen juego con mapa libre cuando lo terminas tiene una linea de juego a respetar sus mecanicas de juego son dificiles segun las habilidades desbloqueadas que tengas ademas de que cuando los desafios del infierno son bastantes bueno jugare el gold para ver sus raices aunque este me a gustado bastante me agradaria que tuviera un enfrentamiento para vencer esqueletos algo asi como la caverna del pollo pero estilo infinito para sacar mas provecho a este increible juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001258363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1449846737}
review:
First of all i haven't played the original. Just to clarify.

Despite being a Metroidvania-like game, Guacamelee is actually quite straightforward. Sure that areas are pretty much mazes, but aside of a pair of sections which were disorienting on purpose due some secrets the game is actually quite linear. Later on you can obviously backtrack with upgrades to unlock new paths, but most of them is to obtain even more upgrades. This might seem as a flaw, but actually keeps the game going yet still giving you breaks to get some new items before progressing further.

The mechanics of Metroidvania still applies however. You get a limited path, but as soon you get more power-ups you'll discover new paths. Most of the areas are challenges to use such powerups so you'll be constantly using them. Otherwise they'll be used in battleto execute long combos and stay in a safe position.

If i have a complain it goes towards the bosses. They constantly appear and harass you during the story as this big group of menacing foes you have to fight at the end of some areas. But when you actually encounter them they are just a lesson of what you learned in their respective area. Unless in hard diffuclty they aren't a challenge and quite underwhelming for the role they have in the story, making common enemies more threatening than them.

Overall Guacamelee is actually quite linear, but the Metroidvania part of the game goes mainly to exploration and get upgrades. That's not a bad thing as is a game you'll feel progress wherever you go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009810921', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1447883092}
review:
Every once in a rare while you come across a game that feels so refined, so polished that there's nothing left to complain about. Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition is such a game. The visual style is unique, captivating, and still coherent. Each objective, and the motivation for reaching it, is always clear, but you're still free to explore along the way or in the opposite direction as you so choose. The collectables scattered about the relatively open world are hidden well enough to require some exploration but not so well that you're inclined to seek out a guide - exempting a select few of course. The ever-growing inventory of new special moves are explained fully, used immediately, and are as useful for regular platforming as they are for fighting. Misjudging a jump and falling into a bottomless pit or a pool of green slime sends you right back to where you jumped from, letting you try again without even the frustration of returning to the last well-placed checkpoint. And if all that sounds too easy for you, there is plenty of post-ending secrets and challenges to test your skills on, including a second, more punishing difficulty. 
Every part of this game just works so smoothly and is so enjoyable that I had a hard time putting it down. But the thing that really caught me off guard is that amongst all the joking and all the delightful silliness, there's still something dramatic and engaging here. There's a damsel in distress that remains defiant and selfless despite being helpless. There's a hero that remains focused and grounded despite apocalyptic consequences and dying himself. There's villains with their own tragic, narcissistic, or trivial reasons for acting as they do. And there's a climax that ties it all together into something more meaningful than it seemed to be along the way. There is truly nothing missing here and no reason to avoid playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067351496', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1448428300}
review:
Metroidvanias are one of my favorite genres, but I really didn't enjoy Guacamelee. 

Combat
-Guacamelee's style of melee combat just doesn't really work for this genre of game. Attacking consists of button mashing, and dodging is as simple as rolling through any attack. In most metroidvanias, dodging is the main skill element. Learning and anticipating a enemy's attack pattern in Metroid or Cave Story is what makes them fun, and timing a roll negates any attack just as much fun.

Platforming
-These segments are just pretty lackluster. It's the same running and walljumping you've seen a million times before.

References, jokes, etc. I was laughing every half hour or so. I just beat it on normal mode, and it was perfect in its difficulty. I am now just starting hard mode, and its pretty perfect the way the difficulty transitions from end game normal to early game hard. 

For people who love metroidvania games, this is most definately for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056194631', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1451408398}
review:
Piccola perla ispirata al classico Nintendo, Super Metroid, Guacamelee Ã¨ un gioco con uno stile originale e colorato e delle meccaniche fluide e ben fatte che catturerÃ  gli appassionati del genere fin dai primi minuti. 
Come classico dei Metroidvania, Guacamelee presenta una varietÃ  di poteri sbloccabili durante l'avventura utili ai fini dell'esplorazione dei livelli, che vi aiuteranno a raggiungere aree in precedenza inaccessibili, il tutto condito da un combat system veramente ben fatto che restituisce un ottimo feeling "luchadoresco" quando vengono sbloccate tutte le combo.

Contrariamente a quanto affermato in alcune delle recensioni negative su Steam, il gioco non Ã¨ affatto frustrante e difficile per chi ha un minimo di intuito e di intelligenza, almeno nella campagna principale, e il suo unico punto debole Ã¨ la longevitÃ  molto bassa, che in questa edizione Ã¨ leggermente colmata dalla presenza di alcune sfide opzionali da affrontare dopo la conclusione dell'avventura.

review: The most fun I've had for a while. Does a great job with the theme. Took me just under 8 hours and the Luchador never felt tired (which was something I was sure would happen). It's challenging enough to make you relish victories, but never felt unecessarily punishing. Great experience, solid combat, fun characters. Well done Drinkbox.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035416875', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1448943873}
review:
One of the only cons about this comes in the local co-op. The puzzle platformer sections are tedious if your partner insists on playing them with you. You've basically got to hope that they time their jumps/specials EXACTLY like yours, or else the camera moves to keep them in view as they fall to their death, and now you can't see those spikes you were trying to dodge.

This can be solved by smacking your partner, having them log out for a moment while you figure out the section, and then logging back in. HOWEVER, most folks who have to log out and just sit there while someone else plays will get bored quickly and there goes your co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975202702', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1480254464}
review:
Premetto che adoro i metroidvania ma odio i platform troppo impegnativi. Se siete come me evitate pure di prendere questo gioco; praticamente a ogni schermata richiede una precisa sequenza di tasti e un perfetto timing nel premerli. Ogni piÃ¹ piccolo errore Ã¨ severamente punito facendovi ripetere decine di azioni e altrettanti pulsanti premuti.La trama pare interssante, ma si annacqua ben presto nel gameplay che palesemente la manda in secondo piano.
Chiunque invece ama le sfide amerÃ  questo gioco, ma attenzione mai e poi mai potrete dare la colpa a nulla se non alla vostra insufficente abilitÃ ; I comandi sono precisi e pronti, le animazioni perfette e il personaggio fa esattamente quello che gli dite.
In conclusione se come me preferite concentrarvi sulla trama enigmi e bastonare qualche nemico senza impeganrsi troppo andate altrove, vi stanchereste dopo qualche ora. Se invece cercate qualcosa che eserciti il vostro istinto avrete pane per i vostri denti e scoprirete che un po di trama e una mondo complesso possono essere meravigliosi!!!

Menzione speciale infine per la grafica e la musica entrambe stupende. peccato solo che la canzone che si sente nel video sia diversa da quella nell'host (a mio avviso quest'ultima Ã¨ peggiore).

review:
I downloaded this game on a Saturday evening, having heard about it from multiple indie gaming sites. As soon as I booted it up, I fell in love. The comedy of this game alone was amazing, combined with tight combat and a steady difficulty curve, made it one of my favorite games I've played ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043784900', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1445720262}
review:
While Guacamelee doesn't innovate the Metroidvania genre, it uses its brawler/lucha-libre fighting system to make a well-crafted experience. The polished mechanics for both fighting and platforming are worth your time.

My only complaint is that so much of the game (and gameplay) are call-backs to other games that the game lacks an identity. (Definitely not for the visual department). On the other hand, the similar mechanics could benefit newcomers who are not familiar with the games it works off of.

For die-hards of Metroidvanias, there is something worthwhile for you too.

The game starts off simple, but quickly ups the challenge and the world becomes more open. (There is no sequence-breaking, but you can earn certain collectables early with enough determination.) Then there are mini-challenges for completionists that will truly test your mastery.

[h1]What's so Super, Turbo and Championed?[/h1]

[list]
[*]You get expanded areas and more challenges. (Every level was reworked.)
[*] More enemy variety and a new boss. 
[*] Rebalancing of enemies' and player's attacks.
[*] New mechanics: Player-controlled dimensional swapping (switching between worlds on the fly) and Chicken Bombing (not often used or needed except for 100% completion).  
[*] Upgraded local coop: From 2 players to 4.
[*] Multiple save-slots (so you dont' have to strangle your friend when he overrides your progress).
[*] DLC of Gold Edition included for free.
[*] Costumes can now be permanetly unlocked.
[*] INTENSO Mode (a fury mode for extra damage and other benefits that you can unlock).
[/list]

Basically, the whole game was redone from the ground-up that buying the standard game is moot. (I got the Complete collection at a discount, and previous owners got a loyalty discount.)

 It definitely plays like a game fine-tuned from the ground up, and it is better for it.

[h1]WARNING FOR EPILEPTIC GAMERS![/h1]

The one change that I think needs more polish is the toned down epileptic screens and visuals. They are much better than what they used to be, and I'm glad they were changed because they made me sick.

However, the Intenso medallion eyes and the names on the boss-screens might still be a strain on the eyes. 

Also, the player-controlled dimension swapping is something I think the devs cannot fix for elipeptic gamers; the visuals are bright and colorful, and the platforming challenges for the harder areas will require lots of swapping between bright colors and a white-circle around the character.

 I think you'll be able to play the majority of the game without much trouble. But like I said, the more difficult platforming areas require you to shift on the fly, so be careful.

[h1]Let's Get Ready to Lucha-Libre![/h1]

With all that being out of the way, let's talk about gameplay. The combat of Gucamelee has a careful synergy between your abilities and attacks, making your progression on platforming and combat obstacles both challenging.

All the abilities you unlock can be used as attacks: The Rooster Uppercut (a saving jump), the Frog Slam (dive-attack), the Goat Run (vertical scaling), the Dashing Derp Derp (yes, it's called that; a forward lunge) and the Goat Fly (Shinespark) are all new abilities that expand your combo potential. And the animation quality is so smooth that it feels energetic.

The dojo in the game can help you learn the intricaces of your abilities. Or you can experiment on your own.

For example, if you use the Dashing Derp Derp, and you want to keep the combo going, you'll have to roll to continue the offense (the DDD knocks the enemy too far away). You can then send the enemy flying with the Rooster Uppercut or wait after sending the enemy in the air normally, and then use a Frog Slam or continue with another DDD or a headbutt. 

Combine all those abilities with the grapple-based moves (throwing and doing some lucha-libre manuevers), and you will find yourself enjoying every single combat encounter you come across. The boss-fights don't feel special, but they're entertaining to say the least.

The platforming is no different; the careful attention to details of your surroundings can let you know of alternative routes or other means to unlock certain collectables. Health, stamina--for the special moves--and the INTENSO meter need three pieces for an upgrade, which you can purchase some pieces but you'll have to find a lot more on your own.

To compensate for giving your character a ton of versatility, the rule is you can use every ability once before you land on the ground again. I have found one or two screens where that didn't seem the case--maybe a bug--where the game forced me to do the platforming one way when I should've been able to use my Rooster Uppercut.  

The Inferno challenges are the best platforming aspects because they're so short, while also very brutal on you mastering your fighting and platforming skills. The same goes for the Mask Pieces, which are all platforming-based; you need to find them (six out of seven before Callaca) to get the good ending.

[h1]The Game's Blemishes[/h1]

For all the game does get right, I think some aspects of the game are lacking or not as finely executed as the gameplay itself.

I already mentioned how the game lacks an identity because it borrows heavily from its sources. Choozo Statues, the memes of indie games and other video-games (from Grim Fandango to VVVVV), the Shinespark ability, the Metroid Bomb eggs--did I mention this was inspired by Metroid?--and tons of other references. But the story is forgettable too.

Essentially, it's two young lovers who haven't seen each other since children now are a part of some demonic villian's plot for taking over the world. I like it 'cause the game reminded me of Mucha Lucha in its art-style and gameplay. But I'm not really given much of a reason to care about "El Presidente's Hija/Daughter" (that's her name), but the game spends a lot of time forcibly supplying plot points to sudden narrative moments.

And speaking of forced, those innuendos. I gotta say, I never really played a game before where I thought the sexual tension in the dialogue was a bit too much. (And I played Conker as a kid). Maybe it was because it was so forced that I thought it was cringe-worthy.

Dying is perhaps the one drawback that improves towards the end. At every checkpoint, you get your health refilled. and when you die you restart at the last one. Thankfully, falling just teleports you to where you last stood safely.

But the biggest complaint I have about its gameplay is what you need to do to 100% the game. You have to collect everything; not just the upgrade-stuff, mask pieces, and side-quests, but also the health-orbs, INFERNO orbs and other stuff you might not want to break in order to save it for later. As a result, I don't see a reason to beat this game for 100% completion.

All you should do for a complete playthrough (around 8 to 10 hours) is collect as many upgrade pieces as you want, then collect all the mask pieces and get Gold raitings for the Inferno challenges. Then, when you're done, you can play hard mode and enjoy the game however you want.

Thankfully, you will want to play again because the gender-swap characters (Juanita or Tostalla) have a different playstyle to Juan. Juanita is much faster and does more damage, but her throws are much weaker. The other costumes have some passive-changes, but none that I would consider worthy for replaying the game like with Shovel Knight.

[h1]Gucamelee: Great as Junk-Food Or for Spicing Up Your Life[/h1]

You can't go wrong with this game whether you've fallen in love with Metroidvanias before or if you've never played one.  You can be guaranteed that you will have a good time, especially if you are able to play with friends (respawns are available).

[b](Guacamelee won't actually spice up your life; it's a game, not food.)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065457453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1445641280}
review:
A really fun and addicting metroidvania game. Full of humour and action, with well thought mechanics and level design,  but also a good level of challenge. This is really one game you will enjoy a lot playing replaying if you like metroidvanias.

Story: you play Juan, a luchador that has save his love one from the evil claws of Calaca, and stop his plan to bring the wolrd of the livings and th dead together! you will face many challenges, meet friends and combat foes to reach your goal and become the greatest luchador of Publuecho!
Well, as you can see nothing blowing the doors off scenario wise,you won't play the game specifically for its super elaborated story, but it does the trick to accompany the game.
The game is however full of humour and references, and characters are endearing, which do make the game/story very nice to follow.

Art: hand-drawn squarish and super colorful graphics that fits very well the theme of the game. It might not be to everyone's taste but as far as I am concerned find them pretty gorgeous.
Animation are very fluid and no slowing down comes to hinder the experience. Overall this is a very nice looking game.
But this is also a very nice sounding game: the soundtrack is very cheerful and accompany perfectly the game. Very good soundtrack I recommend to anyone.

Gameplay: now for the most important part, Guacamelee gets a very good grade here. A mix of combat a and platforming wroking well together. Controls are tights and very responsive, there is a good variety of movements to allow you to create very nice combos on the enemy. Those movements are also well thouth-out as they will also be used to solve platform puzzles/challenges throughout the game. Puzzles and challenges that are well designed, not too difficult but not too simple either, just the right amount of complexity and originality that makes it overal a good level design.
The game will occupy you a good amount of time if you wish to finish it at 100%  aroudn 12 to 15 hours the first time, and extra challenges are available for those who wish a bit more challenges. it also provides rankings for speedruns for those who like that!

Overall this is a very good, fun and cheerful game that I would recommend to anyone. I ended up liking it surprisingly more than I thought I would. This is definitely a game that is high up in the list of good metroidvanias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085427996', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1573266309}
review:
This is a really awesome metroidvania beat-em-up indie title with really smooth controls and great gameplay. As a big fan of the genre, this game doesn't dissapoint in the slightest, with plenty of power-ups and interesting mechanics added to the game. What's the best part of the game though, for me, is hands down the platforming. It's innovative, and uses mechanics I haven't seen been used in metroidvanias all that often, so it's a nice breath of fresh air from what Nintendo has given us over the years. The combat system is fairly interesting as well, being a beat-em-up like game with a suprising amount of depth to it, which I approve of. The Keyboard controls work just fine, but if you have a controller, it's best played with one, although I made it through 90% of the game with just the keyboard, so if you don't have one, don't sweat it.

The Super Turbo Championship edition expands on the already great base game with a co-op feature which I wish more games in this genre took advantage of. Sadly, it's local multiplayer, meaning that controllers are a must-have for it, but on the upside, you can play with four people all at once, which is nice. The added areas and bosses are interesting as well, giving you veterans out there something new to mess around with. A fair warning though, this game is hard. Both in platforming and combat, but it almost never feels cheap and unpolished (Although, it's not a game without it's blemishes.) It's a blast to play and the soundtrack is something I can't get enough of, with Canal De Las Flores being my favorite track in the game, which was added STCE. The Addition of Intensio is also a really cool feature, something I wish was a part of the main game, instead of being added on as an afterthought, but eh, I can't complain too much, it's a neat mechanic, although a bit clichÃ© for action games nowadays. It's more centered around combat and platforming challenges rather than exploration, but there's still a fair amount of things to be found here for everyone to like.

Needless to say, I warmly recommend this game to anyone, and I'm hoping Drinkbox Studios makes more Metroidvanias in the future, as from what I've seen, they have a knack for it. Keep up the good work, guys. It's a really cool game you've made here. Well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024629128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1550166298}
review: Great game. I would recommend this to anyone that likes metroidvania. However, I do have a gripe with the responsiveness of the input. When inputting the button press of what would be the B(X360) or O(Sony), the system sometimes fails to perform the move I am asking of it. I have tested with a microsoft brand 360 controller, a ds4 and a razer controller. It is unfortunate that I had this problem. It has made certain secret platforming sections much more difficult than it needs to be. I doubt that many others have had this, and I haven't seen anything in particular about this when googling. I still fully recommend this, even at the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102399227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1493463527}
review:
An indie game at its finest.

I bought Super Turbo Championship Edition even though I already had the original Guacamelee! and to be honest I didn't even notice any significant difference gameplay-wise. There's been quite a time gap between I played both version, so I was unable to notice anything. But, bro - we're on Steam so I ain't even mad as I got both for pennies.

The theme grabs handfulls from Mexican folklore and is decorating it with lots of humor, which makes the game fun for everyone. Graphics are nice, colourfull, swift and slick with smooth animation.  A cool mexican-themed soundtrack is playing in the background and I discovered it is ear-catchy enough, that developers decided to release the soundtrack separately (available on Steam).

Doesn't matter what version you're playing - Gold or STCE, it's a very solid game. I believe "metroidvania" is a popular term to use on such titles as it is 2D platformer with lots of backtracking, as you will be unable to reach some areas until you'll get powers requied to do so.

I am hardened PC player, but let's be honest - keyboard is a device designed for typing, not for gaming. It's been a long time since I ever attempted to play a game using keyboard instead of my X360 controller. And I'm happy to have one, because - oh, boy - I can't even imagine playing Guacamelee! with a keyboard without breaking a finger. This platformer requies a lot from your reflexes and thank god the controls are tight and well responding.

When you start the game fights are just simple button mashing and platforming is not a big deal. But of course as you progress you get new abilities like double jump, wall-jump, etc., you learn new attacks and also you get to switch between dimensions. So, Guacamelee! is not inventive platforming wise, but isn't it fun if the game is so well made? And it is actually one of the rare games, where all your abilities are not just useful, but they are mandatory to master, so you'll be able to use them in-game. You will have to train your fingers to respond quickly. Simple button mashing to fight enemies at the beginning quickly won't be any effective as you will encounter a lot of enemies that will require certain tactics to down them. As there may be a lot of enemies onscreen sometimes I never felt the fights are chaotic. They just require quick eye-to-finger response as they are challenging, but thanks to the wise use of colour palette it comes with ease to get used to some tactics. (Unless you are using a keyboard).

And mind, that your abilities are useful not only for battling the enemies, but also during platforming. There will be a lot of trial and error, especially when you'll attempt to get some hard to reach collectible.

Sometimes I really missed good old days, when side-scrolling platformers were real deal. It was actually a while since indie game developers could get to the level that was available last time on SNES (I'm not counting Gameboy). Because there's actually plenty of games in that category, but very few of them are good and even less of them are great. Thanks to Steam, we can play a lot of them on PC, as Guacamelee! was previously available only for the consoles. Guacamelee! may not be great. As I said, it is not very inventive. But there is something fresh about it and it is so damn well made, that it's just plain fun. Of course it's a modern game, so it's more forgiving than the SNES era - there are save points and lifes are unlimited. Which I consider a good thing, since the era of memorizing the whole levels is long gone, so it will keep you away from frustration. 

It is helluva fan, folks.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042258100', 'num_games_owned': 1114, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1434227358}
review:
+ Hervorragender Stil
+ Viel zu entdecken
+ Super Soundtrack
+ Passender Schwierigkeitsgrad

author: {'steamid': '76561198217636583', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1443801744}
review:
Two words: Great game. 

That alone should be enough for any gamer to at least consider playing it. But Guacamelee is so much more than that.

Nowadays platforming games are scarce, a sad thing to say but true nonetheless. Guacamelee comes in that front as a refreshingly exciting new adventure where jumping is as important as fighting. 

At the beginning you won't be able to do much, simple button combinations are all you've got to beat the early enemies, but you learn more moves the further you advance in the game. Those moves are both fighting and platforming oriented and you need to use them constatly if you want to progress.

To make things easier, you can buy diffferent perks in the store in exchange for money you get from defeating enemies, crate smashing or treasure hunting. You can also buy different skins for your character, both male and female, that will
give you useful bonuses in exchange for silver coins that you get in some particular chests and once you beat an arena.

The dfficulty curve in this game is outstandingly well done.  Forcing you to give your best in combat and platforming as well. Guacamelee's got one of the most frustratng platforming track you'll ever get to play (yes I'm referring to the saw blades) but it also's got some of the most entertaining challenge fights you'll enjoy (in hell).

Although the theme of the game might not interest you, I can assure you that it doesn't become an annoyance. In fact you're gonna be so into the game that you're hardly gonna notice it. And after a while you may even start to like it as much as I did.

As for the queer design of the ingame drawing I can only say that it fits perfectly with the story and after the first fights is not going to bother you either.

It is precisely in the story where Guacamelee turns weakest. The overall plot is average at best but you're going to be so entertained with everything else that, honestly, you're not going to care.

Lastly, I'd like to say something about reaching 100% in the game, Most of the trophies are quite easy to get, but there are some that are not. Getting the gold medal in the challenges or finding all the treasure chests is going to take time. Getting the "good" ending is demanding too, you'll have to find all 7 parts of the mask and thet will require something else. In order to succeed though, the developers added two additional powers you can get. The first one you obtain in hell and the second one gets automatically unlocked once you find 6 parts of the mask. The latter is, by far, the most overpowered ability you get in the game but frankly, by the moment you get it, is kind of useless. It would have been nice to have these two abilities available in the new game from the beginning, or at least one of them, but the developers didn't see it that way. So you don't.

In short, Guacamelee is an absolutely worthy game to play that isn't too harsh, unless you want it to be, and will surely entertain you. Don't forget to purchase it if you liked it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994839687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1814, 'last_played': 1642818288}
review:
Jesus, this game is good. It has a bunch of references to Metroid in it, which I found disappointing, because I actually enjoyed this game far more than any of the Metroid games. This game learns from all the Metroid games' mistakes to give an incredibly satisfying experience.

It's essentially if you took the exploration and fun of Metroid, tightened up all the sequences, made it hilarious, and then gave it an amazing combat system reminiscent of Smash Brothers. Speedrunning is awesome. Completioning is awesome. Everything about it is just a lot of fun, and I want to play more. One of the best games I've gotten on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044657647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1470403145}
review:
Important note: this is The Version that has all there is (and a few bonuses) in any other versions of Guacamelee. Skip the others, purchase this.
Very definitely that one indie platformer-action games that tends to stand above any other would-be champions of the genre. 

It sports with accurate controls, fast-paced (but not too confusing) battles and moves, a good story and humor that actually makes you grin. It's all built up with an immersive world and unique art style and an unexpected choice of themes, which are Guacamelee's utmost aces. I mean, how many games have you played that dive into any kind of folklore? How about Mexican folklore?

You can sum it up pretty neatly in one sentence. You are the chosen lucha warrior destined to punch undead and Mexican folklore in the face, doing all sorts of manly-heroic deeds on the go. Wear your masks proudly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990904761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1564239738}
review:
Absolutely amazing game.  I got through the entire game in one playthrough.  For those of you familiar with Super Metroid on the SNES, this is pretty much like a love letter to the game.  The influence of that game on this one can be seen all the way from the abilities you earn from statues to the similarities in some of the platforming mechanics in how you use those abilities.  The only issue with the game is that it is fairly short.  However, the replay value is quite high as the fighting mechanics are simple to learn, but provide a high degree of complexity, making the game so much fun.

If you're a fan of Super Metroid, I wouldn't even think twice about purchasing this game.  It's well worth at least $20 if for nothing more than that nostalgic classic Super Metroid experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031354211', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1590181067}
review: Great fun beat em up game with a pretty unique setting and theme. Visuals are very bright and stylized, music is excellent. Game is a bit short, but it was definitely worth the time to get everything and complete everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149177324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1422219506}
review:
Great example of the niche Metroidvania genre. It has a Mexican culture inspired aesthetic that pops out when you start going through the game. Guacamelee has all the things that Metroid/Castlevania games have had back in the day: Big environments, various collectibles that helps your character grow, big uncoverable maps, obstacles that block your way until a certain upgrade is unlocked which is acceptable use of backtracking elements, and more! The combat is not as simple as you might think for a 2D Beat 'Em Up since the unlockable moves help increase your combos and damage output.

Rating: 10/10 because I loved the 2D Metroid and Castlevania games (biased I guess). Everybody should give it a try, it eben has Steam Workshops for outfits!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033605026', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1689548696}
review:
Can't recommmend this enough. 

It's fun, it's fast, it's got supertight controls in a sidescroller platformer beat'em-up/brawler that does not overstep it's own boundaries and has incredible direction and focus.

In other words, it fully accomplishes what it tries to, which is a lot more than most games can say.

Enough said, I'm going to play some more now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044482985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1489979396}
review:
Â¡Viva el Guacamelee!!

A los pocos minutos de comenzar a jugar, Guacamelee! se convirtiÃ³ en uno de mis plataformers favoritos.

Tiene diversas mecÃ¡nicas de lucha y movimiento tÃ­picas de juegos de plataforma, pero innova con la habilidad de cambiar del mundo de los vivos al de los muertos. Esta habilidad literalmente duplica el mundo a explorar y genera interesantes situaciones para el jugador. AdemÃ¡s, cada nivel es interesante y posee una cantidad enorme de secretos y puzzles. Algunos son pruebas de ingenio, otros de destreza, y otros ejercicios de voluntad para quienes no tienen problema en intentar un nivel mÃ¡s de 100 veces. En definitiva: ofrece desafÃ­os para todos los gustos. El gameplay es realmente muy complejo, pero se enseÃ±a paulatinamente a lo largo de todo el juego, entrenando al jugador hasta convertirlo en un experto y sin perder el tiempo en tutoriales.

La estÃ©tica y la mÃºsica son hermosas y el escenario es un gran homenaje a la cultura Mexicana. La historia es simple pero interesante, repleta de personajes divertidos y con un buen sentido del humor. AdemÃ¡s, no deja de rendir culto a los mejores juegos del gÃ©nero, colocando montones de guiÃ±os para los entendidos. La ambientaciÃ³n estÃ¡ perfectamente ejecutada y cuida hasta el mÃ¡s mÃ­nimo detalle. Como latinoamericano, estuve particularmente atento a ver dÃ³nde se equivocaban con las referencias culturales, y me alegra no haber encontrado nada fuera de lugar.

Lo Ãºnico negativo es el gameplay multiplayer, que no es malo, pero por momentos puede ser confuso. Cuantos mÃ¡s jugadores, mÃ¡s confusiÃ³n. De todos modos, es perfectamente jugable de a dos e incluso las desventajas del gameplay pueden ser utiles para superar algunos puzzles y niveles particularmente difÃ­ciles.

En definitiva, Guacamelee! es todo lo que el nombre promete: Mexico + Plataformer de Combate + un enorme signo de exclamasiÃ³n que implica (correctamente) que hay muchÃ­simo mÃ¡s en este juego. Â¡Totalmente recomendable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164255767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1438653595}
review:
This game is super addicting and fun. The controls are tight, the characters are all likeable, and everything is just so pretty to look at.

My favorite thing is all the videogame/meme references though. It's so cute. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197979998458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1438455838}
review:
This game has the worst marketing team ever.  If someone had told me years ago when Guacamelee first hit the scene that it translated Super Metroid mechanics near perfectly, I'd have paid full price instead of getting this in a bundle with 4 other games for $2.99.

If you enjoyed Samus' romps with Mother Brain then you will certainly love Guacamelee as well.  You'll even get to collect powerups from Chozo statues....no seriously, you collect power ups from Chozo statues.  The game itself is so finely crafted, I truly believe that anyone who enjoys videogames will find something they like about this title.  From the colorful Samuri Jack-esq graphics, to the Borderlands tounge-in-cheek humor, to the near perfect music all aspects deserve accolade.

10/10 ... would farm Agave again

author: {'steamid': '76561198199092345', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1440485780}
review: an awesome metroidvania with a simple concept and smash bros-esque combat. It's got a spirit world you can freely move in an out of, unique use of special moves, wall jumping and a double jump for tight platforming, a strange story with the antagonist a dead mexican dude who somehow defeated  the devil himself and is now seeking more power as hes replaced diablo himself and a unique art style that fits in with the tone of the game. Theres also the main character, Juan, who has been killed by diablo murderer and found a mask in the spirit world, bringing him back to life with new strength and giving him the appearance of a luchador. theres also a goat man and his "choozoo" statues which grant you new moves once broken. (apparently he's taken a liking to your mother). and the main selling point of the game. YOU CAN BE A CHICKEN. if you didnt think this game had enough, buy it just for this.

review: Pretty good beat 'em up. The game isn't really too long but it's pretty funny. The characters are well written for what they are and I like the whole Mexican twist.  I only died at the bosses maybe 1-2 times before I figured out the patterns but after that, it wasn't too bad (except the last boss. It was a welcomed difficulty spike), 8/10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198116441306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1444503104}
review: This game answers the call to everything I want in a platformer. Solid controls, clever design, beautiful style, sense of humor, smooth difficulty curve, catchy soundtrack, and Mexican wrestling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118004623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1553635875}
review: This game caught my attnetion multiple times so I finally gave in and bought it.  I have to say it was worth it. It's really fun and silly, the controls are great, and it's very stylish graphically.  There are plenty of side missions, it ramps well in difficulty as you play wihtout ever getting too hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113379084', 'num_games_owned': 1106, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1437462866}
review:
Es un buen juego, se caracteriza mayormente por las plataformas, puzzles y un poco de hack and slash, los graficos en 2D estÃ¡n muy bien logrados se ve bastante bien y es atractivo a la vista. En cuanto a la temÃ¡tica del juego es algo bastante inusual porque toma aspectos de la cultura mexicana y expresiones muy comunes de ese paÃ­s lo cual para los latinoamericanos se nos hace muy familiar tambiÃ©n.

La historia aunque es muy interesante por como se desarrolla es un tanto clichÃ© por el hecho de tener que rescatar a la mujer de la cual el protagonista estÃ¡ enamorado(mario bross), pero eso es algo que el juego hace a propÃ³sito porque posee demasiadas referencias a otros tÃ­tulos tanto retro como no tan viejos, el avance de la historia es fÃ¡cil de comprender no posee una profundidad o reflexiÃ³n muy alta sino que se preocupa mÃ¡s en cÃ³mo sortear los distintos niveles que se presentan.

En cuanto al gameplay es muy adictivo y entretenido, se nota que es en lo que mÃ¡s se enfocaron los desarrolladores, presenta retos bastante complejos y se puede decir que el juego tambiÃ©n entra dentro de una categorÃ­a metroidvania ya que habrÃ¡n zonas que no se pueden acceder hasta conseguir nuevos poderes o explorando todo el mapa.

Las habilidades que adquiere el personaje son muy interesantes tanto pra el combate como para avanzar en el mapa, Ã©stas ayudan mucho cuando se debe pelear contra un nÃºmero elevado de enemigos y cuando se presentan situaciones apremiantes, el juego posee una "tienda" donde se pueden comprar partes de salud, "magia" y aumento de poderes con dinero que se gana matando enemigos.

En sÃ­ para ser un juego indie estÃ¡ muy completo y bien trabajado, a mÃ­ me durÃ³ casi 8 horas explorando bastante y avanzando sin mucha prisa, lo recomiendo bastante tanto por el precio y todo lo que ofrece, si lo ven en una barata o rebaja no lo piensen dos veces y comprenlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997159902', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1471990475}
review: This is the kind of game you beat and then start a new save on Hard immediately. A game that once you get in the rhythm of it, you become a monster combo machine and it's so satisfying that by the end of it you can't help but demand more. Drinkbox put out an absolutely brilliant game that everyone should play through. I have about 5 times now across different platforms and I still can't get enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193953430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1463660517}
review:
TrÃ¨s bon jeu.

La maniabilitÃ© est irrÃ©prochable, et les combats et dÃ©placement dans les niveaux deviennent vite prenants. Certains passages sont durs, mais l'on ne peut s'en prendre qu'Ã  soit mÃªme lorsque l'on Ã©choue.

Le scÃ©nario et l'univers sont trÃ¨s sympas. Graphiquement, le jeu est bourrÃ© de rÃ©fÃ©rence Ã  l'esthÃ©tique Mexicaine, et trÃ¨s colorÃ©. C'est simple et beau.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025547559', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1437085052}
review:
Jogo bem divertido no estilo Metroidvania e temÃ¡tica de lucha livre!

Gostei muito do combate e de ficar procurando os itens do cenÃ¡rio que vÃ£o se tornando acessÃ­veis de acordo com os poderes que pegamos.

Acho que o jogo se alongou um pouquinho mais do que deveria, mas isso nÃ£o chegou a diminuir a boa impressÃ£o que me passou.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076869733', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1455843584}
review: Guacamelee es un metroidvenia, para los conocedores del genero sabran que es un plataformas con muchas exploracion que se desarrolla en un mapa enorme, cuyas partes se van abriendo frente a nosostros conforme vayamos obteniendo habilidades para nuestro personaje, en este apartado guacamelee cumple, tiene una ambientacion de la cultura mexicana muy divertida, y que tiene guiÃ±os a otros juegos, y curiosidades que son muy gratas de encontrar, la duracion es corta, pero intensa, hacia mucho tiempo que no jugaba algo que me hiciera tirar tanta groseria a la pantalla.. en fin es un gran juego que recomiendo por los motivos escritos arriba, es un gran metroidvenia con una muy buena ambientacion y es un buen reto... aunque tiene un fallo que si llegue a detestar y que hacia que la dificultad se hiciera aun mayor, llegando un poco a lo injusto, lo cual es jugar con teclado, es una proeza llegar a jugar bien con ese periferico, se debieron tomar un poco mas de tiempo para adaptar bien los controles. por todo lo demas es un juego sumamente bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112581891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1552868258}
review:
Very entertaining mix with elements from a Metroidvania-like Game and the adventure mode of Super Smash Bros. Brawl. It offers a unique artdesign, which is not for everybody's taste but quite consequently made and in my opinion very likeable. Though the story lacks thrill it doesn't really matter because of the absolutely hilarious humor wether it's some ingame "ads" for fictional Luchador-Wrestling fights or the nicely written diaglogues with both friends and foes. Additionally the difficulty is quite challenging and delivers many different enemys with combat moves by their own and a large moveset for the player with many possibilitys using them in big combos. For my first playthrough I needed about 8 hours and for completing until 100% about 3 hours additionally.

If you like 2D Plattforming Indie Games with fun combat and nice humor you should give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029073737', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1536955277}
review: Excellent metroidvania complÃ¨tement dÃ©jantÃ© basÃ© sur le folklore Mexicain et bourrÃ© d'easter eggs, ce jeu nous met dans la peau (et le masque) d'un apprenti luchador qui voit son amie d'enfance sexy se faire enlever par rien de moins que Calaca, el patron de los muertos. author: {'steamid': '76561198003055571', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1436302333}
review:
This is a really enjoyable platformer. It is witty, funny, gorgeous, and feels great to play even on a keyboard (a bit of training required, and lots of missed keys).

The controls are smooth and the combos are neatly chained and impactful.

My only qualm is that the skins are tied to power-ups and disadvantages. Sometimes I just wanted to enjoy some look but its bonuses aren't as good or my playstyle as other skins, so I just used Diablo and the monster one, mainly.

Played 2 games, normal and hard:
1st playthrough, about 10 hours, 100% completion;
2nd playthrough, hard mode, about 4 hours, rushed. I really wish hard was available from the beginning, it added some needed challenge. I played a second time mainly for the achievement, but I would've enjoyed the game a lot more in one full hard mode playthrough.
100% achievements (second run in hard-mode required).

author: {'steamid': '76561198073450392', 'num_games_owned': 1395, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1432739510}
review:
The Super Turbo Championship adds new features to the already superb original. With the steep discounts it receives, you would be mad not to pick it up if you don't already have the original and are a fan of platformers. If you are an owner of the previous version, ask yourself you want to re-explore the world with the added benefit of more amazing content.

My previous review still applies, copied below:

This is quite possibly my favourite platformer of all time. The writing is actually funny and the controls are excellent. I love the mexican style of the game and using the fighting moves to help the platforming is very unique and interesting. The combat is very easy to learn and surprisingly enjoyable. The game is quite hard and the platforming puzzles can make you want to rip your hair out, but the difficulty keeps the game interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106825427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1435553842}
review:
A fun platformer. You play as Juan an agave farmer made luchador thanks to a legendary luchador mask. He goes on an adventure to save his childhood love, the El Presidente's Daughter, from the evil Carlos Calaca. Yea it a strange story, but hey what are video games for if you can't have a strange story from time to time. The story is really entertaining and the game is constantly making references to other games. It help set up a fun atmosphere.

The game play like your standard 2D platformer, but what set it apart levels have 2 designs, a living and dead. Playing as Juan you'll find yourself having to switch between the land of the living and dead to get through areas and find their secrets. You'll also have to use you're wrestling abilities as you learn them to help you progress through the game. 

The combat involve punching your enemies enough to get them vunerable enough to throw them into other enemies or into environmental hazard. As you learn new abilities, enemies will start to spawn with barriers that can only be broken by using that ability. As you go through the game, you will encounter newer enemies that will put your new powers to the test. 

Honestly this is a fun game that knows how silly it is and it take pleasure in it. If you like luchadores, goats, chickens, skeletons, challenging platforming, and a fun "save the princess" story then this is the game for you.

review:
Dope game, with developers behind it which make poor business decisions. Overall, super fun though, really satisfying fighting system, nice visuals, clever mechanics and a real good soundtrack (Boss theme in particular). It's a brawler/Metroidvania and it works real well. 

I played through the whole game with a suit that makes you take double damage, I didn't realise this, don't do that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170691582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1517, 'last_played': 1430189594}
review:
The Good:
- Right off the top I have to admit that Iâ€™m a huge fan of metroidvania games, and so this review is definitely biased. Guacamelee excels in numerous aspects which define this genre, and so for me this was a fantastic gaming experience. The music, aesthetic, and level design are all superb. 

- Iâ€™m also a pro wrestling fan, and so I loved that the game incorporated a suplex and pile driver into the move set. 

- I didnâ€™t have any performance issues during my playthrough. 

The Bad:
- Absolutely nothing. Guacamelee delivered in every aspect. 

Final Verdict: 
I honestly canâ€™t see how anyone who is a fan of metroidvania games would regret purchasing Guacamelee at full price. It is definitely worth your purchase!
